name: Switzerland must be Conquered!
description:
Switzerland must be Swallowed! was re-released in 2007 as Switzerland must be Conquered!, a downloadable PnP game. The rules were expanded (12 pages rather than the original 8), the combat resolution system changed (and slightly simplified), and the counter sheet re-organised & expanded (strength markers used by the old combat system were eliminated, while Fortification and additional unit counters were added).

Switzerland must be Conquered! is a hypothetical simulation of the planned assault on Switzerland by Nazi Germany during World War 2. Players represent the military high commands directing their forces during what was sure to be a trying fortnight for all concerned. Fortunately for the German player, Adolf Hitler is busy elsewhere and will not interfere with your battle plans.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: UNO: England Rugby
description:
Same as the standard UNO game apart from the TRY card that allows you to swap any of your cards with an opponent's card of your choice.

Players race to empty their hands and catch opposing players with cards left in theirs, which score points. In turns, players attempt to play a card by matching its color, number, or word to the topmost card on the discard pile. If unable to play, players draw a card from the draw pile, and if still unable to play, they pass their turn. Wild and special cards spice things up a bit.

UNO is a commercial version of Crazy Eights, a public domain card game played with a standard deck of playing cards.

name: Nebtauy: The Pharaoh Conspiracy
description:
The game brings you back to three thousands and two hundreds years ago, at the court of the great Pharaoh Ramses III, in the ancient Egypt; there you can play as one of the characters (Artisan, Chantress, Embalmer, Noble Woman, Physician, Priest, Scribe, Soldier) who eavesdrop the conspirators plotting to murder the Pharaoh. In order to save him and to gain a never ending grant from him, you will travel through the Theben Necropolis to the Karnak Temple Complex and, in the end, you will enter the Royal Palace to defeat the conspirators! The setting, philological correct, reproduce the real story told in the Judicial Papyrus of Turin, held in the Egyptian Museum of Turin.

To cross the Nile and get to the next area you need to get enough power, fame and wealth to gain a level and the pertaining title; you can increase those stats by com pleating a specific quest or by chance, slot by slot, by facing the card(s) you will draw: only if you have the right title you can enter the Temple or the Royal Palace!

During the game you can trade with other characters simply being in the same spot, but beware of the hired assassin hiding among you. At the beginning of the game, each player draw one of the eight tiles from a sack and hide it to others: the bloody tile changes your goal from save to slay the Pharaoh. When the hired assassin meets another character, he/she can choose to kill the other character or to pretend to be like anyone else.
mechanics: Area Movement, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Check Four
description: With two players, each player plays with seven pieces on a 4X4 grid. (Eight pieces and a larger grid are used with more players.) On his turn a player either places one of his pieces onto an open square of the grid or captures an opposing piece by jumping it. A player is forced to jump a piece if his opponent placed the piece next to the player's piece. Play ends either when one player achieves four pieces in a row or when no player has enough pieces left to form four in a row. Players score four points for completing four in a row and one point for each captured piece. Play multiple rounds until one player reaches twenty one points

name: Rant!
description:
Players on three (or more) teams compete to rant about their "peeves". Those ranting must avoid using certain words, as indicated on each peeve card, while the other teams try to be the first to determine the nature of the peeve. Points are earned for successful ranting, as well as for being the first team to figure out what the rant is about.
NOTE: This game was tested as a prototype and was never manufactured or released.

name: Down 'n' Out!
description: The players begin with sets of identical blocks and place their respective blocks upright on opposite sides of a battlefield that consists either of hexes or of squares. Players take turns downing an opponent's piece (placing a piece in an unobstructed line of sight to the opponent's piece), taking out an opponent's piece (moving onto a space occupied by an opponent's downed piece and then removing that piece from the board), or restoring a downed piece (placing that piece upright in one's home area). A player wins when all of his opponent's pieces on the board are down.

name: The Roman Empire
description: Roman themed card deck with the possibility to play up to 50 different games. Also functions as a standard 54 card deck. Included are cards that can mimic up to 200 dice rolls.

name: Wuffle Tree
description:
Wuffle Tree is played by two, three, or four players. Each player begins by randomly selecting Wuffles, which are forty-eight cardboard discs in four colors and numbered one through eight. The game board depicts a tree with thirty-two holes for the Wuffles to fit into, each with a number value next to it.

The game begins with someone saying "Go," and all the players simultaneously try to fill as many holes in the tree as possible with Wuffles of their own color. The numbers on the Wuffles must match the number value of each hole in the tree. When all the holes are filled, players tally how many Wuffles each has left, and begin another round. After seven rounds, whoever has the lowest score wins the game.

name: Quantum Mechanic
description:
Quantum Mechanic is a game of combining Quarks into elementary particles, and smashing those particles together for points.
QUANTUM MECHANIC RULES SUMMARY:

Setup the game by shuffling the actions deck, which represents actions that you may take in the game and currency that is used to bid on projects and to buy quarks from the commons. Deal six action cards to each player. then shuffle the Projects deck and deal the first three projects to the market. these are the hadrons that players will try to complete throughout the course of the game. Players then take turns bidding on projects that they want to complete, drawing quarks from a bag of plastic colored quark cubes, and smashing those particles together for points. the first player to get to nine points is the winner.

name: Spill and Spell
description:
A word dice game where players roll the dice and make words to score points. The player with the most points after 10 rounds is the winner.

This 2003 edition by Endless Games includes 22 (14mm, white) letter cubes, rather than the 15 in the original version. The scoring in this edition is also different. Rather than squaring the letter count for each word, a point value is assigned to each letter based upon the length of the word it is part of, with letters used in longer words worth more. Crossed words score the shared letter twice, possibly with two different values.

Scoring:


3 letter words – 1 point per letter
4 letter words – 2 points per letter
5 letter words and up – 3 points per letter
5 point bonus for using all 22 dice
Subtract a point for each unused die

name: Die verrückte Reise durch Niedersachsen
description:
Die verrückte Reise durch Niedersachsen has two modes of play. In the first mode, players assume the roles of reporters who are trying to get an exclusive scoop of UFO sightings in Niedersachsen, a federal state of Germany.

Each player is assigned a color and a transmission tower. Their goal is to transport photographs with a hot-air balloon at locations in the state to their towers (transmitting the scoop back to their news agencies). Each player starts with one photo card, and take turns to roll a die, moving their card by the die's result. They draw new photo cards on a "6". The reporters can deploy Stop Stones to stop other reporters from moving through. The first reporter to transmit back three photographs wins the game.

The second mode of the game is called Top Secret, which is played on the other side of the game board. The game takes place in the news agency and players are racing against time to dig out what the others know. Each player thinks up a secret word at the start. On their turn, they roll a die, move their marker by the result, and can ask another player for one letter of their word. Players get points for guessing another player's secret word. The game ends when one player's marker reaches the end point and the winner is the player who has the highest score.

name: ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino – L Zestaw
description:
ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is an educational game for two players thanks to which memorizing facts about one of the most important battles of World War II comes incredibly easy. You learn while having a great time playing it. Players get to know selected soldiers, unit badges, weapons used in the battle and most important dates. The 133 symbols placed on the game cards were carefully selected to show the Battle of Monte Cassino in a wide international perspective emphasizing the heroic efforts of Polish as well as the allied forces. The manual and game cards are bilingual Polish-English.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino includes 10 cards on each of which 12 different symbols have been placed. Every two cards have a common symbol. Your job is to find and name it as fast as you can. If you don’t recognize your symbol flip your card and read the information on the other side. Then place a new card on the table and go on with the game. If you manage to name your symbol you should give your card to the other player. The first player to get rid of all his cards wins.

ZnajZnak: Monte Cassino is available in 13 collector’s versions labeled with letters from A to N. Every box is a complete game set. You can mix card sets because they always match.
categories: Card Game, Educational, World War II

name: Kippelparty
description:
A shaky game dexterity game for 2-4 players from 5 years old.

The turtle is taking a nap on a rock, but five little rascals are having a party on the turtles back. The game contains two very similar variants:
- All five figures start on the turtle and the spinner determines which animal has to be moved. If the turtle tips over you lose a token. Once you lost both tokens you are out of the game.
- All figures start on the table. the spinner determines which animal must be move on/off the turtle but only blue fields may be used. f the turtle tips over you lose a token. Once you lost both tokens you are out of the game.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Air Race
description:
The entire rules:

Each player chooses a particular coloured Aeroplane.

No player can start until he has thrown a 6 with the dice, this counting as his first move.

The game proceeds by moving the Aeroplanes according to the number shown by the throw of the dice.

The player must observe all the hazards his Aeroplane alights upon, whether in his favour or otherwise.

The exact number required to reach the 100 must be thrown and the first player to do so is the winner.

The board comprises a track of 100 spaces spiraling around a painting of a Gloster Gladiator with RAF roundels. There can have been little playtesting: a player can never land upon the 3 space but it bears the penalty "Fail to rise: miss one throw".

The Gloster Meteor depicted was notable from 1944 to 1955.

name: Monopoly: Alton Towers – The Smiler
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from Alton Towers Resort, a theme park in the U.K.; it's celebrating the start-up of the rollercaster 'The Timer'.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Kalastuspeli
description: This is a roll and move board game, where you try to catch fish. Every player has a boat, which he/she uses to go round the board fishing. There is 40 fishes in the board and the game ends, when there is only four fishes left on the board. The winner is the player who has the biggest catch at the end. Some spaces in the board causes player to lose his/her turn until he/she roll a certain number with the die.

name: Checker Dice
description:
From inside the game: "At last the grand old Army game of shooting dice (craps) has been lifted into respectability- to be enjoyed often when friends meet."

Checker Dice consists of 126 cards (the game calls them "checkers") numbered from 2 to 12. The cards have pictures of die rolls, but the frequency of the numbers does not quite match the statistical likelihood of rolling those numbers on 2D6. For example, there are equal numbers of sixes, sevens, and eights.

To play, players turn over cards and hope to get certain numbers and avoid others, just as in Craps. Once a card is turned over, it remains face up for the remainder the player's turn, which slightly affects the statistical probability of finding another card with the same number.

name: Eine Reise durch Deutschland
description:
This is a promotional board game for "Hederich-Kainit" and "Kali-Dünger".

The players travel from Berlin (space 1) to Bückeberg (space 90). Movement is determined by a die. On some spaces the players have to follow special instructions from the game rules.
The first player to arrive in Bückeberg, wins the game.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Röllin Sydän
description: Four different characters will race for the Heart of Knowledge. Each player controls two identical characters figures. On his/her turn the player rolls a die and moves either of his characters forward, backward or sideways exactly the number of spaces indicated on the die. If you ever land on a space opposing figurine is occupying, the opposing figure is knocked down and moved to the starting place or a resting place. There are safe places on your journey but also obstacles that will slow you down. The first player to get his two characters figures to the goal wins the game!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Potions Class
description:
Potions Class is a press-your-luck dice game where players compete to be the top student in potions class. Be the first to reach 100 points and end the class with a higher score than anyone else to win. Of course in a potions class students can also craft concoctions to give themselves an edge on the other students.

Roll matching symbols to rack up points but if you press it too much you may end up failing the testing and getting none of the points, and fizzling any partially crafted potions.

Class is in session.

name: Von Kelten und Druiden
description: Trivia game about the Celts in Europe. Along symbolic celtic trails each player learns more about the mysterious Celts. To win the game, the players have to answer questions of different topics... however sometimes they have to sing like a bard. In the second part of the game, discussions and intuition are necessary. This game reveals the legendary world of the celtic druids, warriors and bards.

name: Witch: Kampen om Kandrakars Hjerte
description:
The evil Nerissa fights fircely to get her hands on the amulet "Kandrakar's Heart". The W.I.T.C.H.-girls will do what ever it takes to protect the amulet, of where their powers are storted inside!

Battle after battle is fought in the fight between the girls and Nerissa, but who will be triumphant?

Help the girls by gathering good helpers in the battle against Nerissa. Remember that the evil Nerissa also have helpers who can make sure that the amulet will be hers!

Are you lucky, able to think strategigly and cooporate with the other player? Then you have the chance to win over the evil Nerissa and secure that the W.I.T.C.H.-girls wins the battle of the amulet.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building

name: Pixel Lincoln: Blue Noodle Promo Card
description:
Handed out at Unpub 4

Secret: Item

Melee: Only attacks the 1st enemy
Design: When EQUIPPED, _________ may __________, but at a cost of _________.

name: Mona Lisa hat keine Augenbrauen: Das Spiel – Die volle Dosis unnützes Wissen
description:
A trivia game about useless knowledge.
You roll the dice, move and try to answer questions in 6 categories.

name: Barbie Gems!
description: A simple Barbie themed matching game. Players turn over the top card of their stack of cards and the first person to call out "Gems!" wins the two piles of cards under the matching cards. Play continues until one person is left with all the cards.

name: Borscht!
description:
Borscht! is a set collection and strategy card game for 3-4 players ages 8 and up.

Players become Cossack peasants competing to complete a pot of traditional borscht (beet soup) while fending off the marauding tartars and sandy mole rats. In this society, economy is king--the Cossack with the cheapest borscht wins.

Game components include 101 Borscht! cards, 4 action and recipe cards,4 player identification cards, 20 coins in an old sock, and a six-sided die.

Each character identity has special abilities (such as the "Baboushka" (wise woman) whose negotiating skills allow her to buy commodities below market value. After all players have used their identities, the cards are rotated, creating a new balance of power in the game.

name: Armies of Riddle TCG
description:
Armies of Riddle is a Battle Fantasy RPG Trading Card Game for physical play as well as mobile play (Both games are separate entities but work the same way).

GOAL OF GAME: The goal of the game is to destroy your opponent's crystal shard.

PLAYERS: 2 Players

MAIN GAME ITEMS: COLLECTABLE CARDS AND DICE

QUICK OVERVIEW OF GAME PLAY:
1. Players select crystal shards
2. Players shuffle army deck and select randomly 3 army cards each
3. Players then place their desired army cards into battle and roll the dice
4. As the game rounds grow, players can increase their units, into multiple battles and combo battles to try and decrease their opponents powers.
5. The winner is the player who successfully defeats their opponents Crystal Shard
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Role Playing, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Arkel: De Ontdekkingsreis Sinds 1442
description:
A game jointly released by Identity Games and the Reinier van Arkel Group (the oldest psychiatric hospital in the Netherlands) in honor of the van Arkel Group's 565th anniversary. Players bid for control of one of six different ships on the board using a hidden bidding system that simultaneously determines how far that boat may move on that turn. The object is to pick up 'patients' in specific cities and deliver them to your own designated areas - but you have to be careful what you choose to carry because you may not be able to retain control of that boat on the next turn. Safely delivered patients reward players with varying amounts of dubloons and the player with the most dubloons at the end of the game (after there are no patients left in need of transport) is the winner.

There is also a small deck of 'Arkel' cards which players can acquire during the game and use for different one-off effects such as movement bonuses or cash bonuses. The Arkel cards also include facts and anecdotes about the history of the Reinier van Arkel Group.

name: Het Groot Vermakelijk Schapekoppenspel
description:
Het Groot Vermakelijk Schapekoppenspel (“Large Entertaining Sheepheads Game” in Dutch) is a Game of Goose-like game which is actually a children’s game, but is nice to play for everyone interested in the city of Dordrecht in The Netherlands. “Schapekop” is the nickname for a citizen of Dordrecht because of a saga about trying to smuggle a sheep dressed as a man into the city in order to prevent paying toll for cattle without succes.
Players follow a walking route through Dordrecht by dice throwing. Landing on some spots on the route means prosperity, on others adversity (gaining / losing chips and/or going forward/backward), with a description concerning Dordrecht. The first player to reach the end of the route wins the pot of chips / the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dubbel-dobbel
description:
Dubbel-Dobbel is a dice rolling game with a memory aspect. On their turn players throw 2 dice: 1 with a colour on each side, 1 with a Renault vehicle type on each side. Then they may take one of the closed spread cards on the table. If the card chosen matches both die results the player keeps it otherwise it will be put back on the table closed. A player turn only ends if a card is put back on the table. After all cards are taken from the table the player with most cards wins the game.

There are 36 cards in the game, a colour die (6 colours) and a number die (the 6 car types). Cars used are the Renault 4, 5, 9, 11, 18 and 25. Colours of the cards: Red, Green, Blue, Yellow, Purple and Black.

name: Bibi & Tina: Das Spiel zum Film
description:
A memory and racing game themed on the German movie "Bibi & Tina", which, in turn, is based on the children's audiobook series of the same name.

The aim of the game is to reach the finish space on the board first or, in case Maik-and-Maik (adversaries from the movies) get there first, to have collected the most heart tokens.

Players take turns rolling the dice. The red die is for moving the Maik-and-Maik token, from the white dice the active player selects one result for him/herself and moves his/her token accordingly, then the other players chose the remaining dice results.
The racing track contains shortcuts and spaces on which an effect card has to be drawn. Most of these have negative effects (having to move back, changing place with the last player etc.). Other spaces get you a heart token and allow all other players to look at one of the movie cards. Remembering which movie card is where allows players to take shortcuts.
Heart tokens can be used to allow players to move fewer spaces than the die roll dictates, to turn over an additional movie card when trying to take a shortcut, or to ask other players for help with finding the right movie card.
categories: Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing

name: Mob City: The Card Game
description: Players become mob bosses in this mafia-themed deck building game. They use Large to buy cards to build their decks. Act cards allow players to attack, defend and take advantage in the game. Payroll cards earn the players money (Large). Juice cards represent business owned by the boss and earn Juice points. 25 Juice points wins the game.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Fighting, Mafia
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: Sqiz
description: Sqiz is a drawing game for the skilled artist as well as the unskilled doodler. Use the pre-printed backgrounds and draw on top of them to get your opponents to guess what’s on your card!

name: Ready, Set, Count!
description:
From Manufacturers Website:

Roll the symbol die and find the matching puzzle card. Find the correct one and attach it to your picture card. The cards are self-correcting! The first player to place all of the correct puzzle cards onto their picture wins the game. Trains fundamental skills in symbol association, number recognition and counting.

name: Airships of Oberon
description: This page does not exist. You can edit this page to create it.

name: La Tumba de la Momia
description: A roll-and-move game by Toy Company Argentina that uses the same cover artwork as Web of Gold, but is a different game. The game uses one d6 and some 3D plastic pieces in a dark grayish color.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey: Technology Expansion Deck C
description:
From the publisher:

In the ultimate race to build a bunny society on planet Earth, Killer Bunnies and the Ultimate Odyssey pits players against each other as they struggle to gain Civilization Points, by building cities and increasing their bunny populations. Players gain points by developing their own civilizations or by using zany weapons and hilarious scenarios to destroy their opponents.

The Blue deck has a Technology based theme which also includes devices, robots and fantastic cards such as All Bits Zero which allows a player to exchange his cards and Encore, Encore which deals a double deadly blow!
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Deck Construction, Dice Rolling, Hand Management

name: La incógnita
description: This is a children's game based on memory. Two to four players scatter some colored little balls on the play board and then use a tube shaped as a question mark and press it by turns against the balls so they stick inside the tube. When there are four balls inside a tube the oldest ball will fall out from the other side of the tube. If the player guesses the color of the ball that is going to fall he takes it and plays again. When a player gets four balls of his color she wins.

name: Dr. Wack-O
description:
A wind-up dexterity game, part of Milton Bradley's "T.H.I.N.G.S." series of games. Try to flip over all of the discs and capture them with the magnetic hammer.

From the box:
Can you flip the lids before time runs out?

Start the timer by moving the mouse counterclockwise as far as it will go. The platform will start turning.

As lids pass in front of Dr. Wack-O press the button to flip the lips label-side down.

As the flipped over lids pass in front of the hammer, whack them to flip them into the slot!

Whack out all the flipped lids before the timer stops - or Dr. Wack-O will flip right out of his lab!

name: Relic Knights: Battle Deck
description:
Esper energy flows throughout the universe, binding it and permeating all things. The mighty champions of the Darkspace Calamity channel esper to fuel their actions and unleash devastating attacks.

The Relic Knights: Battle Deck contains everything you need to power your games of Relic Knights!
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Miniatures, Science Fiction

name: 1863 Powstanie Styczniowe: Kampania na Kurpiach
description: In this historical strategic/adventure game, the players take on the role of the heroes of the January Uprising in the Kurpie region. Their goal is to complete various tasks around the board, while dealing with random events, such as meeting the Tsar's Courier etc. Each character has a special ability, but there is a limited amount of actions that can be taken each turn, so players best plan ahead. The game aims to capture the struggle of a small guerilla force against the threat of a dangerous, oppresive foe.

name: Gambitz
description: A courtly game of points and powers. Play cards in turn, scoring points as you build up stacks of each rank. Use the powers of the court cards: Lock a stack with a Queen, unlock a stack with a Bishop, refresh your hand with a Knight, and find refuge with a Castle. When no more cards can be played, the player with the most points wins.

name: Taksikuski
description:
A Finnish board game classic from the 1980s in which the players take the role of taxi drivers in an imaginary town. The aim is to collect as much money as possible.

Players start from the taxi station of their choice. Everyone picks up a customer and an address from the yellow customer deck. The taxi fee is determined by counting the spaces between the destination and the current location of the taxi car. Now, all the players must reach their destinations on the map by throwing two 6-sided dice and moving according to them on the board. When a customer reaches his destination, the player must pick up a red destination card: Will the customer be able to pay after all? Or will he even tip you some extra? Or maybe rob you of half of your money?

After successfully completing a trip, the players return to a taxi station to pick up a new customer. Whoever has the most money after a predetermined time or other limit (e.g. end of deck) is declared the winner.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: ZNA
description:
ZNA is a cooperative survival boardgame in a unique post-apocalyptic setting.

The action takes place in Boston, in 2025.

The city has been struck by a storm of dark smoke that the inhabitants will later call “the Fog”. This fog destroys everything in its path, leaving behind it a world plunged into chaos. Nobody knows the exact extent of the damage. The Fog concentrates as it settles over the areas it hits, making them dangerous, almost impassable, and infested with threatening mutants.

Indeed, the vast majority of the population seems to have been infected by the Fog. Those who were not killed have been contaminated to the point of transforming into violent and ruthless creatures with superhuman abilities. Their only motivation appears to be the constant hunt of the survivors.

Will you survive the Fog, unpredictable and ever changing, throughout the 12 scenarios of the game? Getting out of this tainted and contaminated Boston will not be an easy task.

Embody one of the brave survivors of the cataclysm: John (“The Eye”), the criminal with unerring accuracy; B-Mama, the paranoid, baseball-bat-wielding couch potato in need of anger management; Smokey, the specialist in maintaining the more dangerous parts of the city’s underbelly; or Mia, the prodigy chemistry student.

Together, you will progress across the modular gameboard, searching for equipment, swapping objects with one another, looting chemical storage facilities in order to mix up concoctions for various uses, and most of all, fight the Fog and the mutants it created.

Be careful where you step: The Fog is thicker in some more contaminated areas, rife with mutants — stronger mutants. In order to avoid contamination, or a worse fate, you will also need to anticipate what surprises the Fog holds for you next, as you search or fumble through the map tiles darkened by its presence.

By making use of clandestine Bio-Hacker labs, you will be able to create cocktails of chemical reagents to suit any purpose: decontaminating areas; healing or decontaminating yourselves; attacking, freezing, confusing, or even controlling mutants! Best of all, though, is to kill them before they can fight back through nasty dice combos and special abilities, such as accelerated mutation, teleportation, regeneration, or contamination.

Enjoy an even more immersive experience by using the ZNA App, which provides game help, interactive scenarios, a map editor, storytelling, and more! Hack BioCorp’s Drones, and scan map tiles using augmented reality through your smartphone or tablet.

Discover the different game modes: Adventure, Siege, Escape, and all their original mechanisms.

Survive an epic story in a devastated urban environment.

Welcome to ZNA!

name: Letter Rip: The Game of Famous Names
description:
Players roll 10 letter dice two times. On the score sheet all players write the results of the first and second rolls in the same order making letter pairs. All players should have the same letter pairs.

A category d6 is also rolled with: sports, TV, books, history, movies & music.

Those letter pairs will be used as the initials of famous people or fictional characters.

"Unique" non-repeated answers will score one point.

Repeated answers will score zero points.

If the "unique" name matches the category then a bonus point is awarded for two total points.

Most points after 5 rounds wins.

name: Kitty Wampus
description:
A highly amusing and entertaining game for little folks

Kitty Wampus is a very simple game. Each players gets 4 wooden disks of the same color. In turns a player spins the Kitty Spinner. If it lands on his color he covers one of his white spaces with his disk. If it lands on another color his turn is over. The person to cover his 4 white spaces wins.

name: UNO Choo-Choo
description: All aboard for Fast Fun for Little Ones with UNO Choo-Choo Game. Preschoolers depart on an UNO adventure featuring a train filled with adorable animals. Play by matching color or animal cards, or play a conductor card he's wild and matches anything! When you have only one card left, cheer 'UNO Choo-Choo!' to let everyone know the winning train is leaving the station! Includes 28 cards, 4 caboose partitions and train. For 2 to 4 players. Ages 3 and older.

name: Pieken: Op naar de Top
description:
A holiday-themed roll-and-move game. The game is played on a board resembling a Christmas tree. The goal of the game is to reach the top of this Christmas tree first.
On your turn, you spin the included top, resulting in a number from one to three. You then either move that many steps in your current row and cover the field you leave with a Christmas decoration token. However, if you "rolled" a three, or no fields are available, you move up one row. If you reach the top, you win!

name: Hvem Ved Hvad
description:
Quiz game for 3+ players.

One player is chosen as quiz master, and will hand out 3-4 cards. He then pick a player to read and answer the questions on their card; the scoring is as follows:
2 point for a correct answer
1 point for a partial correct answer
0 point for a wrong or no answer

The winner is the one with most points.

The exact date is unknown, but the first editions was with pre-1948 spelling rules.

name: Aqueducts
description: Aqueducts is a tile laying game where you are trying to get the water from the center lake to all 4 buildings of your town. Making a viable town is no easy feat, luckily you have hex shaped aqueduct pieces to help you accomplish your goals. You will have to puzzle out your best path while contending with other players who can direct your aqueducts elsewhere. If you can overcome your opponents sabotage efforts and are the first to get water to all your town buildings, your town will survive and you will be victorious.

name: Geek Army
description:
It is time to bring together your own Geek Army and take over the world (game night) in this 2 - 5 player, simple and fun card game.

Many of us were picked on at school, many were last to be pick for sports and many want to take over the world. Well the fight back starts here! Some will fall in the upcoming battle, but if you bring together the ultimate Geek Army, you will take over the world (game night). Come the GEEK REVOLUTION!

This game has been designed to be played at a game night or convention. Your job is to build the best geek army you can. Each player starts with a hand of cards. On your turn you must do the following actions in order. Draw or Pick Back, then Place and finally Discard. Do each action only once then play passes to player to your left. This continues until a player “Goes Out” by having no cards in there hand.

At the end of the game calculate your score by adding the value of each set in your army together (the cards face up in front of you).
Then minus the value of any sets you have left in your hand. Each of the 10 sets of Geek Cards, have a value based on the number of them you have collected.

The large number indicates how many points in total a set of this type of Geek is worth. The twist is that each set does not necessarily become worth more with the more of that type you have.

The player who wins the game gets to use their new geek powers (meta game effects like picking who makes drinks, or what game the group plays next.) You might want to play again just so you don't have to make the drinks for the rest of the event.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Spot the Twins
description:
Party Game.

24 cards are placed around the room and guests are encouraged to play the game. Each card shows a spectacularly ugly man and, at first glance, seem the same but they are not. In fact, there are 12 matching pairs and so it becomes a game of observation.

The host or hostess announces the start of the game and players must rush to complete their list. The first guest to find all 12 pairs correctly, wins. The host or hostess should have a small prize for the winner.

name: All About Yourself
description:
Party game. Guests are given a card with 39 clues to an item and a time limit. All the answers must be a part of the body. The clues are a mixture of non-cryptic and cryptic. Examples:
A Sticky Substance = Gum
Flowers in Springtime = Tulips (Two Lips)

When "Time" is called, the guest with the most correct answers, wins.

name: Quik-Wits
description:
Party game. Each guest is given a card with 3 different games on it. It is best played as a 'speed-quiz', i.e. first to solve each section will win.

Game 1. Odd One Out - similar pictures are grouped in three's. One is very slightly different and your task is to find that 'Odd One Out'.
Game 2. Two Alike - another observation test. There are 12 pictures of a dog. All of them look the same at first glance. However only two are identical, so players must find that pair.
Game 3. Safari - Players are given 9 different sentences. Hidden within the sentence is a name of an animal. Example; Near the wall a bystander looked on; Answer WALLABY. I am sure this type of word-play has a name but I can't recall it.

name: Hurry Scurry
description:
A splendid action game for young people.

Fourteen perforated sheets are provided and on each are 6 pairs of words which can be separated by tearing along the Perforation which runs down the middle. Each pair consists of related words, e.g., BEE—H1VE, BIRD—NEST, etc.
INSTRUCTIONS TO M.C.
PREPARATION FOR PLAY
Tear each sheet along the perforations so that there are 168 slips in all. The first halves are distinguished from the second halves by the spot in the top right córner of the former.
Distribute the second halves about the house or hall with the printed faces upwards and retain the first halves.
List the players by name or number on a score sheet.
Give each player a “first half” slip.
HOW PLAY PROCEEDS
At the word " GO ” the players set off to find the counterpart of the slips they hold. A player does not know what the word is, but on seeing the words on the “second half” slips he will recognise the one he is looking for by its close connection with the word on the slip he is carrying.
When a player beiieves he has found the correct counterpart he presents the two slips to the M.C.; if correct the M.C. records one point for that player and gives him another slip.
If during the game a player presents an incorrect pair of slips to the M.C. he must resume looking for the correct counterpart and is not given another “first half” slip until he finds it.
OR
If he cannot lócate the counterpart and would prefer to have another “first half” slip, he is entitled to do so but one point is deducted from his score.
THE WINNER is the player who scores the hlghest number of points in an agreed time or when the whole of the slips have been used.
The material in each packet provides for about eight young people. If more are taking part extra perforated sheets should be obtained.
The game can be varied by distributing the first halves and giving the players the second halves.
SOLUTION SHEET
On this are listed the correctly paired words.
N.B.—The pairs of words have been so chosen that there should be little doubt in a player’s mind as to whether he has found the correct counter¬part.
categories: Children's Game, Party Game, Word Game

name: Intercardinal X
description: Intercardinal X is an asymmetric N-in-a-row game. Players take turns placing pieces on a 15x15 board. The first to make a row of 6 contiguous pieces of their colour orthogonally or 5 diagonally wins.

name: Little Football Game
description:
Little Football Game (LFG) is a fast tactical card game in which you control your own football team. Every team has it's own strengths and weaknesses. So you must choose your tactics wisely.

A game is played by 2 players and will last only 20 minutes. You can play the game in tournament mode and play several matches, so more players can join in.

There are 3 types of players: Defenders, midfielders and attackers. You can only play them when the ball marker is in the corresponding playing area on the pitch card. Every player has 14 player cards. You can choose which cards to play first, but keep in mind that you can play each card only once.

The game has a balanced system between several player qualities. Some teams are stronger, but more likely to make fouls. Some teams are weaker but are very experienced or specialized at set pieces. etc.
Every box contains 3 different teams. There are already 6 different teams made for the game. When you buy a game, you decide which 3 out of 6 teams you get in your box. As an expansion, you can get the other teams later on if you like.

name: Möllanspelet
description: A local "monopoly game", about an area in Malmö, Sweden called "Möllan".
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Havets konung
description:
- En kappsegling runt Gotland (A race around Gotland).

The players competing in a race around the Island Gotland in the Baltic sea. The boats are moving by picking up the right picture from facedown tiles that correspond to a field in front of the playing piece. If a wrong tile are picked, then the boat have to move back. The tiles are put back in the same place and after a while you have to trust your memory to pick the right tile.
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Racing, Travel

name: Tostaki
description:
Put the ham, cheese and tomato between two slices of bread and the toast will be yours!

Your goal is to have created more toasts than your opponents when the game ends.Using wisely the ingredients you are given, you can delay the other players' toasts and be declared the winner!

The uncompleted toasts are face up in the middle of the table.When it is your turn to play you simply draw the top card of the face down ingredient deck.Then you have to choose in which uncompleted toast the ingredient will go.Every toast needs to consist of two slices of bread, one slice of cheese, ham and tomato. Cheese, ham and tomato have to be placed on top of the first slice of bread.In order to complete the toast you need to place the second slice of bread on top of all these ingredients and you simply take the toast in front of you as a reward!

name: Connect Connect
description:
User summary:
こねくとこねくと (Connect Connect) is a game based on the lottery mechanic called Ghost Leg ('Amidakuji' in Japan). In this game, you use strings to make connections between face-down cards, trying to reach a high score. The true paths are hidden but you get to see two cards. Can you make the right connections?

Designer's summary:
[あみだくじ]と言うくじ引きのルールを取り入れたゲームです。実際の紐を使って得点を競い合います。

name: Die!
description:
In Die! you are trying not to die; however, you will most likely die...quickly. Players play role cards and try to survive the other players, with a typical game lasting 1-5 minutes. Roles include:


Undertaker
Jester
Knight
King
Peasant


In more detail, each player chooses a role card, then says a secret phrase. You may lie. Players try to deduce and outguess who you are. You may also choose to sit out a round, but this option is available to you only once (via token). You can earn the token back and may live to survive another day — but most likely you'll die.

name: S Jakubem na rybách
description: Players throw the dice and moves his pawn along the board. They have a several destinations where they try to catch as the most valuable fish. Crowned the winner is the player who is at the end of the season for the most points earned catches.

name: Ovocníci
description:
Game based on the animated TV series for children Fruittis.
Players roll the dice and move their token through the board. Their goal is to collect as many cards that can be obtained for stepping on the field or by passing the circuit through playing plan. The game ends at the moment when the first player gets the cards to all eight characters, winning player with the most cards.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Furball Rampage
description:
It is the year 2062. The NSP received a cordial invitation to join visiting extra terrestrial dignitaries for a cup of intergalactic java. The purpose was to embark upon a unique journey of friendship and shared knowledge. But as with all things sinister, it was simply too good to be true. The aliens, who called themselves Repondors, imprisoned a handful of animals on the mothership. After years of experimentation the animals escaped with one thing on their minds: escape and return to earth.

This game is simple, quick and full of fun strategy.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Card Game, Dice, Science Fiction, Territory Building

name: Chouffe Game
description: Discover the CHOUFFE world. Build La Chouffe icons out of bricks in a certain time.

name: Auf den Spuren  des Völkerapostels Paulus
description:
The game plays at the time of the live of Paulus.

The board Shows the east Mediterranean Sea, square fields are marked. There are cities (numbered) on the board, which where visited by Paulus.

At the begin of the game 6 city cards are drawn, sorted by number (lowest on top) and placed on the board.

The Paulus pawn is placed on the city of the Card with the lowest number.
3 additional Cards are placed right to the city Card series.
A neutral pawn is placed on a path at the edge of the board. This path Shows fields with the numbers 1 to 3 and fields with P.
On a player's turn he rolls the die, moves the neutral pawn this number and normally gets the number of Cards the field shows.
The player can choose freely if he wants to get person cards or good cards.
The active player can trade Cards with the other Players.
The active player can found a parish in one of the 3 cities shown by the open cards. For this he has to give the 4 person and goods shown on the city card. dependent on the Position of Petrus he may pay less (neighbored area on the map 3, same field 2, but always the love card).
The player gets the city Card, a new one replaces it on the board.
The turn of the player is interrupted if he reaches with his dice roll the P field (exact or not). The pawn is placed on the P. Paulus pawn moves to the next city in the series. Each parish (owner of it) gets one word card. Additional one for some cities (Jerusalem, same area as Paulus).
Player continues with a new die roll.
Game ends when Paulus reaches the last city of the series.
Winner is the player with the most victory points.
Points: 1 VP for each word Card. Bonus for more than half or all of the word cards of a cathegory.

name: Großes Kino!
description:
Movie Mashup
You are screenwriters for the filmstudio Galactic Pictures, which is looking for the next blockbuster.
It's on you to write a spectacular script as fast as possible!

In the first part of the game you have to gather ideas (cards) for your story, but beware the demands of the studio and the audience! Some genres (card-colors) are highly in vogue, others are simply not. And of course each story should contain lead characters, a supporting character, an item, a villain and a setting! The more precise your script sticks to this demands, the more points it will get.

In the second part of the game it's time to create a short, convincing and exciting story out of your story elements. Tell your storys, give points to each other and in the end one story will become the new blockbuster!


German description:
Filmvisionäre und Drehbuchautoren gesucht!
Das Filmstudio Galactic Pictures braucht einen neuen Blockbuster und hat euch damit beauftragt, so schnell wie möglich die Handlung für einen großartigen neuen Film auszuarbeiten.

Im ersten Teil des Spiels sammelt ihr Ideen, die in Form von Karten auf dem Tisch liegen. Dabei müsst ihr jedoch die Vorgaben des Studios einhalten: Welche Genres (Kartenfarben) liegen gerade im Trend? Und was kommt beim Publikum im Moment gar nicht an? Darüberhinaus sollten von Hauptfiguren, über Nebenfigur, Gegenstand, Bösewicht und Schauplatz alle wichtigen Elemente einer Geschichte enthalten sein. Je genauer die Story diese Vorgaben einhält und den aktuellen Trends entspricht, desto mehr Punkte bringt sie ein.

Im zweiten Teil des Spiels geht es darum, aus den zuvor gesammelten Story-Elementen eine kurze, schlüssige und spannende Geschichte zu ersinnen und sie einander zu erzählen. Dann werden verdeckt Wertungschips für die Geschichten der Mitspieler verteilt und alle Punkte addiert. Die Story des Spielers mit den meisten Punkten schafft es auf die Leinwand und verspricht: Großes Kino!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Storytelling, Voting

name: Super Tank
description:
From the back cover of the rulebook:

This game details super tank combat in the late 21st and early 22nd centuries. This is a stand alone game. It may also be used with the Cassiopeian Empire role playing game as optional rules for tactical combat.

No map is included. You the player make your own map using the outline that is provided. This makes the game different every time you play.

This is a diceless system. Combat is done on a offense vs defense chart. Two vehicle sheets are provided. This gives you two of each type vehicle. Items needed for play. Blank paper, several different colored markers and a ruler. For two or more players.

name: Plänemacher
description:
Promotional game for Commerzbank in Germany.

The game title means Business Plan as players are asked to give their plans to the bank who will then give them a loan and, hopefully, the players will make a profit before the game ends.

The game is a simple roll and move game. However there is some choice because each player has two pawns and may move both by splitting the dice roll; i.e. You roll a 5 and a 2, one pawn may move 5 and the other 2 or vice versa. The board squares feature many actions that may be taken or investment opportunities that may be taken up.

The game ends at the end of a round when a pre-determined time has run out. The player with the most money, wins.

name: Cork and Screw
description:
Cork and Screw is a card game for 4-6 players. It has 288 cards total which includes Question, Answers and Challenge cards. It won't be for everyone. It is sexual, fun and ornery.

This game holds some similarities to games like Cards Against Humanity and Apples to Apples. The difference is in order to advance to the next level, the player must complete a challenge card and be judged by the other players.

name: Pig Out, Pete!
description: Pig Out, Pete! is an electronic game in which Pete moves around and makes funny sounds as he throws up plastic food. Every 15 seconds, Pete will throw up a piece of food and players must dig through a tray of slime/gunk (much like Gak) for a plastic food piece of the same color. Once a player finds the correct piece, they set it aside along with the matching piece that Pete threw up. After Pete has fully purged himself and all of the pieces have been collected, the player with the most wins.

name: Disney Princess Memo-Menu
description:
Set the table with Snow White's help.
Snow White is moved round a table (free direction)with places for each of the 7 dwarves and herself. This move is driven by a die. Each place counts one point.
For each place there is an individual set of under plate, silver plate and chicken dish. Which have to be placed in this series while the game.
The actual player tries to find the right part from beside the plan. If the player has found the right part he is allowed to continue with the next part for the same place.
If not, the next player roles the die and continues.
If all 3 parts are found the actual player gets a diamond.
If all places have all parts the game ends and the player with the highest number of diamonds wins.

name: Trick or Treat
description:
Trick or Treat takes every kid's favorite part of Halloween and packs it into a fun filled, adventurous candy gathering card game. Which is perfect for those occasional rainy Halloweens, Halloween parties or those days when your family just wants to wear costumes.

Each player takes turns rolling dice to flip cards on the corresponding houses. Their goal is to become the big winner on the block who has collected the most candy, while trying to avoid a number of obstacles that make trick or treating an adventure.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: ... ist doch logisch !
description:
Mathematic think and logic game.

Each player gets the same set of numbers (1 and 2 digits). He shuffles them and takes new that he has again 12 numbers on his hand each round. The player adds 3 stones to his Hand if he cannot do anything on his turn.

The game board shows places for the numbers and the 4 base calculations between them.

Additionally there are rows of number fields, where the player can place series of numbers with always the same difference.

On players turn he can place whole valid calculation, or a part of a series of 3 or more numbers (with the same difference).

A third possibility is to continue a series. The actual player places as much as he can.

If something is wrong, he gets the numbers back and the next player has his turn.

The game ends after the round when the first player has placed all his numbers. The player without Stones wins. If more than 1 has finished the one with the less number of used special marked field wins.

name: Hexal
description:
From the box:

The fun game of forward thinking and awareness!

Three characteristics... colour, symbol, size.

Place your tiles such that they match other tile(s) already on the table in at least one characteristic. Simple?! Sure it is.

But be extremely cautious with what tile(s) you place. You may just be setting it all up beautifully for your opponent(s) to come in and out-think and out-score you.

Think a few steps ahead... and be aware - be very aware.

A fast paced game for 2-4 players.

name: TXT Off
description: TXT Off (Text-Off) is a standard trivia game where players move around a board answering questions about texting language, shorthand and trivia. Categories may have all players answering or just the player whose turn it is. Players earn points by correctly answering questions. First player to 20 points wins.

name: A Night At The Movies
description:
A great family game based on classic and recent movies.
Spend hours of fun as you try to recall details from your favourite movies. Your brain cells will be "Smokin'" as you try to beat the clock and your opponents, to be first with the correct answer.
The design of the gameboard allows you to answer questions both on your own turn or the turn of another player!
If you disagree with another player's answer you can dispute and provide another response.

name: Wieso? Weshalb? Warum? Tiere: Das pfiffige Wissensspiel
description:
How do crocodile babies come into the world? If a hamster awake at night? Where is the hedgehog in winter ? With knowledge, a little luck and a good memory you collect the most chips. By the way you will learn interesting facts about the animal world.

To play the game, 30 image tokens need to be assign to the correct one of the 5 theme tables, with each player revealing two tokens on his turn and chosing one. If you manage to place your tokens on the marked spots, you earn victory points.

name: The Universe
description:
Space-themed, dexterity luck, skill, strategy game using dice, marbles and discs. Its bocci ball, bowling, shuffle board, craps, pool, and a little bit of monopoly.

Players send out their ships by flicking and rolling from cornered docks. The objective is to land on the positive spaces, ring bearers or the black hole with your disks. Watch out for negatives and the black hole with your marble and dice.

Defense is also allowed if you can hit your opponents ships with yours. Setting a round maximum, the player with highest points at the end of the set round wins. You can actually win by losing in this game. Simple to learn and competitive to play.
mechanics: Action Queue, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Hallowe'en (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Channel Islands (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, though there are limited selective options for these.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Smoke 'em Mon
description:
A drinking-style game that parodies the Pokemon CCG. Each player starts with one monster in play and 4 more in hand. On your turn, you take 2 actions -- attack or play a new monster. The attacks have humorous flavor text but mechanically just do a fixed amount of damage. Better attacks can only be used after you have 'powered up' a certain number of times -- you power up once each turn by doing some out-of-game task agreed upon ahead of time (e.g. drinking or smoking). The last player with creatures still in play wins.

Description from the designer:

The trading card game that's a little bit hazy.

Smoke 'em Mon is a multiplayer battle game where the objective is to kill all your friends smokies (monsters) and become the Grand Champion Master Sensei. To "Power Up" each player is subjected to smoking, drinking or whatever other tempting tortures your friends can dream up.

Smoke 'em Mon the trading card game features the first 101 smokies known to man and can be played with 2 to 99 players. Thanks to the special "Anything Goes" game rule battles can go in any direction at any time!
mechanics: Action Points, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Wales (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.


This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The board does not have any grey tracks or parallel tracks, except the special express route.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Swap Meet
description:
From the game box:
"Today is your neighborhood swap meet! Dozens of folks have hauled their unwanted stuff into their driveways. Swap your old stuff you don’t want for… well, more old stuff, but old stuff you’d rather have. Be warned, there are other bargain hunters out there too! Go too slow and you lose the deal. Go too fast and you might miss out on the ultimate swap!"

This game was created as an educational tool to teach students about unit conversion. Players start with certain goods and play cards to convert (swap) those goods into other goods, for example Comic Books to DVDs. Players are competing to complete a Deal by chaining swaps to a shared Goal and collect points based on the number of cards used in the Deal. Play continues for a number of rounds and the player with the most points win.

name: Mark Lawrence's Horsemen of the Apocalypse
description:
A chance to combine your interest in destroying the world, card games, and riding down innocents in order to doom your friends.

EVERYONE WHO PLAYS HORSEMEN OF THE APOCALYPSE DIES. Sorry.

The object is pretty straightforward. Be the last survivor...and ensure your (so-called) 'friends' are ridden down first. How? You do this by throwing innocents under the hooves of the Four Horsemen of the Apocalypse in order to slow them down.

Decks of cards contain the Horsemen: Death, Famine, War and Pestilence, and their Horses. They have arrived on Earth at the End of Days hell-bent on bringing doom and gloom to the world. Everything else in the game is designed to help you survive. For a time, at least.

Delay Cards are many and varied. They comprise the bulk of the game and include such things as hippies, a school bus, a beached whale, your grandmother, nurses, farmers, a basket of puppies...basically anything you can throw in front of the Horsemen to stop them from reaching you.

There are also Effect Cards, which include actions such as Swap, Shield, Force, and more. These cards allow a player to steal another player's defenders, or to turn a Horseman back against the previous player, or to force a player to put down any Horseman/Horse card in their hand.

According to the game's designer, Mark Lawrence, "the game is all about recklessly laying down innocent lives to eke out your own miserable survival, but to win you have to do it effectively. Each Horseman of the Apocalypse is unique. It’s going to take something very different to slow down Pestilence than to slow down Famine. If Death and War are both riding your way, throw the Diplomat under War’s hooves and the Doctor under Death’s, not the other way around."
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Player Elimination

name: Iberia (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Yoga Cards
description: Can you stand on your shoulders or hold a steady stance like a warrior? Increase flexibility and focus as you practice 48 yoga poses in this fun and simple card game. Your goal in Yoga Cards: Be the first player to correctly hold seven yoga poses that meet your mission and you win!
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game
mechanics: Push Your Luck, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Big Wheel
description:
From the publisher:

Big Wheel challenges the skills, luck and determination of 1-8 players, pitting players against players and against the board itself! The object of the game: to become a millionaire (or go broke) within the time allotted. Easily understood directions. Educational and fun for the entire family - year 'round!

Big Wheel uses a patented movement which changes the economic conditions of the gameboard randomly among depression, recession, normal, inflation and super-inflation. As a result players must change their strategy as the gameboard changes.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Wer pupst?
description: A children's game with an electronic device that allows one of the three to four players to let a farting sound occur. It's then the others players job to decide which player "farted" and the farting player's job to deceive the others about his fart.

name: Kampen om Uppsala
description:
This belongs to a series of promotional Monopoly clones featuring local businesses and trivia, published around 1988-1992. As in Monopoly you move around a board collecting "shares" and hope for others to land on your properties, although the specifics are slightly different. Obviously the trivia elements vary from game to game within the series, and there are also some small mechanical variations, e.g. in the composition of event cards and how rent is calculated.

This particular entry in the series has trivia questions on some cards meant specifically for children, although there's no guarantee they'll be any easier to answer without specific local knowledge.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Het Westfrieslandspel
description:
A board game with questions in 6 categories about the region West Friesland in The Netherlands.
During the game your goal is to collect the 5 name tags of the big cities and to collect 2 lions.
These can be collected by answering the questions correctly at some locations on the board.
Every turn you roll with the dice and answer questions untill you answered a question incorrect or you received 1 of the 7 goal tags.

name: Shopping Queen: Das Würfelspiel
description:
Description from the publisher:

The candidate of the day is traveling back and forth across the city while you're working in her home, trying to use the funds available to build up the wardrobe of this candidate to match the three special goals before the candidate returns. Who will manage to roll the best outfits in Shopping Queen: Das Würfelspiel?

name: Zauberstein
description: In Zauberstein players try to reach the center of four circular paths on the board. Players can only move from one circle to the next with the help of another player. A six sided dice determines the movement; if a player cannot make use of his dice throw he can donate it to another player, thus helping the ones behind. Nevertheless, there is a winner: the first to bring his 3 pawns (2 in a 6 player game) to the center wins.

name: Basel
description:
Two to four players can play the game,using the city plan set out in four colours with a detailed street map. Each player is given five companies which have to be established in the city.
But competition is keen. Every player must try to establish his company as close to the city centre as is possible. Space is limited and the fight for the best location is tough.
Once a company has been established on the map, the four colour places worth seeing on the back of the company logos may be exposed.
Thus,while playing the game,one becomes familiar with the sights of the city.
The player who makes the least compromises is named the most successful businessman in the city.

Game contents:
City Plan Map board
80 tiles in four colours
8 playing pieces
3 dice
Rules and information booklet.

name: What Should You Do?
description: A roll and move game designed to guide children in life decisions while teaching that all choices have consequences. Players land on spaces and are given everyday scenarios in which they must choose the best action for solving the problem.

name: Walt Disney's Kavalkad
description:
This game doesn't have a board, instead it has 56 wooden jig-saw pieces with different Disney charachers on them. You start the game by "building the game" with the wooden jig-saw pieces. You roll the die and take that many pieces, then you place them on the table, creating one long path. That is the path you then will play the game on.
Then the game actually starts. You roll the die and move your game pawn that many spaces. The character you land on (5 different ones) decides which of the (5 different) piles you get to take a card from. The cards have different Disney characters on them, and there are three different ones to collect in each family. To make it a little harder every character is cut in two pieces. When you've collected all three characters (which is a total of 6 cards) of the same family (there are 5 different families, hence the 5 different card piles) you've won the game.
The different families are Donald (Donald, Daisy, Scrooge), Mickey (Mickey, Goofy, Pluto), Snow White (Snow White, The Queen, Dopey),, Bambi (Bambi, Thumper, Flower) and The Jungle Book (Mowgli, Baloo, Bagheera).
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Hvem-Ved-Hvad Krigsspørgsmaal
description:
The game consists of 55 cards, each with a question about the 2nd World War.

The 55 cards are shuffled, and the players then have to guess the answers correctly. Each correctly guessed answer gives 1 point. In the end, the player with the most correct answers wins the game.

Is either designed or published by "Chr. L. Rasmussen". It was published between 1945-1948, most likely 1946.

name: EMKATA, the acrostic word game
description:
EMKATA is the acrostic word game with over 500 topics and thought-starters to spark your imagination and creativity. Play one-on-one or in teams of two or more in this fast-paced game of word strategy.

Each team draws a category card and gives the other team an acrostic word. Players then build upon their acrostic word and try to score as many points as possible in each of the three 5-minute rounds.

Players can use special Bi-gram and Tri-gram tiles to double and triple their score.

name: Vejle-spillet
description: Monopoly-inspired game about the Danish city of Vejle. The player pieces (small plastic cars) move along the track around the board according to a roll of two D6 dies. Each field of the track corresponds to a local Vejle firm. A player may buy a stock in a firm when ending his or her move on the field corresponding to the firm. Multiple (two) stocks are available for each field/firm. Firms are connected in sets for which the stocks belongs to the same series. Players pay each other when entering fields/firms with no stocks for sale. The players also get stock returns in various conditions. The game runs for a fixed time agreed upon by the players in advance. The player with the most money when time is up wins.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding

name: Superstar
description:
Superstar is a sports-themed family game that actually consists of five different sub-games, viz. Cross Country, Swimming, Shooting, Shot Put and Basketball. Each of the sub-games is represented by it's own roll-and-move, or dice rolling, track on the game board. Players get rewarded by game money ("Superdollars") for relative success in each sub-game - but those who land on the feared "Doping Test" space will be immediately disqualified from that particular sport! The player with most Superdollars at the end will be declared "Superstar" and given a quadruple hurrah by her fellow players.

The catch of the game is that the 18 chance cards actually instruct players to do physical exercises, such as push-ups, stretching etc., and a player unable or unwilling to do those will have to pass a turn.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Autocross
description:
Autocross is a vintage dice rolling board game, up to 6 can play. Players try to avoid the green, yellow and red spaces. Three lights shows on the right of the board, when a car steps onto one of these spaces.

Green light: one space back and miss one turn
Yellow light: two spaces back and miss two turns
Red light: go back to start

The first to get the finish, wins.

Contents:
6 cars
1 dice
1 board

You need a 4.5 V battery to use the lights (not included).

name: Armor Quest: Quæstro – Expansion Set
description: Expansion set "designed for players who have mastered the main boxed game". Additional rules and variations that add complexity, with tougher challenges. Includes a new magical combat system.

name: Boogers
description:
The game of picking, flicking and eating!

You and your disgusting friends are sitting around picking your noses. That’s boring, so you decide to start flicking those little nasties at each other. That can get tiresome and kick up quite the appetite, so in between flicking you gotta eat a few to keep up your strength.

Players draw cards from the Pick It! pile and decide whether they want to eat the good boogers (green) or flick the bad ones (red). Games are short and fast. To win, be the first player to eat enough green boogers or the last player standing, if you get too many red boogers you will be eliminated.
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Elimination, Take That

name: Star Wars: Command – Epic Assault
description:
From the box:

"Take charge and command your battle! Will you take charge as Ezra Bridger and lead the Rebel crew of The Ghost freighter in a fight against the Empire? Or will you take command as the Inquisitor in his TIE Fighter Advanced Prototype and strike the Rebels with AT-DP walkers and TIE Fighters?"

Includes 22 Figures & Vehicles from the animated series, Star Wars Rebels.

The Ghost freighter and the Advanced TIE are spring loaded vehicles that you pull back and let go. They roll across the table and knock down enemy figures. First to knock all the opponents down wins.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Science Fiction

name: We're the Scots!
description:
From the box:
"Scotland's Trivia Quiz Game. A Fun Game To Test Your Knowledge Of Scotland And The Scots."

We're the Scots! can be played either by individuals competing against one another, or teams of players competing against one another. ... Play commences with the first questioner (the player on the immediate right of the starting player) drawing the first card from the end of the pack which displays the photo-image. The starting player is then asked the 6 questions on that card in sequence. The questions are graded by degree of perceived difficulty from 1 to 6. The points awarded for correct answers correspond to the number of the question, i.e. question one scores 1 point, question two scores 2 points, question three scores 3 points, etc. ...
On all cards Question 4 (highlighted in yellow) relates to the illustration on the facing side. When it comes to this question, the questioner should read from the card, then hold up the illustration to provide the answering player with a clear view. ... Players should be afforded a reasonable opportunity to answer each question in their own time. Nevertheless, when an answer does not appear to be forthcoming, the questioner may introduce a time-limit using the one-minute timer provided in the game. A player who is unable to supply an answer within the period forfeits the points for that question....
The winning player is the one achieving the highest score. (From the instructions)

name: Jag Ringer
description: Jag ringer is a quiz game. One player pretend to call his/her friends (the other players) at different times in their lives, as the other players gets one "year" card that tells what age they are. With questions, the players should empathize with "their past" - and remember how they thought and felt when you were, for example: 13, 17 or 25 years - and then answer so convincingly as possible. The most convincing player gets one point. The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Svenskar
description: Svenskar is a quiz game. All questions are about the Swedish people, how many of the Swedish people that have done a certain thing, or that thing that is most popular, eg. What pizza is most popular in Sweden. Player gets questions one by one in turn order. If a player can answer right to a question he/she gets one point.
