The player with most points at the end of the game is the winner.

name: Sten, Sax, Påse: Superdueller
description: Sten, Sax, Påse: Superdueller is a variation on the classic Rock, Paper, Scissors. In this game you have cards with Rocks, Scissors and Pouches (in Sweden it's not paper but pouch), that you play to win matches. But before every match you also draw and read a card with special rule for that match. It can be that more then two player gonna play, or that a player must win two times in a row. The game is played until one player has a certain amount of wins.

name: Trick'in the grid
description:
Trick'in the grid is a trick-taking abstract strategy game that involves capturing cards on a board to play in tricks. It is played with a regular deck of playing cards, and two jokers, and a 4 by 4 grid that has each space holding a card face up.

The cards are dealt out face up and in the basic game, the players simultaneously look over the board and the first player who places their piece on the board determines the Trump suit by where they place their piece. That player then needs to score more points than their opponent to win the round, or their opponent wins the round. Game can play a set number of rounds or to a set number of points. In the advanced variant of the game (recommended using after players played the game a few times), players would bid points in order to be able to determine Trump, to place their piece first, and also move first.

The basic play mechanics consist of players moving like a chess rook, not through an enemy piece, and landing on a card to play it. The card the player lands on is removed from the grid and played like it would out of a hand in a regular trick-taking game. After the first player moved, their opponent must move to a card with the same suit as moved to if they can. After this initial move and following by the two players, who won the trick is determined. The player who won the trick then would then move before their opponent, making it possible for a player to get two moves in a row. Player who wins the trick keeps all cards played for trick, and scores them at the end of the round/hand.

Scoring for a round (cards dealt onto the 4x4 grid), consists of 1 point per trick won. In addition, if a player happened to win more cards in a suit than any other suit they won, the player scores one point for each of the cards in the suit they won of the most cards in. In the case of where a player has had at least two suits tie for the most cards they won in it, then the player doesn't score any bonus points. This score for the round is only used to determine if the player won the round.

name: Pixel Lincoln: Pause Promo
description:
From the designer:
This was a little bit of an "unofficial" promo. We printed about 200 before the game was even on Kickstarter. I loved the idea but it was so different than the rest of the game, so we made it a (kind of) promo card. You'll see that the coin icons don't even match the final game. Hope to redo these with the proper icons somewhere down the line.

name: Walking with Dinosaurs: The 3D Movie
description: Walking with dinosaurs is a childrens' game that 2-4 players try to create their dinosaur, that comes in 4 parts, and be the first to the finish line. The dinosaur parts are placed in the 4 corners of the board at the start of the game and piece by piece you gather them when you land to specific places. The movement uses a d6 and some special rules from the board. Some arrows show the players that can only go to a specific road. It is a fun game for small children who love dinosaurs!
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Environmental, Racing
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Push Your Luck, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Flying Nuns
description: In this daft dexterity game 2 players fire little plastic Nuns from the Notre Dame catapult onto a scoring mat. Scores and penalties are awarded for a Nun landing on a particular part of the mat.

name: Ultiem Verlangen: Kinky Edition
description: Standalone expansion with 'kinkier' questions and tasks. The game takes you on a journey of kinky discovery, intended for partners who trust each other 100 percent and want to explore unusual erotic pleasures such as role-play, fetishes, bondage, voyeurism, stimulation and pain, dominance and submission. The practices the game explores may be a fabulous turn-on for one person, perhaps shocking to another, but they’re always exciting and never disrespectful.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Old Style Pilsner Board Game
description: A no-rules board game that was designed for people to make up their own rules. Clearly, the purpose was more focused on beer drinking than deep strategy.

name: Nallarnas favoritspel
description:
A children game with two games in one with cute bears as playing pieces.

Game 1 is a adaption of the kids game Musical chairs. Every player start with 6 chairs and the last standing is the winner.

Game 2 are the bears on a trail looking for their sweets for the picnic. The first bear to collect alla of their sweets wins.

name: Old Mother Hubbard
description:
This is a Snap-style card game most notable for its fantastic graphics. The best are not Old Mother Hubbard herself or her Cupboard, but the five sets featuring her dog, titled: Dog; Laughing Dog; Dancing Dog; (Dog) Riding the Goat; and (sadly) Dead Dog.

The box is undated, but Alex G. Malloy in American Games: Comprehensive Collector's Guide, dates it to 1910 (p. 36, # 1143).

name: Zoo Keeper
description:
Description from the designer:

All of the animals have escaped. From video footage throughout the park, the monkeys seem to be responsible. Whatever the case, it falls to you to restore order. Work with a team of zoo keepers to return the animals to their habitats.

Zoo Keeper is a cooperative card drafting and set collection game for 3-7 zoo keepers. The goal is simple: work through the entire deck, collecting sets of animals so that no zoo keeper exceeds his hand limit (usually six cards).

Play starts with the player who most recently visited a zoo and works clockwise. It will likely be advantageous to shuffle the cards thoroughly before play begins. Each round, or “card drafting phase”, one zoo keeper draws cards equal to the number of zoo keepers in your team.

Each player chooses one of the available cards and passes the cards clockwise. The last card goes to the last zoo keeper. Players place their chosen cards face up on the table in front of them. These cards are considered your “hand”. Zoo keepers look to create sets of two to five cards. Each card features two numbers. The upper left number is the number needed to complete a set. The upper right number is how many of the card are in the deck. (The number 3/2 means that players must first collect a set of 3 before a set of 2.) Collect sets to free up your hand. Most cards also describe an action that is taken when a set is collected. Zoo keepers may win by collecting a specific set of cards (which varies based on the number of players in the game) or by working through the deck without any zoo keeper exceeding his hand limit (usually 6 cards). If any zoo keeper exceeds his hand limit before the deck runs out, zoo keepers are defeated.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Turtle Flip
description:
The game is a classic memory game with a twist. The object of the game is to win FLIP tokens by playing high numbered cards. It is like a game of hot potato or musical chairs. The player left with the best card when they stop moving wins!

Players start with a card and a token. On a turn, the player draws a second token and plays one of the two. The tokens rotate the face down cards left or right, or the FLIP card reveals all the cards. The highest value card wins the flip token. The first to collect 3 tokens wins.

name: Paddle Rally Cross-Country Race
description:
This Sixties race game from Whitman has a very unusual mechanism for determining how far a player can move. This is an 8" long blue plastic paddle, shaped like a rounded diamond with handle. A small red ball is attached to the end of the paddle by a 4" string. There are six holes in the paddle, five in an arc at the 4" limit of the string, and one in the center near the nose.

Each player swings the paddle in an effort to get the ball through one of the holes. The easiest, in the center, is a move of 1. Values increase toward the edges, with 2 and 3 partway and 4 and 5 on the edges. The hole near the nose is worth two free turns.

While the board box shows a map of the United States, the board itself is an abstract grid allowing orthogonal and diagonal moves. Black dots are obstacles that force a player to stop and then go around. Landing on a dot of your own color allows a free move in any direction. Landing on another player's color allows that player to move you one in a direction of his choice. First to cross the board wins.

name: Where's Olaf?
description: Join your friends from Disney Frozen in a clever game of hide-and-seek! One player hides the included Olaf figuring and other players ask questions and use deduction to figure out where Olaf could be. Is he in a room with a tub? Is he in a room with a pillow? Each question gets a HOTTER or COLDER answer. When you get the chance to go look, see if you can find Olaf before the time runs out!.

name: UNO: Seattle Mariners
description:
Standard Uno-themed card game with the addition of the Open Roof card. The Open Roof card works as a standard WILD card but also allows you to look at the hand of another player.

From the tin:

"Step up to the plate with America's National Pastime and America's #1 Brand of Family Games in UNO the Seattle Mariners Edition. This grand slam version of UNO is fully customized depicting Seattle Mariners all stars Ichiro, John Olerud, Edgar Martinez and much, much more. We have added the exclusive Open Roof card and rule, where you can look "through the roof" at another player's hand. The whole game comes packaged in a highly detailed collector's tin. Don't strikeout by missing this great tribute to the Northwest's home team."

name: Bedlam Beauties
description:
This party game is similar to other UPL drawing games like Beetle and Gooffy, but is slightly more creative. Each player receives a sheet with 12 head-and-shoulder outlines in numbered squares. The game is intended to be played by partners at a table of four or six.

Players take turns rolling a die. When either partner rolls a six, both are allowed to draw a nose on the first face on their cards. Thereafter, each player rolls only his own result, adding a hat on a 5, mouth on a 4, neckwear or an eyebrows on a 3, and an eye on a 2. The cards include 10 suggestions for hats, and say neckwear can be ties or bows for men and necklets or brooches for ladies.

As soon as one player completes a picture, he calls "Beauties" and players record a score for that round. Each feature is worth the same number of points as the die number required to draw it. When playing with multiple tables, the two highest scoring players move to the next table, and the lowest-scoring player rolls first in the next round. The game ends after a maximum of 12 rounds (when each card is filled up), and the winner is the player with the most total points.

The rules note that winners are most likely at tables where the players cooperate in throwing the die as quickly as possible, which "we may add causes riotous laughter and excitement".

name: Keys to the Capitals
description:
Game description from the publisher:

An educational game racing around the USA using the 50 Capital City Key Cards. 2-6 players start at their home towns state capital and pick from the Key Card deck to determine the prop plane route. Player picking the most key cards at end of game wins the round. Each player can check off the score pad the capital they claim. In event of tie player with their home capital wins. Ties are very rare in the 252 test games from our 2 working prototypes. Only a few. The game is very exciting and has 6 special effects that can turn the game even more exciting. Ages 7-seniors even a 4 yr old can play. Very popular with children that when they got the first prototype they play 30 times in a few week period and most rounds last 45-60 minutes average. Special effects occur 20-30 times a round when the two effects match on the dice. 2 regular dice, 2 special effect dice, 6 prop planes on stands, 50 key cards, score pad of 50 states check list. Great thing about the game is not needing to answer the questions but a memorization of the key card(s) of each state capital. It is a fun race game to collect most capitals. Object is to stay away from the long routes needed to get to the capitals. It is normal to have more than one card in your hand due to the extra key and steal a key effect.

name: Our America: A Game for All Generations
description: A family game of fun facts about the U.S.A. Fun for all generations! Learn about the history, heroes and heritage of the U.S.A. as you play. Roll the color die to see which of the six different categories of questions is yours to answer. Have fun following the state flags around your own game board. First player to collect all six category cards and reach the finish square wins!

name: Kicsoda? Micsoda?
description: The aim of the game is to answer the rhyming riddles correctly. The correct answer is shown on the other side of each card.

name: Sullivan
description:
User summary
Sullivan is a simple two-player card game with a theme of boxing between two rabbits.

This game has 12 punch card, each of which is numbered 0-3, and depicts a type of punch, which is either straight, hook, or uppercut. Each player chooses a color and takes two cards which belong to that color.

Each turn, the active player draws and reveals a punch card, whose number means additional punch cards a player receives when that player loses the turn. Both players choose a card from their hand and reveal them simultaneously. If the revealed cards are the same, the active player receives that punch card and the additional punch cards, otherwise the in-active player receives those cards.

Repeat the process until either player receives three punches of the same type, in which case that player loses the game.

Publisher's summary
サリバンは簡単な２人専用バッティングゲームです。手番プレイヤーは山札から１枚引き、各プレイヤーは手札から０または１のカードを伏せて出します。カードが出揃ったらオープンし数字を合計します。山札から引いたカードを手札の合計数分プレイヤー間を移動させます（１なら子のカードに、０と２なら親のカードとなります）
カードを手にしたプレイヤーはカードに書かれた数字分山札を引きます。これを繰り返し同じ絵柄のカードが３枚集まったプレイヤーの負けとなります。

name: Finn McCool The Giant's Causeway Game
description: Played on a hexagonal board with 19 hexagonal positions. Players alternate placing one of their pieces. The goal of the game is to make 4 in a row of your own game pieces. There are 2 types of game pieces, similar to X's and O's, and each player has 9 game pieces. A draw is possible.

name: Loulou le jeu
description: Loulou le jeu is a roll and move game in which each player tries to collect four items before freeing Tom from the claws of Gaspard the wolf. Depending on the die roll, they can also move the wolf to go frighten other players and make them lose an item. Players can also get cards to help them in their quest. The first player to collect all items and reach the centre of the board wins.

name: Skæg & skøre briller
description: A Danish family trivia and party game with a schtick: A beard-and-glasses mask. If you gain the beard and glasses, you are temporarily out of the game.

name: ListMania
description:
ListMania is a version of a familiar parlor game in which players take turns adding to a list of items in alphabetical order. It can be played cooperatively or competitively.

General game play is as follows:
Pick the top card from the deck, read the category, and start listing! Cards will be one of three types - list in alphabetical order starting with a specific letter, pick a partner and try to name as many as the card requests, or list as many as you can by yourself in a limited amount of time.

There is no winning or losing in the cooperative game. In the competitive game, if someone fails to answer correctly or think of a response, the last player who did answer correctly keeps the card.

Whoever has the most cards at the end of the game wins, however, the rules don't actually say when the game ends so players should decide that among themselves.

name: Rock Paper Scissors Dice Game
description: Loot Crate Exclusive. It's believed that this popular game originated over 2,000 years ago in China. Typically played with hand gestures, now Loot Crate brings you its very own version that combines the classic gameplay of chance with the random unpredictability of dice! Opponents each select a colored die and roll against each other. The dice sides are decorated with video game-inspired hand signs that represent "rock," "paper," and "scissors." Best out of three, OK?! Includes a velveteen dice bag so you won't lose them.

name: Tic-Tac-Maniac
description:
Description from the rules:

Tic-Tac-Maniac is based on Tic-Tac-Toe. It's as easy as Tic-Tac-Toe but in the game Tic-Tac-Maniac there will always be a winner!

The object of the game is to be the first player to get a tic-tac-toe combination using all the same colored number cards, corresponding line cards, and wild cards, without being blocked by another player's Cat card.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That, Trading

name: Skunk!!!
description:
Simple childrens/family cooperative game where you try to keep your organic garden safe from pests, while trying to catch as many of them as you can.

The game consists of a 12"X 12" board made up of nine different numbered garden patches, 7 cardboard garden pests numbered 1-6, paperboard havahart trap, 2 dice and electric fence chart (used in harder game play).

Setup: put pests on the board in the matching black numbered/picture patch of the garden. The skunk starts the game off the board next to the number 1 space. Oldest player goes first.

A turn consists of the following actions:
1. Put the open trap on any garden patch
2. Roll both dice to see which pests move.
A pest is moved to its matching picture. Back and forth between its black numbered space and the bottom row of the garden with red-numbered picture/spaces. A 1 rolled, moves both a pest, AND moves the skunk onto the board. The skunk only moves on a 1, and follows the green dotted path through the garden.

If a pest ends up in the trap at the end of a turn, it is caught and moved off the board. It CAN re-enter the game if doubles of their number are rolled! Skunks cannot be removed from the board.

The game ends when all the pests have been caught and are off the board, OR the skunk moves through all 9 garden patches and leaves the garden.

If the skunks departure ends the game, count up how many pests you got rid of, and try for more next time!

name: Crazy Counting Party
description: What did the tiger get as a great gift? And why did the penguin bring the same six gifts? Whoever can count the points correctly gets to unwrap the wacky gifts. Here we go! Throw the dice, count, receive gifts. A crazy game for 2-4 players ages 4-99 that helps develop counting and math skills!

name: Campo Bello
description: A fun, abstract family game for 2-4 players that adds a multiplayer twist to the traditional peg solitaire game. To win Campo Bello, remove your pieces from the board first. Pieces are arrayed in four triangular home areas that surround a center diamond. Pieces are removed by jumping - jumping one's own piece causes the jumped piece to be removed. Jumping an opponent's piece allows you to remove any of your pieces from the board.

name: Loops
description:
In Loops, all players are in control of a plane.

Each round, players are dealt a set of cards that must be played. Each card can either changes the altitude of the plane, changes the plane's direction (i.e., the player who goes next), or triggers something.

As soon as someone gets rid of all their cards, they win the round and everyone tallies up their score. The game ends when someone reaches a score of 200. Whomever has the lowest score wins!
categories: Aviation / Flight, Card Game, Party Game

name: Traveling Animals
description:
Traveling Animals is a multi-difficulty trivia game in which players answer questions about animals or world environmental conservation. At the beginning of the game, each player independently selects whether they will play at the easy (tourist), medium (pathfinder), or hard (native) difficulty level. The goal is to correctly answer questions and be the first player to reach the "Global Animal Congress" (located off the east coast of Australia) with five collected trivia cards.

Traveling by dice-roll, players move their tokens along paths defined by real-world animal migration routes; side routs and branching paths allow for strategic movement. Upon landing on a question space, players get to answer a question from either an Animal or World card.

The 75 Animal cards each have a custom piece of artwork on the front depicting the animal in question and one trivia question for each of the three difficulty levels (usually in the form of true/false, multiple choice, and direct answer, respectively). A correct answer awards the card to the player; some spaces on the board can later cause cards to be lost or stolen. The 15 World cards work similarly, although they all share identical artwork.

Special spaces on the travel paths allow players to jump around the board, steal cards, lose cards, and gain/lose a turn. The rule book contains variant instructions.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Puzzle Place Game
description:
Theme: Be the player to put the final piece of the puzzle together.
Game Play: Pick a puzzle friend and place it on the gear space with the same color as your friend. Spin the spinner and move your friend to the color the spinner lands on. If you land on a space with a puzzle piece place the puzzle piece in the puzzle tray.
Game ends: When the final puzzle piece is placed in the puzzle tray.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Packa pappas kappsäck
description:
Swedish memory game for children. Literally "Pack daddy's suitcase".

Players take turns placing cards showing different items in the "suitcase", creating a new card deck. When all cards have been placed the first player then tries to remember in which order the items were placed in the deck ("suitcase"). For a correct guess items are kept by the player. If the player makes an incorrect guess, the turn is passed on to the next player.

name: Flip'n Chips
description: To set up Flip'n Chips, pour all of the chips onto the table, then lay them flat. Players take turns flipping chips over to match colors and shapes. Get seven of your matching chips face up and you win!

name: Mini Hexchess
description:
Mini Hexchess is an adaptation of the larger 91-cell "Hexagonal Chess" game by the same designer. (The designer notes that, although developed independently, the rules to his larger game are very similar to Glinski's Hexagonal Chess.) The mini game was created in response to a challenge posted on ChessVariants.com.

The game plays like orthodox chess, except the usual moves are interpreted as follows: Orthogonal moves cross hex edges. Diagonal moves follow hex corners, "jumping" over the connecting edges -- moving through spaces of the same color.

Unlike orthodox chess, this game has no castling, no pawn double-move, nor a corresponding en passant capture. This mini game has no queen, so a pawn is not allowed to promote to one.

Each player begins with 5 pawns, a king, a knight, a bishop, and a rook.

name: Assault on Hill 60
description: This is the first game of Kilovolt Design's tactical mini wargame series "Winning or Losing". The theme is the Battle of Messines (1917) during World War I. The title is named after Australian war film Beneath Hill 60. The game is basically played by two players. British player tries to occupy Messines Ridge. German player tries to prevent it.

name: Armapalabras
description:
Armapalabras is the most dynamic and entertaining word game for all ages.

It includes 2 games with different levels of difficulty: Basket and Word.

For the kids: Educational and fun, exercise and expand vocabulary.

For the big ones: A challenge of agility and creativity.

CONTENT
Two decks of 40 cards each, instructions of the game "basket", instructions of the game "word" and a version of practice ..

---

Armapalabras es el más dinámico y entretenido juego de armar palabras para todas las edades.

Incluye 2 juegos con distintos niveles de dificultad: Canasta y Palabra.

Para los chicos: Educativo y divertido, ejercita y amplía el vocabulario.

Para los grandes: Un desafío de agilidad y creatividad.

CONTENIDO
Dos mazos de 40 cartas cada uno, instrucciones del juego “canasta”, instrucciones del juego “palabra” y una versión de práctica..

name: Seagull Splat
description:
Descrption from the publisher:

Seagull Splat is a mischievous and hilarious children's Game that will have kids screaming with laughter as they poop their way through victory. Each player receives a set of beach towels and takes it in turn to fly the Seagull over the towels. Are you lucky enough to dodge that poop? You may end up popped out if you aren't?

Box Contains 1 Seagull 1x75ml seagull foam solution 4x 4 character cards (1 red / 1 orange / 1 green / 1 blue)x 1 spinner label x 1 base x1 spinner arrow.

A mischievous and hilarious children's game. Each player receives a set of beach towels. Take it in turns to fly the Seagull over the towels. Are you lucky enough to dodge that poop? You may end up pooped out if you aren't.

name: Grand Tundra: Arctic Circle Edition Board Game
description:
Description from the publisher:

Kaadoo: your nature safari on the go! Bring the uplands, the expansive Tundra indoors!

Fun and educational wildlife safari board game for children and the whole family. Ideally suited for children aged 6 to 12 years
One-of-a-kind board game created by wildlife photographer and enthusiast Diinesh Kumble; approved and co-branded by the World Wildlife Fund [WWF] India
A game for everyone, offering hours of group play, driving through the jungle, discovering amazing wild beasts and facing the ups and downs of a safari
Offers quick set up and easy understanding for kids and yet involves strategic thinking on the use of cards to alter game status
Educates children on the flora and fauna and develops in them a taste for nature and wildlife
Makes a unique and outstanding gift

name: Wer will schwarzer Peter werden?
description:
Schwarzer Peter or Black Peter is the anti-Santa Claus, a character who comes along and punishes the "bad" kids while Santa doles out presents to the ones who've been good. This 19th Century gambling game uses Black Peter as a theme for a roll-and-move race with particularly nasty penalty spaces.

The board has a 70-space track, with 28 square spaces around the edge of the board, and then two concentric rings of spaces (large and illustrated 33-44, small colored spaces 45-68) with 69 and 70 along with Black Peter in the center.

The game can be played by any number and uses two dice. Anyone who rolls double 1 or 2 gets to roll again. There is an initial ante, and various spaces call for fines to be paid or bonuses received, either to/from the pot or other players. Spaces 12, 21, 25 and 28 make players go back to 5.

Anyone who lands on 35 must take the Black Peter token and is out of the game, while other spaces give players a black token - and three black tokens also eliminate the player. Any player that runs out of money along the way is eliminated too. First player to 70 collects the pot.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Het Enige Echte en Ware Rondespel
description:
This game is dedicated to the Tour of Flanders, one of the five one-day races known as cycling 'monuments'.
It's a dice game for up to 4 players with a twist.

The result of the die throw is read on the decagonal table at the center of the board. For certain throws players must advance not only their rider but another rider as well. There they have to decide if helping a rider ahead (and risking not seeing him again until the finish line) or a rider behind (and putting him back in the fight).
The board is divided in 8 sections, corresponding each to a well known section of the actual race (the short sharp climbs which have made this race famous) and some road crossings which may cause falls.
The player who crosses the finish line first with his rider wins the game.

The game comes with a large (70 x 50 cm) plastic board that is rolled inside a carboard tube.
Apart from the board the tube contains 4 small plastic riders, a D10 die and the rules in 4 languages (Dutch, French, English and German).

name: Elefanttipoika
description:
Description from the box:
Dice game for the whole family.
Exciting hunting game for 2-6 participants. Who will become the next elephant boy, that will save the elephant from the hunters and bring it back to the corral.

Description from the rules:
This is a fun dice game for the whole family. The aim of the game is that the elephant boy saves the elephant Kala Nagi from the hunters, and leads it back to the corral. The excitement for the game comes from the fact that the role of the elephant boy will change during the game.

Based on the 1973 Australian-British-German TV series "Elephant Boy", based on the Rudyard Kipling story "Toomai of the Elephants", and the comic book(s) published concurrently by Semic and based on the series. The box front image is from the series, while the game board art is from the comic.

name: Suomipeli: The game of Finland
description:
This is the Suomi (Finland) version of the Kaupunkipelit (City Games) series.

Unlike most games in the series, this one is not centered on a single city/town but rather a wider geographic area - in this case, the whole of Finland, the companies available being in many cases national and not local ones. And, unlike any other game in the series, this came in two editions that are distinctly different - a World Wildlife Fund promotional edition, and an edition celebrating Finland's 75th anniversary of independence in 1992. The box front of the latter is in portrait orientation, which is also unique in the series.

Kaupunkipelit is a series of games, each of which is basically a light version of Monopoly localized to a city/region of Finland. The games promote local companies, councils, educational institutes etc. and were designed as a fund raising effort for local sports clubs.

The main differences between these games and Monopoly are:

-Instead of a "street" each square on the board represents a local business.
-There are no hotels or houses, but each square has two title deeds instead of just one, allowing two players to jointly own any location on the board.
-The majority of the event cards are trivia questions about the locality the game is set in.
-While the effects of the first two corner squares (Go and Jail in Monopoly) remain the same for every edition (Go and Stock Market Crash), the effect of the other two corners varies from edition to edition and is the only real difference between them (except for the trivia content, of course). They are typically also local businesses but without title deeds and thus no rent either, but some special effect instead, such as pass a turn or get an extra throw.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Set Collection, Stock Holding
publishers: Kaupunkipelit/SKT Oy, Nelostuote Oy, One-Point Oy, WWF

name: Minister Most Sinister
description:
Description from the publisher:

Defeat the blue suit and save Canada from electile dysfunction in this cooperative game guaranteed to raise the best-glued toupees.

In Minister Most Sinister, you play as one of the four challengers vying to topple the toupee. Candidates race around the campaign trail trying to collect sets of cards that ridicule Stevie's shortcomings on Business, Science, Security and Popularity issues. Will you work together to take back some of the Sinister-engineered disadvantages and give your fellow candidates enough resources to challenge and defeat Stevie in time, or will individual greed allow the Worst-Past-the-Post system to squeeze out another Sinister win?

Have no fear: unlike the longest election in over a hundred years, Minister Most Sinister doesn't take 78 days and hundreds of millions of dollars to play. This fast-paced game plays in under 20 minutes with 2 to 4 players. And with 18 different Election Rules, each new game will test your campaigning abilities against the Man in the Blue Suit's devious schemes.
mechanics: Action Points, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Blue Mongolia
description:
Blue Mongolia is a Monopoly reimplementation with a Mongolian theme and a trivia component.

Players move around a circular board buying and selling cultural elements of Mongolia (from the Gobi desert to the Mongolian costumes to the State play of Mongolia). When a player lands on an "About Mongolia" space, they must answer a trivia question, earning money if they answer correctly and losing money if they answer incorrectly.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Horse and Buggy Bonanza
description: A set collection game using a board common to Monopoly and Bonanza style. Instead of buying and charging rent for spaces, the players compete to complete sets played on the board. The cards and matching spaces are based on Amish communities in a handful of US states.

name: Werden Sie Quiz-Millionär
description:
A simple quiz game. You have to answer a question. But to every question you have to choose from three different answer possibilities which is the right one.
If you succeed you can try the next question and risk a step back or you can let the other player(s) take their turn.

The game is won then you answered the millionaire question.

name: 再会の約束 (Saikai no Yakusoku)
description:
Publisher's summary
再会の約束 (Saikai no Yakusoku) in English would mean 'Promise of Reunion'. The game is #3 of the five games in the Ars Combinatoria system, and takes up to three years to play.

Players are given one card each, and write down the same time and place they will meet next time. Then seal a tally impression between each card and its neighboring cards.

At the specified time, all players who have come to the specified place wins the game. But they taste a better victory if opponents don't come to the place.

Any number of players can play this game as long as there are enough cards.

プレイヤーは次に会う時間と場所をカードに記入し、割印をします。
その時間と場所に来ることのできた人が勝ち。
しかし、相手が現れなければ勝利は苦いものとなります。
引き分けを楽しむゲームです。
カードがあれば、同時に何人でもプレイできます。

name: Realm Warfare
description:
Multiplayer, Expandable, Fantasy, Chess Board Game Series

Pit your wits against multiple players in Realm Warfare! Choose from an army of Amazons, Elementals, Elves, or Knights as they fight for the control of The Land of Grathmordath.

Each Hero has varying abilities and bonuses available to vanquish their opponents. Shoot, combat, capture, or cast magic spells to damage opponent's armies. Then use chance to make the final conquest unpredictable!

Expand the Realm with add-ons: game boards, cards, and boss packs. Create your own army, fight monsters, repair damage, join quests, or unite forces for hours of gripping game play! *


Add-ons sold separately.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Geonosis & Battle of Yavin
description:
Description from the back of the box:

"THE BATTLE OF GEONOSIS was the first battle in the Clone Wars. It would be the first major combat of the Grand Army of the Republic, as well as the first major battle the Jedi would fight in years. BATTLE OF YAVIN The Battle of Yavin was a major battle of the Galactic Civil War that led to the destruction of the First Death Star and was one of the Rebellion's first major victories."

To play Star Wars Box Busters each player needs their own Battle Cube, which is a small folding diorama. Each Battle Cube has a unique combination of capabilities.

While Battle of Geonosis is exclusive to this two-pack, Star Wars: Box Busters – Battle of Yavin was also sold as an individually packaged item.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Suricat' Cache
description: A card-driven game about getting your meerkats to safety. Some cards will move one of your meerkats forward, other cards will cause the eagle to strike. If the eagle strikes when your meerkats are on top of the mound, you have to be quick to get the meerkats to safety.

name: Alfamemo
description:
The origin of this letter tile game is mysterious, as it bears no publication info or crediting aside from a private email address whence to direct questions and opinions. It may have been self-published and/or given away in some promotional context.

The game consists of 107 tiles, most of which contain a letter. Players randomly draw these one by one (optionally rejecting or exchanging tiles), aiming to form them into words, which are scored by length. A few special tiles result in extra draws or a lost tile. When all tiles have been drawn or no player wishes to draw any more, the game ends and unplayed tiles result in a penalty.

As an advanced variant, the game suggests only allowing words that fit a certain theme, such as "sports and games", "culture and entertainment", "animals and nature", "geography" or "names".

name: Reset!
description: The fast & crazy game of triangle cards! Green means go, but watch out for the reset cards or you lose a turn! To win, you've got to be the first to get rid of your cards by being strategic and getting others to reset before they can place a card. Triangle cards emphasize where you can play your cards. Sometimes in your favor and others not. The corners of the triangles point to the areas of the playmat you can use. Includes 105 triangle cards of multiple colors and printed playing mat.

name: Sea Emperor
description: Tile placement game of piracy. "You will need diplomacy, strategy, luck, and memory to rule the seas. Will you be the next Sea Emperor ship's boy? To know it embark on Sea Emperor!"

name: Box Quiz: Sverige
description:
One of the over 50 implementations of the Box Quiz series, this one with the theme 'Sweden'.

The game consists of a tin box with 50 questions and answers within a category, here about Sweden. It is a small and simple quiz game, where players simply answer the different questions.

name: Runikend
description:
INTRO:
You were once explorers and pioneers who discovered this new land called Runikend. You have now also become new colonists who want to tame the landscape and make it your new home.

Each colonizer works to create their settlement town and grow its prestige by adding to it. Colonists build new parts of their small town and expand it into a large city, to build their reputation as being the greatest pioneer of the land.

You must build your town into a glorious city before others colonize the new land first and become its new king. Be wary of other pioneers though, for they want to become the new king of Runikend too.

The colonizers will attack other pioneer villages before they are built into big cities, and raze their new buildings to the ground. The pioneer king-to-be must conquer their enemies before they are attacked and defeated by them.

OBJECTIVE:
Grow the reputation of your settlement to attract more inhabitants and grow a village into a large city to become the new King of Runikend. Reputation is earned by adding prominent structures and other notable parts to your settlement that have prestige value. You win the game and become the King of Runikend if you have built a large city (earning 30 prestige points or more) at any point during the game.

—description from the publisher
categories: Abstract Strategy, Adventure, Card Game, City Building, Civilization, Deduction, Dice, Fantasy, Farming, Fighting, Mythology, Negotiation, Science Fiction, Territory Building
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Simulation, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Tens Solitaire
description:
Tens Solitaire is a quick solitaire game using a standard deck of 52 cards. Players remove pairs of card adding up to ten. Tens, Jacks, Queens, and Kings are removed in sets of four matching cards.

13 cards are dealt in two rows of five cards and one row of 3 cards. Remaining cards for a draw pile.

You may discard any pair of cards which add up to 10 or any set of four matching face cards or tens. Replace all discarded cards from the top of the draw pile.

You win the game if you can get all 52 cards on the table.

name: Shopkins World Vacation Game
description:
Join the Shopkins on a World Vacation! As you travel the globe, collect souvenirs from Vacation Spots in Europe, Asia, Australia, and the Americas. You can use Airport Spaces to quickly fly to new destinations, but watch out for Lost Luggage and Flight Delays that can slow you down.

Try to get the one very special Golden Ticket in the game that will allow you to collect souvenirs even faster! The first player to return home with four souvenirs wins the game!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Queen Wasp (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Wasp moves one space around the Hive.
Or,instead of moving, it can use its special ability to sting any enemy piece that's not in a stack. The stung piece is immediately flipped and is unable to move, use its special power or be re-flipped for one turn. The Wasp cannot sting a piece that has just moved or flipped by your opponent.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Firefly (fan expansion for Hive)
description: The Firefly moves two spaces up on top of the Hive from the ground level. When on the Hive it moves one space until it drops down. It cannot move around the Hive at ground level.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Scorpion (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Scorpion moves exactly two spaces around the Hive. Additionally it suppresses any
adjacent enemy bug so that they aren't permitted to f lip (see the orange outlined black Fly),with the exception of the Shieldbug which is immune to the Scorpion's attack. When the Scorpion is covered its powers are disabled.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Centipede (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Centipede moves three spaces on top of the Hive and must end its turn on another piece which isn 't in a stack.The piece which the Centipede finishes on then swaps places with the Centipede's original position

The one Hive rule must always be upheld; the Hive must not be broken. even whilst swapping the two pieces.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Shieldbug (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Shieldbug moves two spaces. one up onto the Hive then one down to end its turn on the ground level. It cannot be moved , flipped or removed from the Hive by any enemy piece. nor by any friendly piece it is touching.
When the Shieldbug is covered its powers are disabled.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Moth (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
The Moth moves two spaces. One space down from on top of the Hive to ground level, then one space back up to finish on top of the Hive.
NB: The Mosquito can only mimic the movements of the Butterfly or Moth when adjac ent to either piece on top of the Hive and not at ground level since they don't begin their movement there.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Stick-bug (fan expansion for Hive)
description:
May move either by rotating (pivoting keeping one end in place) OR
By moving the whole unit so one of its edges would have touched itself in its previous position
Can not land on units, but can land in confined spaces with half (or more) of itself inside
Can pick it up with rotating or moving (so fit through is not an issue, but can’t unlink the hive)
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Earwig (fan expansion for Hive)
description: The earwig moves like a queen bee and then a grasshopper or vice-versa.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion

name: Take Care of Polar Bears (Second Edition)
description:
“Take Care of Polar Bears” is a Serious Game with a theme of ecological crisis of polar bears caused by climate change. The North pole glaciers continue to melt due to global warming. The polar bears can not stay in one place anymore and must move to find new glaciers.

However, as the glacier disappears, polar bears must move larger distances, they cannot get enough food, and thus, suffer a great crisis. The player will become a polar bear, who will have to overcome virus and disease, escape from pursuit of Inuit, and arrive to Greenland as quickly as possible.

The difference between 1st and 2nd editions of "Take Care of Polar Bears" are the following:

1. All artwork is changed
2. Adding new 4 characters
3. Adding unique roles for new characters and modifying rules
4. Change of winning goal
5. Adding a new story of the game
6. Change of the design of all components

The overall difference with the first edition is that the new characters appear and new rules are added, the change of the existing character's abillity/rules, and also adding a story.

name: Kill Them All
description:
The time is now for us to rid the world of a greatly annoying creature that is the bane of human life as we know it. Emojis are so stupid, and really hard to kill. Even so... Kill them. Kill Them All.

How To Play
Separate all 12 Emoji cards from the deck. Shuffle these cards and deal 3 to all players, face-up, in front of them. Set aside extra Emojis. Shuffle the remaining deck and set it face-down between all players. A discard pile exists beside it. The player to the dealer's left has first turn.

For each turn, players draw up to 4 cards (the hand limit) from the deck (or discard pile, or both), and play any number of Weapon cards into the spaces below the 3 Emoji cards that (and only if they) list them. When all Weapons listed on an Emoji have been played, flip it over, as it is dead, and place the weapons used to kill it under the discard pile, to be reused later. If a player is unable to play a Weapon on an Emoji during a turn, one must be played on an opponent's Emoji of his or her choice. If neither are possible, the player must show his or her hand to all. To end a turn, 1 card is discarded (if possible). If the deck exhausts, reuse the discard pile.

Use Special Action cards by playing them onto the discard pile (from where they may not be drawn).

The first to kill all of his or her Emojis wins!

name: Ultimate Soldier Reloaded
description:
Ultimate Soldier Reloaded is a fast paced strategic card game for 2 to 4 players. Each player commands highly trained soldiers that engage in combat against the other players. Your mission is to win three times in battle or earn four soldiers the fastest and become the Ultimate Soldier.

Ultimate Soldier Reloaded (2017) is a brand new edition of the first edition Ultimate Soldier (2013), and is quite different from the original because it features upgraded artwork, all-new mechanics, and new characters.

The Ultimate Soldier Reloaded box comes with instructions plus 133 game cards:

14 Soldier cards
9 Weapon cards
32 Training cards
59 Action cards
4 Intensity cards
2 Sniper cards
9 Special cards
Reference cards


Each player has their own soldiers, which they'll use to engage in combat against the other players. Players take turns in clockwise order, and on your turn you first draw a card from the common deck, and then do one of the following:

Play a Training card
Initiate combat
Discard a card


To win, you need to get four soldier cards, or win three times in battle.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Dragons vs Unicorns
description:
Dragons vs Unicorns is a 2 - 4 player deck building game.
This is a very fast paced deck builder, game time under 30mins.

Game play:

In Dragons vs Unicorns, you race against your opponents to gather reputation and hire Mercenaries from the Mercenary guild.

Each turn you will play out your hand, activate abilities, and draft cards into your deck. Place enchantments for powerful upgrades, send out your Mercenary meeples for more abilities, and destroy your opposition!

Keeping track of your life total is breeze with the dual dial life counters, and keep an eye out for a chance to activate Elemental synergies! Build the strongest army, and help protect the kingdom!

Elemental synergies can be activated by playing cards with matching elemental types, each of the 4 elements, excel at a particular task.
Life - will heal you and allow you to draw more cards
Darkness - will allow you to destroy your opponent's hand
Fire -will allow you to draw more cards, and deal extra damage for each other fire card.
Water - will allow you to remove unwanted cards, making your deck more effective.

Mix and match more than one element to build decks that synergize in unexpected ways.

Each element has cards that can act as mounts allowing you to send our your mercenary meeples, to gain even more effects. Place enchantments to shield you and your meeples from your opponents. Is your opponent's mercenary meeples, causing you grief? Destroy them!

To win, drop your opponents health to "0", empty out the mercenary guild, or bring your life total over 99. The path to victory is varied, which will your choose?

Game includes everything needed for 2-4 players!
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Set Collection, Worker Placement

name: Loy Loy: The Savings Game
description:
Players represent Cambodian garment workers participating in a Rotating Savings and Credit Association (ROSCA). The objective is for the player collectively to acquire 5000 loy (the games money) in order to buy a factory. The player who makes the largest contribution winning.

The game is a roll and move game combined with auction mechanism for the ROSCA. It is 'semi-cooperative' in that one player going bankrupt ends the game in a draw.

name: Tri-Checkers
description:
A three-dimensional version of checkers. There are three stacked 6x6 boards and each player begins with 18 men. Men can move up or down to an adjacent board in addition to the usual checkers moves, and the object of the game is to eliminate all the opponent's men.

This game is one of a series of three-dimensional traditional board game variants published by Tara Toy Corp.: others in the series were Tri-Chinese Checkers, Tri-Gammon and Tri-Tac-Toe.

name: Chess II
description:
It's the chess game of war - played on a new, exciting Space Age battlefield! The 64 squares of standard chess become 64 stations of varied size and shape. They alternate light and dark and have the standard playing relationship to each other. But, rather than follow straight, predictable paths, they bend, curve, and soar - like the trails of space ships in the galaxy.

You follow the rules of standard chess, devise your strategy, develop your tactics and make your move. But your playing piece attacks like a space craft, changing trajectory as it travels.

Chess II has the proven challenge of the ancient game - played in the environment of tomorrow - for exciting entertainment for today!

—description from the box

name: Koncern
description:
Koncern ("Company Group") or, formally, Aktiespelet Koncern ("The Company Group Stock Game") was Aristospel's contribution to the financial games of Sweden in the period 1950 to 2010. Alga held the licence for Monopol and also published their own Finans. From Lemeco came Kapital and Kärnan would eventually publish Börsspelet/Aktiespelet while Olsen decided to publish Yuppie. A similar game was Marketing from Tre Ringar and also Invest from Harlekin. And this is not the definitive list! All in all, a self-respecting Swedish games publisher needed a financial game.

Koncern is the usual Monopoly-like game were players move around by dice rolls and buys and sells stocks and bonds etc. The publishing year is an estimate made on company historic grounds (the companies that features in the game, that is).

An interesting feature is that the companies in this game were to an high degree part of the Handelsbanken sphere of influence, while competitor Lemeco's contemporary game Kapital connected to the sphere of S-E-Banken.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding, Trading

name: Moana Journey Collection
description: Every journey reveals something about yourself. In the Moana Journey Collection game, players roll a die to collect charms for their necklace. Try to be the first player to collect four charms and the beautiful Heart of Nature charm. If you're first, you win! Use the Journey Collection book to decode the order of your charms and reveal something about you and your personal journey!
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 暴力的論理 (The Violent Logic)
description:
User summary
暴力的論理 (Bouryokutekironri), The Violent Logic is a Japanese card game of explanation, a 'communications' game.

Randomly pick two sentence cards and a conjuction card to go between them to make a statement. Since the statement is made randomly, the expression will be totally incomprehensible. (Example: N is shy. So, N's body is strechable). Note: N doesn't have to be a human.

All players discuss why this statement is possible and try to make a conclusion about it.

Publisher's summary
「文」を２つとその間に「接続詞」を１つ組み合わせることで文章をランダムに作ります。ランダムなので、当然意味のよくわからない文章ができあがります。たとえば、「Ｎは照れ屋である」「だから」「Ｎは体が伸びる」という文章ができあがります。プレイヤーは協力して「なぜだからになるのか」理由を考えます。Ｎはなんでも構いません。

name: Tintin & Tintinors
description:
Players try to collect objects of the main characters of the Tintin comics: rum of Captain Haddock, the umbrella of Professor Calculus, the music score of Castafiore and the walking sticks of Thompson and Thomson.

When players have collected a set, they get bonuses and they can change the sets for Tintinors (money).

The player that first reaches a number of Tintinors, wins.

name: Steamcode
description: Steamcode is a strategic game. Players have to find the code, made up of 6 numbers, to power up the Time Machine.The first player who find the code win the game. The game is set in the flying laboratory of the brilliant Jonathan Steam. Players can speed up their search with the cards in their hand,or set traps to slow down their opponents.The laboratory is full of invention, bad or good, no one knows,till you show them up
categories: Card Game, Memory, Number, Science Fiction
mechanics: Grid Movement, Hand Management, Memory, Take That

name: Gingerbread Game
description: On your turn, you pull the lever of the Gingerbread House to see which piece comes out. If the piece that comes out is one you need for your Gingerbread Man, you put it on. Otherwise, you get nothing. The first person to complete their Gingerbread Man wins.

name: Cards Against South Africa
description:
Cards Against Humanity is a party game in which one player reads a "fill-in-the-blank" statement from a black card, and the others complete it by answering with their funniest white card… which usually includes words or phrases typically deemed as offensive, risque or politically incorrect. Whoever has the funniest white card wins.

Cards Against South Africa is a localised version of Cards Against Humanity.

name: Ice Pop Swap
description:
The object is to be the first player to collect 4 Ice Pop Sticks of one color. But be on the lookout for the Icky Sticks - they will not count towards your winning collection.

—description from the publisher

name: The Battle for Candy Kingdom
description:
The Premise:
The Candy King is dead. His long rule was one of wisdom and order except for his greatest oversight - he did not name an heir to his throne. In the wake of his demise the kingdom's most powerful denizens have risen up and taken arms against each other in an all-out battle for the throne. As one of Candy Kingdom's greatest warriors, it's up to you to bring peace to the land by crushing the competition and claiming the Candy King's throne.

The Goal:
Be the last surviving player on the board.

The Basics:
Each turn you get to both move around the candy-battle-themed board to strategically position yourself and you get to cast spells to affect gameplay. You cast spells by spending color square cards you draw each turn. Different colored spells have different effects.

Red and yellow spell are for attacking.

Green spells are for healing.

Orange and Purple spells deal out advantages and disadvantages.

Blue spells give greater freedom of movement.

You can also combine different color square cards to cast unique spells, like an interrupt spell to block an attack.

The game gets more interesting as candy monsters are summoned to the board, creating roadblocks that force the players into closer quarters.

Accessibility:
This game is 100% color blind friendly.

—description from the designer

name: Das geheimnisvolle Amulett
description:
House of Anubis: The Mysterious Amulet

The mysterious amulet is broken, parts are lost!
You put yourself in the shoes of one of the Anubis characters and search for the various amulet parts. Be carefull, since the way is dangerous and the other players try to take away the parts of the amulet. Only, if you manage to reach the target, you are safe so that you can combine the parts of the amulet.

name: Mostradamus
description: Mostradamus is a party game for teams of two or more players. The goal of the game is to obtain more "Mostras" points than the other team. In each round, a player tries to get his teammates to guess as many words as possible in 2 minutes, by drawing and closing its eyes, humming, miming, etc. depending on the results of a dice. Besides, a team can score points by guessing the number of words that will be by the other team.

name: Bingo Dice
description:
In Bingo Dice, Yahtzee (Kniffel) meets Bingo. Roll combinations, unlock rerolls and mark your achievements with the Bingo marker. Other players may help you unlock your cool jokers. A family game for 2 - 6 players 8 years and up.

In Bingo Dice you try to achieve certain combinations with five dice. Unlike other dice games, you earn rerolls for later turns when combinations are missed by one dice or gain a joker when predicting the failure of other players.

Combinations are "Full House", "4 of a kind", "Straight" and "Bingo Dice" (5 of a kind).
Rerolls are gained for "2 pair", "3 of a kind" and "small straight".

In addition, you may doubt whether another player will achieve a combination in this round, thereby gaining a Joker.

Instead of writing numbers on your score card, dab the results with a bingo marker, which is much more fun.
 
The winner is the first player to roll all combinations.

To add variety to the game, cards with additional rules are can be flipped each round, e.g. all 1's are counted as 4's or roll 6 instead of 5 dice.
 

The game comes with
- 50 different scorecards
- 6 dice
- dice bowl
- 16 playing cards
- 1 bag for the game contents (travel bag)
- 1 small dice bag
- 2 bingo markers

-description from designer

name: Carnival “Fun Ship” Adventure
description:
Each player begins with Cruise Cash. The Cruise Cash will be used by the players to pay fees as he or she travels the Cruise Game route. Each time a player makes a round trip on the Cruise Game route and passes their own starting port, a Treasure Chest Key is given to the player by the Cruise Agent. A total of three keys must be secured before the player can go to the Treasure Chest and collect all of the Cruise Cash and win the Game. If during the course of the Cruise the player cannot pay a required fee, he or she must withdraw from play.

—user summary
mechanics: Player Elimination, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Myth: Dredge Minion Pack
description:
Released as an optional addon from the Banner Saga Warbands Kickstarter Campaign.

Comes with 10 miniatures and 1 monster card.
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Variable Phase Order, Variable Player Powers

name: Organizer
description:
Organizer is an auction-type card game that has players taking the role of trendy event organizers booking popular DJs for the world's best music festival, while avoiding the cops shutting down the show.

(Game Flow)
Each turn an artist will be put up for bid.
Players first gain funds and then bid for the booking.
Players try to collect artists with groove point sets.
The game ends when a player's festival has five acts.
The player with the most points wins.
publishers: JUGAME STUDIO (ジュゲムスタジオ)

name: Äppel-päppel
description:
You walking along a fruit-path and the first one reaching the fruit-basket wins.

There is seven spots on the board where tiles with the path fruit are placed face down except for one who is face up.
On your turn you throw the color-die and move to the closest space with that color. The player have then to reveal the fruit that is on the space they moved to, to stay there. If the player fail to reveal correct fruit they have to move backwards to the closets space with the fruit they revealed.

name: Szerencsével ügyesen!
description:
The game has been waiting for players with unusual solutions. The first was the playfield of 64 spaces and out of numbered rectangles.
The second striking difference affects the figures, three of which are of the same size, but the fourth one is much larger. According to the description it is important in this second game mode.
The third striking difference is the dice, which is not a cube but a numbered octahedron.
The game can be played in two ways.
The goal is to get the figures from the starting place to the designated destination locations.

—user summary

name: The Biking Game
description:
Each player chooses a Schwinn bike (the game is a promotional item for the company) and matches it to its model name in its parking place. This is the start and finish space. Each player also chooses which one of four levels of quiz questions to be asked during the game; level four being the most difficult.

In turn, the players will roll the six-sided die and advance one’s own bike along the path. Landing on a red space ends one’s turn. Landing one a yellow space means a player must answer a quiz question of one’s chosen level correctly to get a free turn. Some the questions have a picture of off-road tires on them. If a player answers that question correctly then that player takes possession of the Off-Road Tire card and can take the shortcut paths along the game board.

Other spaces call for players to read “Fun Fact” cards or share biking experiences with the other players. The first player to return to the parking spot is the winner.

—user summary

name: Story Game Egyptian Expedition
description:
When it’s your turn, try to play one of your triangle tiles on the table by matching one of its sides with another tile. The player, who gets rid of all of their tiles first, wins the game. Suitable for even the youngest players!


A classic game that has been turned into something brand new!
Comes with large, durable triangular tiles.
A fun visual challenge


- desciption from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Story Game Ocean Explorer
description:
Roll the big wooden die and turn over one of the puzzle pieces on the table. Try to find the right pieces for your marine puzzle, while keeping an eye on what the other players find. An easy-to-learn game for the youngest players!


Promotes matching skills and memory.
Comes with a beautiful, large, wooden die!
A perfect combination of luck and memory.


—description by publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Pattern Building, Set Collection

name: Wood or Wood Not?
description:
Wood or Wood not? is an adult party game of amorous embarrassment.

Players choose an orange card (person) and a black card (situation) from their hand and plays them. The goal is to create the most desirable situation or the most undesirable one for spending “quality time” with the person in the scenario (a graceful dancer – downwind of a pile of burning tires, a well-built ski instructor – in a pond full of leeches. Players read their cards aloud and then use their vote cards to judge the other suggestions. The player with the most appropriate votes scores two points. The first player to score six points wins.

The box includes 197 cards and rules

name: Biblio-Tekka
description:
Biblio-Tekka is a deck building game for 2-4 players, each player must use in-game currency to collect books and other treasures in order to reach enough victory points to win.

Your goal is to reach 15 victory points by collecting books and book-related items. You may obtain these items by purchasing a book card or an event card on your turn.

—description from the publisher

name: Das Supertalent
description:
The game is based on the RTL game Show "Das Supertalent". The players roll an eight-sided die. According to the result of the roll, the players draw a task card from category 1, 2, 3 or 4 and have to resolve the task, described on the card. The categories are:

1 Table Star
2 Acrobat
3 Superhirn (Mastermind)
4 Showtalent

If a task is solved, points are rewarded. On a fixed amount of points the players move their meeples one step ahead. If a player reaches the space "Ziel" he has to solve a last task to win the game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Singing

name: Bomb's Away
description:
Bomb's Away is a card game for 2-4 players that is a combination of Waterworks and Uno. To win Bombs Away, you must be the first player to play all your cards.

Bomb's Away can be played with additional players, provided there is one deck for every four additional players.

—user summary

Bomb's Away is played with up to 4 players with a unique 75 card deck. Place the Hydrant Card in the center of the playing surface and choose a dealer. Shuffle the deck, then deal each player ten (10) cards face down.

The player to the dealer's left lays one Pipe Card on the table, connecting it to the Hydrant Card. All Pipe Cards must be played in the same orientation as the Hydrant Card (pipes and card edges maintaining congruency) New pipes may connect to same-colored Pipe Cards at the 'open' end of a pipe. A Pipe Card cannot connect 2 different colored pipes, unless the Pipe Card is Wild. The placement of a Pipe Card cannot block an 'open' pipe.

If the current player cannot play a card, they draw until receiving a playable card. Each player takes a turn in a clockwise fashion around the table. This process repeats until one player has zero cards remaining. If every card is used before a player wins, all discarded cards are shuffled and returned to the deck pile.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Network and Route Building, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Pääministeri-peli
description:
The box comes with two games.

First is Pääministeri-peli where players compete to be the prime minister of Finland. This is essentially a version of Afrikan tähti set in Finland.

Players roll dice in turn order to move on a map of Finland. And they try to collect as many votes as possible until some one finds the voting token and manages to get it back to Helsinki.

When moving around the map, players turn around tokens from which they either get or lose votes.

When the voting token is returned to Helsinki, everyone counts their votes and who ever has the most is the winner.

The second game Ministeri Mylly is basically Trouble (Kimble), but with a twist.

Each player has two pieces. Pieces are moved on a round track by trowing a dice. Players try to get their peaces around the board. When they do they become ministers, and are moved to ministry. From there they might be forced to go to European Parliament.

The player that has the prime minister or otherwise highest ranking ministers is the winner.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Pyrabec Game
description:
Essentially a roll and move game.

The game board consists of a 3D plastic pyramid with a track running around the outside. This track is indented to hold marbles in place. Some of the spaces have holes which drop the marble to lower levels of the pyramid. Each player has 3 marbles which they have to get to the top of the pyramid. Roll the die to determine how many spaces your marble can move and try to avoid the holes.

The first player to get all three marbles to the top is the winner.

—user summary

name: Rolnik szuka żony
description:
Rolnik szuka żony (Farmer wants a wife)

Funny game for matchmaking based on a very popular tv show. It contains interesting questions, not only about living in the village!

Play as a farmer or as a candidate and answer the questions to move on the board. The farmer and the candidates have their own paths - players who meet in the middle could call themselves soul mate!

—user summary
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Schau Schau!
description:
Schau Schau! is a simple observation game involving Alexa with cards in four background colors and with eight items.

Alexa asks questions that usually connect two or three objects with each other. "Where do you see exactly one garment and one item from the school?" "Where do you find three foods?“
Who knows the answer, reaches for a large figure and calls the card color with the suspected solution. If it is correct, the player wins the card. If there is an incorrect answer, a card must be handed in. After 20 questions is over. The player with the most cards will win the game after 10 to 15 minutes.

Noris recommends SCHAU SCHAU! for children from the age of five.

—user summary

name: Jersey Shore Family Vacation: The Game
description: Jersey Shore Family Vacation: The Game "engages consumers with trivia based on iconic moments and sayings" from the television show of the same name, according to the publisher.

name: Cartoon Crusaders
description:
One 52 card poker card sized deck needed for 2 players to play!

Attack Cards
Defense Cards
Instant Abilities
Player Equipment Cards


Shuffle the deck, put in the middle of the table. DOMINATE!!
In a game of Skill vs. Luck. vs. Skill.... try to best your opponent. You have 20 health, he has 20 health.... Be the last one standing planning your attacks, and setting defense properly, all while playing out of the same deck of cards!!

name: Extinction: The Last Game They Ever Played
description:
What really ended the dinosaurs' reign? Was it a supernova? A giant meteor? Or just mean card play? You'll have a good idea after just one game of Extinction: The Last Game They Ever Played.

It's survival of the fittest in this fast-paced game where everything from thundering meat-eaters to natural disasters are out to make your dinosaur herds extinct.

During the Gene Pool, players unleash sneaky, egg-eating Oviraptors, a dreaded Turannosaurus Rex, and catastrophic events in attempts to make opponents' herds extinct.

Extinction comes with three decks of quality playing cards, a set of ten embossed herd extinction markers, a plastic storage tray and a millenium of fun.

—description from the publisher

name: Die Ratten von Nizza
description:
Detective Jigsaw Puzzling Game: Rates of Nice

First, the players read some information about a criminal case. With this information, they start creating a jigsaw puzzle which gives them addtional hints to eventually solve the overall criminal case.

This game deals with one of the biggest bank robberies ever.

name: Crown War
description:
Crown War is a quick and fun game.
Pick up the highest value crown to win each round, pile up your winnings. The player with the highest pile – wins the game.

Before the game begins, mix the coins and place them on the table, facing down.
All players pick 1 coin simultaneously. The player with the highest value coin wins the round, and collects his friend's coins.
When all coins in the center are gone, or when there are less coins than the number of players, compare players piles.


The player with the highest pile wins the game! It is recommended to play 5 games in a row, and the winner in most games is The Champion.

—description from the publisher
publishers: Advance games by FoxMind Group, FoxMind Israel

name: Chaos Kingdoms
description:
Chaos Kingdoms is a high fantasy board game with an immersive world map. Players take on the role of adventuring Heroes, each with their own set of unique skills and strange character. A Faction of cohorts carry the Hero’s flag, lending their own abilities to their leader. There are 3 legendary goals before them: Last Man Standing, Immortality or Godhood. As they advance, players vanquish rival Heroes, explore dungeons, and spike their power with experience & plunder.

How to WIN:

For lively game play, there are 3 ways to win.
Last Man Standing: PVP, Player Elimination
Immortality: Battle 4 Jabberwockies to get 4 artifact pieces that grant Immortality
Godhood: Build 5 glorious shrines to yourself in 5 cities

Gameplay:

Game play is relatively simple, making it an easy-entry game for novices. There are 12 Heroes and 12 Factions to choose from, which provides a multitude of strategic combinations. Roll a six-sided dice to travel a classic RPG hex map. Boldly engage with monsters and villains in dungeons and lairs. Battles are a contest of attack rolls with modifiers from pulsing Magic Items and burning Spells. Once powerful enough, conquer fellow Heroes, claim Immortality, or climb into the vaulted existence of a God.

Game Features include:
A multitude of different Hero / Faction combinations
Exploring Dungeons, Ruins, Caves, Hideouts, Towers & more
Unique Artifacts, Weapons & Spells
Fierce PVP and long range attacks
Stealing (very fun and effective)
Targeting opponent Cities
Targeting opponent Items and Followers
Goal: PVP Last Man Standing
Goal: Immortality / Jabberwockies
Goal: Godhood / Shrines
Ruling the World of Chaos Kingdoms

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Set Collection, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Disney Babies
description:
An easy to learn game for 2-4 players, featuring the delightful Disney Baby characters. The game teaches recognition, matching and simple strategy.

The goal is to be the 1st player to fill his bingo card by completing the 3 sets of 3 Disney Babies cards.

—user summary

name: Vaiana Happy Families & Action Game
description:
Vaiana Happy Families & Action Game is a 32-card deck, and it includes rules for two different games:

1) happy families
A set collection game where you are supposed to collect a set of same-colored cards by trading with fellow players.

2) action game
A game where you're supposed to get rid of your starting hand of 5 cards. A starting card is turned face up on the table, and you can play a card on top of it if it matches either the symbol, color or number of the starting card. Action cards trigger when played, and they include reversing the turn order, giving an opponent a card, playing an additional turn and switching hands with an opponent.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 花式自殺 (Fancy Suicide)
description: The game 花式自殺 (Fancy Suicide) bears the subtitle "十萬個激嬲女友的理由", which could be translated as "1001 Ways to Provoke Your Girlfriend". Not sure what the game is about, but perhaps we'll all learn in time.

name: Peeing Pup
description:
Fill the pup with water and then pass him around the group. Pet him and if he barks three times in a row, then you pass him to the next player. If you keep petting him and he gets too excited, he'll pee on you! If you get peed on, you're out and the remaining players continue until there is one winner.

-description from designer

name: Ardrí
description:
The High-King is in his palace in Tara, surrounded by his enemies, and the country is in danger. To save the kingdom, a warrior must come to help the High-King. But dangers await him - a wolf, a wild boar, a giant, the Greek warrior Caol, Ailéan the Burner, the Fair Princess, and one-eyed Goll and his brother Conán Maol. There is a danger also that the warrior will be led astray by the Troublesome Servant (An Giolla Deacair) or that he will be lost in the fairy fort of Cuileann - a place where people enter but seldom come out again!

An exciting board game for 2-4 players (7+), played on a full-colour 20" x 20" playing board, and coming in a robust beautifully illustrated box. Each player chooses a coloured playing piece, and with the aid of dice and Magic Cards, races to overcome obstacles and reach the High King in Tara.

In his palace in Tara, the High King is surrounded by enemies. To save the kingdom, you must hurry to help the High King. But dangers lie in wait!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Punching Babies
description:
Punching Babies is a quick and easy turn based card game that simulates two heavyweight boxing babies. Obviously, this is a two player game.

Each player is dealt ten cards from the deck which contains Attack, Defense, and Special cards (some of these cards allow the player to draw cards while others do not). To determine who goes first, the player quick enough to actually play a card from his/her hand takes the initiative. A player's turn is complete once they make an attack, which allows their opponent the opportunity to play a defensive card, if they want.

Players start at 0 damage and gradually count upwards as they take hits from their opponent. If a player can no longer play a viable card, or runs out of cards, their opponent will continue taking turns until they run out of attacks.

Once both players are out of attacks, the round is over and who ever took the least amount of damage wins.

Play styles include: Best 2 out of 3, TKO-ten rounds continually tallying up damage, and Knockout-the first to reach or pass 100 damage loses.

-description from publisher

name: ak•rô•nym
description:
The hilarious party game of made up acronyms that will have you LOL with your BFFs!

Over six rounds collect points ( and try not to lose any). While thinking of the funniest acronyms from the letters and subject.

One person draws three cards each with a letter on it, then they draw a category card. Flip the timer and go, think up the best acronyms that fit the category and the three letters. Once time runs out take turns reading what you feel is your best answer. Each person votes who they think gave the best acronym and every vote counts as a point.
