During speed rounds, who ever is in the lead starts. They must think of the first acronym on the fly and say it outloud then play passes to the next player. When the timer stops, that player loses two points. After six rounds tally up the points, and the most wins!

name: Gonitwa na 102
description:
A game for 2 people. You can move the pieces by 1 squares according to the board's indications. The winner is the one who collects all opponent's pieces.

—user summary

name: Rollopolis
description:
In Rollopolis, players are urban architects and town planners of their own district. By drafting dice, players will acquire certain permits that will allow them to build different buildings. By careful planning, smart choices and a bit of luck, players will score points and the one who gets the most at the end of the game is the winner and will be appointed as the new County Architect.

—description from the designer

name: Na łowy
description:
The board is divided into 36 fields. 20 animal cards are placed on them. Each animal has its point value. The game involves throwing 2 dice. One is responsible for the second column in rows. The ejected value indicates the field on the board. If there is an animal in the field provided, the player takes them. The one who scores the most points wins.

—user summary

name: Star Trek (The Original Series) Spock's Logic Puzzle Box
description:
Voyage boldly into the strange new worlds of Star Trek and the incredible adventures of the U.S.S. Enterprise by pitting your wits against this collection of puzzles inspired by the brilliant and ever-logical Mr. Spock.

'Star Trek: Spock's Logic Puzzle Box can be played alone, with friends or as a team competition. Two to six players work best.

—description from the publisher
categories: Deduction, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Puzzle, Trivia

name: UNO: Alex Rodriguez Limited Edition
description:
Celebrate one of the biggest stars in Major League Baseball with this special Alex Rodríguez Edition of UNO.


112 Custom Cards feature A-Rod of the Yankees in action at third base or at the plate doing what he doeas best: getting big hits and driving in runs.



Same great UNO play PLUS the exclusive MVP card and rule.



Be sure to yell "UNO" as you try to be the best player in the game just like A-Rod is year after year.


—description from the box

name: UNO: Michigan
description:
Show your school spirit with the Wolverines in the University of Michigan edition of UNO.


112 custom cards feature campus landmarks including the Law Quad, the Rock, the Michigan Union, the Cube, and more.



Same great UNO play PLUS the exclusive Go Blue card and rule.



Be ready to yell "UNO!" as you show your blue and maize pride and go for the win!


—description from the back of the box

name: UNO: Mets Special Edition
description:
Get ready to make a run to October with the 2007 New York Mets edition of UNO.


112 custom cards feature Pedro Martinez, David Wright, Jose Reyes, Carlos Beltran, Carlos Delgado and other Mets stars.



Same great UNO play PLUS the exclusive Acquisition card celebrating the signing of dominating closer Moises Alou.



Make sure you yell "UNO" as you go for a walk-off winner of your own!


—description from the back of the box

name: Pocket Quiz: Globetrotter
description:
This is a small, pocket-sized trivia game. It contains 50 cards with 3 questions each, most of them with multiple choice options. The backside of each card contains the answers and offers additional information.

The title translates to "globetrotter" and the questions are about that topic.

—user summary

name: BrainBox: First Colours
description:
This BrainBox title has been developed to support very young children in early colour recognition. The front of the card features 3 images, each one in a different colour. Children must look at the images and try to remember all of the colours (the words are also shown), then they turn over the card and each image is shown as an outline only. The question asks "What colour?" and children have to say the colour of each of the objects they have just seen.

The object of the game is to study a card for 10 seconds and then answer a question based on the roll of a die. If the question is answered correctly, the card is kept and the person with the most number of cards after 5 or 10 minutes is the winner.

name: Slay Your Friends!
description:
"Think about the most cutthroat games you know, the ones that threaten to tear apart even the oldest and closest of friends. Now add weapons to that game and you are getting a little bit closer to the intensity and thrills of Slay Your Friends."

Learning to Slay could not be any easier. To get started:


shuffle the deck and then place eight hero cards face down on the table so that each player can select one at random and then replace the remaining hero cards in the box



deal seven cards to each player and then flip a coin or roll a die (or you could arm wrestle) to determine who goes first, each player then drawing one card on their turn, the board going clockwise and each player starting with 25 health points, which corresponds to the health tracker and health token



flip over the top card and start the discard pile, where players will place cards once they are played


That's all there is to it! There is a range of actions and outcomes with the cards, and once a single hero remains, the game is over. You can play with or without the hero cards. Have no mercy – and Slay Your Friends.

All retail copies of Slay Your Friends includes the Slay Your Enemies expansion pack.

Learning to Slay could not be any easier. To get started:


shuffle the deck and then place eight hero cards face down on the table so that each player can select one at random and then replace the remaining hero cards in the box



deal seven cards to each player and then flip a coin or roll a die (or you could arm wrestle) to determine who goes first, each player then drawing one card on their turn, the board going clockwise and each player starting with 25 health points, which corresponds to the health tracker and health token



flip over the top card and start the discard pile, where players will place cards once they are played


That's all there is to it! There is a range of actions and outcomes with the cards, and once a single hero remains, the game is over. You can play with or without the hero cards. Have no mercy – and Slay Your Friends.

—description from the publisher
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fighting, Medieval, Party Game
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Hand Management, Player Elimination, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trading

name: Koppla av, res med oss
description:
Koppla av, res med oss ("Relax, come travel with us" in English) is a travelling game set in Europe.
They game was most likely published in all of the german speaking world as well as Scandinavia, as the city names on the game board are in German and the rules have a note about the language version for the specific game.

The players start in Brussels and selects one out of six destinations (Edinburgh, Gibraltar, Palermo, Athens, Istanbul, Helsinki). The players proceed to travel along a route, each route are of equal length, but can deviate by taking optional routes along the way or be forced to turn back.

During the trip they will spend their money on means of travel (By foot, bicycle, car, train and airplane) and visit different cities along the way. The main mechanic is to pay following a tariff table to determines how far you travel.
In each city they have to draw an event card and see what happens in that city. Events can be positive or negative, mostly to your travelling fund but also for instance change the final destination.

The object of the game is to be the first to reach your destination with travelling funds still on hand. If a player runs out of funds he or she is out of the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Instant Hockey
description:
2-player card game about Ice Hockey. No knowledga of Ice Hockey needed!
First player to have 3 goals wins.
Players play cards from their deck into a 3x2 game area for each player. Cards are compared in each 3 column. Winner in each column has a greater card values in that column. Then each winning columns are added together and highest value wins the situation (turn).

It´s possible to win with a lower value cards a player that plays higher value cards. That´s when cards are played wisely.

IH introduces an interesting new game mechanic: Deduction Deck Mechanic.

—description from the designer

DDM is a card mechanic where two values are compared. Winning value (higher) and losing value (lower). Then from results deck is drawn as many cards as is the winning value. The losing party (player) then deducts (eliminates) the most bad cards from that set: Goals and worst Penalties.
After that the winning player chooses from the remaining cards the outcome of the situation: Goal, Penalties, Powerplay etc.

name: Järnåldersbönderna
description:
During the course of the game, you have to acquire different goods in the forest and at the lake which can be exchanged for gold with the trader. The team that first gets a gold climb per participant wins the game.

The players are split into two teams. Each team chooses an iron age farm as the starting point. Then you go out into the iron-age landscape to collect food for their tribal members or obtain goods from the forest and the lake which can then be exchanged for gold at the famous Jämtland market place Frösön. If the game piece lands on a colored spot, it draws a card of the corresponding color and does what the card says. An important part of the game is to always ensure that all tribal members have a food card otherwise the whole tribe can starve and die.

—user summary
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: The Bourbon Run
description:
The Bourbon Run is a bourbon trivia board game for bourbon enthusiasts. Challenge your knowledge of America's native spirit with this one-of-a-kind trivia board game.
It includes trivia, quotes, history, the production process, and much more. The board resembles a horse track and each furlong feature a craft distillery. Hand-made tokens and high-quality materials make this a must-own game for all bourbon lovers.

Roll the die to move around the track. If you land on a distillery you get to answer a multiple choice or true/false trivia question. Answer incorrectly and you move back a space. Land on a Cooperage Barrell space and you discover a new piece of trivia and move on the board according to the card. The first player around the race track who answers a trivia question correctly is the winner.

name: Awesomeness is Lowell
description:
A fun filled, exciting game of touring historic Lowell, Massachusetts visiting historic sites, local businesses & collecting souvenirs. Be part of the famous Lowell Kinetic Sculpture Race, Walk through Kerouac Park, Visit Whistler's House, or Enjoy an outside concert at Boarding House Park.

Players move around a board of historic places in the city of Lowell, MA. They are tourists collecting special souvenirs that they will then get to keep when they finally return home.

The object of the game is to tour Lowell, visit the 6 historic sites with the green bar above and purchase a souvenir. The first tourist to collect all 6 different souvenirs and return home wins.

name: Śląsk 1939: San 1939 (part II – Przemyśl)
description:
The game is part of the W39 system and is an extension to the game Śląsk 1939. Maps connects togehther.

Game was published in 36 issue of "Taktyka i strategia" magazine. It uses W39 - Wrzesień 1939 rules.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War II

name: JustUs Junkie's Trials & Triumph
description:
Trials & Triumph was designed by a criminal defense attorney to guide teens in their interactions with law enforcement. The game uses a simple roll-and-move format to chart the course of a player navigating between the World of Possibilities and the World of Trouble. The object of the game is to get out of the World of Trouble with a Clean Slate by being the first player to arrive at the Triumph space.

Some spaces on the board require a player to draw a Flashing Lights card and read it aloud. The cards present over 50 different scenarios involving encounters with law enforcement. The scenarios are based on the designer's 19 years of experience as a criminal defense attorney. The cards do not permit the player to make any choices, they merely spell out the scenario and provide a result. The result of a Flashing Lights card can be positive (e.g. advance your pawn two spaces) or negative (e.g. move your pawn to the World of Trouble, a circular track representing the criminal justice system).

There are various ways a player may leave the World of Trouble track: If a player is convicted of a misdemeanor, the player returns all the way to the Start space in the World of Possibilities; being acquitted allows a player to return to the World of Possibilities on the Clean Slate space; however, if a player is convicted of a felony in the World of Trouble, the player may be eliminated from the game.

The game designer's key lessons are captured in a list of the "7 R's of police encounters," a summary list of do's and don'ts that are echoed throughout the game: Don't run, reach, resist, or run your mouth (i.e. make a statement to the police); do refuse all DUI tests, refuse consent to search, and request a lawyer.

A supplemental Game Guide ebook is available for separate purchase. The Game Guide aligns with the scenarios on the Flashing Lights cards to provide background information about the criminal offenses and legal concepts involved in the game.

—user summary
mechanics: Events, Lose a Turn, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Traffic
description:
A simple 1960s (?) game, where the goal is to buy a Cadillac. Each turn, you get your monthly salary and roll a marble of one of the two ramps. Then execute the space the marble ends up - you could have an accident, buy a service station or garage, or earn stars by obeying traffic rules. Every three stars earn you the right to buy an extra car (and extra salary), and you need 9 stars before you can win.

Seems to be a commercial game made for Total tank stations.

—user summary
publishers: Clipper, Constri, N.V. Smeets & Schippers Amsterdam

name: Banana Banana
description:
Banana Banana is a light dexterity family game inspired by an Indian folktale. All players try to build their stack to achieve a certain goal score. The choice of blocks is dependent on the dice and the number of points one wants to score on their turn.

The game has 3 variations:

Nutty Bananas - Roll dice, choose blocks according to the roll and risk, stack and score. The player who achieves the goal or has the last stack standing wins.
Monkeying-a-round - Roll dice, choose 1 block,stack and move to the next stack. Last stack standing wins
Monkey Business - Take 2 actions - roll the dice, pick, steal or play a card. Challenge or score points to achieve the goal.


—description from the designer
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Card Game, Dice
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Extractor
description:
Reinventing the classic Australian sheep-farming game 'Squatter', 'Extractor' is a dystopian board game that maps the possible dynamics of global data-driven businesses or 'platforms' as they compete for world domination. The vast accumulation of data needed for this goal is set against a backdrop of aggressively 'extractive' business practices and the impact they have on the planet. Extraction is a fundamental mechanism of most industries, with a small few accumulating great wealth by extracting value from the earth and the majority of its population. In the universe of Extractor, these global platforms--and aspiring monopolies--automate extraction processes and dominate industry, exhausting resources and polarising society in its wake.

This is a playable artwork by Simon Denny, produced in a limited edition of 1000 copies to accompany the exhibition MINE, by Simon Denny, at the Museum of Old and New Art (MONA), Hobart (Tas.), June 2019 - April 2020.

"Instead of making an exhibition catalogue for Simon Denny's exhibition Mine, we chose to make a board game, thus giving you the opportunity to experience the dynamics of the data mining world, in addition to reading about it. [...] Making reference to the classic Australian sheep farming board game 'Squatter', Simon's game 'Extractor' allows you to read and theorise on the topic through a great selection of essays, but also to play against your friends in a highly competitive scramble to achieve world data domination." - Rule book foreword.
publishers: Museum of Old and New Art (MONA)

name: The $100,000 Pyramid DVD Game
description:
The $100,000 Pyramid DVD game is fast-paced and easy-to-play - just pop it into your DVD player and try to top the Pyramid!

Like real game show contestants, you shout out clues for your teammates while they try to guess their way through a maze of challenging and humorous categories. Whether you're giving clues or guessing answers, you've got to think fast and talk fast to reach the Winners Circle!

—description from the back of the box
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: The Newlywed Game: DVD Edition
description:
Play the classic couple's game on TV! First the husbands answer a question … then the wives. Do your answers match up? Guys, do you remember the outfit your wife wore on your first date? Ladies, what is your husband's favorite song? Whether you just tied the knot yesterday or thirty years ago, The Newlywed Game DVD edition is classic couples fun for everyone!

—description from the publisher
categories: Electronic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Pull My Finger
description:
Pull Mr. Buster’s Finger and watch his butt inflate. How long can he hold it in? You never know when he’s gonna blow! Pull My Finger combines two things everyone laughs at monkeys and farts. Spin the banana spinner, pull the monkey’s finger and watch his butt inflate with each pull. Avoid the farts and win.

—description from the publisher

name: Apocrypha Adventure Card Game: Something Familiar Promo Card
description: Promo Card given by Lone Shark Games when The Devil Expansion purchased from their online store. It is a Soul Gift that allows allows you to discard for an additional soul dice. In addition during the support phase, you can slot in your halo and can be used by the saint in the position define by where your card is in the halo to add 2 additional soul dice when in the assemble phase and an ally gift is to be confronted.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Horror
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: Poten
description:
Poten is an educational and functional board game that will help you find your potential and even think about a new job.

Poten is a standalone expansion of Flip. While Flip help you to learn about your personalities, Poten help you to find jobs that suit your personalities. When you combine those two games together and play them, they will give you a great fun and clear view of your passion.

How To Play:

Draft six 'work cards'.
Set five 'icon cards' on the table.
One player becomes a narrator and the rest will play the guessers.
The narrator selects two icon cards and place a job card next to each icon card.
And talk about two jobs represented by each set of icon & work cards as if he or she is currently working in that field.
The other players listen to the stories and vote a job that suits the narrator better with the O token and place the X token on the other job secretly.


The objective of the game is to achieve the most victory points by guessing the right jobs that go along well with other players.

—description from the publisher

name: Mumbai Estate
description:
Each player secretly draws one out of five house colors. One of the remaining house colors is placed in the center of the 5x5 grid of the game board.

Each player has six windows. Five of them show the corresponding five house colors and one of them shows a compass rose. In their turn the player places their die on one of the windows to perform that action. They cannot use the action, which they performed in their previous turn.

When a player picks a colored window, they place a house in the corresponding color to the board. Depending on the setting of the black direction marker it must be placed horizontally or vertically adjacent to an existing house. A color circle determines which house color is allowed next to each other. For example, a brown house may only be build next to a gray or a yellow one.

When all houses of a player’s secret color have been build, that player yells “toping” and wins the game.

name: Handy-Handy
description:
The game includes a board with a 5x8 grid, four large and four small cardboard mobile phones, four differently-colored pawns, 40 cardboard mobile phone keys (0 to 9 in the four player colors, with the same number, but black background on the backside), a regular six-sided die and a notepad.

Every player first receives the large and then the small cardboard mobile phone as well as a note sheet. They secretly write down a secret message to the player who has with the large mobile phone in the corresponding color. The message should consist of exactly 10 words.

The 40 keys are turned to the black side, shuffled and randomly distributed to the 40 fields of the game board. Starting with their pawn at the positions marked with an arrow, the players play alternately in clockwise order. At first, they roll a dice and move their pawn according to the rolled number in any direction (horizontal or vertical, but not diagonal). The direction can be changed once during the turn. If the pawn ends his turn on a key, it is turned over. If it shows the player’s color, they place it on the corresponding key of their large cardboard mobile phone and the player who wrote the message to that player tells the nth word corresponding to the number on the key. If the front of the key has a different color, the player puts the key next to their own mobile phone and no word is revealed. If the player rolled a 6, they get an additional turn.

To receive the missing keys which are collected by the other players, they have to capture the pawns of this player. When a pawn is captured, is returns to the start position and the capturing player steals a key of their choice from that player.

When player believes to know their sentence they yell “Stop!”. After the turn of the current player, they have to guess the sentence and if it is correct, win the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Static Capture

name: Z Day Survivor: Per Ullus Opes
description:
Z Day Survivor: Per Ullus Opes ("By any means") is a turn based game of strategy and luck that features 8 unique characters for varying styles of play. Using a one-of-a-kind Zombie Survival Kit, track the spread of the virus, bonuses to movement, and organize items collected during your journey to become...the Z Day Survivor.

—description from the publisher

The city is cut off. No help is coming. Will you be bitten or will you fight, cheat, and steal your way to victory to become... the Z Day Survivor? Eight survivors trapped in a hospital receive an emergency broadcast, warning that no help is coming. The only chance for survival is to escape anyway you can to an extraction point near the far edge of town. There's just one catch --- salvation is on a first come, first serve basis and seats are in short supply.

The strategy is simple: MOVE, SCAVENGE, FIGHT. Each player enacts his turn in three phases.

Move -- Traverse the terrain as quickly as you can. It's a race to be the first to escape.

Scavenge -- Gather items and search for vehicles necessary to help you get ahead of the crowd.

Fight -- Behind each corner waits looters ready to strip you of your supplies, displaced civilians that may need your help, and zombies ready to tear at your flesh. Along the way, help or hinder your opponents, but take great care not to be bitter, the zombie virus spreads quickly and there are only a limited number of antidotes in play.

—description from the box
mechanics: Action/Event, Dice Rolling, Events, Lose a Turn, Movement Points, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game, Track Movement, Turn Order: Time Track, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Hour of the Jackal Games, LLC

name: Cheers
description:
Cheers is a board game focused on the social aspects of party games. It is a new concept targeting 16-25 years old people who enjoy having fun and partying. The game has many questions and challenges and thereby guarantees inappropriate but fun situations to occur.

Cheers is a board game with a new groundbreaking concept. We have gathered a selection of the most popular pre-party games in one, so you can focus on having fun.

Cheers - be the best host!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Acting, Action/Event, Player Judge, Singing, Voting

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Tear Me A New One Promo Card
description:
May be used once by a player to immediately steal all Carrots received by an opponent during the current turn. Tear Me A New One may be used at any time but only by the game’s owner (or with the owner’s permission) by tearing the card in half!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Trading

name: Would You Rather...? Prove It
description:
Would you rather play with smelly socks on your hands, or eat snacks out of your shoe? Would You Rather? Prove It is the awkwardly hilarious game of demented dilemmas! In this unnerving family game, players secretly vote with tokens on crazy choices as its revealed who would do what. Choose wisely and be careful what you vote for, or you might have to prove it! Players read out dilemmas from three different card categories: Would You Rather, Would I Rather, and Would You Rather…Prove It. You’ll be making tough choices, as you vote in the majority to earn a scoring chip or vote in the minority and you’ll have to prove it! Things will get hilarious as players who have to prove it do things like yodel, eat a spoonful of butter or play a whole round moving like a sloth!

—description from the publisher

name: Balance of Command
description:
A promotional game for a Kickstarter animated film "A Winter of Empires".

The game is a simple fighting game between two spaceships. Manage the resources of your ship and try and guess your opponent's next maneuver. Claim victory by destroying your opponent's ship.
categories: Abstract Strategy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Print & Play, Science Fiction
mechanics: Action/Event, Betting and Bluffing, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Wigetta y las gemas mágicas
description:
Willyrex, Vegetta777 and their friends wake up in a mysterious cave without knowing how they got there. But, they are not alone... inside the cave there lurk some dangers.
With the help of the Goblins, they will try to come back home a loot of gems, while avoiding falling into the traps or being caught by the Hypnocielagos or the Slimo King.

Can you help our friends to escape from the caves and collect the most valuable gems?

On each turn, players must play a creature card from their hand. All cards are revealed at the same time and the solved its effect. First to play is the slimo kings. They will catch the Hypnocielagos in play. Then, if there are hypnocielagos in play, they will catch the goblins in play. Last, if there are goblins in play, they will collect the gems from the cave. Each type of creature will be solved starting with the card with the highest value.

Collected gems and trapped creatures you get along the game will give victory points. At the end of the game, the player with the biggest loot will be the winner.

—description from the designer (English)

Willyrex, Vegetta777 y sus amigos despiertan en una misteriosa cueva sin saber cómo han llegado hasta allí. Pero no están solos; las cuevas están repletas de vida y con dentro acechan grandes peligros.
Con la ayuda de los Duendes, intentaran volver a casa con las valiosas gemas de la cueva, evitando caer en las trampas y ser atrapados por los Hipnociélagos o el Rey Slimo.

¿Podrás ayudar a nuestros amigos a escapar de las cuevas y reunir la mayor cantidad de gemas?

En cada turno, los jugadores deben jugar una carta de criatura de su mano y deberán revelarla a la vez. Primero se resolverán los reyes slimo que haya en juego. Estos atraparán a los Hipnocielagos. Luego, si hay Hipnocielagos en juego, atraparan a los duendes de la cueva. Y finalmente, si hay duendes en juego, podrán recolectar las gemas de la cueva. A su vez; cada criatura se resolverá comenzando por la de mayor valor en la carta.

Las gemas conseguidas y criaturas atrapadas de darán puntos de victoria. Al final de la partida, el jugador con el mayor botín será el ganador.

—description from the designer (Spanish)

name: Parada y  Fonda
description:
Parada y Fonda is a different game. In it you can tour Spain and get to know each of its corners, its traditions, its customs, its gastronomy kilometer by kilometer.

The winner is the player who first completes the kilometers that have been marked at the start of the game.

—description from the publisher

name: The Presidential Wall Game
description:
Now everyone can build a GREAT, GREAT wall…or knock it down! It’s a HUGE hit, no matter which side you’re on!
Remove bricks without knocking the President off the wall. If he falls, you’re fired! Helps develop fine motor skills – which leads to lower unemployment rates. Includes handsome, really rich character (President Trump likeness) which balances on the wall. You will have many, many fun times playing this game. The best times.

—description from the publisher

name: Bugs Building
description: Bugs Building is a twist on Jenga that is perfect for young learners. In this simple game, players take turns rolling the die, then removing a corresponding bug from the tower and placing it on top. The goal is to remove the bugs without toppling the tower.

name: Vocaboliere
description:
Vocaboliere - Il gioco della lingua italiana is a trivia game for 2 to 8 players. The box contains a scoring sheets block, a pencil and 130 cards with 520 questions in 10 categories concerning the Italian language. In turn order, the players must answer to 30 different questions featuring different points (4, 3, 2, 1 points). The game ends when all the players have answered to 30 questions.

—user summary

name: After Dinner Trivia
description:
After Dinner Trivia includes 300 quiz cards covering 6 classic trivia categories; perfect for riotous after-dinner fun!

Wow your friends and family with your knowledge of anything from films to geography, music to inventions, to name just a few of the topic areas. The only down-side is that you may have trouble getting rid of your dinner guests at the end of the night!

Trivia categories: Geography & Nature History & Religion The Arts & Music Entertainment & Celebrity Science & Invention Sports & Pastimes.

—description from the publisher

name: Savo
description:
Players travel through the historical province of Savonia, Finland. Dice are thrown to move from town to town through the linear map. For every town there is an event in the manual, presented in both standard Finnish and the Savonian dialect, and usually involving answering a trivia question to gain or lose a turn.
First player to reach the goal wins the game. The players then sing a thematic song. The game describes itself as historical and old-fashioned and the manual includes a separate history section.

—user summary
mechanics: Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Singing

name: TankArmada
description:
With the help of judicious movements and shots of his tanks which evolve on a ground, which changes with each party, each player tries to take possession of the opposing Headquarter to win the game. Exploitation of the field like the performances of the different tanks, simple tactics, and shooting success will lead you to victory.

—description from the back of the box

The game is played on a 9x5 array of landscape cards, which includes the two players' headquarters cards. Each player starts with five tank cards on stands that move over this landscape. The tanks are differentiated by range and damage ability, but not firepower - all tanks roll a six-sided die when shooting and if the number rolled exceeds the target's damage value, it is destroyed. If any tank moves onto the opposing HQ space, the game is over and that side wins the game immediately.

The game has some unique interpretations of "realism" in its rules. For example, each tank MUST move one space each turn, regardless of the situation on the board. Also, damage in a given turn is cumulative, so two (or three, or four) tanks can combine their damage to destroy a single vehicle.

—user summary

name: 10 to the Top: Addition Game
description:
10 to the Top, the fast-stacking, tower-topping game of making 10!

Contents and summary:
Ten to the top is a simple arithmetic game featuring thirty firm foam dice with numbers or a star on four sides with different colored backgrounds and two opposite sides with a blank white side or copyright notice.

Summary of play:
Each player takes five cubes, setting aside extra cubes except for one. Place the extra cube in the center of the table with the numbers facing right side up.
Players add cubes to the tower as quickly as possible to make a total of ten facing them. Once they do, they call "Ten."
Cubes cannot be moved once placed on the tower.
Players keep stacking cubes to make ten. If all players are unable to make ten, take a cube from the extra pile and add it to the top of the tower then continue play.
If a player knocks down the tower, they take two more cubes from the extra pile, then take a cube from the extra pile and re-start a new tower.
To win, stack all of your cubes on the tower.
Alternate play: Take turns stacking a cube instead of racing and be the first player to stack all of your cubes.

—description from the publisher

name: Die Olchis Kuddelmuddel Knubbel-Knoten
description: A game in the style of Twister, using a less regular playmat. Meant for children and designed with the Olchis franchise.

name: Solar Dominion Fleet Combat
description:
Solar Dominion Fleet Combat is a two player area control game played on a rotating board simulating the orbits of planets, space stations and asteroids around a star. Each player controls several fleets of spaceships and must attempt to capture as much of the solar system as possible, capturing asteroids to gain resources to equip and restore their fleets and planets and space station.

Each turn, the orbit rings rotate, moving both locations and player fleets and changing their relative distances from each other, providing an extra tactical element.

Once a majority of locations have been claimed by either player, the player with the most locations earns a victory point, and the first player to reach the goal wins.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Map Deformation, Simulation

name: Rampant Hordes: Fantasy Mass Battle Game
description:
Rampant Hordes is a scale and model agnostic fantasy mass battle game.
It is designed to be played in about an hour with fully customizable forces from your favorite fantasy setting.
The rules can accommodate infantry, cavalry, monsters, and wizards.
Players choose generic units and customize them using a Fantasy traits list. Most weapons and equipment is abstracted into simple to use Fantasy Traits for the units.

The mechanics are straight forward, streamlined, and easy to learn. Rampant Hordes uses a d6 vs. a target number to resolve combat, actions, morale, and other results.
In addition, it uses a Command Point system for resource management to unlock special rules and benefits for your troops at the key point of battle.

Victory in Rampant Hordes focuses on completing mission objectives. These are randomly generated prior to the game and come complete with twists and turns to make every gaming experience unique.
It also includes a campaign system to link your games together into a narrative to build and maintain your armies.

—description from the publisher

name: T RUN: The Ultimate Fun and Strategy Card Game
description:
T RUN is a fast paced card game for people who like to plan ahead, strategize, or team up! The objective of the game is to use clever tactics to get rid of all your cards first. At the same time, you must get rid of your cards in the correct order to win the game.

The players can use strategies such as taking the lead during opportune moments to get rid of low ranking cards. Or, skipping a turn to conserve high ranking cards which can be used later in the game to outmaneuver opponents. The game gets more intense as players discovering more strategies to win.

The game can be played with an odd or even number of players. Also, the game can be played 1 vs. 1, or team vs. team. Each deck allows up to 7 players at the same time. If you have more than 7 players, just add another deck, and everyone can play at the same time.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Push Your Luck, Take That

name: Whitewater Rescue
description:
Work as a team to rescue the swimmer and get off the river.

It's a good day if you rescue the swimmer and all players make it to the same portage trail.

It's a bad day if your group is unable to play the required gear cards to rescue the swimmer or a player stuck in a purple hazard. Actually, it’s game over!

—description from the designer
mechanics: Action/Event, Cooperative Game, Modular Board, Moving Multiple Units

name: Star Patrol Micro
description:
Take on the role of starship captain and patrol the border worlds to keep people safe from the pirate threat. Manage your shields and missiles to defeat the enemy ships and use the reward money to keep your ship performing to it's highest potential.

When you're comfortable try your hand at a campaign boosting your ships status and facing off against larger threats and unique missions. Can you stop the pirates once and for all?

All on one double-sided page. Use 1 six-sided dice and track your status using either a piece of scrap paper or number of paper clips on the status tracks allowing for a big game in a small space.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: Apéro Humour
description:
200+ humorous questions for an evening between friends.

Présentation de l'éditeur:

Plus de 200 questions amusantes et humoristiques pour animer soirées et apéritifs entre amis. 200 questions avec un brin d'humour à consommer sans modération entre amis ou en famille !

Fous rires garantis pour des apéritifs réussis !

name: Gram-R-Fun
description:
Players attempt to score a bingo on their individual “Parts of Speech” card. A player rolls the die and selects a card from their opponent’s hand. The number rolled determines which word to use on the chosen card for construction of a sentence later in the game. The player must identify the correct part of speech shared by all words on the card. If successful, they add the card to their hand and mark off the appropriate space on their bingo board.

There are Dapper cards in the deck which allow the scoring of one additional point when declaring bingo and constructing a sentence, as well as Zapper cards which prevent a player from declaring bingo as long as they are in possession of that card.

Once a players declares bingo, they must construct a sentence from the cards they have in their hand with the words designated by their previous rolls. A point is scored for each word successfully used. The first player to 21 points wins the game.

name: The Cloud Dungeon 2: Sunken Dungeon
description:
In The Cloud Dungeon 2: Sunken Dungeon, 1-6 players color and construct their characters, buying and attaching armor and weapons, and making their own, utterly unique creations. Your party is 'borrowing' a submarine and setting out for the Sunken Dungeon: a defunct, dangerous place full of sea creatures, monsters, and green olives. You're hoping there's treasure in there, someplace. Throughout the process, you'll be engaging in hand-to-claw combat with crabs, electrifying whales, and working together to pilot your submarine in intense submarine battles.

Along the way, you'll be making choose-your-own adventure-style decisions as a team, with huge (and ridiculous) consequences. You'll lose your leg, have starfish plastered all over you, and tangle with a Very Cheerful Squid who wants to kill you. It's ridiculous fun for any player who is creative, loves coloring, or wants to have a fun coloring adventure with their friends, family, or game group.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Legacy Game, Paper-and-Pencil, Role Playing

name: Farmy'Up
description:
Roll the dice in the 3D farm. Chicken? Cow? Fruit? Great moments of fun to see who will be the first to grab the right wooden disk. With Farmy’up, a game of speed and deduction, children learn about life on the farm, from the hen house to the vegetable garden.
—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Farming

name: The Battle for Arrakis
description:
The planet Arrakis, commonly known as Dune, is a barren wasteland. It's also the only place where spice can be found. This precious resource is essential for space travel and so every house in the known universe vies for control of Dune. The Padishah Emperor Shaddam IV has recently granted stewardship of Dune to house Atreides, angering the previous stewards: the corrupt house Harkonnen. But this stewardship is not intended as a reward for the noble Atreides. The Emperor secretly fears the popularity of Duke Leto Atreides in the Landsraad and the Harkonnen's unbridled ambition and hopes that his scheme will spark a war between these two powerful houses that will weaken them to the point that they no longer pose a threat to his position as Padishah Emperor...

In this free Print & Play game, the players have been recruited by either house Atreides or house Harkonnen to fight for control of Dune. They each start with a base and a small personal deck of cards representing the units that make up their forces. These units can be sent to sectors to claim a spice income that allows a player to purchase or build more and better units for their deck.

When a sector becomes too crowded, a battle will be fought there. The winner of this battle will permanently claim the sector. A claimed sector does not give income anymore, but it is worth a number of victory points. After claiming a set number of sector cards, the game ends and the player with the most victory points will be the winner.

Units can also be used to attack the opponent's base. Units in your deck and discard pile will defend against attacks on your base. If you fail to defend your base, it will be damaged during attacks and you might eventually lose the game because your base is destroyed.

—description from the designer

name: The Classic Brio: Race Game
description:
The fastest car in the world needs the fastest service! Who will first drive the winning car in their garage - the mechanic who first gathers the game's five service cards!
Car game for children. Combination of dice-rolling race and memory game. Game set contains also a wooden Brio toy car.

name: Cricaré: The Indian Holocaust – Wargame in Brazilian Colonial Era
description:
The Battle of Cricaré was one of the bloodiest massacres carried out by the Portuguese against Tupinambá - Tupinikín Indians. It happened on the São Mateus River, also known as Cricaré, in the until then Povoado do Cricaré, including on the Mariricu River (variation of the word Marerike, which means fortress of pau-a-pique), in the current state of Espírito Santo, at the beginning of the year 1558.

Fernão de Sá, son of Mem de Sá governor-general of Brazil at the time, when he arrived in Porto Seguro in Bahia, he received the information that there were many Indians in the region of the village of Cricaré. He set up a punitive expedition with about six caravels and 200 men. He disembarked on the banks of the Cricaré and began to slaughter the Gentiles, using their firearms against the ill-armed Indians.

By underestimating the bravery of the Indians and the carelessness of the soldiers, the governor’s son went a long way in the persecution and ran out of powder. The Indians realized and advanced on him that he was only with ten men. He was killed along with Manuel Álvares and Diogo Álvares, both son of Diogo Álvares Correia, The Caramuru - The man of fire - and three other soldiers.

Despite this victory by the Indians, a large number of Portuguese soldiers joined the Cricaré River region, killing thousands of Indians. However, two notable facts occurred: the first defeat of the Portuguese on the Brazilian coast and, in return, the greatest genocide committed against the Indians in Brazil.

The Bellum Brasilis series was originally produced by the extinct Riachuelo Games and was directed to games at the tactical level, covering several episodes in the history of Brazil.
This wargame is the second in the Voxelhouse Old School Wargames series.

—description from the publisher
categories: Pike and Shot, Print & Play, Wargame

name: Skirmish Elite: Struggle for Maleme – The Invasion of Crete, Vol.1
description:
Skirmish Elite: Struggle for Maleme - The Invasion of Crete is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the German 7th Fliegerdivision Fallschirmjagers and the 5th New Zealand Brigade around the Allied airfield at Maleme on Crete, May 1941.

The book includes eight scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of three campaigns. The book is the first of two Skirmish Elite books that will focus on Crete.

Maximum Replayability: the Skirmish Elite system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information and history on the German invasion of Crete. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes:

8 Scenarios,
3 Campaigns.


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: SkirmishCampaigns: North Africa '40-'41 – Italian Misadventure and Arrival of the DAK
description:
SkirmishCampaigns North Africa '40-'41 - Italian Misadventure and the Arrival of the DAK is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the opening fighting in North Africa and the entry of the German Africa Corps (DAK).

The book includes twelve scenarios that can be played alone or together in one of five campaigns.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the campaign for North Africa. This book also features a bibliography of sources.

Includes:

12 Scenarios,
5 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: SkirmishCampaigns: Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr
description:
SkirmishCampaigns: Heroes of Omaha and Panzer Lehr
This is the companion book of Normandy-First Hours.

It is a complete book for recreating skirmish-level battles and campaigns centered on the US drive from Omaha Beach to St. Lo in June 1944 and the counterattack of the German Panzer Lehr Division in Normandy in July 1944.

Maximum Replayability: the SkirmishCampaigns system features a realistic (and historic) variable order of battle for each scenario, guaranteeing countless unique scenario and campaign replays.

Generic Order of Battle: this book also includes a unique generic order of battle listing that can be translated to almost any skirmish rule system.

Historical Research: this book includes several introduction sections that contain background information on the campaign for Normandy in 1944. This book also features an annotated bibliography that is especially taylored to the reader interested in tactical battles in Normandy 1944.

Includes:

11 Scenarios,
3 Campaigns


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Wargame, World War II

name: Waimea Wipeout Surf board Game
description: The world's first realistic surfing board game. Featuring the surf photography of Brian Bielmann, the game board and box are covered with magazine quality surf photos, making looking at the game almost as enjoyable as playing it. Roll a 10-sided die and execute the take off, drop and tube of waves on the north shore of Hawaii. If you make it past the barreling tube, you can execute a variety of maneuvers to accumulate points in search of the perfect 10. Additional surf break charts are also available to localize your Waimea Wipeout experience (not included). This is the game for surfers...but not only for surfers. Waimea Wipeout educates even the most novice of fans about the essential elements of competitive surfing, while also giving the chance of victory to all players. Unique would be an understatement for this game !

name: ミックスジュースパーティー (Mix Juice Party)
description:
ミックスジュースパーティー (Mix Juice Party) is a Japanese card game. The game proceeds mainly with card drafting; each player picks a card which they want to keep from their hand and reveals them together, then gives the remaining hand to the next player. Repeat this until last one card remains in the hand, which is discarded.

After drafting cards is over, each player makes a juice mix from the cards they kept. The player sorts their card by type of fruit, and then loses the highest card from the highest value fruit set.

Then players work out their total fruit mix value. If all the players have got a different total, the highest and lowest total players will lose milk (victory points). If some players have matching totals, those players lose milk instead.

The game ends when any player has lost all their milk. The final score is the total from the last round, plus the value of milk retained. Most points wins with heavenly milk!

Watch out for the cat cards. During the rounds, if a single cat appears, it steals fruit and the other players get no card. But if more than one cat appears, they run away together and no fruit is lost.

Keep away from losing your points and make nice juice by using three kind of fruits, honey, hot pepper, and special cards like the cat!

手札から欲しいカードを1枚選び、一斉に公開してから手札ををとなりに渡すドラフト形式でゲームは進行します。
ドラフトを行った後獲得したカードでジュースを作りその合計点数が他の人とかぶると失点です。
かぶった人がいなければ？最高点と最低点の人が失点となります。

一定の失点を獲得した人が出た時に集めていたカードの点数が最も高い人が勝者となります。
ですが、点数計算の前に自分が一番集めたフルーツはジュースにせずに食べてしまいます。
そして、ネコは今選んだカードを持って逃げてしまうので注意しましょう。

ゲームのメインはドラフト（与えられた手札から1枚選択し、残りを隣に渡して順にカードを集めていくシステム）となっております。

集めたカードの内合計値が最も高いフルーツは捨て札になります。
そして、残ったカードの合計値が他の人とかぶるとライフを失います（ミルクが1本なくなります）。
誰かがライフがなくなった時にゲームは終了し「その時点でのカードの合計値が高い人」が勝者となります
※最終ラウンドの点数しか見ません、ライフが残っていた分はボーナス点になります。

3種類のフルーツとハチミツとトウガラシ、そしてネコといった特殊カードをうまく使って失点を受けないようにうまくジュースを作りましょう！
publisher' summary
mechanics: Open Drafting, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Bob the Builder: Auf der Baustelle
description: This dice game makes the little ones the greatest construction helpers ever! Your job is to bring the building materials to Bob, Leo, and Wendy at the construction site. This colorful color cube game also turns the players into small construction helpers by quickly taking their building blocks to the construction site. If you are the first to bring your building blocks to Bob's construction site, you win. The building blocks are brought to the construction site with the help of the different colored construction vehicles. The more construction vehicles the players “roll” in a round, the more building blocks they can transport to the construction site. The color cube game with Bob the Builder conveys the first understanding of the rules and promotes the color assignment in a playful way.

name: Eagle's Prey: Villa Rides!
description:
Eagle's Prey: Villa Rides! Revolution and Conquest 1910-1923 is a complete and comprehensive rules system for the Age of Villa and the Mexican Revolution! Designed to fight the larger scale battles and engagements of the Mexican Revolution, Villa Rides allows players to refight the struggle for power and control of Northern Mexico!


Allows for a 20,000 man game to be completed in three to four hours.
Can be used with any scale and no rebasing needed.
Covers the various factions and forces list.
Features HRG's terrain generation system.
Follows historical organization and unit capabilities.
Includes a scenario generator and player-aid tools.
Rated leaders for brigade and division command.
Command at the brigade level, with smallest unit a battalion.
Includes United States and various native tribes.
Features artillery, aircraft, armored cars, and trains!


—description from the publisher
categories: Book, Miniatures, Wargame, World War I

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Yellow Enchanted Bunny Promo Card
description:
Enchanted Bunny may be placed into The Bunny Circle or may be used once by a player to eliminate another Enchanted Bunny. An Enchanted Bunny may only have an Enchanted Bunny Modifier.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Negotiation

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Shazbot Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #3

Text says:
Shazbot may be given to any player. The player must return one Carrot to Kaballa's Market (even if the market is closed) for each curse (or naughty) word that he speaks during the game. The player may pay 10 Dolla to remove this card.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: After Darkness Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #4

Text says:
After Darkness may be used once by a Player to eliminate any 50/50 weapon at any time after sunset or before sunrise. May be used at any time (during the game)!

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Pucker Up Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #5

Text says:
Pucker Up may be used once by a Player to force all Opponents to roll a die. The Opponent who rolled the lowest number must either kiss the Player or give him one Carrot, Zodiac card and Mysterious Place card.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Hitchbunny's Guide Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #6

Text says:
Hitchbunny's Guide may be used once by a Player to take one card from the Discard Pile that features a picture of the planet Jupiter (either in full or partially) for each combination of a roll of '4' and '2' on the dice.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Indiana Clones Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #11

Text says:
Indiana Clones may be used once by a player to discard his entire five-card hand and replace it with any five weapon cards from Rooney's Weapon Emporium.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Psi Corps Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #12

Text says:
The player with this card saved may control all Psi cards use by any opponents. If at any time the player has no bunnies in the Bunny Circle, then this card is discarded.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunny Eye For The Carrot Guy Promo Card
description:
Psi Series Card #2

Text says:
Bunny Eye For The Carrot Guy may be used once by a Player to choose a Carrot if he is the player wearing the most clothing with the color that matches the highest die rolled.

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Interview With The Bunnies Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Interview With The Bunnies
Nu 02: This is a double Specialty Bunny. The player with these bunnies down may play two cards per turn.

categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Atlas Shrugged
Nu 04: Roll all of the twelve-sided dice in your game. If a number of dice (equal to the number of players) roll any identical number, then all players move to the adjacent seat. For example, if three people are playing, then three of the numbers rolled must be the same. It does not matter what number it is, as long as there are three of them.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Even Stephen, Odd Todd
Nu 05: May be used once by a player who rolls the die. An Even (or Odd) roll allows a player to take an Even (or Odd) numbered Carrot from any opponent or Kaballa’s Market. For example, if a player rolls a 9, then he may take any Odd numbered Carrot from any opponent or Kaballa’s Market.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Journey To The Center Of The Circle Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Journey To The Center Of The Circle

description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Red October
Nu 07: Each player rolls the die in the order of play. Players who roll an Odd number must place one of their bunnies from The Bunny Circle into the Red October while players who roll an Even number may take a bunny out. The player who played the card rolls last and may roll twice.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: The Scarlet Letter Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

The Scarlet Letter
Nu 08: May be used once to force any opponent to discard all cards in his five-card hand that contain the letter 'A' in the title or that have a Red button in the upper left corner (RUN cards). The player decides which option to use. The opponent must show his hand to the player to confirm that he has complied.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: A Tale Of Two Bunnies Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

A Tale Of Two Bunnies
Nu 09: May be given to any opponent with at least two bunnies in The Bunny Circle who must give any two of his bunnies away to other players. The opponent chooses which bunnies to give away and to whom.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Through The Looking Glass Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

Through The Looking Glass
Nu 10: May be used once by a player or given to an opponent. Odd rolls increase a player’s Cabbage or Water by the amount rolled while Even numbers decrease the amounts.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: 23 Skidoo Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

23 Skidoo
Nu 11: Allows all players to discard any cards in their five-card hand that have a 2 or a 3 in the Card Identification Number. Players may keep any cards that they wish. New cards are drawn immediately.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: W Is For Whammy! Promo Card
description:
Killer Bunnies Nu Series Promo card available in the specially packaged Killer Bunnies Quest Blue Starter Deck and the Killer Bunnies games for Go! Games.

W Is For Whammy!
Nu 12: May be used once by a player to launch all Weapon cards in his five-card hand at any bunnies in The Bunny Circle. Weapons are launched one at a time directly from the player’s hand. All cards used must be replaced with new cards from the Draw Pile.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Bed Bugs
description:
There's a plague of bed bugs in teh house and we have to trap them with our different body parts, even if we end up in almost impossible positions. But if you also want to win more points you'll have to perform the action that appears on the card without dropping any bed bugs. Don't stay in your seat!
In each card you can see where you should put the bed bugs in your body, the first one to put the bed bugs in the correct place, should ring the bell and can decide if he win this card or want to win extra card doing the action of the extra card.

—description from the publisher

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Go With The Flo Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Go With The Flo
Omega 03: Allows a player to exchange any saved Special (or Very Special) card for Carrot #04 (Flo).

Number Six

No Supe For You
Omega 07: May be used once by a player to eliminate all Super Bunnies from The Bunny Circle that are the same color as any die which rolled an even number. Good luck getting even!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Hare E. Potter Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Hare E. Potter
Omega 08: May be used once by a player to retrieve the Magic Spatula or any Magic Fountain card from the discard. The retrieved card may be used immediately or saved.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Baby Bunnies On Board Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Baby Bunnies On Board
Omega 10: When a player has this card saved and at least one Kinder Bunny down in The Bunny Circle then any time he must roll a die (or dice) of a specific color, this card allows the player to roll both the 10 and 12-sided dice of the same color and to choose which roll to use.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Red Herring Pink Salmon Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Red Herring Pink Salmon
Omega 11: May be used once by a player to counteract the death of any Red or Pink bunny. May be used at any time!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Bunnies of the Caribbean Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is also included as part of Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot: Chocolate Booster, and is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Quest for the Magic Carrot.

Bunnies of the Caribbean
Omega 12: May be used once by a player to steal the amount of Dolla rolled from any one opponent. Only the exact amount may be taken.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Omega Thirteen Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

Omega Thirteen
Omega 13: May be used once by a player to force any one die roll by any player to be re-rolled. May be used at any time!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: I Dream of Bunny Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

I Dream of Bunny
Omega 14: May be used once by a player with no bunnies in play to take any one bunny from the Discard Pile and to place it directly into The Bunny Circle.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Kubrickian Glee Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

Kubrickian Glee
Omega 15: May be used once by a player and given to any opponent who must kill at least one bunny before he may choose a Carrot.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot: Soft Kitty Warm Kitty Promo Card
description:
Omega Cards are promotional cards distributed at conventions, bunny promotions and special bunny events. Some cards are distributed when you buy your game through Playroom Entertainment or from select retailers.

This card is considered promotional card for Killer Bunnies and the Conquest of the Magic Carrot.

Soft Kitty Warm Kitty
Omega 16: May be used once by a player to immediately cure all bunnies in The Bunny Circle of any sickness or hunger. May be used at any time!
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Action Queue, Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: A NÉBIH küldetés
description: You can be a NÉBIH inspector! NÉBIH is a hungarian inspection organization, the Nemzeti Élelmiszer-BIztonsági Hivatal, in english National Food Safety Agency. In A NÉBIH küldetés everybody can be inspector in restaurants, animal farms, etc.
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Galamons
description: A trading card game, Galamons welcomes you into a world where monsters walk the Earth. This is a trading card game tailored both to tabletop gaming enthusiasts and to card collectors, encouraging you to immerse yourself into the rich lives of Galamons, each monster boasting its own powers and its own skills. A game quite unlike any other that you have ever played before, it features stages of monsters, who transform through the Power Stone cards that correspond to each monster's type. And your goal is to destroy the other player's planet using your Galamon's Attacks, or defend your own planet with Galamons and Spell Cards, You can develop unlimited strategies to win.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Episode IV
description:
In Episode IV, players are trying to create two poker hands, and the player with the most valuable hands will be the winner.

The game uses two decks of cards. One is referred to as the "Normal" cards, and consists of ranks 1 through 10 in each of 4 suits. The other is referred to as the "Randolph" deck, in an allusion to the designer Alex Randolph, as they are acquired through the mechanism popularized in Hol's der Geier. The "Randolph" cards may have more than one possible color and/or rank.

The game consists of 4 phases, and each player will have ten cards in their hand at the beginning and end of each phase.

In the first phase, the players are dealt 10 cards each from the Normal deck, and will draft cards until they have one card of each rank in their hand.

In the second phase, the players will reveal a certain number of Randolph cards face up and have an auction for them using the Hol's der Geier mechanism. For players who have their bid cancelled, they will return their Normal card to their hand at the end of the round. Otherwise, players will enter the next round with any Normal cards they did not bid, and any Randolph cards they won.

In the third phase, a trick-taking round occurs, which is must follow and does not have a trump suit. The winner of a trick distributes the cards from the trick to the players as they choose, with each player getting 1 card.

In the fourth phase, the players make two face down rows of 5 cards with the cards they obtained in the trick-taking phase. Each row is revealed simultaneously and awarded a given number of points based upon poker hand type conditions. There are a few exceptions in cases where only one player scores, or only one player does not score.
mechanics: Auction: Sealed Bid, Open Drafting, Set Collection, Trick-taking

name: Sea Hunt
description:
"Based on the exciting T.V. adventure series"

A simple roll and move game for four people. Players move their diver figure, descending from the surface to a shipwreck on the sea bed. A treasure chest is collected from the ship's strong room and carried back to a boat on the surface to win the game. There are a number of hazards to overcome along the way.

The game was produced to tie in with the popular T.V. adventure series of the same name, starring Lloyd Bridges.

name: Grimasjakten
description: A player takes a card and tries to copy the grimace shown on the card. The other players should now try to see which grimace it is and as soon as possible mark the correct picture on the game board.

name: Diskwars: Moon Over Thelgrim – The Sons of Triamlavar
description:
There is a bad moon rising, full of blood and ill omens. The Great War has come to Thelgrim, and death follows in its wake.

Moon Over Thelgrim is the first expansion set for Diskwars. With Moon Over Thelgrim, you may expand your Diskwars game with more 100 new Disks, including new creatures, spells, lands and even a new faction. Moon Over Thelgrim comes in eight different army packs: The Draco Wing (Dragonkin), Frothan's Ghouls (Undead), The Groman Guard (Knights), The Sons of Triamlavar (Elves), Zocrab's Marauders (Orcs), The Hammers of Urth (Dwarves), The Knives of Q'aro Fenn (Uthuk), and Waiqar's Sundermen (Acolytes). Each pack has four set flats of that faction and four random flats.

What's New in Moon Over Thelgrim:

Terrain - The expansion includes new rules for terrain, as well as six new Terrain Disks.
Champions - These unique new hero Disks add power to your "pure" armies.
New Disk Abilities - Dozens of the new Creature Disks feature new abilities to add variety and strategy to your game.
New Scenarios - No Diskwars expansion would be complete without new scenarios, and Moon Over Thelgrim gives you several from which to choose.
A New Faction - The mysterious wilds of the Thelgrim Peninsula are home to strange new faction that does not appreciate outsiders invading its homeland.
categories: Collectible Components, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Wargame

name: Lua Cheia
description:
Lua Cheia is a trick-taking game for two players, using a deck of 15 cards. Each player receives a 6 card hand, and the remaining three cards are not revealed.

Each trick is "may follow" and resolved after each player has played one card. If the cards are of the same suit, the player with the lower ranked card loses an amount of life equal to the difference of the card ranks. If the cards are of different suits, the second player loses an amount of life equal to the rank of the lead player's card.

At the end of a hand, the players' remaining life values are evaluated. If one player has been KO'd, the other player earns 3 points; otherwise, the player with the most life earns 1 point. Prepare a new round, with renewed life totals, and play until one player has earned at least 7 points; the player with the most points wins.

name: Sterke verhalen: Waar of niet waar?
description:
Strong Stories: True or False is a board game for 5 players, in which you trick each other. Tell each other tall stories and let the others judge whether the story is true or whether you make it up on the spot. The more players you trick, the longer your nose becomes. Whoever has a long nose first wins the game.

—description from the publisher (translated)

Sterke verhalen: Waar of niet waar is een bordspel voor 5 spelers, waarin je elkaar bij de neus neemt. Vertel elkaar sterke verhalen en laat de anderen oordelen of het verhaal waar is of dat je het ter plekke verzint. Hoe meer spelers je bij de neus neemt, hoe langer je eigen neus wordt. Degene die als eerste een lange neus heeft, wint het spel.
—description from the publisher

name: Regalia
description:
Regalia is a fast, portable party game where the players reenact medieval court conspiracies.

Each turn the players simultaneously choose one character to add to their collection - avoiding the most popular characters is the key to the victory as characters chosen by more than one player can not be claimed.


No randomness
No player elimination
Language independent components


—description from the publisher
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Take That

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Sixth Edition): Codex – Imperial Knights
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Game of Plouf
description:
Hi, It's Plouf !
After so many years criticizing video games, I got bored out. What I want now, is to have my own video game. a AAAAA game. And this is where it all starts. You will have to develop the best possible video game. But keep in mind this is a complicated task. The road ahead is still long and rocky, not to mention the fierce competition among you. Because in the end, I'll be able to keep only one of your games. So Good Luck ! To be the winner of Game of Plouf, you'll need it !

Aim of the game
To win, you'll need to be the first player to achieve 4 objectives or to be the one having the most cards at the end of the game.

—description from the rulebook (translated)
mechanics: Hand Management, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Dark Angels
description:
The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.


User summary:
Codex: Dark Angels is an expansion codex book for Warhammer 40,000 3rd Edition. This book covers the Dark Angels Chapter of the Space Marines and provides details of their history, chapter organization, equipment, special rules, painting schemes, and army lists.

From the back cover:
The stubborn warriors of the Dark Angels are held in awe throughout the galaxy, but have secretly pursued a sinister vendetta for ten thousand years. Inside you will find:

Army List: Rules and information for new forces available only to Dark Angels armies, such as the renowned Deathwing and Ravenwing. Also included is information detailing new weapons, vehicles, and wargear used by the Dark Angels.

New Scenario: A new Dark Angels mission and rules for playing it.
