Hobby Section: Seven full colour pages packed with invaluable tips and advice on collecting, painting and playing with a Dark Angels army.

Special Characters: Rules and information for Dark Angels characters such as Commander Azrael, Chief Librarian Ezekiel and Interrogator Chaplain Asmodai.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Warhammer 40,000 (Third Edition): Codex – Space Wolves
description: The Warhammer 40,000 Codex books contain the complete rules for playing various armies in Warhammer 40,000. They also contain in-depth painting guides, army lists, and much more.
categories: Book, Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Science Fiction, Wargame
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Modular Board, Variable Player Powers

name: Gone To See The Elephant: Miniatures War Game Rules for The Mexican-American War, 1846-1848
description:
Utilizing the basic game model first published in John Company, Gone To See The Elephant GTSTE requires absolutely no written record keeping, and as few as three standard six-sided dice.

Play is card driven, with random order of movement with players commanding Brigades composed of from two to five infantry battalions or cavalry regiments, possibly with an artillery battery.

How many Orders a General can issue in a turn to the units in a Brigade depends on his pre-determined Generalship, and the draw of a card from the Orders Deck for his level.

Orders are placed before movement each turn, then units check their Resolve to see how well those orders are obeyed--or possibly not at all!

Fire is calculated by weapon, troop types, unit Resolve, and number of Bases. Losses are taken in Bases as well.

Uncontrolled and unexpected Events can result from the effects of enemy fire, but also randomly. A distinct and separate Mexican and US Army Event Deck is provided. Unique and historical occurrences impossible to write rules for, but which could or did happen in fact, are now part of the mix as players seek to create a battle plan then react as best they can when it actually makes contact with the enemy.

Prairie fires, false truce, amazing individual acts of courage, etc, all could influence battle in Mexico, and can for the players, too.

GTSTE also provides optional Rules, including Ammunition, Stamina and Fatigue, Skirmishers, Sappers, Night Fighting, and Weather, among others.

Special Resolve advantages are available to the Mexican force which can field in miniature figures for the conduct of pre-battle Mass, a military band, field hospital, and Soldaderas supporting the soldiers.

Introducing an innovative ground scale system for basing, the game may be played with ANY size figures, from 5/6mm,10mm, 15mm, 25/28mm to 40mm, using the same 1” x .75” and 2” x 1.5” square bases without effecting movement or weapons ranges. Artillery is mounted on pre-measured triangular templates (provided with the rules) indicating maximum firing angles eliminating the need for measuring in play.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Measurement Movement, Simulation

name: Empedocle
description:
Get rid of your Hatred and break the Empedocles cycle which opposes Love and Hatred inside the Terrestrial World, composed of four elements Air, Fire, Earth and Water.

Turn are played in 3 phases.

Players will choose their dice side and should have chosen a different side from other players to be able to take the chosen element. Otherwise they are eliminated from the turn.
They can modify their dice if they roll it with the risk of being eliminated. If they target alone an element, they can take it.
Each time they unify Air, Fire, Earth and Water elements, they are able to get rid of one Hatred fragment.


They win the game when they don't have any more Hatred fragment.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hidden Movement, Worker Placement with Dice Workers

name: Daimyo's Fall: Dice Tuners – Paradox Pop Idol
description:
Some of the girls we already met before decided to break the circle and prepare something beyond everyone’s imagination!

The fun fact is that they actually had the same dream during the same night: they were wearing strange clothes, performing on a stage filled with lights and there was a crowd screaming their names louder and louder! Was that just a coincidence?

After the endless multitude of Kami crafted the universe, they also ordained the mysterious flow of time… Is it possibile to transcend time and see, through dreams, alternate realities?

You asked for an add on, and here it is! This super special Kickstarter exclusive promo pack introduces powerful heroes with unique abilities and new strategy cards to overwhelm your opponents... with grace, style, and brand new aesthetics that you don’t want to miss!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Ponce de Leon
description:
Ponce de Leon was a Spanish conqueror who came to Florida in 1523 with the intention to explore and colonize this new territory for the Kingdom of Spain. They say that being in Florida he heard an aboriginal legend about "The fountain of youth" and dedicate to search for it. They also said that the Kingdom of Portugal knew the intentions of Ponce and sent an expedition to find the fountain of youth before the Spaniards do it.
A card game forming a map. Dice and pawns to move thru the board.
The players will go from their ships thru the paths on the cards until they get The fountain of youth" and return to his/her ship.

—description from the publisher

name: The GearSeed Saga
description:
The world of GearSeed is a peculiar place. Its seasons shift sporadically and the strange folk that call this world home do their best to adapt to its ever changing landscape.

The GearSeed Saga is a boxed collection of 2 completely different card games set in the same world.

SYNOD is a Kickstarter Exclusive Micro game for 2 players and was illustrated by Sandro Rybak.

GearSeed is a combo driven, tile laying card game for 2 to 4 players and features the illustrations of Oliver Howe. Artist Jason Benningfield is responsible for all of the icon work that ties these two games together.

name: Nowhere to Run
description:
A solo dice game about getting back home.

Inspired on the cult film The Warriors.


Postcard released in the August 2016 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.


SETUP
A postcard game where your gang is represented by the Hearts suit (Ace to Jack), and then you will deal 6 cards to form the leaders of the other gangs, and add some more cards according to the suit.

HOW TO PLAY
Roll both dice and lock a die, if possible, on one of 3 actions: Fight, Weapon, and Take Trains. Then roll the other die to get a number equal or higher to take that action, or get one of your gang cards wounded.

You will be advancing in a track, having to defeat all gang members at a location before moving, or taking a train to advance anyway.

You will also be able to build weapons to heal your gang or clear other enemy gang.

If you make it HOME before discarding your whole gang, you win!

name: Take-out
description:
Take-out is an exciting number game. Can you remove all the numbered dice for a score of zero? Take-out is fast to learn and fun to play.

Players each start with 50 points. If a player reaches 150 points they are eliminated. The game continues until there is only one player remaining.

Each turn a player will roll 10 red dice. Then they will roll two white dice. The total number of pips on the white dice must be removed from the pile of red cubes in any combination. The player continues to roll the white dice until they can no longer remove the red dice. If a player can remove all red dice, they subtract 10 from their total score. If unable to remove all red die they player will add the combination of remaining dice to their score.

Blanks can be used in place of any number, but if any remain at the end of the turn the player will be penalized 20 points.

name: This Very Ground Victory or Death
description: A small-unit skirmish miniature wargaming system for the black powder period. It is designed to not only put you in command of the weapons and troops of the period, but into the historical tactical situation of an officer. Your presence on the battlefield will be the difference between your forces moving forward in good order and engaging the enemy, or in your ragged formation falling apart in defeat. You will be the difference between Victory or Death! Experience the tactical challenge of small unit warfare from the Beaver Wars through the War of 1812.
categories: Age of Reason, American Indian Wars, American Revolutionary War, Miniatures, Napoleonic, Wargame

name: Allgäu fertig los
description: You get in the saddle with a few friends to explore this oasis of the European countryside on your bike. But you want to make it more exciting and decide on a race that will lead you through the Upper, Lower, East and West Allgäu. Everyone gets their own target points, everyone chooses the supposedly shortest route. Actually, everything was really easy if it weren't for the many little adventures and tasks that lurk for you along the way. Only one thing helps: full throttle until „Lälla“ hangs out
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vuureiland
description:
When you arrive at Fire Island, everything seems like a paradise. But there is a volcano which is becoming very active, and only one player will be able to survive this nightmare...

The game board exists of a standard setup of hexagonal tiles, with the volcano in the middle of the board. On your turn, you play one of the six standard action cards that are the same for every player, like sprint/walk/push & steal/dig/look and rest (to get your action cards back). Every turn you play two action cards, and you try to dig up special treasures like God cards, which will give you special actions.

But, there is a caveat. There are ten rounds in the game, and every round the volcano spreads across the island, dictated by the random direction of the wind. The player who plays his cards right, who is able to receive the favour of the gods and who is able to stay away from the lava, will survive and will be the only one left standing... Let the nightmare begin!

—user summary

Wanneer je aankomt op Vuureiland, lijkt het met zijn slaperige vulkaan en witte stranden recht uit een droom geplukt. Maar schijn bedriegt. Terwijl de vulkaan langzaam ontwaakt, wordt er ook iets in jou wakker. Je vermoedt dat dit verhaal mogelijk langzaam een nachtmerrie wordt; een nachtmerrie die eindigt in goud en bloed.

Verover machtige schatten, paai wraakzuchtige goden en schakel sluwe tegenstanders uit voor de vulkaan uitbarst. Ben jij klaar voor de ultieme vuurproef?

—description from the back of the box

name: UNO: Trolls World Tour
description:
Sing, dance, and hug... then play this Trolls World Tour edition of UNO!

Includes an exclusive "Tiny Diamond's Mix Tape Rule," which forces the next player to draw a card from each player's hand.

And don't forget to yell "UNO!" before the party is over!
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: Felicitas Fogg: In 80 Karten um die Welt
description:
Felicitas Fogg is a point-to-point movement bidding game with augmented reality (AR) support, where players have to select vehicles from their hand to move the character Felicitas Fogg on her trip around the world or discard them from their hand to restore energy and draw two new cards. The vehicles have different values for range, energy consumption and data traces. The values are modified by events like weather effects and individual player abilities. Felicitas always chooses the vehicle with the highest maximal range and the player winning the bid gains victory points depending on the number of fields she travelled. However, a hacker from F1X collective chases her, so the players are forced to leave as few traces of data as possible. At each location switch, the chaser makes an attractive offer and players may individually choose to help him. But whenever he catches Felicitas, all players lose the game.

Felicitas Fogg has been published by the organization Deutschland sicher im Netz (Germany safe in on the Internet) and is sponsored by the German Federal Ministry of Transport and Digital Infrastructure.
mechanics: Area Movement, Auction: Sealed Bid, Auction/Bidding, End Game Bonuses, Events, Hand Management, Multiple Maps, Prisoner's Dilemma, Race, Semi-Cooperative Game, Variable Player Powers
publishers: Deutschland sicher im Netz e. V.

name: Liefde is... samen een spelletje spelen
description:
'Liefde is ... samen een spelletje spelen' is Dutch for 'Love is ... playing a game together'.

You earn points ('hearts'), by guessing what answer another player gave to one of the personal questions on the game cards.

Some sample questions are

On my first date I always want ....
For a romantic weekend in my own country, I prefer to go to ....
In my previous life, I most likely was ....


The other players can randomly shout their answers, for 30 seconds.

name: Counting Campers
description:
Counting Campers is the fun counting game for your little camper. Players move their pegs forward or backward along the hiking trail by drawing a ‘plus’ or ‘minus’ card. Follow the winding path through the muddy swamp, across the fishing pond, over the old bridge, and more, to get back to the campsite. The first ‘camper’ back to camp wins the game!

In more detail, each player chooses a Camper and places it in the starting space on the game board in its matching color trail. Shuffle the cards and place them to the side of the board, facedown. Let the camping trip begin!

On your turn, draw a card from the playing deck. If a plus card (+) is drawn, jump your Camper forward the number shown. If a minus (-) card is drawn, move backwards the number shown. It's a great way for young players to practice counting skills and learn the concept of plus (+) and minus (-) while having fun!

Watch for special Camper cards while you play! If a card is drawn with a happy Camper with a sun/rainbow, draw two more cards and move. If a card is drawn with an unhappy Camper under a rain cloud, you lose a turn.

The first Camper to reach the campsite wins! For additional challenge for older players, the exact number card must be drawn in order to move the remaining spaces to the finish.

name: Brain Warp: The Trivia Game
description:
Place a deck of cards with questions taken from four categories (people and history, science and the world, miscellaneous, sports and entertainment) and a hexagonal score mat divided into six sections (including START) at the center. Each player/team choose a triangular mover and place it on the START space.

Oldest player draws a card from the deck and reads aloud the question on the front of the card to everybody, stating the three possible answers.

First person to clap their hands together gets to answer the question. The reader of the card decides all ties. If they are correct, that player or team moves their triangle ahead one space. The card is placed in a discard pile. If they are incorrect, the reader will indicate they are incorrect and any other player or team gets a chance to answer by immediately clapping their hands first. If nobody gets it, the card goes into the discard pile.

The player who answered the question correctly then draws and reads the next question. Play continues until a player or team has answered five questions correctly.

Includes score mat + 90 cards + 4 triangle movers. Play one-on-one or split players into up to four teams.
mechanics: Race, Team-Based Game, Turn Order: Claim Action

name: Cards of Candour
description:
Have you ever wanted to skip to the part of the evening when everyone starts revealing the hilariously weird things they’ve thought and done?

The game consists of 300 question cards that were carefully devised to help you uncover the hilarious inner thoughts, secrets and stories that your friends never even knew they were keeping from you.

The game dice guides you to ask other players personal questions that you think that they might say yes to - if they say yes you win points. So the game has an infinite-combinations-dynamic of revealing both what a person has thought, felt or done, but also what the asker thinks that they might have thought, felt or done.

Philosophically the creators of Cards of Candour believe that "we are all weird, now it’s time to share."
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Hand Management, Player Judge

name: Cards of Candour: Real Friends Expansion
description:
The Real Friends Expansion contains 50 darker and more inquisitive cards about sexual exploration, death and relationships.

These cards are not safe for work, families or acquaintances.

Save them for your real friends and shuffle them into the First Edition box to add a little pepper and spice to your evening.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Feisty Dice
description:
A Wagering Game for 3 to 6 mostly grown-up Adults.

The game consists of a number of rounds in which players draw tiles, play a dice game and then resolve the results to hopefully increase their money (called "shekels" and represented by various coloured chips representing various denominations).

The tiles come in two colours and two levels. The beginning, or "Scout", level orange tiles represent which game of four - Read Your Mind; More or Less; None the Same; or Knock Knock is to be played in that round. The beginner blue tiles are "Escapade" tiles, which give the player special powers. The advanced (Sage) tiles introduce more game options and new Escapades.

Each player begins with a set amount of shekels, a player guide which shows each game and the particular rules for that game, and a blue tile. The remaining tiles are placed in the provided pouch. On one's turn, the player draws a tile and resolves the outcome - either play the indicated game (orange tile) or if a special power blue tile is drawn, decide on whether to keep or use that tile. The game continues until there are no more tiles to be drawn from the pouch.

The player with the most value in shekels is declared the winner.

name: Shadows of Brimstone: Perilous Expeditions
description:
The Perilous Expeditions Set is a new Narrative Campaign mode that expands Shadows of Brimstone in exciting new directions. The heart of the Perilous Expeditions Set is the Narrative Campaign Book which includes all the Rules, Campaign Objectives, Story Threads, Enemy Lists, Expedition Hazard Charts for Land and for Sea, for both the Norse Coast and the Jungle Island Chain, as well as a host of other new material, including 8 brand new Missions for use with the Expedition Ship Board, the Wilderness Encounter Board, and some unique Campaign Story Missions. Heroes use the Gold and Dark Stone they collect on Missions to upgrade their Expedition Camp and Ship over the course of the Campaign, unlocking new options and powerful bonuses as the Darkness grows ever-stronger. Heroes explore the Campaign Map to reveal Adventure Locations, travel to OtherWorlds and back, hunting down Campaign Clues that lead you through the Story, and eventually (if you survive the perils thrown at you) reaching a climactic final push to defeat whichever powerful creature or sinister scheme the Darkness has unleashed upon the world!

Double-sided Expedition Ship and Wilderness Encounter Boards are used when your ship or camp is attacked by Enemies. Each of the three new Board types is double-sided, with unique content for Viking and Conquistador play. The Expedition Ship Board is a tactical Game Board for fighting off Enemies that attack your Ship and crew at sea, allowing you to move around the deck of the ship repelling boarders and protecting key areas of the ship and crew. This board features a Viking Long Ship on one side and a Spanish Tall Ship on the other. The Wilderness Encounter Board is a tactical Game Board for having battles on land as your Heroes trek through the uncharted territory on your journeys. It can also represent your Expedition Camp being attacked by Enemies! This board features a Snowy Forest on one side and Jungle Pathways on the reverse. The Campaign Map Board is a strategic Game Board for playing out the Campaign Rounds between Missions, allowing your Heroes to sail the seas on your Expedition Ship and make landfall to seek out Adventure Locations, progressing the story and launching narrative Missions as you explore the region. This board features an icy Norse Coast region on one side and a Jungle Island Chain on the reverse.

Two new Enemy types are included: Deep Stalkers are terrifying fish-men that climb aboard ships that stray into their oceanic domain, kidnapping the crew for their dark feedings. Leviathan Tentacles are the long, squid-like tentacles of a massive Leviathan, that rise up from the deep to attack Heroes at sea, or those that linger too close to the coastlines.

A set of Custom dice are included for dynamic travel around the Campaign Map, as well as for use in some Expedition Hazards and Camp Site Events. These Expedition Dice are marked with special Icons for Marching, Sailing, and Navigation, and determine how and where the Expedition can move during each Campaign Round.
In addition, the set contains all of the cards, rules and counters needed for Campaign play, with Camp Site Upgrades, Expedition Ship Upgrades, Plot Twists, Campaign Objectives, Story Threads, Enemy Lists, Expedition Hazard Charts for Land and for Sea, and 8 new Missions, to keep things exciting and ever-changing as you progress through the interactive story!

-description from Kickstarter campaign
categories: Adventure, Expansion for Base-game, Fantasy, Fighting, Horror, Miniatures
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Modular Board, Role Playing, Variable Player Powers

name: The Hare and the Tortoise, the Fox and the Snail
description:
The objective of the game is to be the first to reach the end of the track (106 spaces). Players choose to be either a hare, a tortoise, a fox, or a snail. Each animal has a custom dice. The tortoise and snail each uses a normal six-sided dice. The hare's dice has three rests and three sevens. The fox's dices has two rests, two sevens, a ten, and a minus three.

—user summary
mechanics: Different Dice Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Battle of Shanggao
description: An wargame on the Battle of Shanggao in 1941 during the Second Sino-Japanese War. The fifth game of Kilovolt Design's "Mini War" series.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Quizduell Master
description: The most popular quiz app in Germany can now be played as a board game at master level! Quizduell Master allows up to six players to compete simultaneously at the gaming table with over 1,800 trivia questions of 3 difficulty levels. Players can customize the game to play a traditional quiz duel, play in teams, or compete in tournament mode.

name: Hot Rod Grand Prix
description: Gotta Go Fast! Race to the finish with up to four players. Roll the dice and move along the track but watch out for the hazards. If you land on a hazard you must abide by its instructions whether they're favorable or not. The first player to reach the final square wins!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Half-Pint Heroes: Trinkspiel
description: Mini extension: It contains 7 playing cards printed on both sides and a cover card with information on where the English rule can be downloaded. The German rule is included.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor
mechanics: Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trick-taking

name: You Are Probably the Criminal
description:
In You Are Probably the Criminal, a.k.a. あなたがたぶん犯人です, you and the other players are suspects in a murder case. Heartless as it might sound, who is actually guilty of the crime doesn't matter because in the end all that matters is who is the most suspicious among you!

The criminal search relies on four elements — weapon, motive, place, time — and evidence cards left by the actual criminal is placed face down in the center of the table. Each player also receives a confession card for each of these four elements, and sometimes a confession card will match the evidence card.

On your turn, you can make a statement based on the confession cards you hold or you can investigate an evidence card by revealing a confession card you hold. If you make a statement that matches the evidence, you'll be more suspicious, so you might prefer to investigate — but the fewer statements you make, the more suspicion points you gain at turn's end, so you can't only investigate. Perhaps you can forge evidence to throw off suspicion?

In the end, the player with the most suspicion points loses the game and is arrested.

name: Generation Y: Anders Leben! Anders Arbeiten! Anders spielen!
description:
Generation Y is a new social game with a twist - you will use your smartphones and their features as playing field.


You are playing around the table with your smartphones
The game arena is online. A messenger-app of your choosing
Challenge yourself in over 45 tasks
Knowledge, talent, creativity and humour will bring you victory


Share your experiences and get a viral hit

—description from the publisher

Generation Y ist ein brandneues Gesellschaftsspiel mit einem innovativen Spielprinzip - ihr nutzt euer Smartphone und dessen unzählige Funktionen als elektronisches Spielinstrument.


Gespielt wird am heimischen Tisch mit eurem Smartphone
Die Spielarena ist online. Eine beliebige Messenger-App
In über 45 Aufgaben fordert ihr euch gegenseitig heraus
Wissen, Talent, Kreativität und Humor bringen euch den Sieg
Teilt eure Spielerlebnisse und landet einen viralen Hit


—description from the publisher (German)

name: Show Me The Monet
description:
Think Go Fish, with a classical art theme and deeper strategy.

To start the game, players are dealt four cards face down. The remaining cards are placed face down into a draw pile. On a player's turn, they ask another player if they have an artist card (e.g do you have a piece by Van Gogh?). The player they're asking then has two options. They can either say yes and give the other player their Van Gogh cards, or say no, either truthfully or in an attempt to bluff. As this game involves bluffing, if a player does not believe their opponent is telling the truth when they say they do not have a card by the named artist, they can challenge their opponent. If their opponent did have any cards by the named artist, the opponent loses a turn and has to give all cards by the named artist to the person who challenged them, and the person who challenged them takes another turn. If the challenge fails, the person who made the challenge must give the person they challenged all their cards by the named artist and the turn then passes to the left.

When a player builds a complete collection (four cards by the same artist, by artists from the same country, in the same genre, or by female artists), they place those cards on the table face up, these cards form your collection. If when doing this a player runs out of cards in their hand, they draw four new cards from the draw pile. Play continues until the draw pile is empty and all cards are placed into collections, or no more collections can be formed from the cards left in player's hands.

At the end of the game, players add up the value of their collection, taking into account any end game and wild card bonuses. The player who has the most expensive collection wins the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Set Collection, Trading

name: KFC's Assano
description:
The game contains cards with numbers and 'actions' printed on them, in several colors plus a few jokers.

The purpose of the game is to get rid of your own hand cards first. To do this, when it's your turn, you try to match on of your own cards with the color or symbol of the last played card. Jokers are always valid to play, if you have them. If you can't match, you draw a card from a shared draw pile. If you can match that card, you can instantly play it.

The game-box contains 36 card, divided as follows:

3 Cards with the rules, in Dutch, English and French.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color yellow.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color blue.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color green.
7 Cards with number 1-5, plus 1 sleep (skip turn) and 1 turn (reverse direction) card, in the color red.
5 Card with additional actions, 2 "take-2" cards, 3 "change color" card, in the color black.


This game resembles Crazy Eights / UNO, but with some the "take that" cards, but not all.

This game was published as part of a promotional campaign for the KFC restaurant group.

—user summary

name: Totes Emosh
description:
Totes Emosh is basically charades with your face. You pick a card, pull the face on the card and everyone else has to guess which face you’re pulling. The player with the roundest head starts. As soon as they pull the face anyone else can shout out a guess, using the key cards to see the face numbers. Guessers can’t try again until at least one other player has had a go. No shouting “1, 2, 3, 4, 5...” you cheats. Whoever shouts out the right number wins the card. Then it’s their turn to pull a face. When all the faces have been pulled, count your cards. Most cards wins... obvs!

—description from the publisher

name: Numbalee
description:
Fast-thinking, 13 fun compact games of chance and skill for all the Family to improve players skills in addition, subtraction, multiplication and division. Players are encouraged to verbally explain their sum, and challenge errors.

Numbalee can be played anywhere with a table or flat surface. It is packaged in a sturdy canvas bag making it easy to travel with and take on holiday.
mechanics: Connections, Hand Management, Player Judge, Speed Matching, Tile Placement

name: Anastasia Adventure Game
description:
Travel around the board, and try to find the Locket, the Royal Crown and the Music box discs to put on your passport. Avoid the evil forces of Rasputin and the Minions, or they’ll take one of your discs!

Be the first to get all three discs and move HOME, and you will prove that Anya is really Anastasia, Princess of Imperial Russia!
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Playmobil: Dragon Fight
description:
The box contains a total of 32 cards, namely:

24 warrior cards
4 joker cards (one for each symbol/strength)
4 rule cards


In Playmobil Dragon Fight players play cards to win tricks. Unlike other trump card games, this game uses four different suits, from which the player can choose to play their card for. Every card has four symbols/strengths, these are: Tactic, Attack, Defense and Range.

At the start of the game, the warrior cards are shuffled and all are dealt among the players as equally as possible. Every player gets one joker card, the remaining joker cards are removed from the game. After receiving their cards, players put them -face down- in front of them.

The starting player takes the top card from his deck and pick one of the four symbols to play. They call out both the symbol and the point value. Then the other players take the top card of their decks and call out the point value for the chosen symbol and show their cards to prove their claims. The player with the highest point value in the chosen strength wins the trick and places all cards -face down- at the bottom of their stack. The game continues until a single player owns all the cards.

Jokers can be used to win a trick, they always have the highest point value. But they can only be played at beginning of the turn or if the corresponding symbol has been called out.

—user summary
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Wargame

name: Shuffle: Star Wars Rebels
description:
“The Empire are hunting down the Rebels who are hiding out across planet Lothal.”

The aim of the game is to capture and control Territories, by winning battles as the Rebels or as the Empire. The character card(s) played with the highest total power score capture the Territory to win a round. Matching skills with the Territory's properties increases the total power score.

The first in a 2-player or 2-team game to capture four Territories wins the game.

—user summary
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Science Fiction
mechanics: Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Skojarzenia
description:
Each player or team starts at a corner of the board and movies along a track to the center. Players, in turns, draw cards containing phrases belonging to various categories and then they either pantomime or make drawings to indicate the phrase that matches the color of the spot they are on. A timer keeps every turn short.

Each player or team mark their score on the board. The first team to get to the centre spot on the board win the game.

The game contains 2100 phrases on 300 cards.

—user summary
mechanics: Acting, Action Timer, Line Drawing, Team-Based Game

name: Tic Tac Tics
description: Tic-tac-toe on 5x5 grid. Three in a row is called a run. Four in a row gets an extra run and five in a row gets extra three runs. When the grid is filled, the difference between the winner and the loser is called the net run. Play then continues to a new sheet. First player to score 11 net runs wins.

name: TWO FREAKIN SWORDS
description:
TWO FREAKIN SWORDS is a card game with deck construction, role playing elements (with characters carrying over between games and perma-death), and a rock-paper-scissors mechanism. Players create characters, customize decks of 40 cards, and go back and forth against opponents in 1 vs 1 games, 3+ player rumbles, and 4+ player team games.

Each deck comes with 10 cards of 4 different types:
Defending/Block
Defending/Parry
Attacking/Strike
Attacking/Fake

Before the game, players must fill out a character sheet if they haven't already. They can then customize and organize their decks, keeping the number of cards in the deck at 40 and a minimum of 8 of each type of card. If not everyone has a custom deck, players must instead draw cards from a single pile of 80 cards (two standard decks shuffled together).

All players then place an aggression coin by their right arm and draw 4 cards from their (or the community's) deck. Players then place the card they want to play with the indicator side (Defending/Attacking) facing up. They then decide what they want to do in response to their opponent(s) cards. Once everyone has their cards down, players flip their cards over and compare each hand independently (Player A's right hand vs Player B's and vice versa).

The goal is to get enough hits on your opponent to knock them out of the game (a new character can take 5 hits before dying), tearing up their character sheet in the process and (if you win) adding +1 hit point to your character for the next game you play. The game ends when the last player (or team, in a team game) is left standing.
mechanics: Deck Construction, Open Drafting, Passed Action Token, Player Elimination, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking, Variable Phase Order

name: E gewinnt
description:
E gewinnt is a game about learning and understanding e mobility.

E gewinnt is at its core a roll and move game with the goal of being the fastest to race a across a map of Germany and parts of its neighbors.

Players take turns driving across the map by rolling a fast red die showing higher numbers or a slow blue die with lower numbers, both of which consume different amounts of power from the car's batteries.

Players need to manage the different power consumption in order to preserve precious battery power. Fast and slow charging stations for the vehicles are placed randomly on the map as players advance towards their target. Event cards are drawn each time you make charging stop.

While playing, the game tries to educate the players about electronic mobility.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Donald Duck in Disneyland
description:
Game for up to 6 players.
Each player chooses a Disney character, rolls the die and moves in the direction of the yellow arrow. If the arrow has a number, look in the rules to see what the player must do.

Artwork theme: Disney's Peter Pan movie

First one that reaches Cinderella's castle, wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Events, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Remigio, lungo viaggio alla ricerca della mamma
description:
The players play the role of Remigio, a child in search of his mother. They will have to reach various places on the map where they can discover clues that will lead them to discover the identity of their mother, hidden at the beginning of the game in a secret place. In the various places visited they will be able to acquire objects that will allow them to move faster, to be the first to discover the identity of their mother and thus win the game.
The game is evidently inspired by the cartoon television series Remi, broadcast in Italy for the first time in 1979

name: Love to Hate
description:
Warning: this game may stoke divisions! In Love to Hate from Ridley's Games, you'll find out just how well you actually know your friends & family. And the player who knows the others the best wins.

On a scale from Love to Hate, can you guess what your boyfriend thinks about pineapple on pizza or clowns? How about your sister's feelings about ABBA or being tickled? Find out in this hilarious party game filled with highly divisive subject cards!

Featuring topics and themes including pop culture, pet peeves, and people, players will take turns picking a card while the others guess how that player feels about it using voting cards. With the feelings ranging from 'Love' and 'Like' to 'Ehhh', 'Nope,' and 'Hate', each round will sure to be a conversation starter!

Perfect to play with family or a group of friends, the game is suitable for ages 8+, 3 to 8 players and has an average 20 minutes gameplay.

—description from the publisher

name: Alphabetizing
description:
Players attempt to fill columns with words in alphabetical order from top to bottom. Players first start by lacing five randomly chosen words, face down, to place onto the board in the red center positions. These words may never be moved, and determine what words can go above and below them on the board.

For example, if a red word is “Freeze”, all words placed above must come before freeze alphabetically. All words below it must come after alphabetically.

After these words are placed, players take turns picking from face down cards that contain other words, and place them in such a way that they can successfully fill a column. There are also blank cards which act as wild cards and 10 point bonus cards which just give a player a point bonus.

If a player completes a column, they get bonus points. Any player who draws a word that cannot go on the board loses points. Each player may also once per game move a blue space word to make room for s word they have drawn. Player with the most points when the game is over is the winner.

—user summary

name: I Want the Truth!
description:
Players are given a category and three potential facts. They score points by identifying the correct fact. A correct answer scores 1 point, and the first player to 15 points wins.

—user summary

name: Das große Baustellenspiel
description:
We help on the construction site! Three tasks are on the table, everyone has three construction vehicles of one color. When it's your turn, you roll the dice - for a tool, you take it from the supply or from a fellow player, for a question mark, you take it only from the supply. If you have two matching tools for a task, you hand them over and place a construction vehicle on this section of the picture, also from another section. If the required number of vehicles - also several of a player - is in the section, you put a brick of your color into the house, you take the vehicle(s) back. When all tasks are completed, the player with the most bricks in the house wins.

—user summary

name: Mazica Party
description:
Mazica Party is a novel trading card game published by toy company Takara Tomy.

Cards in this game are scratch cards which can be scartched to get hidden information such as attributes, effects and rarity. Players build 12-to-20-card decks with card books, like Mage Wars Arena.
Players fight with monster cards using a Rock-Paper-Scissors mechanism, and the player who defeat all opponent monsters will win the game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Deck Construction, Hand Management, Rock-Paper-Scissors

name: French Tour
description:
The country of France has not finished surprising you! 66 illustrated themes: places full of history, dreamy landscapes, monuments, curiosities... From the caves of Lascaux to the forest of Brocéliande, Broceliande forest, surprises and wonders, so many invitations to discover France with your family. A mix of « mistigri » and « search and find » game.

The game is in two phases. In the first phase, the players discard pairs of cards from their hands like in the old maid game. The player win 2 points for each pairs played. In the second phase is a find and search using the pairs of cards. If the player find the right spot of the monument on the map, he will win 1 point.

The player with the most points wins.

name: Vysočina: otázky a odpovědi
description:
The new knowledge family game contains 900 questions about Vysočina region Czech republic.

The questions are divided into four sections, and if you do not know the correct answer, you can help yourself by choosing from three options.

name: Get Bit! Feeding Frenzy: The Sharkspansion
description:
Get Bit! Feeding Frenzy: The Sharkspansion expands Get Bit! in two ways:

• Item cards: Players can use items that have been lost at sea to get away from the shark — or at least get away from the other players.

• Shark cards: Instead of mindlessly chomping on the last swimmer in the line, the shark is now a playable character. Can you outthink the others to keep your belly full?
categories: Animals, Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Hand Management, Race, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Battle of the Sexes
description:
Battle of the Sexes has 660 questions (220 cards) split between male and female cards. For every question your team answers correctly, a trophy is moved closer to your team's Winner's Circle. Earn three trophies to win.

Each team can use Challenge Tokens. These Tokens could either propel you to an easy victory, or send you backwards. If your team doesn't know the answer to question, but you think the other team doesn’t know the answer either, you can throw the question back at them by playing one of your challenge tokens. If they answer incorrectly, move the trophy towards your side of the board. If they answer correctly, move the trophy towards their side of the board. Each team only has 3 Challenge Tokens.

name: Regime Rumble: Core Game
description:
Welcome to the year 4057

The world is overpopulated and cloning has been banned from day-to-day use. The De'Graw corporation has managed to obtain an entertainment license under global code 456-8. This allows the use of cloning to subdue mass unrest. The corporation has begun a televised sensation, Regime Rumble! Ever wonder who was the best in politics, science, or pop culture? What would happen when these personalities from around the world meet to duke it out? Well now you can find out every Saturday morning! Watch as famous personalities from around the world are defeated and cloned again and returned to the arena. Unfortunately, the more frequently they are cloned the more the copies begin to degrade.

Smash your friends in a fast paced game of futuristic clone combat. The RR core box has everything you need to get started and play! (Just add a LOT of dice)

Regime Rumble consists of 1-2 miniatures per side (when playing with 4 players) and is played on a 2'×2' area. Gameplay and combat is based on a simple D6 dice pool mechanic that is fast to learn and fun to play.

Players will set about choosing their regimes from available clones and using their cards to perform various special actions and abilities. At the heart of RR is a system of conspiracy cards that allow players to work together to bluff and trick their opponents, to the victor goes the crown!

—description from the publisher

name: LasseMajas detektivbyrå: Pusseldeckarspelet
description: In the Puzzle Detective game, you must solve crimes by jigsawing different clues. When you get to a crime scene, you have to pull a puzzle piece with stolen goods from the bag. This is your first clue. You put the stolen goods in front of you and hurry on to the next crime scene. You can find the thief in the line of suspects by dragging event cards on your way between the various crime scenes. When you find the thief, you puzzle the thief together with the stolen goods. You need a thief and at least two stolen items of the same color to finish the game. For now, you should quickly get to the right crime scene and get the last clue to complete your investigation. The one who first has a complete chain of evidence of puzzle pieces in front of him; a thief + at least two stolen goods + a crime scene in the same suit are the winners of the game!

name: Ü40 Party Quiz
description:
A quiz game for people 40 and over wanting to test their knowledge about trendy things from those times.

One player after the other is the quizmaster and asks a question from the card.
All other player are allowed to answer simultaneously.
Whoever answers five questions correctly first wins.
mechanics: Simultaneous Action Selection, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Flanks of Gettysburg: Little Round Top, Culp's Hill – July 1863
description:
Flanks of Gettysburg is a two, two-player games on a company level, simulating the two brigade sized flank attacks on Little Round Top and Culp’s Hill on July 2, 1863. Each assault is a separate game based on a chit-pull system that can be completed in several hours. Historically the Union bested rebel forces on both flanks because it fed enough reinforcements in to stem the gray tide But that is not to say that the rebels don’t stand a chance. They do.

FOG uses a chit pull system similar to John Poniske’s Ball’ Bluff and Belmont designs. Both games follow similar rules applying unique fire and movement, melee and order assignment. These are simple, rapid playing approaches to complex situations. FOG clocks in at three to three and a half hours per game and provides high solitaire capability.

The battles of Culp’s Hill and Little Roundtop demonstrated Lee’s determination to attack and envelop the Union Army of the Potomac. FOG does not attempt to recreate either grand assault in full, rather it presents the desperate three-hour finale that took place on the extreme ends in both cases These were the two instances when Lee came closest to claiming a Gettysburg breakthrough.
Culp’s Hill offers the Union prepared defensive positions but the liability of having reinforcements report to General Greene before joining the line. Little Round Top introduces artillery and sharpshooters and challenges players to exit or block the exit of Rebel forces between Little and Big Round Tops.

Each game offers a beautiful Rick Barber map and a low counter mix. Regimental draw chits allow companies to move, volley fire or melee at the player’s discretion. The ground over which the Confederates must assault is rough and at times movement under fire can be distressingly slow. Casualties mount rapidly until the rebels are close enough to exact revenge.

–Description from the publisher
mechanics: Chit-Pull System, Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: Regime Rumble: Pax Britannica Expansion
description: This expansion adds 4 British leader miniatures (Margaret Thatcher, Winston Churchill, Henry VIII, and Elizabeth II), 1 corgi miniature, and 4 associated Clone Cards to the base game. The miniatures are supplied unassembled and unpainted.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Miniatures, Political, Science Fiction, Wargame

name: Cat & Mouse
description:
Two player game where a battery operated wheel of cheese has two colors of mice pop up in the air in a particular sequence.

Each player gets a plastic cat holding a garbage bin that opens with a trigger. The goal is to catch the most mice of either color, or the most of a particular color in the air to win.

name: Arde ConSEXuate
description:
Arde ConSEXuate is a fun, adult game that challenges you to talk about sex.

The deck is placed face down in the center of the table. The most HOT player begins and from there to the left of him he will continue the round. The starting player picks up a card from the deck, reads it aloud and performs the action / command. If he complies with this card, it remains in his power, in the event that he does not comply, he will have to have a drink or make a garment that the group designates.

Who first manages to get to keep 5 cards wins.
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Trivia

name: אלפא (Alpha)
description:
In Alpha, players try to lose their cards as quickly as possible, by matching colours or Hebrew letters. Some power cards mix up the gameplay to add some strategy.

—user summary
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching, Take That

name: You Think You Know Me?
description:
Do your friends know what your dream holiday destination is or which celebrity would you choose to dine with?

Test them by offering them a question and a set of alternatives and let them answer with answering cards. All players in majority group win a card and first to 5 cards wins!

name: Even Monsters Get Spooked
description:
A Halloween themed card game where you draft spooky creatures into your hand, get them hopped on as much candyy as possible, to make them as scary as all get out, in order to spook your opponents into submission.

The player who takes 3 tricks, wins.

name: Madison Avenue: Now You Are In The Ad Game
description:
In this fast paced, easy to play game that replicates the real world of advertising agencies. YOU are an ad agency president charged with getting more and bigger accounts.

As you go around the board, you will hire staff and pit them against your (hopefully inferior) competitors to pitch and WIN accounts!

It is that simple ... HIRE STAFF and PItch ACCOUNTS. But, Oh, what problems you will experience along the way! Can YOU manage your way to success in the glamorous world of advertising? Or will you be just another "also-ran". It is time to find out!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Constrained Bidding, Kill Steal, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Welcome to Real Vegas
description: Bring home the excitement of a Las Vegas casino in a board game. Players work their way around the board as a group and play all the great casino games including Poker, Blackjack, Roulette and Craps. The winner is the player who has the most money when the first person crosses the finish line.

name: Först i boet!
description:
A simple game with Disney's squirrels Chip ´n´ Dale where the first in the squirrels nest wins. But you have to get the number in the next square with the dice to move to that square.

The game is included in the comic book "Musse Pigg & C:o", No. 9, September 1983 (Musse Pigg is the swedish name for Mickey Mouse).

name: Opposite of Wellness
description:
Improve your wellness one opposite at a time.

Contents: 9 Category/Topic cards.

Players will be dealt a card which determines 3 categories as areas of wellness they have to improve.

Each round a topic and two categories will be determined.

Players will answer the question:

What is the [CATEGORY] opposite of [TOPIC]?

Players will reveal their answers in turns. If a player wrote your exact answer, you must pass for the round. Then players must vote for the best answer. Players will win points by voting for the same player, and for being the most voted on a category of their area of wellness. Then they repeat for the opposite category.

When all 8 topics are completed, game ends and the player with the highest score wins.

name: Kapteeni Koukun Aarre
description:
The goal of this Disney licensed game is the same as in basic memory that you have to find matching pairs around the board and who finds the most wins the game. Moving happens by rolling the dice and you can move any of the three characters on the board. You get to see the tile that you land on and one any other tile to see if they match. If they do you get to roll again. The game lasts until all pairs have been found. The player with the most pairs wins the game.

—user summary

Hälytys, hälytys! Kapteeni Koukku ei löydä aarrettaan. Liity kapteenin joukkoihin ja auta häntä löytämään kadonnut aarre. Merirosvojenkin muisti reistailee joskus, mutta ehkä sinä voit auttaa heitä. Kyllä he jonnekin tänne piilottivat sen, mutta minne? Pärjätäksesi tarvitset hieman onnea, hyvän muistin ja merirosvon oveluutta. Kaikki mukaan jännittävälle aarrejahdille!

—description from the back of the box

name: Caveosaurus Dinos
description:
A rampaging herd of dinosaurs are circling a peaceful cave village. Located far out in the dusty desert plains, the village's only defence against the prehistoric invaders are their very own Clyde, Charlie, Chester & Chuck. Rallying together throughout the night, can the brave team chase off the Caveosaurus Dinos?

A fast paced co-operative card game for 1 to 4 players with a game length of 15 minutes. On a players turn they will draw two cards from the deck and will choose to play one and discard the other. Cards will allow a players caveman to move around the village circle of caves, send in an enemy dino, rotate the attack spear or hopefully chase off a dino.

Once a day and night has been played the team of cavemen can add up their total score for points awarded for chasing dinos, caves protected and if they returned to their home caves.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Area Movement, Cooperative Game, Hand Management

name: Spin Fighters
description:
Spin Fighters were die-cast metal top toys that were manufactured by Bandai in China in the mid 1990s (1993-1997).

The Spin Fighters tops were loaded into Launchers (Later, called "Power Launchers"), which were then tightly wound by fingertip, and subsequently released into the Spin Fighters Battle Arena (or, onto a flat surface). The tops battled (hitting against each other) until the last top spinning was the winner.

Spin Fighters tops were ~1 inch across, came in black and gold colors, and bore a prismatic sticker featuring a character from a TV show or video game. Usually, the black tops represented the "Bad Guys" and the gold tops represented the "Good Guys." Spin Fighters were sold two to a package: one gold and one black spin fighter. Power Launchers and Battle Arenas were available separately or bundled. Spin Fighters tops can be disassembled and worn on jackets, shirts, and hats, through any small button hole.

Production of Spin Fighter ceased around 1997. They are widely seen to be the forerunner to Beyblade, which began production in 1997.

Spin Fighters series included: World Wrestling Federation (WWF), Saban's Mighty Morphin Power Rangers, and Capcom's Street Fighter.

name: Bear Stare Down: Scout Expansion
description:
Adds 20 new bear, action, forest, and diffuse cards as well as adding two more players to Bear Stare Down base game and upgraded forest cards.

Also adds:

3 KS exclusive cards:
Care Bear - This tender hearted bear adds a life back
Share Bears - both you and your opponent lose a life
Dare Bear - Do a Dare and save your life

20 scouting theme cards: Handy Pocket Knife, Smores, First Aid Kit, Bear Bag, Compass, Legendary Scare Bear, etc.

name: North Pole to Manhattan: The Elf Game
description:
Roll and move Buddy the Elf from the North Pole to Manhattan. Make sure to spread Christmas cheer and don’t eat the yellow snow!

This game has 2-4 players play as Buddy the elf racing to find their dad in Manhattan. Straight roll and move game with events on the board that may move you forward or backwards (many backwards are -20 spaces). First player to the North Pole wins.

—user summary

name: Two Lies & a Truth
description:
Can you tell truth from lies?
In this twisted take on the original game, you’ll have to find the truth...rather than the lie. It’s harder than you think. And that’s a fact. Or an alternative fact. Or both.

From history to humor, politics to performers. No lies too big. No truths too real. It's the perfect game for the post-fact world.

On a player turn, the pick a card and read it out loud. Other players guess which one of the three statements is true. If correct, they earn points otherwise lost points. Most points at a predetermine end wins.

200ish lies, 100ish truths

-description from publisher's website

name: Sparspel
description:
Game released by the grocery store chain “Spar”.
Basic roll & move game.

name: Sweet Existence: Pleasant Nonsense
description: In the Pleasant Nonsense expansion pack for the Sweet Existence game, a few things have changed from the Sweet Existence game. Instead of Existence Squares, you’ll have Nonsense Squares that are dreams with unique powers. Perishing is no more. The Consciousness Persists Square is hiding in your Nonsense Squares and prevents you from dreaming so you can’t win. Action Squares multiply chances of mishaps, while Sucrose Sweet Disks make for a sweeter victory. Each game includes 1 of 3 possible mysterious object tokens to track the Active Being. The first being to pay for all 3 Nonsense Squares in front of them wins! It's a marvelous, light-strategy party game for current and budding Strange Planet fans ages 13 and up. —description from the publisher
mechanics: Action/Event, Alliances, Memory, Passed Action Token

name: Escape Adventures: Von Wikingern und Runenmagie
description: Family friendly escape game in a viking age setting. The story driven game includes solving puzzles as well as some deductive skills and offers a scoring at the end based in the age of the group and the used hints.

name: Chiseled: Critic Promo Card
description:
Originally available as part of Pack A from the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign.

Text says:

+ 6 if your final trash pile contains fewer cards than your sculpture.

name: MimocirQ
description:
Greatly inspired by the Cirque du Soleil imagery, MimocirQ brings you irresistable cards featuring a cast of zany characters in dazzling colours!

To collect the most sets of three identical cards, you will need to make the facial expression of body position shown on the wanted card.

Sounds easy? Try it and see... without bursting into laughing.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Humor, Party Game

name: Bear Stare Down: Parks Expansion
description: This Parks themed expansion includes 20 cards that can be used to expand your Bear Stare Down game to add 2 more players. Simply add this expansion to the base deck.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Humor

name: Freedom Five: 2021 Dice Tower Bystander Cards
description:
These were released as a pack of 5 promo cards for the Dice Tower 2021 Kickstarter campaign. The card pack includes 5 bystanders named Ella Ampongan, Roy Cannaday, Stella Jahja, Timm Metiver, and Tom Vasel.

Each card provides unique rewards and penalties to add to your game.

name: Host Your Own Escape Room
description:
Are you ready to embark on a code-cracking challenge? You and your guests have been invited to an exclusive launch party at the London art gallery Grafix. As you admire the artwork, the lights suddenly go off and you find yourself mysteriously trapped inside with no way out. One of the galleries most celebrated artists has been taken hostage and you have just 60 minutes to identify their location and rescue them before it's too late. Ideal for escape room novices, the difficulty level of this escape room game is moderate. Great for families or groups of friends looking for a fun evening of entertainment- no knowledge of London needed!

—description from the publisher

name: Dino Deck
description:
Taken from back of the box:

Dino-Deck contains 72 cards with 12 colorful dinosaur characters each with 5 symbols about their size, what they ate, and how they walked. Friendly Rex, Claus, Study, Puny, Thor, Lance, Billy, Spike, Packy, Heat Wave, Rolo, and Sarah invite you to play their 5 action-packed card games and learn about dinosaurs.

5 Action-Packed Games:

Meateaters: An exciting game of matching symbols and collecting meat eating dinosaurs!

Dino-Match: Ask your friend for a dinosaur and see if it matches one of yours. If it does -- ask again. When you are out of cards, you win!

Dino-Play: A new fast-paced game of matching card colors and dinosaurs. You get a chance to play 2 cards in 1 turn!

Collect-A-Saurus: A real strategy game. Which card do you choose from your friends' pattern to finish your pattern? Score 100 points and win!

Recall-A-Saurus: How's your memory? This game tests your memory of where the dinosaurs are in a 25 card pattern!"

name: Chonky Donkey
description: Each player in Chonky Donkey has a hand of question cards. In a round, the active player draws a card from the answer deck and reads it out loud. Each other player in turn chooses a question card from their hand and reads it, after which the active player must give their answer without laughing. If the active player succeeds in keeping a straight face, they keep their answer card as a point; otherwise they give it to the person whose question made them break. Play until someone collects the required number of points to win.

name: Top Trumps: Indiana Jones Mini-Game
description:
This 8-card Top Trumps set plays the same as the original game but with only two players. It comes with the following cards:


How to Play a 2-player mini game of Top Trumps using six cards



Indiana Jones
Colonel Dovchenko
Irina Spalko
Marion Ravenwood (1957)
Mutt Williams
Ugha Warrior



Card advertising 4 Top Trumps: Star Wars titles and a "Kingdom of the Crystal Skull" movie magazine.


—user summary
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Inundo
description:
Players use developmental measures in the form of different cards to protect houses on a map against flooding.

Each round you gain income to pay for these measures and new cards. On top of that, there is an event card affecting all players. At the end of each round different houses along the rivers are flooded in certain patterns that are determined by dice roll. Every house that wasn't protected by you specifically (multiple people can protect the same house) gives you one negative point.

After 6 rounds you want to be the person with the least amount of negative points. Additionally, there are win conditions for having ecological and aesthetic points on your measure cards. Finally, after the end of the main game every player gives a speech about their protection efforts. Everyone then votes on the best speech, which is the third component for determining who wins the game.
mechanics: Acting, Bingo, Events, Solo / Solitaire Game

name: North Idaho-opoly
description:
An unofficial Monopoly-style game featuring Idaho Panhandle lakes, state parks, outdoor recreation destinations, and a couple mines and fairs, as properties, and similar topics on random event cards.

The remainder of the game's not specific to Idaho in any way - metal playing pieces (a hand, a smile, a heart, a dog, a pretzel, and a shoe), green and red plastic houses and hotels, and "dollars" for keeping track of how long you must suffer.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Pigskin Football
description:
The wildest, grittiest & most extreme 2 player football board game that plays in an hour. Pigskin uses a combination of set collection, dice rolling, action selection & hand management to bring a fresh and fun way to play out a 2-player game of American football.

Pigskin has all the stats of an actual football game baked into the mechanics, including penalties, completions, yards gained, sacks, turnovers and scoring to bring you the most realistic football board game on the market that plays in about an hour.

The game uses a "mean, muscular pig player" theme with fabulous artwork on the cards as well as a beautifully designed board (football field) to really allow players to get immersed into the excitement.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: El Alamein: Kickstarter Promo Cards
description:
This is a promotional pack of cards released for El Alamein as part of the Kickstarter.

It contains 4 cards:

P04 - Airfield
P06 - Das Boat
34A - Minsk
35A - Rostov

name: MITRYS
description:
Mitrys is a fantasy adventure game based on the Dual Realm Universe (Mitrys Trilogy). Players take role of one of the heroes: Shaman, Assassin, Druid or Warrior. They compete with each other using characters' various advantages.

A player wins, when they completes the Mission from the Mystery Card.

During the game many adventures awaits: treasures, friends and foes. The battles are resolved by rolling the dice. Players will gain experience and will improve their statistics. Collecting spells, items, acquiring companions or learning new skills is also a thing. Sometimes it can pay off to make a small alliance or sabotage the actions of other players. No gameplay is the same. You don't have to read the trilogy to be able to play, but knowing the plot and atmosphere of the universe doubles the pleasure :)
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Variable Player Powers

name: Ukrainian Nightmare: Objective Kharkiv 2021
description:
After years of quasi-peace since 2016, the Donetsk and Luhansk separatist armies that Russia supported and built-up launched another attack with the aim of seizing more territory. It was hoped to occupy the city of Kharkov and Dnipro but even more modest gains would have political and military value, in addi-tion, further destabilize the Ukrainian government.
Both sides had similar military strength with 35,000 front line troops manning the fortified front lines. The DPA and LNR, 914 AFVs, 720 artillery guns, 202 rocket artillery between the two pro-Russian forces. Each had around 200 tanks. Among these were at least 2100 Russian forces to assist. However, Putin also had placed elements from the 3rd Motorized Division along the northern border from its 20th Army and the 150th Division not far near the Crimea. The 150th was quite strong with two tank regiments and two mechanized infantry regiments. Either or both, if used, would be a decisive in seizing more Ukrainian territory.
The Ukrainian forces were capable and equal in most aspects, especially their elite units that proved their worth in 2014 and 2015. The front lines were vintage WW1 with trench lines and fortified areas along the main avenues of approach. Many of the Ukrainian units were mainly reinforced battalion strength de-spite their regimental or brigade designation. In fact, many "bri-gades" only had one or two battalions.
While they had many more AFVs, many needed refitting or repaired as with much of their equipment. The one new weapon was the American Javelin AT. Ukraine had 47 launchers and 360 missiles which could be used against armor and structures. They also had 12 Turkish Bayraktar UAV for reconnaissance.
As in previous battles, both fought with tenacity and the tipping point was always whether the Russians would send in their units, which they did in 2014, 2015. The other potential was whether the Americans also send in help from Poland.
With both sides facing each other since 2016 in a quasi-peace, both the DPA and LNR forces had built up and trained their forces with Russian aid. The Ukrainians also built up forces and created a fortified line along main avenues of advance. Finally, sometime in 2020, Putin decided to try to get a larger section of the Ukraine in 2021. The offensive would be limited.

Designed by Perry Moore in 2020, this game seems prophetic on the battle of Kharkiv in Feb to May 2022. along with the use of Javelins and supply issues for the Russian army.

name: Donetsk!: Ukrainian Inferno at Ilovaisk – August 2014
description: Ukrainian Inferno is a game on the near success of the Ukrainian forces during August, 2014. In July, these forces had cut up and isolated many of the pro-Russian forces called the DPA who were fully supported by Russia. The Ukrainian forces were in a near win position after months of fighting, having cut the main arteries for supply used by the DPA. While it looked promising, there remained one main highway used by the DPA that supplied those forces in and around Donetsk, a large urban-like area they controlled.

name: 王宮の飾り絵師 (Painter in the Royal Palace)
description:
In 王宮の飾り絵師 (Ōkyū No Kazari Eshi), roughly translated as Royal Palace Decorative Painter, the players are each painters who have been hired by the royal family to paint the Monochrome Palace.

Each player receives a die showing different colors and one showing different numbers. The players also get a sheet which shows the outline of a painting which they will be coloring in during the game.

On a turn, the players simultaneously choose the faces for their dice and then reveal. Beginning with players who chose the smaller number, players can color in sections on their sheet corresponding to the number and color chosen as their dice values. However, as the resolution proceeds to higher valued die, you will not be able to fill in colors that were chosen by players with lower numbers, and other similar concerns.

The game includes royal request cards that can grant points at the end of the game (e.g. have the most sectors of a certain color) or during the game (e.g. be the first do have one section of each color).

The game ends after 12 rounds, and the player with the most points wins.

name: Into The Echoside: Cupcake
description:
A promotional card in the Psychopathic faction for Into The Echoside only obtainable from DCG con. It is a slightly different size and thickness than the other cards, likely requiring sleeves for play.

Costs 5 Karma, Worth 2GP

Effect: +1 Karma & draw a Flavor Card
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Horror

name: Escape Game: Serial Killer
description:
In the heart of London, innocent victims are at the mercy of a fearsome serial killer. Only you can save them. Investigate but watch out for time... the crime doesn't wait!

The Escape Room range is inspired by the Escape Room rooms. Find their incredible atmosphere at home! Go on an adventure, observe, manipulate and solve various puzzles that will put your logical mind to the test.

This Escape Game contains 8 scenarios of 60 minutes each.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Deduction, Scenario / Mission / Campaign Game

name: The Rugrats Movie Board Game
description: The aim of the game is to proceed around the board by rolling dice. The first one to reach the "Hospical" is the winner!

name: Guinness World Records: Marble Challenge
description:
Can you move a record breaking number of marbles using chopsticks in one minute?

In the game, players take turns moving marbles from the game box to an adjacent bowl using only chopsticks. Players take turns trying to reach the highest score possible. Can you break the world record?

name: Conquest of Nations
description:
The year is 10,000 bc, take control and start your nation. Germany, Great Britain, France, the USA, and the USSR. 2-5 players lead their nations from the ancient era to victory! Explore different routes on the techtree. As you discover stronger and deadlier weapons, your enemies will coward in your power. If destruction isn't your cup of tea you can construct a rocket and leave your competitors in your dust. Trade, diplomacy, and foreign relations have never been more important as you progress and gain potential allies.

This game was created and is owned by S&J games
categories: City Building, Civilization, Fighting, Negotiation, Political, Territory Building, Wargame
mechanics: Action Drafting, Area Movement, Bribery, Communication Limits, Contracts, Hexagon Grid, Kill Steal, Multiple Maps, Negotiation, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Player Judge, Point to Point Movement, Team-Based Game, Tech Trees / Tech Tracks, Trading, Turn Order: Pass Order, Voting

name: Classic Horse Race
description:
Two players roll 2 dice. From start must roll a 2 or total of 2, then a 3 or total of 3, and so on. Continue until reach 12 to win! Land on your opponent and they must go back to Start! Race around the track to the finish line!

—user summary

name: Hello Kitty: Picnic In The Park
description:
Hello Kitty and her friends are looking for the perfect place to have a picnic. Choose Hello Kitty, FiFi, Jodie or Tracy, then take a card to find out what color space to move to next. Getting a Hello Kitty or a friend card can move you ahead. But a puddle card will always send you back.

Be the first player to get to finish to win!

—description from the back of the box

name: Princess in the Making
description: In this spin-to-move game players take on the role of one of four Disney Princesses ⁠— Cinderella, Aurora, Belle, and Snow White ⁠— starting at their associated start places on the board. To win a player must visit all four castles on the board with their princess standee, collecting a True Princess token at each, and then be the first to return to their associated castle. To collect a True Princess token the player must demonstrate a skill related to being a princess as described by that token. The skills described by the tokens are: balancing a cardboard book on their head, miming dancing with their prince, performing a curtsy, and complimenting another player.
mechanics: Race, Role Playing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Cosmic Coding
description:
Cosmic Coding is a fun board game designed to introduce children to coding. Compatible with Key Stage 1 of the National Curriculum, Cosmic Coding teaches the basic concepts of Computer Science, including algorithms and programming language. A full detailed guide is included to help your child become a Cosmic Coder and complete their mission to collect all their stars.

Guide your spaceship around the galaxy by drawing a card each turn and following the conditions set out. Each game you'll be trying to collect three different colours of stars, collect the right combination, complete your mission and win the game!
mechanics: Command Cards, Memory, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: Pokémon Match Battle
description:
In Pokémon Match Battle players are trying to be the first to win 3 match battles. It is a simple ‘spin-and-compare’ game where each player has only one Pokémon card. Players are each dealt one card at the beginning of each game and keep that card for the whole game. Games appear to be of short time length.

This game is very simple and designed for play by young kids by using simple rules, low complexity and short time length. These were distributed in August 2022 as part of a McDonald’s Happy Meal program, at least in the US. As usual for McD’s there were multiple sets. The only apparent difference between them is the color highlight and representative Pokémon on the box and also used on the plastic game spinner for that set. Each set has a sealed pack of 4 Pokémon cards.

On their turn, the player flips the ‘coin’ (cardboard circle about 1.5” diameter) to determine whether high or low will win. Next the player uses the spinner to determine which of the 5 attribute categories will be used for this turn. Then all players compare that attribute among the cards. The player with the highest or lowest (based on the coin toss) value wins the match point. The first player to win 3 matches (points) wins.

The cards that we’ve seen show a distinctive set logo in the lower left corner and show #/15, for a total set of only 15 different cards apparently. They are a mix of Basic and Stage 1. Presumably any Pokémon cards can be used with this game.
categories: Card Game, Collectible Components, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Highest-Lowest Scoring, Stat Check Resolution

name: Demolition Racing 2055
description:
During the 2050s in the future, people are going crazy over a dangerous race called Super Demolition Jockey (SDJ).

Instead of waking up a genius racer from cold sleep to win the race, you were woken up by mistake to hold the wheel. It is easy to drive the car, but it is a tough race with traps, explosions and the cars bumping to each other. If you fall behind, you must immediately retire from the race. There are no lukewarm remedies for those who drop behind. Try to detect where the traps are and aim for victory.

Complete 3 laps before anyone else, or make all other players drop out.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Events, Programmed Movement, Race

name: Nya Gotlandsquizet
description:
Nya Gotlandsquizet is a quiz game consisting of a pack of cards; questions revolve around the culture and history of Swedish island Gotland in the Baltic Sea. In the default rules players take turns to answer questions, and a player must get both questions on a card right in order to claim it, 10 of which are needed to win. There are a few suggested rule variations, for instance that players gain points for each question answered correctly or that questions can be answered by any player.

A similar game was published in 2015 as Gotlandsquizet with slightly different rules and three questions on each card instead of two. That version also had an English edition, The Gotland Quiz.

name: Le grand défi de la Culture générale pour les Nuls
description:
Roll the die, move forward as many squares as indicated and answer the question you are asked. History, arts, cinema, daily life, there is something for everyone!

And so that young and old can play together according to their level of knowledge, two levels of difficulty await you, beginner or expert.

Finally, to spice up the game, "special" boxes await players throughout their progress and will offer them challenges, super challenges and quizzes...

—description from the publisher

name: The Scotch Whisky Trail Game
description:
Answer the Questions and follow the Trail on a fascinating journey to distilleries, whisky tastings, the occasional bar, a Burns Night party; and of course, enjoying the odd "wee dram" along the way.
