This game is intended for those who enjoy the fine simple pleasures that can be gained from a good glass of whisky.

It will enhance your appreciation of whisky and provide a very enjoyable evening for 2-8 players.

—description from the back of the box
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Banking
description:
In Banking, players must amass money and stock values by rolling the dice and advancing one of their three pawns. When they land on a square of their color (or when they use a "banking" card if they have one), players can put all their assets in the bank, where they will be safe from fire, thieves and other hazards that can occur during the game.

The game ends when one of the players brought all his pawns back to the starting point. The player who has the most assets in the bank wins.

—user summary
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Grab & Play Game: The World
description: Roll the die then draw a card and read the corresponding question/direction. Some require the use of the map (e.g. which country borders this country on the east). If you are correct, draw a token, which is worth the number of points shown. 1st P to collect 100 pts in tokens wins.

name: PINGU Südpol-Rennen
description:
"Hui, schlitter, plautz! Here am I, the Penguin Pingu from south pole. I have invited all my friends. We will make a race, do you want to join us? Then go for it! That will be fun. And for not beeing hungry, we will take a huge amount of fish with us. The fastest player which reaches the goal wins!"

The penguins are on the way. They are jumping from floe to floe. But be careful, there are floes which are not stable anymore. In some cases also the water is a good idea, but only if there is no Orca in the way.

The penguin family which reaches first the south pole wins the game!

name: Huck + Monster
description:
Huck + Monster is a field-to-table Ultimate Pickup game that condenses the action and gameplay of Ultimate into a travel-sized, sideline-ready, turn-based gamekit.

Ideal for Ultimate players and enthusiasts of any skill level, the Huck + Monster gamekit includes everything new Coaches need to train their next Ultimate team dynasty.


Gameplay Overview:

Handler rolls for throw distance. Adjacent defense rolls to challenge throw, disc path, or catch. Offense only rolls again for continues, or challenge catches. Highest roll count wins the challenge, and controls the disc. Catch discs in the opponent’s endzone to score.

---

Game Steps:

1. Add 7 players to each line. Add the offensive disc to the last open defensive line space.
2. Defense rolls 3 to throw. Disc moves roll total.
3. Teams roll 3 to move. Offense moves first.
4. Roll total may be split across players. Players and discs cannot move over occupied spaces.
5. Roll 3 to throw, or catch; 3 to mark, or block.
6. Roll 1 when continuing; 2 when intercepting.
7. Roll strategy dice once per throw.
8. Score by catching disc from the endzone.
9. Game plays to 7 points; win by two.


Certain pickup kits may include spinning pins,


which replace “roll” instructions above.
categories: Dice, Educational, Party Game, Puzzle, Sports
mechanics: Action/Event, Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Critical Hits and Failures, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hexagon Grid, Line of Sight, Movement Points, Moving Multiple Units, Passed Action Token, Roll / Spin and Move, Score-and-Reset Game, Team-Based Game, Tile Placement, Turn Order: Claim Action, Variable Set-up, Worker Placement, Zone of Control

name: Word Splice
description: Players try to score the most points by using the letter cards in their hand to spell new words and/or by splicing (inserting) letter cards into words previously played to form new words.

name: Donut
description: Donut! is a simple trick-taking race game for 2 to 6 players. In this game-winning tricks represents selling donuts. Each player owns a Donut Shop with a great reputation. But a great reputation is just not enough in today’s world. You need your Donut Shop to be famous that’s the only way to make it. Each round players will compete to sell the best donuts by playing Donut Cards from their hands. For every Donut Sale they win, their fame will increase by one.

name: Peppa Pig Fruit Day
description: Join Peppa Pig and her friends to celebrate Fruit Day. You will have the opportunity to make your own smoothie from three random (the first game mode) or selected fruits (the second game mode). This seeming easy task will require you to be perceptive and a little bit lucky. The first one make their smoothie wins the game.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sweep the World
description: The aim of the game is to have the least cards at the end of play. Players start with 10 cards and at their turn they try to get rid of their playing cards by placing them on one of their opponents’ stack of cards. Cards are matched according to different geographic features. New cards are picked at the end of each turn. Players need to be smart and use their wits when deciding how to play their cards and how to block players from piling their own stack with cards.

name: Harry Potter: A varázsigék mestere
description:
The Ordinary Wizarding Level, or O.W.L. exams, the most important test for all Hogwarts students, begins!

Choose a house, choose a character, and show what you know in the theoretical and practical exams of the Transfiguration, Charms, and Defence Agains the Dark Arts subjects!

Do you know all the charms well? Do you know the right wand movements? So let's see what you know! On your cards, you'll see one of the 218 magic spells from the Harry Potter universe. Memorize them well from magic spells to wand moves, then check your knowledge in the presence of the examination board so that while the game is getting tougher from level to level, you will score as many master magic points as possible, and as the most skilled witch or wizard You will be the champion of the game, become the Master of the Magic Spells!

A game with learning, magic spells, wand movements, drawings.

Who will be the Master of Magic Spells?

—description from the back of the publisher

name: Peppa Party Time
description:
The box contains two games.

The goal of the first game is to get the three pieces of the gift puzzle that we are going to give Peppa Pig. To get the pieces of the gift, we have to guess and perform physical tasks.

The key to the second game is to get to the kindergarten table as quickly as possible. Along the way, you can find special fields that cause you to lose the queue, extra traffic, and so on.

name: Grammar Police
description:
Annoy the hell out of your opponents by correctly identifying all the grammatical and/or spelling mistakes in these signs, headlines and other forms of text.

We know what you’re thinking: a grammar game is your idea of hell. Well, guess what… it’s some people’s idea of heaven. That’s why we’ve made it a team game. Wouldn’t you just love to wipe the smug grin off your mate’s face by correcting this…

“Haircuts and shaving your nuts not to come in!! Fully air-conditioned experienced barbers”

Be careful, though, as the English language is a cruel mistress. And you will experience epic levels of frustration if (probably when) you get it wrong. Because you lose points for every incorrect answer.

Oh, and one more thing. When we say this game’s educational, we mean that you might learn something. Like, what a nit-picking grammar geek your nan is, for example. Just watch out, is all we’re saying.

—description from the publisher

name: ウロボロスの傭兵 (Mercenary of Ouroboros)
description:
In Mercenary of Ouroboros, each player has an identical deck of cards ranked 1 to 3 in three suits. The players arrange them in a random grid of 3x3 cards and reveal the front row.

Playing with this front row of cards, one player leads to a trick, and the other player follows with one of their cards. The winner of the trick will have one less card in the column, but the loser of the trick will collect the winners cards and slide it into the back of the column they played a card from.

The first player to empty two of their columns wins. The game also includes some tactics cards which affect trump suits, one time rank bonuses, etc.

name: Probability Magic Kingdom Chess
description:
Probability Magic Kingdom Chess is a 2P abstract game where players take turns moving pieces on a board. Rather than simply capturing a piece that would be landed upon, the pieces show a pie chart of the probabilities of certain results that will happen when each player rolls a standard D6 to determine the combat results. Each piece has a side at full health and can be flipped over to an injured side.

The first player to kill an opponent's king or move their king into the opponent's king's space is the winner.

name: House Pets vs Aliens
description:
This family-friendly game is fast-paced, simple to play yet strategic, and so much freaking fun!

House Pets vs Aliens is a play on the classic card game "War".

Each player commands their own army of House Pets or Aliens (or Plants or Robots with the expansion packs), battling for control of Earth. Each army has 50 cards of varying numbers from 1 to 10. Additionally there is a deck of Battle cards that further influence the game by increasing or decreasing values, preventing other players from playing cards, stealing played cards, etc. A round consists of each player flipping a card from their deck. Players can then play battle cards or draw additional cards from their deck with the goal of being closest to 10 without going over. In the event of a tie where multiple players have the same number close to 10, or 10, then each tied player draws a single card from their deck and the highest card wins. If the newly drawn card results in another tie, keep drawing cards until their is no tie and then whomever had the highest last drawn card wins. Winners of a hand take all the cards played by all players and put them in a second stack by their deck.

Play continues as the above until one player deck of 50 has been depleted. Then players count up the number of cards collected. Highest amount wins.

name: Rapido Météo
description:
AUDITORY MEMORY AND SPEED GAME
The weather is unpredictable, and Théo is wondering which outfit to pick...
Listening, memorisation and transcription are the skills that children will need to find the right outfit and get Théo dressed as quickly as possible!

The players take it in turns to be the "Leader", who describes how the tiger is dressed, and the "Player", who dresses their tiger.
The leader pick a card and describes the tiger's outfit while the other player closes their eyes.
The game ends when there are no cards left in the pile: the player with the most cards wins.

—description from the publisher

name: STACKS
description:
STACKS is a set collection game built around collecting sets of red, blue, and green cards. The cards may be in a central array on the table, in front of a player, or in a player's hand.

On their turn a player will either play 1 card from their hand or the top card of the deck to the central array. Alternatively, they can play a set of cards (one of each type) to the central array. Depending upon the adjacencies of colors and certain card effects, the card which was played may have its effect triggered or the player may be forced to acquire cards.

The game will end when the deck runs out of cards. Then, each player scores points for cards left in their hand and cards in front of them. Any sets of cards (one of each type) in front of them can be combined into a single card. The player with the fewest points wins.

name: Monopoly: The Falcon and Winter Solider
description:
In the Monopoly: Marvel Studios' The Falcon and the Winter Soldier Edition game players go around the board buying up 3 different types of properties: events, hostile forces, and Wakandan tech.

Once you control color sets, you can double the rent and add Captain America Stars and Shields to charge even more rent. The last player with money when all others have gone bankrupt wins.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Superfrågorna
description:
Trivia game based on the popular quiz program "Supersvararna" which was broadcast on Swedish television in the early 90s.

According to the box, the questions can also be used for other trivia games such as Trivial Pursuit.

name: Catch
description:
Catch is the game about the art of catching and keeping your dream partner. The winner of the game is the one who collected the most points by answering the questions correctly, correctly guessing how the fellow players answered, writing funny pickup lines and being good at body language.

Except in the Heart category, the game is played in the form of duels between two players. The duelist of the player is chosen by each fellow player rolling their dice in turn. Whoever gets the same symbol as the player becomes a duellist. After each duel, it is the next player's turn to roll the dice and get a duelist. The side shown on the dice is the category to compete in. The categories are Heart (fun fact questions), Magnifying glass (Intimate and close, players have to guess what the other answers to intimate questions), House (Living together, questions about relationships and cohabitation), the Speech bubble (funniest pickup line), Thumbs up (best body language) and Frog (the player gets to choose category and duelist).

Players collect points and the one with the most when the time is up (30 minutes recommended) can title themselves the ultimate dream partner!
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Die Icon Resolution, Narrative Choice / Paragraph, Questions and Answers, Voting

name: Packat & klart
description: Question and dice game based on a popular travel program on Swedish television. Contains 25 game variants.
categories: Card Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Travel, Trivia

name: My First Magic School Board Game
description:
Help the little wizards save the school from Goblin slime! The sneaky goblins have been leaving their slime all over the school, making a big mess. Race through the magical lands around the school to be the first little wizard to reach the goblin caves and convince them to clean up their mess to become the hero of the magic school!

In My First Magic School, kids will race through around the lands surrounding the magic school, using numbered cards to move ahead, while trying to be the first one to reach the goblin caves. But they better be careful! Along the path there are slime-covered spots that could send them back, as well as spells and potions to collect. Players move by using their numbered cards to get ahead. Use your cards strategically to avoid landing in slime, pick up spells and potions, and slow other wizards down. Once a player reaches the goblin caves, they roll the dice to see how the goblins will respond. The first player to reach the goblins and convince them to clean up is the winner!

The bright magical board, characters, and cards make this story driven game a great way to help kids develop their strategic thinking and counting skills. Limited reading and simple counting make this an easy game for kids 5 and up to learn and enjoy!

-description from publisher

name: The Movie Memo Game
description:
This challenging memo game will test your memory of the Movies.
You must identify iconic film characters by their costume and match them with their famous quote from the same film.
This is the perfect after dinner game, get ready for some nostalgia!

name: Björn Borg TENNIS
description:
Björn Borg TENNIS is a simulation of a real tennis match with the help of rolling a dice. It's the same rules as real tennis.

The simulation is done by rolling a dice and following what the dice result shows in a guide. Based on the result, a ball is moved across the playing field (which is a tennis court). For example, on the first serve, a one makes the ball go into the net and a six makes it a serve-ace. If the ball is still in play, you take turns rolling the dice and follow the results in the table. Game and set wins are marked on a score marker and whoever wins three sets first wins the match.

There are also rules for playing a doubles match and holding a tournament with more players.

—user summary

name: Tumbling Mice Game
description:
The game consist of one cheese piece and 12 mice figures.

There are two variants of the rules:

Players stack the mice on top of the cheese. The first player that makes the tower collapse loses. All other players win.
Players stack the mice on the table. When a player makes any mice fall, they take all the fallen mice. The first player to place their last mouse wins.

name: Uczę się w mig! Czytam: 3 litery
description:
Uczę się w mig! Czytam: 3 litery (directly translated to: I Learn in No Time! I read: 3 Letters) is a great game that will develop your child's memory and perceptiveness. In addition, it will help them learn to read on the basis of 3-letter words, while providing a lot of fun and emotions. In the game, the winner is the one who best remembers the position of pairs of pictures and three-letter words, revealed for a moment, out of all the illustrated tiles lying on the table face down.

—description from the publisher (translated)

This game is a classic Memory game with a simple twist. Instead of all tiles featuring illustrations, here we have pairs of illustrations and text, which is meant to enhance reading skills.

—user summary

name: Bubble Stories: Pancake party
description:
Demo game.
10 cards with an exclusive story.

Discover new worlds by exploring, card after card, all the places you can visit! Enjoy each place along the way and discover what is hidden at the end of each adventure!


Choose the different places you wish to explore.
Turn each card over one after another.
Successfully reach your goal !


In short, Bubble Stories is solo narrative card game without text.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Exploration
mechanics: Move Through Deck, Narrative Choice / Paragraph

name: Uno: Encanto
description:
It's the UNO matching card game everyone knows but featuring favorite characters from Encanto. Players still race to get rid of all their cards by matching color, number and character. When someone plays a special 'Wild Don't Talk' card, they choose a player who will not be allowed to talk (except to call "Uno") until Uno is called. And just like always, when a player is down to one card, they must shout, 'UNO!' Makes a great gift for card game lovers and Encanto fans ages 7 years and older. Colors and decorations may vary.

The classic UNO card game builds fun on game night with themes inspired by Encanto.
Each game features a deck decorated with character graphics from beloved show!
As in classic UNO game, players match colors, numbers and symbols to the card on top of the discard pile!
A special 'Wild Don't Talk' rule may force some player to not talk.
Makes a great gift for kid, teen, adult and family game nights with 2 to 10 players ages 7 years and older!

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Number
mechanics: Hand Management, Lose a Turn, Matching

name: David Walliams Gangsta Granny Stash The Swag Board Game
description:
Based of David Walliams best-selling book 'Gangsta Granny', race around the board collecting jewels and be the first ‘Granny and Ben’ team to find and stash the Crown Jewels without being caught by the Queen!

Once you've collected a jewel, turn it over to reveal if it's one of your 'gangsta' coloured letters, stash the swag and race home. But the Queen is always on patrol, so don't let HM catch you or back to the start you go!

For 2 to 4 players, the first to spell out GANGSTA in your colours wins. Put your cunning skills to the test...you Gangsta!

name: Seinfeld: The Coffee Table Game
description:
Are YOU Master of your Domain?
Find out in The Coffee Table Game, where the goal is to recreate and collect the most iconic scenes from Seinfeld! Remember and re-enact the funniest scenes from Seinfeld, from the most mundane to the most absurd. Can YOU spare a square? But watch out for action cards trying to throw off your game. Serenity Now!!!

—description from the publisher

name: TASK 4
description: Your goal here? The four! You have to collect four consecutive numbers as quickly as possible and place them in front of you. The colors of these four cards will tell you what your next task is. Each color stands for a different task. Sometimes you have to bring two pairs, sometimes four cards of the same suit, sometimes a four of a kind. Because each player has different tasks each time, the games are very different and remain exciting until the end. And if a task drives you crazy, maybe a joker will help you out of a jam...

name: Strikes & Spares
description:
"Bowl your opponents over with your dicemanship! Your challenge is to attain the hightest possible score for a 10 frame game."
A simple dice game that mimics a game of bowling, using 10 special dice with 5 blank sides and one side showing a bowling pin. "The dice that turn up blank indicate the pin has been knocked down. The dice that show a pin on top indicate the pins have been left standing." Players can re-roll once to try to knock all 10 pins down. The score sheet is identical to a standard bowling score sheet, and points are counted identically. The highest possible score is 300, just like in bowling. (quotes from the rules sheet)

name: Disgruntled Decks: Air Force Edition
description:
Disgruntled Decks is a card game for military service members and grizzled Veterans who enjoy laughing together about their time in the service. With a unique blend of descriptive language and military themes, Disgruntled Decks gives one more reason for service members and Veterans to talk about their shared experiences while having fun in the process.

We strongly believe that humor is healing, and some Veterans still have a good amount of healing left to do. We hope to provide some of that humor with Disgruntled Decks.

—description from the publisher
categories: Card Game, Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game
mechanics: Hand Management, Player Judge, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Labyrinth of Galleria: Dungeon Divers
description: Maze building cardgame included with limited edition copies of Labyrinth of Galleria: The Moon Society. Players delve into the titular labyrinth to hunt down magical, cursed curios by building out the labyrinth and win by accrueing the most points.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Fantasy, Maze, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Chaining, Once-Per-Game Abilities, Physical Removal, Pieces as Map, Solo / Solitaire Game, Variable Player Powers, Victory Points as a Resource

name: Who has..?
description:
Pointing fingers is usually considered rude, but this time it’s compulsory! One player reads a question aloud and then all count 1-2-3 together and point to the person they think it fits best. All players in majority group win a card and first to 5 cards wins the game. Flex your fingers and enjoy…

—description from the publisher

name: Monopoly: Marvel Studios' Black Panther – Wakanda Forever Edition
description:
Black Panther fans, get ready to enter the Marvel Universe with this exciting Monopoly game inspired by the Black Panther: Wakanda Forever superhero movie. It's an epic race to control key locations, build temples, and secure as much Vibranium as possible. Play on the side of the Wakandans or support the Talocanil using different colored custom Monopoly tokens and buildings. The last player with Vibranium when all other players have lost theirs wins the game. Will the forces of Wakanda or the mighty Talocanil claim victory in this fierce battle across land and sea?


BLACK PANTHER: WAKANDA FOREVER THEME: This edition of the Monopoly game features artwork, characters, components, and gameplay inspired by Marvel Studios' Black Panther: Wakanda Forever movie
BOARD GAME FOR AGES 8+: Players choose a side in this exciting Monopoly board game for Black Panther fans. Play on the side of the Wakandans or the Talocanil in an epic clash across land and sea
CUSTOM ZINC MONOPOLY TOKENS: Players choose a silver colored token to play on the side of the Wakandans, or a gold colored token if they're supporting the Talocanil
BATTLE FOR VIBRANIUM: In this exciting Monopoly game, players race to control key locations and add buildings to turn the tide of battle. The last player with Vibranium when all others lost theirs wins
FUN FAMILY BOARD GAME: Get family and friends together to play Monopoly: Marvel Studios' Black Panther: Wakanda Forever game. It's great for family game night and makes an awesome gift for Black Panther fans


—description from the publisher
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Income, Loans, Lose a Turn, Negotiation, Ownership, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Stock Holding, Track Movement, Trading

name: Remedio
description:
Remedio is a historical adventure game. You solve tricky puzzles in escape game style, explore the world of knowledge in Southern Europe, North Africa, West and Central Asia in the 14th. Century and experience adventures together.

This cooperative game can be played several times and offers three different puzzle routes to search for the cure for the Emir.
categories: Adventure, Card Game, Deduction, Medical, Puzzle

name: Doktor, mul on mure!
description: Team game where the Patient team tries to describe their very delicate issue to the Doctor team. Due to the delicate nature of the issue the Patient can only give clues as what is the problem without using words. It's up to the Doctor to successfully uncover the actual issue. After 2 minutes the teams switch, the most successful team wins.

name: Sätta bo
description:
A game published by Alga in the 1950s on the subject of a couple paying off a house and getting modern furnishings and a a car. The title translates to "build a nest" and refers to getting your own place of residence (with someone).

Players roll a die and move around a circuit performing transactions and purchasing furniture or car tiles. Occasionally a wheel is spun which mostly leads to more purchases but may indicate taking a loan, selling a tile to the bank or auctioning off an excess tile to the other players. A player wins by paying their initial mortgage, obtaining a full set of tiles, and having at least 5,000 in money.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Loans, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Magnetar
description: Players take turns drawing a card from a face-down deck of cards that depict celestial objects, some with positive numbers and some with negative numbers. The players place the drawn cards face-up in front of them. The first player to reach one hundred when the negative values are subtracted from the positive ones wins. A few cards have special properties that, when drawn, can affect the tableaux of other players.

name: Abe's Chaturanga
description: A new take on the classic board games of Chaturanga, Chaturaji, and Shatranj. This features several ancient variants of Chaturanga and related games, modern variants that the designer has found, and additional rules by the game designer. Extra game pieces are included to accommodate special optional rules.

name: Saimaan Aarre
description:
An escape room game where you're trying to find captain Aamos Uutos' greatest treasure.

Aamos Uutos sailed lake Saimaa for decades, and you have the keys to his greatest treasure in your hands. You only need to solve his puzzles to find out what the treasure really is.

name: Droggel
description:
Droggel was included as a bonus in the first edition of the video game The Whispered World. It consists of a game board and three twelve-sided dice that show Nordic runes instead of numbers. In addition, you need to provide one playing piece for each player.

The players race to the finish space. The player who reaches it first wins. During your turn, you roll the three runic dice and spend them on three possible actions:
Move: If a die shows the rune of an adjacent space, you may spend the die to move to that space.
Jump: If a die shows the rune of an adjacent space, and the color of that space matches the color of the die, you may spend the die to jump over that space to the next space with a matching rune.
Droggel: If multiple dice show the same rune, you may move directly to the next space showing that rune. No dice are spent during a Droggel. After a Droggel, you reroll all of your remaining dice.

If you move to a space that is already occupied by another player, you fight over that space. Fights are resolved using a simple dice-based combat mechanism. The loser of the fight has to move their piece one or more spaces backwards.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That, Track Movement

name: De Quem É O Reino?
description:
In the jungle, everyone knows who the king is, and none of the animals dares to challenge the mighty lion. But on a magical night, 6 amulets were created. Now the kingdom can belong to anyone!

Objective: Win consecutive battles until reaching 12 points, challenging opponents with "The Kingdom is Mine!" in each battle.

There are six different types of animals, each one stronger than the previous one. All animals have 4 levels. So a level 3 snake defeats a level 2 snake but loses to a level 1 lion.

In each round, a new amulet will be opened indicating which animal will be the trump of the round. This animal will win against any other, regardless of their ranking. The round is worth as many points as the number of players who decide to compete in it, with an additional point if all players participate. The winner is the first player to reach 20 points.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Hand Management, Trick-taking

name: Aquarium
description:
Aquarium is a fast-playing dice game using standard six-sided dice or the Steve Jackson Games "Ocean Dice." If using standard dice, you will need six dice for each player, and each player will need a set of differently-colored dice.
Players compete to be the first to fill their aquariums with one of each type of sea creature by rolling and passing dice.
Players roll their dice at the same time, and set aside any creatures rolled (or "1" results). Some dice will get passed to other players, and then everyone rolls again. Play continues until someone has collected one of each type of creature in their "Aquarium."

name: National Park Trivia Board Game
description: National Park Trivia Board Game is a trivia board game where players will be answering questions about National Parks' history, landmarks, wildlife and more. On a players turn, they roll a die and move that number of spaces. Depending on the space the player lands on, they will draw a card from the corresponding deck and answer one of the six questions. Answer wrong and the player moves back one space. The first player to the finish line has to correctly answer a question in the topic of their choosing in order to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game

name: Geh' Fischen!
description:
The big blue ocean is full of beautiful fish and sea creatures. Will you be able to snatch them from your fellow players, or will you have to go fishing yourself? Great fun for the whole family!

Geh' Fischen! is a modified commercial version of the traditional card game Go Fish. The game's child-friendly mechanics, which do not require the classic shuffling and dealing of cards, make it particularly suitable for the youngest players.

At the start of the game, each player fishes five cards from the ocean (a special shared pile of cards in the middle of the table). Then, by cleverly asking the other players, they try to collect a group of four identical marine animals. If the asked player does not have the desired sea animal in his hand, he replies with "Go fishing! In this case, another card is fished out of the ocean. This often leads to funny dialogues, making Geh' Fischen! a communicative game with a lot of wit. At the end, the player who has collected the most groups of sea animals wins the game.

—description from the publisher

name: Detective Conan: Case Closed
description: Drawing card game.

name: Diggin' Doggies
description:
Oh no! Your doggie has lost all his bones. Help him find them and bring them back to his dog house. Be the first to help your doggie collect all his bones and you win! Get them nose down to a bone and watch as they magically pick it up with their magnetic noses!

This law of attraction will help your doggie win the game. Learning to play this game will be way easier than teaching your dog to fetch. Place all the bones color-side facedown in each dugout space around the board, place the doggies in their respective kennels, and roll the die. Choose a direction, and hop as many spaces as the die indicates.

Use your doggie’s magical nose to pick up the bone where your doggie landed. If the color of the bone matches the color of your doggie, put it in his/her kennel, if not, return it to the dugout space, and let the next player test their luck. Once players fetch all three bones, their pup is very close the victory bark. Just make sure he/she runs back to the doghouse before the others catch up. Diggin’ Doggies is a great indoor game to play with the family or a few friends.

It teaches counting, color recognition, hand-and-eye coordination, following game directions and taking turns, all while your family is having fun. Updated version of International Playthings Award Winning Diggity Dogs.

—description from the publisher

name: Biathlon Crystal Globe: Piste du Grand-Bornand
description:
Piste du Grand-Bornand provides a new terrain board for a harder challenge (8 new rules for simulating this famous ring).

—user summary

Signez de nouveaux exploits sur cette piste mythique inspirée du stade de biathlon d’Annecy – Le Grand Bornand, l’étape française de Coupe du Monde. Situé en Haute-Savoie, le Grand-Bornand est le rendez-vous incontournable où bat le cœur de tous les amateurs français de biathlon. Seuls les plus grands biathlètes s’y sont imposés. Face aux difficultés techniques proposées par ce circuit exigeant de la station des Aravis, les biathlètes pourront compter sur les encouragements de plus de 60 000 spectateurs. Il leur faudra grimper l’impressionnante montée tant redoutée, résister aux faux-plats et avaler les bosses avant de rejoindre le pas de tir. C’est là que la victoire choisira son Champion au rythme des acclamations du public de la grande tribune. Découvrez les 8 nouvelles règles de jeu qui viennent pimenter ce circuit : passage des bosses, ascension du mur, cardio au tir, finish au sprint… Pour des parties encore plus intenses !

—description from the publisher

name: Rund um die Schweiz
description: How well do you know Switzerland and its 26 cantons? In this exciting racing game, you can prove your knowledge, discover lots of new things, and steal cards from your fellow players. The one who collects the most coats of arms and cards wins. This card game is suitable for children aged seven and above, and 2 - 4 players can participate together. The set includes 78 question cards, 26 coats of arms, 1 game board, 4 game pieces, and 1 die.

name: Hyperspace: Automata
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Automata are efficient, well-balanced, and effective as befits a machine civ. They can draw on tech powers without researching them, and their abilities are evenly divided between early- and late-game advantages.

The Technotron is a highly-flexible ship with controlling computers that can access and instantly activate a wide number of effects. When encountered, Technotrons can manifest many different results. They are not just for combat, either, and are often seen helping with manufacturing projects, scientific research, and other such efforts. As with all Automata ships, the Technotron has no “crew”. It is, itself, a single machine, and as such is precisely a single “Automata” resident, though a large and authoritative one.

name: Hyperspace: Azota
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

Over time the Azota enervate and weaken other aliens – gradually, but permanently, removing colonies from play. But the Azota weaken over time as well, making the game into a race. The Azota must “spread the love”, gathering colonies as they go. They are more powerful in the early game, and lose oomph as time goes on. They must maximize their advantages before they fall apart.

The Skeleship is designed for one purpose only – to kill. If you can afford to accompany it with a single puny corvette, it is certain to score a kill in every fight – possibly more than one. It is deadly, and the Azota ability to engage in extra battles makes it even worse.

name: Hyperspace: Daldath
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Daldath are a terrifying civilization which can desolate the map. They leave hollow spots in their swath, from which they can later harvest precious supplies. The destruction is expensive, however, and other civilizations can often profit through this same destruction.

The Daldath can create gigantic biomechanical structures, deeply rooted in a planet, and powered by energy from its core. These structures project destructive energy across
the light-years of space and destroy entire worlds. Their planet smashers are the core of Daldath power. Though they can be destroyed, it is difficult.

name: Hyperspace: Dacians
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Dacians are a terrifying threat. When the Dacians produce, they drain extra resources from their neighbors. Their Vorax tech makes them both fearsome and flexible in battle. At least they prefer to keep your colonies alive, as feeding grounds,
and they must carefully plan just when they are going to receive a secret, to manage their vampirism.

Their super-ship Lancets is part and parcel of your Feed action’s success. It ensures a Feed’s success, letting you drain your foe and bump up the battle track without risk.

name: Hyperspace: Old Ones
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Old Ones grant wisdom and lore to other species. They suffer from their current decadent state, which makes them unable to boost colonies, but they can make up for this by the blessings they spread selectively.

The Oracle super-ship is an amazing vessel. When its main armament fires, it can either inflict vast damage, or create a portal into hyperspace, granting strange energies for the Old Ones. Either result is useful to their species and makes them a particularly knotty problem to crack.

name: Hyperspace: Starspawn
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Starspawn plunge through the sky, gain the secrets of Cthulhu’s wisdom, and must slumber periodically. They can devour enemy ships before the latter get off a shot, and they can instantaneously gather rewards. They are fearsome, but fortunately at least in Hyperspace terms, not unbeatable.

The most powerful Starspawn weapon is of course Great Cthulhu himself. But since his rise, he underwent mitosis, and now two are available. Perhaps this was always the point of conquering Earth -simply to enable Cthulhu’s duplication.

name: Hyperspace: Yaddith
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Yaddith start with the best homeworld of all. Unfortunately, they are due to lose it, so must maximize its use early on. At game end, they earn VPs from enemy starbases, don’t need to conquer these – this knowledge can mean opponents sometimes let the Yaddith colonies alone.

The Stingship doesn’t require a key action to build – with enough resources they can amass a deadly fleet faster than any other civ. Keep this in mind; the Yaddith is not about slowly growing over time, but about quick reflexes and adaptability

name: Hyperspace: Zepzeg
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The Zepzeg are a twisted and engaging civ. Other players generally love the Zepzeg’s presence, benefiting from their presence, which of course is a potential problem. But the Zepzeg can turn the tables – stealing resources and forbidding combat in an awkward system.

The Zepzeg combine structures, which also have a religious purpose, out of smaller ones. They carry this practice into space, and thus their Cathedral starships are made up of smaller ships, cemented into a whole. These break off when it is damaged or destroyed, giving the Cathedrals a tactically interesting power.

name: Hyperspace: Humans
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

The humans uniquely don’t have a homeworld, though they do have a small population on an asteroid. Their ability to store and keep secrets for later use, makes them challenging for beginning players, but a veteran can use this ability to amaze and horrify his or her rivals. Despite their lack of early resources, the player can make this up by means of Wardens and techs, amplifying the human threat.

The Warden is a colossal coldsleep vessel. It harvests hormones and chemicals from its sleeping population without harming them, so is effective in both war and peace. The humans start play with both Wardens already in action – the mightiest fleet in the galaxy.

name: Hyperspace: 5-6 Player Expansion
description: Enlarge your Hyperspace games to 5 or 6 players!

name: Hyperspace: Space Cats
description:
Each Hyperspace expansion civilization comes with a Homeworld tile, 4 unique Citizens, 2 Super Units, and 2 Super Techs.

Gameplay components to cross-over your Cthulhu Wars Bubastis faction miniatures to play the Space Cats faction in Hyperspace.

name: Blitzkrieg 1939: Hoepner
description:
Blitzkrieg 1939: Hoepner (or Blitzkrieg 1939 II) is the second game in the "Blitzkrieg 1939" mini-series. It simulates battles during the German invasion of Poland, September, 1939, between Polish defenders and the German XVI Corps commanded by Erich Hoepner.

The following battles are included:

Mokra
Piotrków Trybunalski
Tomaszów Mazowiecki
Sochaczew
Warszawa (Warsaw)


The game uses the B-35 wargaming system developed by Taktyka i Strategia.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hexagon Grid, Movement Points, Paper-and-Pencil, Ratio / Combat Results Table, Simulation, Zone of Control

name: Northern Pacific: Southern Pacific
description:
The first expansion for Northern Pacific is covering the Southern Pacific Railroad.

The Northern Pacific expansion: Southern Pacific game uses the components found in both the original Winsome Games production of Northern Pacific and the later licensed Rio Grande Games production of Northern Pacific. It may be played by owners of either game.

Provided are two 11x17 inch maps that must be trimmed on the short edge, resulting in an 11x33 inch game board.

The Northern Pacific expansion: Southern Pacific is for 3-6 players and takes as long as a Northern Pacific game. There are no rules changes.
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Network and Route Building, Score-and-Reset Game

name: Q.E.D. 猫=液 (Q.E.D. Cats are Liquid)
description:
In Q.E.D. Cats are Liquid, players are exploring the rheology of cats through Deborah numbers.

In practice, players have a container of size 21 and a hand of cat cards. Players draft a cat card, place it in front of them, and pass the remaining cards. Some other cards may affect the size of the container or cat values with algebraic operations.

Once a player's container size equals the sum of their cats, they are finished with the round. Other players continue until all cards are drafted. Generally, the player with the largest matching cat and container size wins.

name: Making Bad Situations Worse
description: The adult party game where you try to submit the worst reactions to bad situations. Roll the die to select and read a bad situation, then ask the other players how to make it worse. They submit answers from the Make It Worse cards in their hands of 7 cards each. Read the answers aloud and award a point to the player who made the bad situation the worst.

name: Garbage Monsters
description:
The game with lovable trash! Be the first to sort your cards in sequential order. Avoid the garbage monsters so you don’t lose a turn!

Players begin the game with a grid of 10, facedown cards. The start player draws a card from the deck. If the card is a number card, and that number’s corresponding space in the player’s grid is still facedown, the player replaces the card in their grid with the drawn card. If the card replaced can be placed into the player’s grid they may do so. This may continue until they replace a card that cannot be placed into their grid or until they reveal a garbage monster. Any player who completes their grid in the round (all other players get one more turn after the first player achieves this) then starts the next round with one fewer card in their grid. The first player to complete the 1-card grid wins the game.

name: Subway Surfers: The Board Game
description:
APP COMES TO LIFE: Experience the legendary app now as a board game in your living room!

MOST TREASURED CHARACTERS: Challenge each other with your favorite characters from the Subway Surfers franchise such as Jake, Tricky, Fresh and Yutani on the three iconic subway tracks.

EXCITING GAMEPLAY: Boost your surfing skills with items, collect coins and dodge oncoming trains in this agile and adventurous game!

—description from the publisher

name: Disney Frozen II: Frozen Memories
description:
Elsa wishes to uncover the mystery behind her magical powers - but will she find out the truth? Fortunately to her, she can count on her sister Anna and their amazing friends. Join your favourite characters in the world of Frozen II, be observant and test your memory!

There are two variants int this game: lottery and memos.

In lottery variant players try to collect a set of all characters by pulling out forest tokens and getting corresponding character tokens.

Memos variant is similar, but more challenging. After pulling out a forest token a player needs to find a matching character token from a pool of face down tokens.

In both variants the first player to collect set of all 6 characters is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Barbro
description:
Barbro is the game that reveals what you and your girlfriends really think. The game where you have to stand up for your opinions - and secrets. Barbro sets out to find out what type of woman you are: Bimbobabe, Bullmamma, Ninjafeminist, Viktigpettra or Dräktdrake?
It's about making moral decisions, performing embarrassing tasks and showing your knowledge of women. With Barbro, the truth comes out. Barbro a game just for women!

The game Barbro is played in two phases. In the first phase, is about to collect character tokens that will determine what type of woman you are. Character tokens are won by answering questions correctly or completing missions. After a jointly determined number of chips before the start is reached, you enter the second phase, where you have to correctly answer questions based on the character tokens collected during the first phase. Whoever succeeds in flipping their character tokens first wins and is named the evening's Barbro.

The game's five female types:
Viktigpettra - "It is cowardly not to explain to others how things are"
Bimbobabe - "With a little femininity and a push-up bra you can go a long way"
Bullmamma - "Hot milk chocolate and mangled sheets help with most things"
Ninjafeminist - "Raise your voice and refuse to shave your armpits"
Dräktdrake - "Life is a business idea that should be profitable"
categories: Humor, Mature / Adult, Party Game, Political, Trivia
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Player Judge, Questions and Answers, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Little Red Riding Hood
description:
A cooperative game for children in which the players have to guide Little Red Riding Hood faster to grannys house than the wolf can appear there. Once the house is reached the game is over.

In turn order every player rolls the die and performs an action according to the result. One either moves Little Red Riding Hood or the wolf or granny one further step. An additional action if a green color is rolled is to turn over a tree piece and perform the corresponding action such as moving the wolf one step further or to reposition Little Red Riding Hood.

One interesting fact of the game is that it is not a simple race as it is affected by some random effects in the game: The wolf can only enter the house if granny arrived already there. Also Little Red Riding Hood can skip a few steps or repositioned with a special tree piece.

There exists also a competitive variant for two players if each player plays a character.

—user summary
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Name That Puppy
description: Each player draws a hand of 5 puppy cards, which each have a unique photo of a puppy. At the beginning of a round, the "pack leader" (judge) will flip a name card from the name deck. The other players will select a puppy card from their hand, and the judge will pick the puppy that they feel fits the name the best. Players then draw back up to 5 cards. The first player to win 3 rounds is the winner.

name: Shimmer and Shine
description:
Shimmer & Shine is the card game of the namesake NickleOdeon TV cartoon. Three to six player exchange cards round after round in order to build up couples. The first who gets rids of all his cards, wins. Meanwhile, whomever holds the kitten card in the last round is the loser of the game.

A fast and simple game for the younger kids. Especially apt for 3 to 5 year-olds.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Closed Drafting, End Game Bonuses, Hand Management, Simultaneous Action Selection, Trading

name: Ensimmäinen pelini: Sammakon loikka
description:
Hop across the lily pads! The small frogs must go home, but they must cross the pond on their way. Leap across lily pads and roll the die. The lily pads may reveal a surprise!

The game features four cute wooden frogs and no plastic components. The die roll tells you what to do on your turn: hop to the next free lily pad, sit still for a turn, or flip over a lily pad, which may move you forward, backwards or help the frog in the last place.

Ensimmäinen pelini: Sammakon loikka is for 2–4 players, age 3+, and is meant as a first game for small children.

name: Soloventure
description:
Soloventure is a single player RPG adventure campaign that fits within a single tuck box for play anywhere, anytime.

The game provides 4 heroes to choose from, a randomized procedurally generated dungeon, random encounters, and even a dice deck for on-the-go play. Everything you need in one portable box.

name: Captain of the Fleet: Great Lakes Division
description:
Challenge the fury of the Great Lakes and deliver your cargo to various fresh water ports. Overcome natural obstacles while building a fleet of lake freighters. The first player to successfully navigate the headwinds, collisions, and misfortunes will be "Captain of the Fleet"!

Players will each be given a fleet of three ships and a 'Trip Log' describing the ports they will need to obtain cargo from and deliver to as well as their start position. The players will then navigate the dangerous waters of the Great lakes by rolling a D6 die to move and drawing and completing the text on a 'Log Entry' event cards when they land on these spaces. Additionally players will have to deal with Ports, Canals, and Occupied Spaces, all of which may impede their progress.

Once the player's vessel finishes the tasks from the 'Trip Log' it remains on the board at it's final port and the player selects a another 'Trip Log' to repeat this process with their second ship. The first player to complete a three of their ships with this process will have won the game and proven themselves capable of being 'Captain of the Fleet'.

—user summary
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: شیر مرغ (Chicken's Milk)
description:
Chicken's Milk is the Persian re-imagining of the classic "Snake Oil" game. In each turn, a player assumes the role of a costumer, and picks a costumer card which gives him a "role" to play is (from firefighter and nurse to alien and vampire).
The other players choose 2 out of 6 cards in their hands to combine them together and come up with a product for that costumer, and pitch it for a maximum of 1 minute. Then the player who is the costumer listens to every pitch, and then chooses the pitch that they think suits their role the best, and award the seller with the costumer card.
At the end of the game whoever has the most costumer cards wins.
mechanics: Acting, Hand Management, Player Judge, Role Playing, Storytelling

name: The Lord of the Rings: Battle For Helms Deep
description:
Defeat Saurons army at Helms Deep! Be the first player to find the icons needed to destroy the armies in front of them. First player to flip over their cards wins!

Up to 4 players move around the raised Helms Gorge game board, watching their opponent's moves, and collecting the tokens hidden under Helms Gorge. These tokens allow players to use the right cards to match the icons on the cards of Sauron's armies, so you can use them to defeat him by turning over all their cards.

name: Chef Piatti italiani
description:
Goal of the game:
To be the first player to compose the Chef's Menu, consisting of 6 different courses (recognisable by the colour of the card frame), plus the bill card.
How to play? The game is played with open cards. After shuffling the cards the dealer does not deal any cards to the players, but places the covered deck in the centre of the table and turns over the first card, to start the discard pile and the game.
In the event that the first card turned over is an action card, one continue to turn over other cards until you find a course (starter first course, second course, side dish, dessert and drink), after which the player to the left of the dealer starts the game (clockwise), choosing from the following possibilities:

draw from the covered deck with the option to discard(discarding is optional);
draw a useful range from the discard pile, without being able to never discard;
play an action card from their own cards, without being able to draw or discard;
discard a range from among one's cards without being able to draw.


—description from the publisher

name: Scooby-Doo Scrappy-Doo: El Barco Fantasma
description:
Help the Scooby gang find a hidden treasure! The player who arrives first to the Lost City and gets the treasure wins.

Each player rolls the dice and advances that number of squares. There are two groups of trap tiles placed on the board (ghost ship and seaweeds) which are shuffled and placed on the corresponding areas of the board. When a player falls in a centaur or ghost pirate square, the traps of the corresponding group are reshuffled (even if there is a player already over one).

When a player lands in a trap, the tile is revealed and the player moves backwards as many squares as the tile indicates (3-6) or stays on the same place if it’s blank.

To get the treasure (and win the game), the player needs to roll the exact number or move backwards the number extra squares.

—user summary
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Pirates
mechanics: Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Do You Even Know Math?
description:
This fast-paced math game helps to sharpen mental math skills through an action-packed gameplay that both kids and adults will love:

Praised by teachers for making math fun in both the classroom and home.
Unique action cards can quicky change the game, adding another level of excitement.
The perfect STEM game to play with kids, teens and adults.


How To Play?

Set up: Deal 15 card decks to each player and lay 5 cards face up in the middle of the table, this will be The Field.

How to play: Players can only hold up to 5 cards from their deck at any time. You can use any of the 5 cards in your hand to build an equation that equals any of the number cards in The Field by using addition, subtraction, multiplication and/or division.

Once a player comes up with an equation, they must quickly place the cards down over the number in The Field, creating a new number to be used. That player then draws cards from their deck to hold 5 cards again. Continue getting rid of the cards in your deck by building equations.

Winning Condition: First player to get down to 1 or no cards wins!

There are 2 card types in the deck:

NUMBER CARDS: Use these cards to build equations
ACTION CARDS: Use these cards to help yourself or give another player a tougher time. Anyone can play an Action Card at any time!

name: Dragons
description:
Another dice game from Steve Jackson, part of his nanogames series. Each player takes eight dice of a different color and everyone rolls at once to construct the body of their dragon. 1 and 3 are the head and tail, respectively; 2s are the body; 4s, 5s, and 6s are passed to the next player and rerolled next round. The goal is to mix colors together to get bonus points and be the first to earn 10 points, but if there is a tie, the win is shared equally.

Printed on the back of the rules for Halloween Dice (renamed Jack-O'-Lanterns).

name: アニマノレース (Anima-no-race)
description:
アニマノレース (Anima-no-race) is a game from Japan with animals racing to survive. Each player has a squirrel, a rabbit and a bear to move, and each animal needs its own food (nuts, carrots, fish). Instead of rolling dice, all players choose a tile to show their move, and after revealing players decide which of their three animals to move. The game is designed to balance choices between moving or getting food, and stealing food for victory points by landing on the same space as another animal. The player with the most points at the end is the winner, and the bears receive bonus points as well.

The publisher says:
Squirrels, rabbits, and bears escaped the dried-out forest with only a bit of food. They are trying to reach the paradise called Animanoland where only three animals can live. On their way to escape, they need to get food from other animals in order to survive.

Basically this is sugoroku game but with tiles instead of dice. Players moves 1 of their animal tokens out of 3 each turn with stealing/being stolen their food each other. The first three animals reached to the paradise will get bonus points. The player with the highest points, the total point of the bonus and the food they stole from other animals will win.
description by publisher
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Movement Points, Track Movement
publishers: Mi-san (ミーさん), NANAWARI (ナナワリ)

name: One of Us
description:
Who do you think of whenever you see a cat? And who do you think of when you see a sparkling diamond necklace...or a leek?

That's what One of Us is all about. Now all you have to do is agree with the majority of players, and you've already scored a point together.

name: RunnuRound
description:
A betting game to see who can correctly guess the number of sequences in a randomly created grid of tiles. Forty numbered tiles are shuffled and place in a 4x10 grid and players make secret bets on how many "runs" will be present. Then the tiles are flipped and everyone earns or loses points based on how close they were to their bet. First player to get 10 points wins.

—user summary

name: みんなでメイキングＢＬ (BL Made By Everyone)
description:
In this game, you and others become goddesses who love BL (Boys' Love) and shape the destinies of boys in an all-boys school. Each player holds cards and creates precious scenarios to color their high school lives.

There are 10 character cards with various types like cool, cute, delinquent, teacher, and more! Additionally, two cards allow you to create your own preferred settings.

You can enjoy playing with your favorite pairings.

—description from the publisher (translated)

ＢＬ（ボーイズラブ）が好きなモブ顔の女神様となったあなた達が、ある男子校の男子達の運命を作り出すゲームです。

手札を持ち、彼らの高校生活を彩る尊いシナリオを作ってあげて下さい。

キャラクターカードは10種。クールキャラ、可愛い系、不良系、先生などタイプは様々！さらに好きな設定を自分で作れるカードも2種封入。

好きなカップリングで遊ぶ事ができます。

—description from the publisher

name: TEVolution
description:
TEVolution is a trick-taking game played with 16 cards.

After that, starting with the person who played the weakest card, each player chooses one card from the remaining cards on the field and puts it into their hand. The person who gets 4 tricks is the winner.

name: コレクトリテ～ボディビルver～ (CollecTrick: Bodybuilding Ver)
description:
In order to participate in the bodybuilding competition, collect and train your team's macho muscles by winning tricks, earn evaluation points, and help your team win. However, an unbalanced body will result in points being deducted, so be careful not to train too much.

コレクトリテ～ボディビルver～ is a trick-taking game where you need to balance the collected the upper and lower training cards bodybuilding poses.

name: Knoo: Adventure Survival
description:
Nestled beneath a frisky pine forest lies a land of lakes and streams. Navigate through the charted map system by water, portage or take a bush plane, putting kilometres behind you, thwarting disasters and aquiring new skills to survive while setting up new tent sites and obtaining the points you need to win.

Along the way you will pick up valuable equipment needed for your survival. “Weather or Not” you have what it takes to return safely to the Parking Lot with all of your points, might be up to you, but someone else may have another idea!

Each player starts with 2 Equipment Cards (which is the currency each turn, no dice), 2 Survival Cards, 3 Tent Site Markers, a Map Reference Card to establish your starting position and a MNOO player piece. Point tokens are scrambled and placed randomly on star locations throughout the board.

Gameplay is to strategize the best, one way, route to collect 15 minimum points and get back to the Parking Lot to win. You must thwart inevitable disasters with Survival Cards or purchase special Weather or Not Cards that can help or hinder you along your journey. Take a bush plane to move greater distances as an additional transport mechanism.

—description from the designer

name: Le Jeu du Petit Patissier
description:
Game largely inspired by Mille Bornes (One Thousand Milestones, with its green lights, punctured tires, etc) added with a mechanism of recipe to follow (each player is racing to bake a cake), this game was published around the late 1970s/early 1980s to promote the cake brand "Alsa".

In Le Petit Patissier (French for "The Little Pastry Chef"), each player receives a recipe card during setup, as well as a hand of 7 cards. Each on turn, players draw a card then try to follow their recipe by building a tableau made of a Chef's hat (mandatory to start cooking), then a couple of kitchen utensils and all the necessary ingredients (flour, eggs, butter, etc.).
The first player able to bake their cake will win. However, every other chef will try before that to hinder others' progression by attacking with various incidents (flat cake, burning cake, etc). Some rare cards in the game allow you to become a special chef, definitely protected by such attacks.

While typical of the time for its mechanisms (Take-that, draw and discard), Le Petit Patissier is a hard to find collector's item.

name: Random Board Game
description: Players try to maximize points by placing their disks adjacently on a grid and multiplying the points when their group of disks crosses over into multiple quadrants on the board. Blocking disks can be used to stifle the competition.

name: Mirakel Mix
description:
In Mirakel Mix, the players, fortified by freshly mixed potions from the magic cauldron, traverse insurmountable obstacles of a cave labyrinth.

It's all in the mix. Each turn, the players first decide with which additions they want to fill the magic cauldron. Then they "tap", and a few turns of the large cauldron wheel elicit a colorful mixture of its magical ingredients from the magic vessel. Anyone who completes the recipe for a magic potion will gain supernatural powers. These powers are urgently needed because the master test of the cauldron spirits can be passed only by those who can move through iron grids and fire walls in a notorious cave labyrinth – which is completely unthinkable without magic potions...

—description from the publisher

name: Zanuu Canadiana
description:
Team-based or solitaire trivia game with questions about Canada.

Players choose a team (red or green) and a province (no territories). The circular board has numbered bars around the perimeter that pull out for keeping track of each players score, one for each province, and a central disc for keeping track of each teams score. Players place a red or green pawn on the end of their score bar to indicate their team. When a player reaches ten points, they reset their score bar and score one point for their team, turning the central disc clockwise for a green point or counter-clockwise for a red point. When a player reaches five points, instead of answering a trivia question, they roll a six sided die to determine how many points they get. The winning team is the one to reach ten points first, or if using a timer, the team with the most points when time is up.

Questions are read from cards, and each card has four questions. Before playing, a difficulty level of one to four is chosen, which determines which questions are read from the cards (Level one is just the first question, level two is the first and second question, etc.).

The instructions mention that it can be played solitaire.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Solo / Solitaire Game, Team-Based Game

name: I'm the Boss: The Dice Game
description:
In I'm the Boss: The Dice Game players compete to form deals. Each player starts as the expert in one or more of the six fields and rolls dice and plays cards in order to become expert in more fields and to initiate deals.

When a deal is initiated players can freely negotiate in order to assemble the required set of experts. Deals always have some flexibility in which experts they require and cards can be played to temporarily become expert in a field. Cards can also be played for other effects, such as "I'm the Boss!" which lets a player take over control of the current deal.

After every two deals the payouts increase. After eight deals the game is over and the player with the most money wins.

name: Skulls of Sedlec: Troubadours
description: All these wandering musicians want to do is strum and sing for their captive audience. The more of them are playing together, the better they sound. Rather than scoring individually, each group of connected Troubadours scores a set value based on how many are in the group. But having too many musicians muddles the sound: once there are 4 connected Troubadours, any additional ones added to the group no longer improve their performance.

name: The Good, the Bad and the Goat
description:
In The Good, The Bad and the Goat, players assume the roles of various Old West characters, striving for wealth, control, and dominance in a frontier town.

Throughout the game's three rounds, players engage in a dynamic exchange of Character Cards. As the dealer rotates among players, each turn involves checking four cards and offering one face-down to another player. The dealer must declare which character is being offered but may lie about this. The recipient then faces the choice to accept or decline the card. If accepted, they gain control of the character; if declined, the dealer gains control of the character. In either case, the player on the left becomes the new dealer. Characters grant players with coins or valuable belongings, but some, like the Sheriff and the Gunslinger, bring trouble or arrest. And, of course, no one wants to get the Goat because it's worthless.

Following three rounds (or four in two-player games), the game concludes. The player with the highest total of money in coins and Belonging Tokens is the winner.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Star Wars: Box Busters – Rebels Speeder Bike Chase
description:
Ezra Bridger commandeers his Speeder Bike as imperial troops give chase. In the process he meets his future comrades of the Rebellion.

Star Wars: Box Busters is a series of small plastic dioramas. The dioramas fold into a small plastic cube known as a Battle Cube. Each player needs their own Battle Cube to play.

The basic game uses a simple battle-dice mechanic. Advanced rules incorporate a Battle Cube's unique special abilities.
categories: Children's Game, Expansion for Base-game, Science Fiction

name: Trustafarian
description:
Little is known about how Great Uncle Harry amassed his fortune. The sole stipulation to each of his beneficiaries (whom Great Uncle Harry fondly described as “my dear Trustafarians”) was to “stay strong, keep trading and have fun along the way”.

In Great Uncle Harry’s memory, Dave Sellwood (with a soupçon of help from Jon and Darren) set out to devise a board game with universal appeal.

“Navigate the exhilarating highs and heart-churning lows of your Risk & Reward cards and enjoy landing on Great Uncle Harry space to get just what you need.

Playing in pairs, the winning team is the last one standing or the one with the highest net worth after 90 minutes has elapsed.”

name: Podróże Pana Kleksa
description: A game based on Jan Brzechwa's book "The Travels of Mr. Kleks" and its film adaptation from 1986. At the beginning, each player must equip themselves with a button because no pawns were added to the game. (In those days, all Mr. Kleks's fans collected buttons, like Mr. Kleks, looking for a button for a magic hat, needed to turn his enchanted friend into a starling back into a human.) Players roll the dice. If the result is even, they move the number rolled. If the player rolls 1, he draws a card from the "surprise" deck, if 3 - from the "obstacle" deck, if 5 - from the "adventure" deck. Each of these decks consists of 10 cards and one whose content you can come up with yourself. The cards describe situations such as: you lose 1 turn, you gain 2 throws, you move 10 spaces, stand 20 fields away from the finish line, return to the start, etc. The player who reaches the finish line first wins.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Esploriamo il corpo umano
description: An educational game for kids where the players roll dice to to reach a suffering organ in the human body and “heal” it. After an organ is cured, another one will need assistance. At each turn, the players also draw cards that may boost or hinder their movement.

name: Pickle Everything
description: A reader reads a clue from a card. The first player to shout the answer, which will begin with the letter "p", wins the card, but only if that player adds the word "pickle" to his answer. Play an agreed-upon number of rounds. The player with the most cards wins. The game also can be played in Times-Up! fashion, in which clues are one-word long or in the form of charades.

name: Wyścig pod dyplom
description:
Card game created by Arkadiusz Ciesielski with illustrations by Jakub Dębski known for a webcomic titled "Duże ilości naraz psów". It is a competitive game about college students trying to outperform each other to pass all the exams.

In each round players take one action and play one card. With actions, they must balance their parameters: knowledge, attendance, focus, and relaxation. Playing cards is mostly done to interfere with other players' plans with a "take-that" mechanism. To pass an exam each player needs 5 points of knowledge and 2 points of each other parameter.

The winner is determined after a number of rounds equal to a number of players. A player with the most passed exams is declared a winner.

name: Paniku
description: Trivia game where each player in turn draws a card and asks the others for a list of items following its instructions; if nobody manages to provide a complete list in ten seconds, the card is added to a personal tableau. To win the game you need to build a grid by placing each card next to a card with a matching edge color. An electronic timer is integrated with the box.
mechanics: Action Timer, Drawing, Matching, Pattern Building, Real-Time, Turn Order: Progressive

name: Mind the Gap
description:
The theme of this game involves a tour of London with stops to see the sights, eat, enjoy the nightlife, and of course shop. For over 900 years ravens have patrolled the Tower of London. According to legend, if the Raven's ever leave, London will fall. The objective is to return the Ravens to the Tower of London.

Mind the Gap is a board game for 2-6 players ages 8 and up. The board consists of photographs of famous London attractions. Movement is determined by rolling dice and moving along a track representing different locations in London. There are cards used in the game providing information/trivia about London and parts of British life. These cards also affect game play by causing players to lose turns, switch places with other players, etc.

name: Abracadabra
description:
Abracadabra (Who are you? A creative liar or a walking encyclopedia?) is a party game based on the game Dictionary. Here’s how it works: pick a card from the deck, see the word on it and read it out loud. This word is most likely UNKNOWN to you but painfully SIMILAR to a word that you most likely do know.
Your task is to summon your deepest knowledge or, even better, your acting skills, and convince the other players that you know exactly what the word means.

What is an Enchiridion? A collapsible folder? A Mexican food? A rare-earth metal? Do you have your own version?

There is only one word, but everyone will have their own interpretation of what it means. You have to convince everyone that YOUR definition of the word is correct. The key to Abracadabra lies in a player’s ability to improvise the definitions and persuade all the other players that you really do know what you're talking about. Players earn points by convincing other players that their definition is correct, or at least close to correct, by betting on the most accurate definitions and by actually getting the definition right.

name: Speed Colors: Free Demo Version
description:
A free promotional demonstration version of the game Speed Colors.

In Speed Colors, each player has a double-sided card with a colorful picture on one side and the same picture but in black and white on the other side. All players memorize the colorful side of their pictures, flip it, then color it in as quickly as possible the same way as on the back of the card! The faster and the more accurate you are, the more points you get. Try to keep up as the caps on the markers are switched at the end of each round (adding more challenge)!

—description from the publisher
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Memory, Party Game

name: Fishin' Around
description:
In this game, you have a circular "river" that has about a dozen fish that go around it via magnets under the board. As the fish go around the river, their mouths open and close and your goal is to use your fishing pole to snag as many fish as you can - you do that by positioning your hook in the mouth of a fish while the mouth is open and then wait for the mouth to close.

Intended for toddler-age kids and featuring music that plays (quite loudly) while the fish move around the river, Fishin' Around can be fun with young children.

Similar, but not the same as Let's Go Fishin'
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Music

name: Oh! Canada
description:
This multi-faceted colorful bilingual game was issued without charge to schools and citizens who requested a copy from the Commissioner of Official Languages of the Canadian Federal Government's Language Development Program.

All of the components of the game fit into the cardboard game board, which when closed is a large envelope that is 35.7cm long x 31cm wide. The game was created by Madeline Knonby and illustrated by Geo Boka, copyrighted 1974.
The game board when open is 35.7cm long x 62.3cm wide and about 1cm thick, and is a stylized map of Canada. Each province and territory (of the time) is in a different color and major cities are indicated on the map appropriately. In addition there are colorful scenes depicting various activities across Canada. Some places are indicated with their names in English and others indicated with their names in French. Different types of lines between cities illustrate modes of transportation between cities. For example, the dotted black line at the bottom between Winnipeg and Regina indicates a railroad, while the double red lines from Winnipeg going east indicates a highway; the yellow line from Churchill going northwest indicates an air-route and the white and black line going northeast indicates a water-route! The "legend" at the lower-left side of the board indicates these transportation modes as well as moves of players during the game.

The spinner on the board indicates the transportation modes a player must use while attempting to travel across Canada. The 32 page included bilingual book contains instructions for playing the game and other bilingual information. The game is for four players (illustrated in circles on the front of the book), each of whom is represented during play by a 1.5cm diameter plastic disc of white, green, red, or yellow.

The 33 1/3 RPM phonograph recording (17.8cm diameter) includes 2 songs in both English and French. There is also a glossary of phrases in both languages which includes phrases such as: "It's snowing", etc.

This game appears to be a modified later version of an earlier game - From Coast To Coast, but an earlier version of The Great Game Of Canada.

name: Pittsburgh in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania. It has spaces such as Kennywood, Primanti Brothers, Heinz USA, Three Rivers Stadium, Andy Warhol Museum, and The Point. The tokens include a sailboat, a football, a baseball, and a hard hat. Cards include local events and staples of life in Pittsburgh.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Psych-a-Doodle: The Board Game
description:
A fun party game in which players add to a half-finished doodle, in one of four doodle categories:
