Taboodles: Don’t draw the three things secretly listed on the card.

Meet your Match: The turn-taker’s doodle MUST MATCH as many other player’s doodles as they can.

Matchless Masterpiece: The turn-taker’s doodle MUST NOT MATCH any other player’s doodle.

Analyze This!: Try NOT to doodle anything that the other players have analyzed that you will!

Plus: ESP—Extra Special Points if you draw the Psych-a-Doodle analysis doodle!

It plays like a mash-up of some elements of Pictionary and Squint and Taboo and perhaps a little bit of Telestrations...

name: Battle Group Commander
description: Every second counts in this action packed game of strategy and tactics, as each player attempts to take control of the battlefield and become absolute commander. Skill, cunning and tactics are the only thing that will see you through! If you think you have nerves of steel, and the strength of character to make men take the battle to the enemy under a hall of withering fire, then maybe you can be 'Battle Group Commander'! Soften the enemy up first with pop up attacks on any unit that is getting too close with the helicopter, or bombard longer-range targets with the launcher. Try and take out as much of the enemy specialists as soon as possible, but remember while you are doing all that to your enemy, they will be trying to do the same to you!

name: Lachen Lachen für Kinder
description: "Can you ride skateboard - Only when I'm sitting in the bus." This fun party question and answer game for any number of children provides 2700 possible combinations of questions and answers.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Spider-Man Vs. Doc Ock
description:
Spider-Man is up against the evil Doc Ock in this exciting new game of racing and capturing. Every player takes on the role of Spider-Man jumping onto buildings and swinging along special spaces.
Get to the clock tower and attempt to rescue Jane from Doc Ock. Fail and you may go back to start. Succeed and you can race to the finish. Don't let Dock Ock thwart your attempts to succeed.
mechanics: Area Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scooby-Doo! Cyber Chase
description:
From Publisher:

"Scooby Doo and his friends have been zapped into a computer game and a most hair-raising adventure is about to begin: the Cyber Chase!

Start off in the Science Lab and on your turn spin to see what will happen next. On your way, you need to overcome three different challenges. The Roman Coliseum, with its hungry lions, presents the first challenge. A prehistoric jungle filled with dinosaurs is the second and a Samurai warrior is the third. By winning the three challenges, you'll collect the three snacks that you need: a steak, a bone and an apple.

Along the way the Phantom Virus will try to set you back. So choose your friend: Scooby Doo, Shaggy, Velma, Daphne or Fred and let the adventure begin."
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Dumb Criminals
description:
Wanted: Dumb or Alive. Play the game that's packed with stories of blundering burglars, clumsy crooks, fumbling felons and ridiculous robbers. Are the stories true or false? Answer correctly, and your crew could pick up a load of cash. Watch out - one false move and your crew could be carted off to jail. Be the first player to make off with $50,000 in cold, hard cash and win!

Dumb Criminals is a game of simple True or False blended with high risk, high reward. Players move around the game board with their "Crew," wagering crew members on each "Heist." If a player answers a Dumb Criminals story correctly, they earn cash for every crew member they wagered. If a player answers incorrectly, those wagered crew members are carted off to jail.
The first player to earn $50,000 or the last player on the board is the winner.

Contents include: 300 Dumb Criminals Cards, 30 Crew Member Tokens, $170,000 in Play Money, 4 Playing Pieces, 1 Die, Game Board, Instructions.
mechanics: Bribery, Deduction, Player Elimination, Push Your Luck

name: Taikalamppu: Kadonneen taikalampun etsintä
description:
Description from the box:

The story goes:
Living the year 1490 in a small mountain village of Kabbudal.
On a midnight happens the that what has been fiered: the bandit chieftain Amzeh Kwallabin leads his mountain bandits to steal the most precious treasure from the village, a powerful magic lamp.

With the help of the spriti of the lamp the village has survived many a dangers: plague, sandstorms, fires and harsh winters. That's why the people of the village are terrified. The lamp must be gotten back.

The strongest men of the village try to search for the lamp in a horrific sandstorm. Men are lost, but the lamp stays hidden.

Time goes on, generations change. Afther hundreds of years the story of the magic lamp is only a legend.

Afther five hundred years.
It is year 1990. There is a hum going on in the village of Kabbudal. The explorers from the Gobi desert have brouht an unbelieveple information. The magic lamp lies still burried somewhere on the vast desert. During the excavations they have found a map, telling about the hiding of the lamp.

It can be concluded that banditchieftain Amzeh has written down the hideout for the lamp, but then died for the drienes of the desert. Unfortunately no one can read the bizare markings on the map. Only the last sentence is clear: Find the lamp - becouse it will never lose it's power.

The bravest of the village are summoned. They are tasked to to retrieve the Magic Lamp quickly, defining all the dangers. A uniquelly dangerouse mission awaits these adventurers... and you are one of them. Rememper to be careful
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement

name: Pojedynek: Dynamiczna gra szlachecka
description:
Easy game for 2 players, about dueling nobles in Poland. First game from new polish publisher Styks. The goal of the game is to defeat opponent by getting him out of life counters.
This game was designed for Polish museum Palace in Wilanow.

Here you can watch promotion video about "Pojedynek": http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=v5HHngYZUmw

The box contains:

6 nobles cards
2 reference cards
100 tiles: attack, defense, special
2 dice
Board
Rule book

name: c-jump Computer Programming Board Game
description:
Discover the fundamentals of computer programming by playing a board game! c-jump helps children to learn basics of programming languages, such as C, C++ and Java.

The game teaches basic commands of a programming language, such as "if", "else", "switch", and introduces variable "x" concept.

Skiers and snowboarders line up at the start location and race along the ski trails. Spaces on the board show statements of programming language. First player to move all skiers past the finish line is the winner.

Players calculate number of steps in the move, including addition, subtraction, division, and multiplication of small numbers. The game helps to develop understanding of a complete computer program, formed by logical sequences of commands.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Captain America: Civil War
description:
Try on the role one of the super heroes of Marvel Universe.

The game is starting from the 7 cards in your hands from the base deck plus 6 cards with super powers. Your goal is to get rid of all. The base cards are ridding in the drop's decks by colors or cost. Super powers could change the balance of the match. The winner is the first one whose hand is empty.

name: Candid Camera Game
description:
Each player secretly hides their Candid Cameras at various locations around the board and tries to force his opponents to enter those locations.

Movement around the board is determined by a die roll. Each space will force a player into a location (if open) or allow him to draw a card. Cards can be used to forgo the roll of the dice or open or close a location.

As the game progresses, more and more of your locations will be known, so play of the 'Close Shop' cards to funnel others to your locations is important.

Each time an opponent enters one of your locations, shout "Smile! You're on Candid Camera!" and take a Camera card. The first player to reach a predetermined number of Camera cards wins. Twelve cards takes about an hour to play.

name: Autobahn
description:
Objective: Be the first reaching space 69; learn traffic rules/signs
- moving by turns -

Each player moves forward according die roll. Ending on a marked space follow instructions glued into the lid.

name: Zap!
description:
From the box:

Step right up folks, and roll the dice! Roll'em fast and roll'em right. ZAP!' It's a glittering casino right in your own home.

You get dice tokens to start the game, and the object is to get just one into the center of the board by rolling the correct sequences. Sounds easy? It's not.

The danger of the game is when your opponent gets hot and blows you right off the board. But remember, the wheel of fortune spins both ways.

Roll snake eyes on the come-out and you're an automatic winner! Any other double dice roll, a 1-1, 2-2, etc., elimiates the competition. As you move closer to the middle of the board, it's more difficult to advance. You might get a little frustrated, you might get very frustrated. But hang in there, kiss those dice, and let 'em roll!

Whether you zap or get zapped, ZAP' is a lively night for all takers! 2 to 6 can play, only one can win.

name: Hockey Night
description: A trivia game about ice hockey published to promote Finnish ice hockey TV-program Hockey Night. There are 900 questions and answers included.

name: Chuck-A-Luck
description:
A simple betting game, based on the roll of three standard 6-sided dice held within a turnable cage.

From the printed rule sheet:
"You may invite any number of people to play. The first step is to set out your equipment and select a person to be Banker. The Banker pays off all bets for any agreed number of plays or time limit at the completion of which another player acts as Banker.
All numbers on the layout do not have to be sold. For example, only two or three people may participate in a single play. The profit percentage is exactly the same as if all numbers were covered.
When all bets are down on the layout, the Banker gives the cage a turn which raises and drops the dice at the opposite end of the cage. The three numbers on the top surface of the dice are the winners.
If a bettor's number appears on one die he receives the return of his stake plus a like amount (even money). If it appears on 2 dice he is rewarded with the return of his bet plus twice the amount bet (2 to 1). Three like numbers rewards the players with thrice the amount bet plus the bet (3 to 1).
Lowe's CHUCK-A-LUCK is an exact duplicate of the regulation casino game. It has all the play features of the larger size game and will give players the same high degree of enjoyment."
publishers: E. S. Lowe Company Inc., J. Chein & Co., Pressman Toy Corp.

name: Kick Punch Burp Fart Slap
description:
Black Slither Games is at it again, and this time we've gone micro. Kick, Punch, Burp, Fart, Slap is a 2-5 player micro card game based on the classic hand gesture game Rock, Paper, Scissors. KPBFS takes those hand gestures and puts them on cards, with that silly Black Slither twist.

It's incredibly fasted paced and anybody can play. Kick, Punch, Burp, Fart, Slap can be played for points, or as a drinking game. Without giving all the details away, here is how it's played. Deal out cards, turn over cards, drink if you lose, don't drink if you win, wash, rinse, repeat. Oh, and keep track of points if you care. Simple and to the point.

name: Fiske Flax
description: This is a children's game that combines memory with some maths skill. You pick a fish from the lake (that is the game board). Every fish has a number on it and you have to pick flamingos until you reach the right number or more. The problem is that a flamingo can stand either on one or two legs which is hidden from the players so you have to remember this. If you get the number right you get to keep the fish otherwise it's placed back into the lake. The first player to catch five fish wins the game.

name: Dora the Explorer Play Park Adventure Game
description: Dora and her friends are on their way to Play Park and they need YOUR help getting there! Spin the spinner and advance Dora, Boots, Tico or Isa along the path. Who will be the first to get to Play Park? Play until Dora and all her friends make it there! ! Excellent!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mini-Monster Trumpf
description:
A simple mini card game for 2 players, consisting of eight monster cards. The game is contained in Exit: The Game – The Haunted Roller Coaster.
Each player receives 4 monster cards. Then the active player calls a monster feature and its value (for example, 6 legs). The player with the higher value receives the top card of his opponent. Once a player has won all cards, the game ends.

—user summary

name: The Twilight Saga: Eclipse – The Movie Board Game
description:
Enter Into the world of the Twilight Saga

It all begins with a choice. Which path will you choose? Make your choice, then collect Friends, movie scene cards, and face the Newborn army! The more you know about the Twilight Saga: Eclipse and your friends the better your chance of winning.

Players take turns moving around in the world of the Twilight Saga. Each space on the board is part of a scene, and each space offers a challenge, either a trivia question about "Eclipse" or a strategy question (which can be a dice challenge, a voting challenge or a visualization/memory challenge). Successfully completing a challenge allows the player to collect that scene. The first player to collect all eight scenes wins!

Along their way to collecting all eight scenes, players will have to collect either Quileute or Cullen friends to help them defeat Newborn vampires. Players can also collect special Story cards to help them defeat challenges, or use Fast Movement spaces to move quickly from scene to scene.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Memory, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Voting

name: Beast Masters: The Dice Placement Game
description:
Beast Masters is a Dice Placement Game for 2-5 Players. If you grew up playing any kind of Monster raising simulation game, you will fall in love with Beast Masters!

Take the role of a young, new Beast Trainer seeking fame and fortune! Spend your time training your beast, going on adventure and confronting threats that affect the citizens of Tymuria, all of which come to a head each Season with the Grand Capital Tournament!
categories: Dice, Fantasy, Fighting, Video Game Theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Simulation, Variable Player Powers, Worker Placement

name: Wolf & Sheep Game
description:
An antique children's trick taking card game.

"Farmer Brown was looking out a window of his barn and saw the wolves after his sheep. He loaded his gun and a race began. The wolves chased the sheep, and Farmer Brown, who was also a great hunter, chased the wolves."

"'Wolf' is a most fascinating children's card game. It is played with twenty cards by two, three or four players."

name: Nascar Speedway Challenge
description:
~Note it is difficult to find info on this game, but here is text taken from a website that has this game for purchase~
NASCAR races have been the nation's most popular spectator sport, and now the excitement can be enjoyed at home! The NASCAR Speedway Challenge is one of two NASCAR-licensed racing board games available. The game simulates the thrills of stock car racing with die, 32 pit cards and four Racing Champion 1:144th-scale die cast cars

name: Wallis's New Game of Universal History and Chronology
description:
A roll-and-move racing game with 138 spaces illustrating persons and events from history in chronological order. In the centre of the gameboard one can see a depiction of George, the Prince Regent, later George IV. The game was accompanied by a 34 page booklet of rules and specifics regarding the "chronology of the most remarkable events from the creation to the present time." The book of rules was printed by F. Vigurs, 14 York Street, Covent Garden.

An event 604 A.D.: The first church of St. Paul built in London by Ethelbert.

An event 1804: Buonaparte crowned Emperor of the French.

name: Bouquet
description: Trivia game about wines. Choose to play as an amateur, professional or connoisseur. Roll the dice, move your cork and attempt to answer from 900 questions in six categories, Grapes, Region, Estate/Producer, Spirits, Fortified Wines and Vocabulary.

name: Dr. Seuss's ABC
description: Players move along a track of 52 spaces (A a B b C c . . . Z z), and if the first to land on a square they take and keep a matching card with an image and word or phrase from the book upon which the game is based. Movement is determined by a spinner; each result can be taken either as a number (1-4), or "BIG" or "little" which advances one to the next upper- or lowercase lettered space. Game ends when the last player reaches the end, and the winner is the player who holds the most cards. Recommended for ages 3+.

name: WW2 France
description:
From the One Page Wars game series.

In this simple World War II game, the Germans battle the US and British across an area map of France. Units are rated for attack, defense, and movement. There are two scenarios.
categories: Print & Play, Wargame, World War II

name: Do you look like your dog?
description:
From the Press Release:

In this outrageous game, players match dogs to owners and owners to dogs, and try to earn bones from other players, who vote on the best matches. Players have 30 seconds to state their case and bury their bones. And just when you think you are home free, you may find your opponent sneaking into your doghouse, and referring to you as a Shih Tzu! In the end, everyone’s bark is worse than their bite! Each game comes with 20 Owner Cards, 20 Dog Cards, 8 Go to the Dog House Cards, 24 Bones, 4 Tokens and game board. Complete game rules included. Designed for 2-4 players. Ages 7+

name: Sulttaanin Jalokivet
description:
Sultan's Gems

The players are adventurers looking for a hidden treasure in a non-specified Oriental land. The treasure is hidden in a cave, but first the players must visit three other way points (City, Oasis and Mountains). In the way points they can change their method of transport - by Foot (1 space at a time), by Camel (2 spaces) or Jeep (3 spaces). This is an important choice because on the way, they must pick up number cards from numbered spaces; entry to the cave requires a certain set of numbers, which may also change during the game. There are also event cards which may help or hinder the players.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Muumien sanasirkus
description:
Muumien sanasirkus is a box with two seperate games. Both games are use letter tiles and the aim is to create words with the tiles. The theme of the game is based on the Muumi characters.

Game is a Finnish Game of the Year 2008 finalist.
categories: Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip, Word Game

name: Færdselsspil
description:
In this game you have to drive from your car park, around the city and return - you have to drive as good and safe as possible, following the traffic rules!
During your drive, several things can occur and you can be asked to recognize the different traffic signs.
The winner is the one first to arrive back in the car park.

The game has changed a bit over the years and has been made in different editions:

1st Edition (1950s): Colourful board with a lot of humoristic graphics

2nd Edition (early 1960s): The game gets a name change, and the board gets a redesign; the ferry in the lower left corner is moved, the parking is moved to that spot and the board gets less colours and different graphics.

3rd edition (late 1960s): The game gets it's old name back. Not much more information is known about this edition.

4th edition (1977): Board is back to the original design with ferry, in colour and a lot of drawings again. The game is revised to follow the Traffic Code activated May 1st 1977.

5th edition (1990s): New publisher and new name. A modernized design, but still with the original idea. More rules are put into the game as well as a point system and more means of transportation.

Probably the same game as Færdselsspil.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Racing, Trivia
publishers: (Unknown), Damm / Egmont, Nordiska Papperskompaniet Ab: Oy Pohjoismaiden Paperikomppania, Palet spil, PK Pohjoismaiden Paperikomppania, Top-Game

name: Votum
description:
from the game rules translation

A true-to-life game about election victories and majorities
for 4 to 6 players.
The unique game VOTUM allows you to play the exciting role of a party leader, who might belong to the generation of the grandsons of the present-day greats.
Votum is a fast and talkative, sometimes loud and often clever game: it requires decisive bargaining, a little luck, and, above all, else the gift of negotiation.
Each player is responsible as the trustworthy chairman of a political party, whom he leads through three legislative sessions, that is, game rounds. During each session, five elections take place followed by the formation of the government. The goal is to advance as far as possible in the parliament. Advancement comes, on the one hand, through luck (namely, your cards) and the way you use it, that is, playing the right cards at the right time, and, on the other hand, through skillful negotiation with your fellow players about posts and their related points.
Success is measured in points. Each player has a sixth of the game field (the plenary hall) in front of him, his points are marked in the track of his color. After 15 elections, the strongest party-chairman wins; that is, the one with the most points.

name: Veturi
description:
The Veturi (translation Locomotive) game is teaching young children the order of numbers, by placing cards, with carriages numbered 1-10, in sequences after a locomotive card.

To win the game, the player has to be the first to get rid of all his carriage cards, by placing them in the right order from 1 to 10. Bonus cards are used as blank carriages, not effecting the order of the carriage card to be placed next.

Components:
1 locomotive card
50 carriage cards (5 sets numbered 1-10)
4 bonus cards
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Number, Trains

name: Moose Boose
description:
Bring a miniaturized classic country fair atmosphere into your own home. Filled with moose calls, bidding and trading, Moose Boose gives a whole new meaning to the half-and-half concept.

Own the winning square by purchasing from or trading with your opponents. But be careful! The winning square might already be yours right from the start! Moose Boose is a strategic game of luck and is ideal for entertaining the whole family and friends.

Apportez à la maison l'ambiance des foires agricoles en un classique miniaturisé. Agrémenté de cris d'orignal, d'enchères et d'échanges, Moose Boose réinvente le concept des moitié-moitié.

Procurez-vous la case gagnante en achetant ou en échangeant avec vos adversaires. Mais attention! Il se peut que vous possédiez la bonne case dès le départ! Moose Boose est un jeu de hasard stratégique, idéal et «orignal» pour amuser toute la famille et les amis.

name: Das Bürokraten-Spiel
description: Following the "success" of "Der Weg zum Erfolg" this is another game using the "Malefiz"-mechanic with a slapped-on theme (in this case the books of Israeli satirist Ephraim Kishon, very popular at the time in Germany). Production values are high, but the game feels endless.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Big Fix
description:
The Big Fix is a strategic and psychological card game that puts each player in the shoes of one of Film Noir’s most iconic roles. As the Private Investigator, the Femme Fatale (or Homme Fatale), the Politician and more, players uncover clues and trick their friends, all while searching for their enemies’ true intentions. Six roles, five agendas, and twelve character cards combine randomly so that a new story is told every time you play.

From top to bottom, The Big Fix is designed to play and feel like a Film Noir. Our goal was to create a game which is not only fun and strategically deep, but makes its players think and act like they were a character in a Film Noir. The game emphasizes individual agendas, simultaneous and interconnected player storylines, and temporary alliances driven by mutual benefit - all of which are key themes and motives in Film Noir. Winning at The Big Fix requires strategy, cunning, and a hard-boiled attitude.

name: WWJD: What Would Jesus Do? The Game
description:
This group discussion game challenges you to look at the role of Jesus in your life as you explore over 600 thought-provoking questions. Each question deals with life's everyday dilemmas and provides answers on how you might respond to them. Would you take the easy route in these situations or ask the ultimate question- What Would Jesus Do?

Start the challenge now! Answer a question and receive points for players who correctly predict your answer. As you gain points, win special letter tokens. Be the first to collect W,W,J, and D and you win the game! Learn more about your friends, family, and yourself in this controversial and conversational game.

name: African Kingdoms
description: A war-strategy game themed around the African Kingdoms of the Nok, Kush, Ghana and Zulu Warriors. Players choose sides and place their army pawns and chips on the map board corresponding to their warriors colors. Warrior cards are also distributed which allow players to take advantage of special warring capabilities during a turn. The game then proceeds in a series of battles whose outcome is determined by a combination of die rolling, warrior card usage and type of pawn used in battle. Successful battles earn victory points (chips) and territory. The object of the game is to accumulate 8 victory points and be declared the winning warrior.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Dice Rolling, Secret Unit Deployment, Variable Player Powers

name: National Geographic Geo Bee Challenge Game
description:
A geography trivia game. The object of the game is to be the first player to collect 12 Golden Geo Awards. You win the Geo Awards by answering questions correctly. You lose the Geo Awards by answering questions incorrectly. The GeoBee cards have two types of trivia questions--"novice" and "experienced"--to accommodate players ages 8 and up.

On a turn you use the popping dice randomizer then move your pawn the indicated number of spaces. If you land on a GeoBee, True/False, or Explore space, you will have to answer one of the respective question cards. To answer a trivia question on an "Explore" card, you must point to one of the continents or water bodies (river, sea, ocean) on the board as the answer to the question. If you land on a space occupied by another player(s), you read one of the GeoBee questions and they need to answer it. If you land on a star space you get a free Golden Geo Award, and if land on a Tourist space, you get a card that might be good or bad.

name: Pimp City
description:
Pimp City is the party game where you’re the pimp and your objective is to move your whore around the board, make the most money, and become the New Pimp Daddy!

Pimp City has Cat Fights, Trick Ownership, Truth or Dare options, Neighborhood Watch Cards, Slammer Time, Sugar Daddies, Big Tippers, The Alley, and even Revenge!

Home Page: http://www.pimpcitythegame.com/

name: The Simpsons: Go For It, Dude
description: The object of the game is to be first to climb to the top of the grade chart. The cards are dealt face down to the players who then take turn to place their top-of-the-deck card face up in the middle of the table. When two cards with matching family members come up, the player that is first to slam his/her hysteria card in the middle gets to move up one step on the grade chart.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Sodan ja rauhan tie
description: Sodan ja rauhan tie (The road of war and peace) is a historical board game, were the players travel to 21 different places throughout the Ostrobothnia region of Finland and run across interesting people and events from the time period 1596 to 1918. The movement is controlled by rolling dice as well as answering questions about real events and persons. In the booklet, each place is given a short historical description.

name: Blik op de eeuw spel
description:
'Blik op de eeuw spel' is a Dutch game, published by PTT Post (Dutch postal service) at the end of the 20th centrury for promotional use.

The game has a lot in common with Trivial Pursuit. Players have to get all of their three pawns to the middle of the gameboard. Winner is the first player to do so. Pawns are moved by roling a d6, a pawn can only be moved towards the middle of the board by answering a question correctly.

There are 10 categories of questions, each category covers one decade of the 20th century.

There also exists an edition that comes in a tin box.
publishers: Identity Games International B.V., PTT Post

name: Bible Search
description:
From the rulebook:

The object of the game is to be the first player to locate the hidden "Treasure of Knowledge" (Proverbs 2:4,5)

The first player to complete five destination requirements receives the "Treasure of Knowledge," and thus, wins the game. This is done by traveling to various destinations on the game board and also solving two riddles during the course of the game. The answer to each of the two riddles points to one of the 93 illustrated circles on the game board.

name: Guilty Pleasures
description:
A trivia game rooted firmly in the realm of pop culture. Players answer questions based on everything from celebrity gossip to the plots of movies.

Publisher Blurb:

Guilty Pleasures is the pop-culture trivia game that asks the question "Are you willing to admit how much you know?" Players move around the game board while attempting to answer questions that they might not want to admit they know. For example, do you know...

What pop star diva once shook her finger at a police officer and called him a bitch after the police interrupted a romantic meal to arrest her husband?

Or...

What reality show pitted luminaries Star Jones and Nobel Prize winner George Fitzgerald Smoot III against schoolchildren?

Trivia categories include: TV Sitcoms & Dramas, Movies, Reality TV, Books & Tabloids, and Miscellaneous.

The game includes: 300 Guilty Pleasure trivia cards, a game board, 6 markers, 36 tokens, and easy-to-follow game rules.

name: Woof Woof
description:
The first game invented by a dog... Not recommended for cats!

A game that would even give a dog the creeps. Instead of dice, you throw a dog and a bone. In the box there are 12 fields (like the field on a clock). The position of the dog (standing, on its side or on its back) and the place in the box give (or take) points. Also the place of the bone gives points. The first one to reach 100 points is the winner. A very nice game to play in a pub.

Similar to:

Pass the Pigs
publishers: Crown & Andrews Ltd., I Libri del No, Irwin Toy Ltd., Kärnan, Schmidt Spiele, Selecta Spel en Hobby

name: Konkurrer med vaskebjørnene
description:
(From the box - translated from Norwegian)

Konkurrer med vaskebjørnene (Raccoon wash)

Come and join in the fun and hectic cloth wash chaos! The raccoons try to recover the right t-shirts for their sets of cloths from the washing machines - the player first player to find the t-shirts on his/her three secret tiles wins the game. But... on the way to the washing machines your raccoon have to find the tiles that is needed to open the right washing machines. The raccoon may also find a lucky joker tile or get a chance to have a peek into one of the washing machines. Who will be the first to recover the right t-shirts for their set of cloths and win the game?

name: PRECISION
description:
In PRECISION, Players take turns pulling cards and stacking geometrical pieces on an unstable, rocking base.

Payers pull the topmost card from the deck containing:
Numbers 1-5
Skip
Reverse
Circle

Players play until the structure falls over and whoever causes the collapse is the loser. If a player places the last piece on the board they are the winner and the game can restart.

—description from the publisher

name: Armor of God
description: Based upon Ephesians 6:11, this board game teaches children the specific purpose of each piece of the armor of God in practical ways they can successfully use them in their daily lives.

name: Husqvarna
description:
Husqvarna is a promotional card game provided by Husqvarna Poland LLC. In the game players are gardeners who are testing new Husqvarna equipment in an experimental garden. The goal of the game is to cultivate grass, shrubs and trees.

The board is made from plant cards which players will mow during the course of the game. There are three more types of cards: clothing cards, equipment cards and power cards. Different types of clothing allows players to mow different types of plants, which has to be mowed using corresponding equipment. The power cards are used to provide energy for the equipment.

The players take their turns alternatively. Each turn a player may change his cards and mow the plants. After that he draws new cards. Each plant is worth 1, 2 or 3 points. More valuable plants needs more energy to mow. There are also bonus points for players that get the most plant cards in each category. The game ends when all plants are mowed. The player with the most points is the winner.
mechanics: Hand Management, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: The Hokie Hike
description: The Hokie Hike is the Virgina Tech game where the object of the game is to be the first player to accumulate 200 credits and reach Burruss Hall for graduation. Unlike Techopoly, The Hokie Hike is not a generic game and was designed only for Virginia Tech.
publishers: Virginia Polytechnic Institute & State University: Extension Division

name: Playball Card Game
description:
From the box: "This fast moving card game has all the action of a real baseball game. Players take turns at bat and in the field. You can strike out, foul out, tag a runner at first, hit a home run, field a foul ball and more."

The game box also functions as a score keeping device by marking the score with the provided paperboard bats into slots at the proper numbers. The game is mostly dictated by the spinner and the cards are primarily the game board and status markers for the spinner results. The one exception is the fielding cards which will give variable results for base running after hits are spun. There is little to no decision making in the game as it is totally run by the spinner and fielding cards.

The instructions are in English and French.

name: Changing Society
description:
A Monopoly clone with a twist... you are never forced out of the game... you just become your descendant, go back on welfare, and keep going.

Components restrict the game to six, but any number can play. Players keep going until a set time limit is reached (I suggest at least 2 hours) or when the there is only one player left in the game (if played without descendants). If descendants are being used, the game is never ending and can go on indefinitely.

The highs and lows of society are portrayed by spaces on the board. Businesses may be bought and sold, players may get a higher education, join a Co-op, become a thief, enter the military, etc.

An additional random element is in the form of 'Change' cards. With the draw of a card you can become an alcoholic, get busted and sent to prison, become a parent of quintuplets, etc. Because there are only 54 of these cards, they seem to come up again and again... expecially when six are playing.

Elections make the game the most fun. During an election, players are encouraged to put issues to a vote... majority rules. This allows aspects of the game rules to be changed or outright ingored! Because of this, interesting things can happen, for example: elimination of taxes or a military coup d'etat.

name: Shark Tank: The Game
description:
Based on the hit reality television show about pitching business ideas to big name investors for a chance to score real success. In this home version, the player with the largest net worth after six company pitches wins!

Players take turns being the Entrepreneur, taking a pitch out of a large deck of theoretical products and selling it to their friends the best they can. Their friends bid, or don't, and if one wins, they get to back the company and get any rewards associated with it. Get bonus money for backing projects that match your investor's area of expertise.

Caveat: The rules say this requires a die, specifically a d3 of colors, but one is not included. Most homes can easily use a d6 and designate two numbers each for the three colors, though.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation

name: Burger Pile-Up!
description:
The dealer deals three cards to each player and gives each one a bottom bun. The dealer then replaces the remaining cards in a pile with the number face down.

The first player to build a burger consisting of 10 topping cards, numbered lowest to highest, wins!

—description from the inside of the box

name: Urban Legends: The Game
description:
The game where you and the other players must face and survive Urban Legends. Some legends award you when they come true, others hurt you, and some even kill you. In this game though, death is not the end! Good luck is rewarded with karma points, and the first player with 12 karma points wins.

Includes: a game board, 108 Urban Legend cards, 6 game markers, 72 karma point tokens, a die, and easy-to-learn game rules.

name: Attorney Power
description: Ready to practice law? ATTORNEY POWER (1982) will give you a corner office and as many clients as you can handle, but you have to give correct advice to real legal problems. ATTORNEY POWER will give you the opportunity to conduct a bar investigation, neglect to file a lawsuit, give advice on changing a will, decide where to sue, and many more real life legal problems. The game has paralegals, fee gougers and client stealers, as well as 56 evidence and liability rulings based upon recent court decisions in both criminal and civil law.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Lose a Turn, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement

name: Empire: Make History on Your Living Room Floor
description: Risk-like battle game. The twist is a series of cards which allow players to take advantage of scientific advances and historical events from the 1800’s into the future. Components include 8 Dice, 100 Empire Cards, 6 sets of 50 Unit Markers and 6 Capitol Markers.
mechanics: Area Movement, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: Runner's World Marathon Game
description:
Get ready to move fast, and take risks- for you're in your favorite marathon running for new records. The strategy is up to you, as you change your pace throughout the RUNNER'S WORLD MARATHON GAME.

Feel the agony of sore feet. Sense the excitement of victory. Plan your strategy for a race that takes you and your opponents on a road of challenge and decision.

If you've run a marathon, you'll appreciate the inevitable pitfalls of thirst and potential injury. If you've never run a marathon, here's your chance. The RUNNER'S WORLD MARATHON GAME is the finest running strategy game ever created.

Strategy is of such importance that the game can be enjoyed by enthusiastic adult players yet simple enough for children to play


According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": The opportunity to vary one's pace - from walk to sprint - adds strategic options to this realistic version of the popular race.

name: Scarney 3000
description: Another member of the Farkel family (along with Cosmic Wimpout), Scarney 3000 uses 5 dice upon which the 2 and the 5 have been replaced with the word "Scarney". Points are scored for rolling Scarneys or for rolling 3 or more of a kind on one roll, but you're not allowed to score your roll until (a) you've collected at least 200 points for this series of rolls and (b) you've rolled at least one Scarney. If you can't (or choose not to) score your current roll, you must re-roll all non-scoring dice, or all 5 dice if they're all used in scoring (e.g., a Scarney and four 3s). First player or team to 3000 wins.
publishers: John Scarne Games, Inc., Stackpole Games

name: The Houndcats Game
description: Based on the Houndcats animated series, this is a typical early 70's spin the dial and move game. The object of the game is to be the player that reaches the most "trouble spots" at the end of the game ("Sparkplug to the rescue!"). A deck of cards is shuffled and the first card is drawn and placed on the appropriate spot on the playing board. Each player then spins the dial once, and EACH player must move their playing piece with the intention of reaching the spot with the trouble card (the spaces on the spinner have a number 0,1,2, or 3, related to each players color so during each spin, each player moves their playing piece the number of spaces indicated for the color of their playing piece). Pieces can move forward or backwards and any number of players can occupy the same space. Once a player lands on the card that represents the trouble spot, the card is taken by that player and a new card is drawn and the process repeats.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Ambition 5000
description: Ambition 5000 is a dice game where you try to get to 5000 points. It uses 3 special dice marked "A", "P", "D", "50" or "100". Special rules allow for surprising turns of events.

name: Don't Wake The Chicken
description:
Eier Klauen / Don't Wake the Chicken is an electronic dexterity game. The game consists of 3 x 12 eggs (small, medium, large) and an electronic chicken. The goal is to take out as many eggs as possible from underneath the chicken's wings. Once the chicken makes a sound, the last egg the player wanted to take, is taken out of the game and the next player takes his/her turn.

In the end (when all eggs are either caught or taken out of the game) the number of eggs and the size of them make out the score. Large eggs are 3 points, medium ones 2 and small eggs only 1 point. The player with the most points wins. Ages 6 years and older.

From the box:

Penny the Chicken has laid a lot of eggs. She doesn't want anybody to take them. If you try to take them she will squawk loudly! Can you trick Penny and steal her eggs? If you are gentle and clever you can slowly take them - one by one. But if she clucks then you have lost your turn. The winner is the player with the most eggs.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic

name: Pilgrim's Progress
description:
PILGRIM'S PROGRESS has a similar theme and name to another entry on the database but is an entirely different game.

From the box:

"The PILGRIM'S PROGRESS board game faithfully recreates the wealth of atmosphere from Bunyan's classic all time best seller. In your progress to the Celestial City from the City of Destruction, you may meet any of the Characters just as Christian did. The progress you make along the route takes you through the Slough of Despond, you may stay at Palace Beautiful, encounter the dangers of meeting Apollyon in the Valley of the Shadow or get captured and taken off to Doubting Castle.

You must plan, pray and prepare for each encounter, for only your prayer and determination protect and spur you on.

All together PILGRIM'S PROGRESS creates an exciting and totally absorbing game within an authentic and informative format that will excite all ages and provide a wonderful teaching aid whilst being tremendous fun to play."

name: Jeu de la Révolution Française
description:
A race game for any number of players taking place on a board depicting events of the French Revolution. The game was produced during the revolution, apparently for propaganda purposes.

Players advance from the fall of the Bastille towards the National Assembly. Players landing on certain spaces are required to pay tokens and/or suffer other penalties. Players falling into the well must await rescue by another player. A player in prison must await another player to take his place. A player landing on the Death square must return to the start. The winner is the first player to land on the final space, by exact count.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Ottawa on Board
description:
From the excitement of the Canada Day fireworks and the frozen fun of Winterlude, to the hi-tech innovation of Silicon Valley North and the intrigue of national politics, Ottawa is truly an amazing city. Queen Victoria and Colonel By sure knew how to pick a unique and exciting Capital. Where else can you skate for seven kilometers on a frozen canal, stop and eat a world famous Beaver Tail (no, not the kind on the nickel), and visit a national museum all in one day. It can only be Ottawa, the coolest city in Canada.

Now, how would you like to own it? Ottawa On Board is a unique real estate trading game that celebrates our Nation's Capital, as well as the businesses, attractions and people that make it so special. Roll the dice to advance your custom game token around the boar until you buy up all of Ottawa's special properties.

Hey, the city is yours for the taking! Are you ready for the challenge? Proceeds raised from the sale of Ottawa On Board will go to support the Children's Hospital of Eastern Ontario (CHEO).
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Die drei ??? und das brennende Schwert
description:
Another in the Die Drei??? series, which are based on a popular series of books. Three detectives named Justus, Peter and Bob must solve this mystery with clever card play!

Contents
1 Gameboard
4 Pawns
27 Riddle cards
3 Detective cards
3 Game play cards
1 Game rules
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Baseball
description:
Players flip cards and try to score as many runs as they can before totaling three outs. Basic baseball rules are followed.

The player with the most runs after 9 innings wins.

The cards include (total=38; 36 + 2 instruction cards):
Ball (10)
Strike (10)
Foul Ball (2)
Foul Out (1)
Fly Out (2)
Out (double play at second) (1)
Out (double play at first) (1)
Single (2)
Double (2)
Triple (1)
Home Run (1)
Hit by Pitcher (1)
Stolen Base (1)
Balk (1)

Includes:
8.5x11 page with baseball diamond

name: Moods & Faces
description:
52 cards in sets of four, each depicting a face that is revealing a certain look; smiling, frowning, angry, etc.
I don't have the rules so I don't know more details. The cards are beautifully illustrated. Could be a Snap type game (although the cards would not suit a children's game). I would think it had more adult appeal.

name: Pippi Langstrumpf Puzzlejagd
description:
Childrens game where the players race to complete a jigsaw first.

Each player chooses a different colour and is given the eight pieces that will make up a picture of Pippi Langstrumpf. In your turn, you roll the special die. The die has freckles instead of numbers except for the face that shows the monkey Herr Nilsson. If the monkey is rolled, that player can start to assemble his jigsaw and he may continue to try until another player rolls the monkey and cries "Stop!". Then that player can start his jigsaw. It continues in this way until someone has completed the puzzle and that person is the winner.

name: Dirk Stikeez Spel
description:
The Dutch supermarket 'Dirk' provides 'Stikeez' (little figures with a suction cup) together with a boardgame. Next to 1 'Stickee' per person you also need a 6-sided die. The youngest player may begin.

It's a roll and move game, comparable to the Game of Goose. On certain places there are some penalties or bonuses. Different from the Game of Goose: when you land on a 'Stikeez' place, you may move again the same number of pips you rolled. If you land on a place with already another 'Stickee', you may move 1 place further. The first player who land exactely on place 63 is the winner.
publishers: Brand Loyalty Special Promotions, Dirk, Lidl, Zing Toys

name: Monopoly: Disney Vacation Club
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Another version of the classic Monopoly. This time the cases represent the Disney Vacation Club.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Dolfje Weerwolfje: Dolle Volle Maan Kaartspel
description:
Card game starring "Dolfje Weerwolfje" werewolf kid hero from children's books.

Variant of Uno. There are cards that can only played when the moon is out, cards that can only be played during daylight, and cards that turn the day to night (or night to day).
In addition, some cards have special effects e.g. change the direction in which is played.

The first player to discard all of his cards, wins the game!

name: Scandal the Game
description: Board game based on the ABC series, Scandal. A collect and deliver type gameplay with trivia.

name: Kaksintaistelu
description:
Learn by playing program: Familygame for 8 years and up.

From the box:
Kaksintaistelu is a dice game for two players, where you need to count correctly. There will be no numbers over 12, but combinations that the two dice in the game can give are several. The game will teach the younger players how the dots in the dice can give the same result in many different combinations. For example: the sum 8 can be made from 6+2, 5+3 and 4+4.
Like in Tic-Tac-Toe, you are trying to get your pieces in lines while trying to stop your opponent from doing the same.
Both players get 29 pawns (red or yellow) And you get the points for the length of the lines you have made. The lines have to be echelon.

name: Knight Rider: KITT vs KARR Card Game
description:
Lifelong rivals KITT and KARR go head-to-head in a destructive battle for victory. Drain your opponent’s energy by racing around the map and performing stunts to either attack or defend.

Players choose a Drive card from their hand to
play face down. When flipped over, whoever has the fastest speed goes first. If the colour button matches your previous card you can choose to activate a stunt.

Stunts can be used to attack your opponent, defend an attack or move past or through roadblocks. To perform stunts, players have to perform trick-shots with their car discs.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Racing
mechanics: Area Movement, Hand Management, Open Drafting, Player Elimination, Slide/Push

name: ToeJam & Earl Tabletop Remix
description:
Celebrate 30 years of funk! ToeJam and Earl take it to the tabletop in this brand-new Rogue like Party Board Game, where players can experience new and different levels every session!

Be the first player to find and collect 3 Rocketship pieces - while not letting the Earthlings trip you up! Players roll dice and move along the track collecting rocket ship pieces and presents. Every present is different and may just give you the winning edge!

ToeJam & Earl Tabletop Remix is fully compatible with Yooka-Laylee and Mutant Mudds Game Decks board games! Mix and match for some truly funky results!
mechanics: Modular Board, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Track Movement

name: The World Council: Cold War
description: The Cold War expansion includes a new gaming mode. Councilors will split into two teams. While following your leader to fulfill the teams' achievement, your opponents will also try to stop you. Everyone in this game are able to change they faction when they pay the cost, which will make the game more unpredictable!
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Farming, Industry / Manufacturing, Negotiation, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Regentropfenspiel
description: This game tries to teach very young children about rain. In the game, the colored die moves "raindrops" up the rainbow and over to the cloud to then fall on the fruit trees. You score fruit baskets if enough rain falls on your turn.
publishers: Otto Maier Verlag, Το Καλό Παιχνίδι Α.Ε.

name: Addition Bingo
description: Addition Bingo is an educational children's version of Bingo, designed to teach children addition, while retaining the flavor of Bingo.

name: Kraft Heinz Variety Game Pack
description:
Kraft Heinz Variety Game Pack contains three food-themed family games in themed packaging:


KRAFT Macaroni & Cheese Game: Satisfy your cravings by rolling the dice to play matching noodle cards and push the Cheesasaurus Rex piece up the Noodle Meter — but make sure you don't run out of noodles!
JELL-O Jiggler Slap Game: This card game is a quick-thinking, hand-slapping treat. Be the first to slap the correct card on the JELL-O gelatin flavor that's called out to win. You might even have to wiggle and jiggle for your favorite flavor!
HEINZ Ketchup Dice Game: It’s HEINZ ketchup or bust in this press-your-luck game of risk versus reward! Roll the dice and collect as much ketchup as possible to score 57 points.


These three games are available only in this set and are not sold separately.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game, Dice, Math, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Matching, Open Drafting, Push Your Luck, Speed Matching

name: Flaming Continent: Record of the Three Kingdoms Ver. Lord
description:
Flaming Continent: Record of the Three Kingdoms Ver. Lord is a board game that allows you play as a lord in Three Kingdoms. The game also support AI batter for 0 player.

There are 4 seasons in a round. In each round, player should bid different actions and active them. Players are trying to control the most areas to win the game.
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Area Movement, Simulation

name: Blackmail
description: Set up surveillance cameras to blackmail opponents, send them blackmail letters, receive wage increments or reductions, hire thugs and private investigators or even let the FBI on someone's blackmail scam.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement, Trading

name: The Shakespeare Game
description:
Victorian game in which each of the 52 cards represents a scene from a Shakespeare play (with fabulous card art!) and has a quote from that play printed on it. It could be played in any of three ways.
In the preferred method, a slightly souped-up version of "Authors," the player to the left of the dealer reads the quote on one of his cards. If the next player knows which play the quote is from and needs that card for a set of the four scenes from that play, he gets it. Completed sets are laid down on the table, and whoever has the most sets at the end of the game wins.
"When mere amusement is desired and the educational feature not cared for," the second game play method is the most basic version of "Authors" in which the players ask each other if they have a card for a particularly play. The third game play method is, strangely, a non-bidding four-handed partnered trick-taking game in which the four series of scenes substitute for the four suits in a regular card deck, with the "A" series always being trump.
The maximum number of players for the third method is four. The maximum number for the other methods could be higher, but it might prove difficult to build sets. The approximate playing time is a guess.
Bottom line: I guess they knew their Shakespeare a lot better at the start of the 20th century than we know him at the start of the 21st.
publishers: Cincinnati Game Co., Fireside Game Co., Merrimack Publishing Corp.

name: Barbary Coast War
description:
As described on the back cover: "Take a side in the first war against terror fought by the young United States against the Barabary [sic] Coast Nations. Historically the War lasted from 1801 till about 1806. The War started when the Barabary [sic] Nations would board vessels that flew the US flag and take those US citizens as slaves. The U.S. DID at first pay tribute the the [sic] Bradshaw [sic] of Tripoli which did make the US a vassel [sic] State of the Ottoman Empire (technically speaking). How and if the United States wins is up to you."

From the Guild of Blades "Empires of History" series of Axis and Allies style historical games. Based very loosely on America's war with the Barbary pirates.

Components (all in black and white): small 4.5x6x1.5" box, 11x17" paper game map, rules, cut-em-yourself counters, ten-sided die, errata sheet.

name: The Hunchback of Notre Dame
description:
See the festival of fools unfold as you move Quasimodo from space to space, flipping up street scenes to reveal his path. As you play, help him hide his friends, Esmeralda and Phoebus, from his evil master, Frollo. Move them along the Diamond Path to the Cathedral. Try to find the crown token to crown Quasimodo the king of fools. If you do, and Quasimodo reaches the Cathedral’s rooftop, you win. Then help Quasimodo battle evil Frollo to free everyone forever.

Featuring a special flip-up game board, that flips up as Quasimodo moves ahead, and a 3D cathedral, 3D place markers, and 3D Festival events.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
publishers: Hasbro, MB Jeux, MB Spellen, Milton Bradley

name: Emil i Lönneberga
description:
Based on the books by Astrid Lindgren, players are Emils and, as usual, are up to all kinds of mischief on a daily basis. They move on the board by rolling the die and if caught (landing on a red mischief space) they get grounded in the snickarboden (wood shed) in the center of the board, and have to carry on from there on their next turn. First to reach the finish wins.

Components: Game board, four playing pieces, six-sided die.

Note: Not to be confused with another Alga game with the same name and the same theme, Emil i Lönneberga.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: The War Room: The Persian Gulf Conflict
description:
Played on a map of the Middle East. 4 factions are
Blue: Saudi Arabia, Oman, Qatar, UAE.
Green: Egypt, Jordan, Syria, Turkey, Sinai,Israel, Lebanon.
Red: Iraq, Kuwait, Iran.
Amber: Sudan, Ethiopia, Somalia Yemen.

All forces are equal in units and types. Combat is A&A like with different hit numbers based on attacking and defending units. All factions has a deck of action cards.

Teams are Blue/Green Vs Red/Amber.

Has timed moves
mechanics: Area Movement, Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Windkracht 10 spel
description:
"Windkracht 10" was in 1997-98 a rather successful Belgian TV series on a "search and rescue" team located in the military base at Koksijde on the Belgian coast. This family boardgame was published in 2006 to accompany the launch of the unavoidable movie.

The game simulates the rescue missions. The board divides the Belgian coast and part of the sea in sectors. You have to respond to an SOS, pick up the survivors with one of the six helicopters and transport them to a nearby hospital corresponding with your playing color. The helicopters can be moved by all the players. Each player decides in secret how many spaces each chopper will move. You gain points for each successful delivery (the number of points depends on the mission). After a fixed amount of missions, the player with the most points wins. Event cards spice up the game.

The game contains 6 cardboard "3D" Seeking rescue-choppers.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Piratack
description:
From the press release:

Aaarr! Hoist your sails and set your course for high seas adventure in Piratack. This thrilling new board game beckons you into a world where all can join in swashbuckling fun. Players must throw caution to the winds as their ships voyage through tranquil and stormy seas or pass through whirlpools. Ships must trade cargo to increase their strength in cannons because when time runs out…
You can’t escape…
PIRATACK!
In the end, the fiercest will battle for the ultimate sovereign rule as Piratitan!

name: Bible Baseball
description:
The Bible teams up with America’s favorite pass time.

Made by Rhythm Band in 1984 for 2 or more players.

Contents include: game board, 4 pawns, 4 card decks (single, double, triple, and home run), and the instructions.

name: Quest Master: Small World
description:
The game in roll and move mechanic with Quest Master theme and without cards.

Each player roles a class as Quest Master and each space its move by the dice rolled has the event that affect differently for each class.

The game has modular boards that allows players set them up in any sequence or any pieces they want or not want to play.

During the game, while they roll and move to the goal space, there are events that may sometimes affect specific class or role to be advantage or obstruction to that player.

Goal is reaching to the goal space as simple roll and move mechanic games.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Love Trivia
description:
Similar to Trivial Pursuit with 2500 questions and answers on seduction.
Players roll the dice, move around the board and answer the fun questions collecting the pieces of each color.

Love Trivia Gold is a real encyclopedia of everything you need to know. Over 500,000 games sold to date.

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: Throwdown Edition
description:
From the publisher´s website:

With Watch Ya’ Mouth Throwdown Edition, 4-10 players face off in our mouthy mashup of all your favorite bar games, relay race activities, and acting, singing, and drawing throwdowns —with some social media twists.

name: Laruna: Age of Kingdoms
description:
Age of Kingdoms (AOK) is an epic-fantasy 4x board game where players lead the nations of Laruna in their quest to earn the favor of the gods. As powerful magic wielding rulers, players will fight, trade, and spell-sling their way into the god’s good graces in their race to earn the most glory before the end of time.
With thought provoking design, this worker placement-miniature battle hybrid will have players utilizing strategy to defeat one another through careful use of spells, territory control, unit advancement and economic development.
Choosing between 10 ruler archetypes, 6 kingdoms and over 40 recruitable units, players will earn glory by way of war, trade, or mutual achievements, allowing them versatility in both their tactics and playstyle.

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Worker Placement

name: Warmaster Chess 2000: Variants
description:
Published in Command # 52-53, adds new rules and counters for the base game: Hq's, Infantry, Tanks, Artillery, Mg's or Airborne, Bulldozers and Phalanx.

It's based in an article of a Russian chess magazine of year 1933, by A.S. Yurgecevich.

—user summary

name: The Gin Game
description:
The ultimate board game for any gin lover!

It's a game of chance and twists that will test your gin knowledge. Work your way around the board by answering History cards, Mixology cards, Gin-ius cards.

name: Spectre & Vox
description:
Set in the world of Spectre and Vox in 1893, this exciting 3D table-top adventure game combines lights, sound and interactive storytelling for you to solve your own immersive mystery.

Open up your wooden chest to uncover a perfect replica of a haunted house from deep within the Spectre & Vox archives. Once assembled, download the app and input your password to activate the case file and lose yourself in your own escape room adventure.

As the story unfolds through audio files, touchpoints and immersive soundscapes, explore the rooms and use the props.

Apply your best detective and puzzle-solving skills to plot your route through this epic thriller and finally solve the mystery.

—description from the publisher

name: Help! The Game
description:
This game was released by an insurance company in Australia (NRMA).

It's time to roll the dice on everything you own. In HELP! The Game you experience real-life risks without having to risk anything. Make your way around Australia and face floods, fires, tremors, tornadoes, burglars and bin chickens. Remember to protect your assets with our HELP! domes because one wrong move could wipe you out of the game.

Whoever has the most assets still intact at the end, wins.

name: Pirater & Skatter
description: Move around on a pirate map, and collect as much treasure as possible.
mechanics: Hand Management, Point to Point Movement

name: Do the Urkel!
description:
From the back of the box:

There's lots of crazy fun when you get to be TV's favorite nerd - Steve Urkel! The challenge is to collect bow tie cards. To win them, roll a special die. To keep them, do what Steve does - like hike up your pants....laugh and snort...or say one of his favorite expressions! But watch out! Any opponent may suddenly make you DO THE URKEL - and that could lose you some cards. The first player to collect 8 cards wins!

Includes gameboard, 1 6-sided special die, 1 plastic die-rolling tray, 29 bow tie cards, 1 pair of cardboard glasses, 1 cardboard finger puppet, and instructions

name: Home Baseball Game
description:
Get a higher score than your opponent in nine innings. Two dice are rolled and added together, and the result is referenced on a chart. Possible results are hits (singles, doubles, triples and home runs), outs (including a double play), foul balls, and even wild pitches. Since individual strikes and balls are not included on the result chart, the game plays a bit faster.

The game includes 4 pegs for each player, two standard dice, and a pencil to keep score. This game, along with others is from Channel Craft's Vintage Game Series, and is part of the Collection of THE NEW YORK HISTORICAL SOCIETY. It is a replication of the McLoughlin Brothers game of the same name originally produced in 1901.
It comes in a small tin. Progress is marked with pegs, which rest in holes after each play, making it a very portable game.

name: Baryon
description:
An abstract game that uses color as an element. Each player have 3 pieces, one in each color, red green and blue. If you move a blue piece into a blue square you capture all your opponents pieces that are also on a blue square. You also get an extra turn.

You score one point for each piece you capture and win by getting five points.

name: Wróg u bram: Stalingrad 1942
description:
Wróg u bram: Stalingrad 1942 (Enemy at the gates) - 2-player game simulating one of the most interesting episodes of WWII.
This game depends strongly on a card playing mechanism. There are three types of cards: Commanders (most important), Units, and HQ Cards.
Commanders determine strength and size of your corps. They also determine your ability to play and modify HQ Cards.
Units consist of infantry, artillery and armored units.
HQ Cards are responsible for modifying battle results and the overall game situation - kind of special cards.
mechanics: Campaign / Battle Card Driven, Open Drafting

name: Marblehead
description:
You put the cardboard face around the clear plastic head and fill it with marbles. Each player gets their own plastic tray which fits under the head to collect marbles that drop out of the head after one stuck a finger through a single hole in the head.

Be the player to accumulate the most marbles by sticking your finger through the holes in the head.

name: Världs-kontroll
description:
Världskontroll is a Monopoly-stylish educational game published by the swedish fair trade association Tanzania Import.
"Världskontroll is a game about industrialized countries, underdeveloped countries, the so-called nic-countries and the multinational corporations. It deals with their roles in the economic order of the world." (translated from Swedish)
Players assume the position of either a poor, semi-poor or a rich country, or even that of a multinational corporation. The game has three different phases: in the first phase the game "simulates" the current economic world order. In the second phase some rules are changed in favor of the poor countries. In the third phase the players are to make rules that are fair to all players.

There is also an earlier version of the game called Världs-Monopol, with the only difference being the name.

According to the manual, the game has been published in Swedish, Danish, Norwegian and English. Even Finnish rules can be found.

The publishers must have had at least production help from Alga even though this is not credited anywhere; the box is standard Alga size and quality, money is standard Alga money (with even the Alga logos included!) and the dice and playing pieces are also Alga standard - depending on edition, houses and hotels from Monopoly or factories from Nya Finans to represent the "large" and "small" factories in this game, player pawns and plastic stands for the cards as used in several Alga games.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Legal Decision
description:
Legal Decision is a challenging game for Ages 14 and up. A game like you have never played before -- all the excitement and suspense of a courtroom trial! You can be the quick-witted defense attorney, State's tough prosecutor, jury foreman, or the judge himself! Witnesses testify, cross-examination may change testimony - jurors' sympathy can be swayed, new evidence may be introduced. The drama builds as the jury moves toward its verdict.

The designer is likely Rico Gatti who is listed as the copyright holder.
mechanics: Acting, Dice Rolling, Player Judge, Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game, Track Movement

name: Woman & Man
description:
War Between the Sexes Game.

A Dynamic - Psychology Today - Communications/Research/Machines.

Bookcase Format

Each woman must accumulate enough Status Quo points (100) to prove her equality to men. Each man must collect enough Status Quo points (100) to prove once and for all a woman's place is beneath his.

Power and Confrontation cards are used to promote debate. Trivia based questions are also related to certain board locations.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Team-Based Game
publishers: Communications/Research/Machines/Inc., Dynamic Games / Dynamic Design Industries

name: A Day With Ziggy Game
description: A game where anything can happen and usually does, from the popular comic strip by Tom Wilson. Ziggy's day is full of many misadventures. Be the first player to get back to start.

name: Godzilla Street Stomping Game
description: Your opponent grabs the Godzilla Foot Stomper and turns over a card. If you've got a city card in front of you with the stomp card number on it, Stomp! Down comes Godzilla's foot on your own card. It's history! To win, avoid the Stomper and be the last player with any cards.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Teen Trivia Plus
description:
3,448 questions and answers for teens and adults. Ideal for home or compact for travel. Family Trivia Game complete on its own or a great add-on to other trivia games.
Categories:
1 Rock 'N' Roll Video
2 Jock Talk
3 Facts As Figures
4 Useless Information
5 In So Many Words
6 Box Office
7 Birds And Bees And Trees
8 People And Places

name: Haggle
description:
Cash and assets such as classic cars and oil paintings are traded with markets rising and falling constantly through the game.

The length of the game is predetermined by the players who can also decide whether to play haggle in its simplest form or amend and vary the rules in any way they can agree.

"Everything is negotiable...even the rules"

name: Benji Game
description:
In the Benji Game, players are rolling dice to attempt to get their wooden token to the middle of the board.

Players take turns rolling two dice and moving. If they land on a square with a picture, they either take another turn, roll again, go back to the start or draw a card. The cards aid to manipulate the movement of the pieces.

The first person to reach the center of the board by exact throw is the winner.

from the Waddington ad from 1977 for the game:

"Now you have the chance to join Benji, the world's most huggable hero, in an exciting "chase" to meet Tiffany. You will try to be the first player to pass all the obstacles. The first player to meet Tiffany is the winner.

2 to 6 players ages 5 to 10
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mary-Kate and Ashley Friendship Connection
description: Players move around the board drawing cards and answering questions about themselves. Questions range from favorite fashion styles to things you might chat about online. The player writes down the answers in a privet journal and the other players try to guess the answer. Correct guesses win Mary-Kate and Ashley friendship accessories. The first player to collect all 5 accessories and the laptop wins.

name: A Big Train Game
description: This is a game of train building. To begin, players select a color, shuffle the tiles and lay them face down on the table. On a turn, you draw a tile and turn it face up. If it depicts several cars of your color, you play it to the table. If it has only one car of your color (or no car) you can either play it or discard it. Tiles played to the table must be connected in such a way that the tracks are joined correctly and the winding train grows longer with each play. A tile may not be placed so that the track turns back upon itself preventing another tile from being added. At first, players may add tiles to both ends of the train. When an engine or caboose is drawn, it must be added to the front or back respectively, thus reducing plays to only one side. When the train has both an engine and a caboose, the game ends. Players count all the cars of their color on the train, and the one with the most cars wins.

name: The Grow-Op Game
description:
A game about growing marijuana, allegedly to "educate" as to the dangers involved in doing so.

From the news report:

Players roll the dice, move around the board, renting properties, buying lights and equipment, planting and harvesting crops. Moving in an opposite direction on the cylinder shaped board is the "GrowBuster." He lands on the unsuspecting player's property, rips out the plants and sends the player directly to jail.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Touristen-Nepp
description:
Touristen-Nepp (The word means taking 'easy' money from tourists) let 3-8 plays have the 'holiday of their life'.
On a map you have to buy the right equipment to have a good holiday, boots for nature, sunglasses for the beach and 'something to be saved' for the sexual experience. And all is in the game as material, small plastic cars, small boots, small sunglasses and also, umm!!, the 'other things' ;-).
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Team-Based Game, Variable Player Powers

name: ITN News at Ten: the Game
description:
From the back of the box:

"The aim of the game is to be the first player to travel the world and put together the ITN News at Ten Program by collecting stories in each of six categories and returning to ITN House in London. The categories are Current Affairs Home, Current Affairs Abroad, Royal, Human Interest, Sports and "...And Finally".

To collect a story players have to collect a headline card, a picture card and a story card which the majority of other players consider satisfies the category. But beware, other players can stop your story with a "Commercial Break" or a story can be stolen with an "Editor Card"."

Note: It's actually spin-and-move, not roll-and-move, but they're functionally identical.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: 800: The Game of Verbal Perfection
description:
Created to make your preparation for English exams more fun, 800: The Game of Verbal Perfection features the most commonly found words in over 2400 questions, divided into three levels. The questions are modeled after the verbal SAT in a Trivial Pursuit-like format. You'll increase your vocabulary while having fun with your whole family!

The questions simulate actual questions from the SAT, ACT, GRE, and MAT with a bit of a humorous bent.

A board is placed on the table with an octagon track on it. The track is made up of six rings, each ring, containing spaces that are either a number (the outer ring spaces are "300", with numbers increasing until the final inner space, which is "800"), an arrow, or a "RC" space (Reading Comprehension.) Two decks of cards: the Level Deck and the Reading Comprehension Deck are placed on the table, and each player puts a pawn of their color on one of the arrow spaces on the outer ring. All players roll the dice, with the highest roller going first, with play proceeding clockwise around the table.

On a turn, a player simply rolls the die and moves their pawn counter-clockwise that many spaces. Depending on what space a player lands on, the following occurs:

"RC". Another player reads the passage on the top Reading Comprehension card to another player, and then asks them a question with five choices.
Level Space ("300" through "800"). Another player asks them a question, using the matching question on the top Level card. These questions are ones such as "Machete is to brush as…", and there are five choices to pick from.
Eliminate One: Some level spaces say "eliminate one" on them - and are the same as a normal space, but a player only has to list one wrong answer to get the question correct.
Arrow Space: The player is asked a question from a Level card that is equal to the level of the ring they are currently in. If they get the question correct, they move their pawn one ring further in; if incorrect, one ring out.


No matter what space they landed on, if a player gets the question right, they may roll again and continue.

The game continues until one player gets their pawn into the middle 800 space and answers a question correctly. At this point, all other players gladly crown them the winner.

--gameplay summary from Tom Vasel (see https://www.rpg.net/reviews/archive/12/12318.phtml)

name: Post Office
description: This is a game for 2 to 4 players. The instructions say that it should be played by girls and boys together. Each player gets a particular color to start on. That color is used later on. A girl starts the game! There are spaces on the gameboard such as First Class, Air Mail or Special Delivery. When a player lands on one of them the player picks a card and reads it aloud. The card will list some kind of stunt that must be accomplished in order to score points.
