If a partner is needed to accomplish the stunt then the player spins a spinner, the male who has that color representing him is the girls partner for the stunt. There is a time limit to accomplish each stunt. The stunts are childish (this game is appropriate for perhaps 8 to 12 year olds). Some examples of stunts that need to be done; You and your partner eat a potato chip at the same time and immediately whistle Yankee Doodle. First one to whistle the first line wins the points. Or Standing back to back with your partner, remove his or her jacket or sweater and put it on yourself without turning around. The successful completion of a stunt in the given time limit results in winning a certain amount of points. First player to reach 500 points is the winner.

name: Bumps and Grinds
description:
Bumps and Grinds

A hilarious drinking and stripping game.

(Any number can play)

For the first time here is an imaginative game whereby the rules require candle light and your favorite drinks. To create the proper atmosphere the game at first allows for more drinking due to various safety's but as Bumps and Grinds progresses and the first bashful blush is forgotten, more and more clothing is shed.

Hilarious situations are created when a player has to "Go Directly to Bar" or luckily draws a "False Modesty Card" as a temporary safety in lieu of removing one article of clothing.

When any one player is down to his or her last article of clothing and is about to lose that, he or she may blow out the candle and be declared the winner of Bumps and Grinds.

name: Sanctuaries
description:
Players take turns placing their set of 12 pentominoes (like Blokus) on a ten-by-ten grid in an attempt to prevent the other player from placing a piece. Unlike Blokus, there is no restriction on placement.

The "compressed game" variant takes place with a single set of pieces on an eight-by-eight subset of the board. There is also a solitaire variant, one player attempting to cover the 8x8 subset without covering the four marked center squares.

name: Match: Le Jeu de Michel Platini
description: French soccer player Michel Platini was one of the most famous soccer stars from the '70s and early '80s. In 1978 a soccer game was released and licensed on Platini (with his photo on the cover). This vintage game looks quite good with 22 plastic figurines representing the soccer players. The board has a soccer field & stadium printed on it, the field is divided in squares. The game also has a die, but that die doesn't have numbers but colors on it. Collectors item, especially for soccer fans.

name: Crazy Horse Black Shield White Bull: Prelude to Little Big Horn 1866
description:
The game covers the first disaster that befell U.S. cavalry when they tried to coerce the Indian tribes on Bozeman trail.

This would culminate in the Fetterman massacre which the Indians lured 80 U.S. cavalryman into a huge ambush consisting of 1000 Indian warriors.

Basically surrounded and overwhelmed U.S. troops with heavy firepower(Spencer and Martini henry repeating rifles and Sprinfield muzzle loaders) and limited ammo vs. hordes of Indians armed mostly with bow and arrow but also a smattering of repeating rifles and muzzle loaders.

Chit pull game system based on his design Into a Bear Trap.

One 11x17" color game map
Over 280 playing pieces
One Rulebook
Playing Aid Cards

name: Chase the Cheese
description:
Components:
4 mice in 4 basic colours, hollow underneath, with long flexible plastic tails
4 cheese boards
1 large and 32 small pieces of cheese

Each player takes a cheese board and places it in front of him. Place eight pieces of small cheese on the eight triangles marked on each board. Put the single large cheese in the middle of the playing area. Players must make their mouse "eat" first the eight small cheeses on their board and then the single large cheese, by holding it by the end of the tail and moving it around. Ages 5 and up.
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Set Collection, Simultaneous Action Selection

name: Tornerspelet
description: Swedish game based on real medieval personalities. You go to a tournament and have to get a horse, armor, weapon and a squire. When you have that you can compete in four different tournament disciplines. When one player is the champion in all disciplines he wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Cats and Nines
description: Players try to roll 9 times 9 without rolling 9 cats. The 1 on each die is replaced with a cat.

name: Gra o kartę rowerową
description:
Polish board game for minimum of 2 players with an objective to reach the finish line with your bicycle rider pawn.

Each of the 64 fields on the board is one of the road signs in Poland. Landing on the field means you have to follow the instructions from the instruction sheet.

You move by rolling the standard D6 dice. First one to reach the finish line - wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Räkna rätt
description:
Mfg suggested Ages 7 - 9
The game consists of 36 domino tiles.
One half of the tile contains a digit between 1 and 9 and the other part a picture of a number of fruits, animals or objects that are well known to every child.
The tiles are shuffled and dealt. The aim is to play the tiles one by one and then trying to match the digit and the number of objects of the already played tiles on the table.
The tiles are color coded to make it easier for the youngest children.

name: Jan van Haasteren's Verjaardagsspel
description: This is a simple, family roll-and-move game to be played on someone's birthday. It is lavishly illustrated by the popular artist Jan van Haasteren. The game is 63 spaces, with certain spaces allowing 'jump forwards' and other special events, and other spaces requiring the shouts of 'hip hip hooray' by the crowd. This is a variant on the famous 'Ganzenbord', or Dutch Goose game.

name: Dancing with the Stars Card Game
description:
From the University Games catalog:

Players become judges in this hilarious game. To win, players must correctly win actual dances from the show by playing the correct dancer card with each specific dance. Fun for fans of the show and fans of dancing.

Ages 8 and up
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: The Official Handy Game: The Game for Boys
description:
From the publisher:

Celebrating a boy's life, The Official Handy Game

name: Bauer sucht Frau: Das Brettspiel
description: Bauer sucht Frau - das Brettspiel is based on the successful German TV show "Bauer sucht Frau" in which real German farmers are looking for a partner. In the boardgame you have the same goal of finding a partner. You draw a profile card and move with your potential partner to your farm. The game is featuring trivia questions as well as communicative tasks. Whoever collected enough love markers first, will win the game and get married.
publishers: Clown Games, Fremantle Media, Imagination Games, Smart Ltd

name: Monopoly: Everton Edition
description: The classic Monopoly with constructions and other elements from the Everton Football Club, based in Liverpool, England.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Rajd starych samochodów
description:
Simple boardgame where players race against each other in old cars race tournament.

Each player has one car. Every round player draws a speed card - it shows, how many field the car advance. On the board are also special events cards. It can be a bonus (one field forn), a breakdown (one turn lost), or even a car accident (elimination from the race).

For each race - the wining player receive a trophy. Whole game is a four race tournament. Who archive the most number of trophies - wins.

In basic rules, the game is totaly random, and has not any place for strategy. But simple rules modifications make it more interesting.

name: Göteborg
description:
A local version of Monopoly taking place in the swedish city Göteborg.
You buy and sell streets and houses in Göteborg and learn some of its history.
The playing pieces you can choose between are vehicles all found in Göteborg.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Genius Football
description:
The game board has 6 x 7 holes in which pins are placed at the beginning. The moving mechanism is simple and well-known: A pin can jump over any adjacent pin and then remove it. This is repeated until no pin can move anymore. The holes have point values though, and the player whose remaining pins have scored most points is the winner. The players therefore try to isolate their own pins in lucrative spots and force the opponent to jump out of the same spots.

Can be played solitaire as well.

name: Hännänheiluttajat
description: If you own a dog, would you like a dog or just like the hair of those muzzle of excellent, this game is made just for you. Chance cards and dog questions of interest to make the game entertaining and educational. You get the chance to compete with the different dogs and during the game you learn these fun tail movers many useful things. The highest award requires access to the podium of luck, tactics, and a little hair on the dog you have much information on! You win by getting the highest god show award!

name: Golden Trivia Game: National Football League (NFL) Edition
description: The object of NFL Trivia game is to be the first player to reach a predetermined number of points by answering National Football League trivia questions. The questions are divided into six categories (see contents).

name: Battle Gum
description:
Early in the game, players can freely exchange between their hand and up cards.

Player may any time lays down up to 3 cardswith equal value.
The next players may ask one or more cards of equal value or greater than those already laid.

If by chance a player can not ask for cards that meet this rule, it collects all the cards already laid down and adds those to his hand.

First player who gets rid of his cards wins the game

name: Ich lerne...Englisch
description:
German game for young children to enhance their early English language skills.

Six player boards are included and 36 tiles, each representing a common English word and the associated image.

Two games are described. The first is Englische Bildpaare suchen, a version of Pairs or Memory. You don't use the boards. Instead, turn all the tiles face down and lay them out on the table. Children must find the pairs, which are not two of the exact same image but instead, two tiles that 'go together'. Examples: Cow and Milk, Jacket and Trousers, and so on. If you 'match' a pair, you take the two tiles. When all the tiles are matched, the player with the most tiless, wins.

The second game uses the player boards and is played like Picture Bingo or Lotto. The first player to complete a line of three images is the winner.

name: Diamanttjuven
description: Diamanttjuven (Diamond thief) is a stand-alone sequel to Afrikan tähti, where the fiamond is stolen from the owner of the diamond, a princess. But out there in the dark all thieves looking alike, and there will be a number of thieves. By rolling a spinner you will get the possibility to either draw a card, drive your pink car or do both. The aim of the game is to catch thieves.
mechanics: Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Scrooge
description: A card/dice game relying heavily on chance as players try to steal money away from Dicken's Ebenezer Scrooge. Players take the role of a famous character, Mr Pickwick, Artful Dodger, Fagin, Mr. Micawber or Oliver Twist. By rolling a lettered die and numbered die, you determine if you collect or deposit money with Scrooge, and sometimes you draw one of the lavishly illustrated cards (with artwork from Habiot Browne, George Cattermole, Robert Seymore, George Cruikshank and John Leech) which forces you to pay extra fees or gather extra gains. The game was designed with the aid of the curator of the Dickens House Museum.

name: Marvel Avengers: Hulk's Smashing Challenge
description:
Put your keen eyes and reflexes to the test. Smash your way to victory! Collect the most "Target" cards by smashing (slapping) the right cards to win.

Game contains 10 Target cards and 38 Smash cards. The Target cards tell you what to smash.

On your turn flip over a card from the Target deck for all to see. Then take the Smash deck into your hand and flip over Smash cards one at a time, forming a discard pile in the middle.

All the other players look for the right card to "smash" (slap). The first player to smash the right card wins the Target card and the turn passes to the next player. Continue until all the Target cards have been claimed. The player with the most Target cards plus Hulk Fists wins.

(2-player variant included)
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Comic Book / Strip

name: Clifford the Big Red Dog "You're Invited!" Game
description:
It's Clifford's beach party, and You're Invited! In this fun game, each player gets to be Clifford, racing around the board inviting their friends to a beach party. Drop the die down the dog house slide and see how far you'll go! The first player to pass out a complete set of invitations and make it back to the party wins!

Includes a colorful board, four plastic Clifford figures, dog house, die, and rules.

Designed for 2, 3, or 4 players age three and older.

name: Gender Wars
description:
Mars and Venus collide in the ultimate showdown! The battle of the sexes has been raging since the dawn of time - now it's finally time to settle the dispute and find out whether the boys or girls will reign supreme.

Players split into two teams: as one team tries to give answers to a category, the other team has to guess which answers they won't get.

name: Watch Ya' Mouth: NSFW Expansion #3
description:
You just can’t get enough, can you? Let’s invite more people to join in. Do you think your friends are game? Let’s watch them make asses of themselves. Take pics. Post publicly. Tease mercilessly. Look cool. Warning: Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #3 is not responsible for any social media beefs. #SorryNotSorry

Watch Ya’ Mouth, The Original Mouthguard Party Game, is authentic and hilarious. Often imitated, never duplicated.
3-10 players
Hampered by cheek retractors, teams attempt to read and interpret silly phrases, like:
Wonder Woman wears super panties.
The brew pub is in the village.
My husband wears a mankini for fun.

Watch Ya Mouth NSFW Expansion Pack #3 comes with 155 depraved, explicit phrase cards and 6 blanks (161 total cards). Our cards are strong, thick, and durable for years of hysterics and beer spills.

name: Quiz: Historia Polski
description:
Quiz: Historia Polski (which means Quiz: History of Poland) is a trivia game about Polish history.

Every turn a player throws a die and moves her pawn the corresponding number of spaces. The space that the player lands on determine the following action which may be:

a general question from a card of a color corresponding to the color of space that the player landed on
a historically important date question
the catapult challenge in which a player will try to shoot the ball into the cup using a catapult


Each good answer and each scored catapult is worth 1 point.
The first player to score 50 or 100 points (depending on what players agreed on) is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Dungeon Dice: Dual Artifact Pack
description:
This optional expansion adds unique new weapons that count as multiple weapon types.

Contains

Morning Star
Songbow
Long knife
Halberd
Swift Bo Staff
Magic Hand Armor
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling

name: Puukauppapeli
description:
A traditional roll and move with an educational aspect. Players are aspiring forest owners trying to become rich by selling the lumber.

If a player stops on a numbered square, event text will be read, adding or subtracting players money. On a question square, a foresting trivia question is asked and right answer is rewarded with money, while wrong answer will cost the player some amount of money.

Whoever has the most money in the end is the winner.

name: Snakes and Ladders + Ludo With A Twist
description:
Two games using the same custom six-sided dice, and different sides of the same board.

The 1 on the die becomes "M", allowing a single move in any direction (including diagonally in Snakes and Ladders), and the 2 becomes "S" allowing any two pawns to be swapped. The Snakes and Ladders game is played with four pawns, Ludo-style, and players must get all of their pawns to the 100 square to win.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Vikingaspelet
description:
Vikingaspelet (English, The Viking game) is a game of luck and courage inspired by the book series about Halvdan and Meia.

The players take turns rolling the die to move around Midgårdsormen (English, the Midgard snake) and into Midgård itself. The goal is to secure and establish a trading post and then buy a chalice, sword and axe. The first player to return back to their homestead with these three items wins.

—user summary

name: L.O.L. Surprise! Shuffle Club Game
description:
Any L. O. L. Surprise fan will love this Shuffle club board game! In this ttly awesome game, use the electronic LED action wheel and move spaces, perform actions and gather the members of your L. O. L. Surprise! club. Flashing lights, fast rounds and random moves make this game a surprise every time you play. GR8, right! ? Plus, L. O. L. Shuffle Club comes with four awesome L. O. L. Surprise! balls. It’s, like, it’s almost 2G2BT!

—description from the publisher
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Chaf Chof
description:
Chaf Chof is a game of agility and vistual speed. Throw the dice and be the quickest to find the card with the same combination of the animals or colours. You can play with colours or shapes and the instructions also include a playing variant from 2 years old.
If the combination of colours or animals is not on the table, the first one who see it, can say it and take this card from the deck of the player who took it.

—description from the publisher

name: Really Karen?
description:
Really Karen? is a hilarious party game for 2-6 players.

Be the first Karen to argue your way around town, collect all four manager tokens, and make it back home. If you do this you'll be declared the ultimate Karen!

How to Play:
Choose a Karen character and match them to their house in the middle of the board.
Roll the dice to see how many spaces you move. Along the way you will encounter small business locations and have to draw Really Karen? cards. These cards could send you backwards, forwards, or even make you lose a turn.
Get to the large business locations and attempt to collect the manager token there.
Be the first player to collect all four manager tokens and return home to win the game.

Really Karen? will keep you laughing all night long.

—description from the designer
mechanics: Card Play Conflict Resolution, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement

name: The Lion Guard: 3D Snakes & Ladders
description:
Reach the top of The Pride rock by rolling the die! Climb up the cliff and be careful not slipping down the ledge.

Classic Snakes and Ladders in 3D.
Featuring characters from Disney's The Lion Guard

—description from the publisher (translated)

The Pride Lands are abuzz with excitement, because the race to The Pride Rock is about to begin!
Move Kion and his friends all the way to the top and look out for the boulders that can help you climb up a a level or send you sliding down again.

—description from the back of the box (translated)
categories: Animals, Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Incorgnito
description:
In this corgi themed game players use their Incorgnito cards wisely to gather information about a secret item, sniffing around for the correct answer. Go "Incorgnito" to be the best dogtective of the bunch!

Each secret item card contains an image of a corgi dressed up in costume. One player is the clue giver and the other players are tasked with guessing what item the clue giver has. The clue giver starts the round by saying "the secret item is a little bit like a corgi."

The play proceeds with the player on the left choosing an incorgnito card from their hand and placing it face up and asking if the secret item is more like the item pictured on the incorgnito card.

The clue giver will confirm or deny and give one reason why.
Play continues in this manner until a player chooses to "sniff" out the secret item, if correct they are awarded points, if they are wrong play continues until the item is guessed.

At the end of the game, when each player has been clue giver twice, the points are tallied and the player with the most points wins.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Deduction, Memory

name: Sisu: Battles for Suursaari Island 1942 & 1944
description:
Suursaari, also known as Högland, Gogland, or ‘the Great Island’, is a large island in the Gulf of Finland. In 1942 and again in 1944 it was the focal point of a battle. The island is centrally located, perfect for dominating sea lanes leading to Leningrad or those crossing between Finland and Estonia. Float planes, or ski planes in winter, could use it as a base; strings of minefields could be monitored from it; coastal guns placed on it could engage passing ships. Immediately before World War II the island belonged to the Finns. It was a rustic vacation destination, complete with casino. The Russians acquired the island without a fight during the Winter War of 1939/40. In the winter of 1942, the Finns took it back from the Russians. In September 1944 the Germans tried and failed to take it from the Finns. This game comprises two scenarios covering these battles, using a common set of rules.

Scale is 300 meters across a given hex. Contour lines are 20 meter intervals. Since the 1942 battle took place in winter and the 1944 battle took place in summer, each scenario uses its own map. The military units are sections (squads), platoons, and companies. Other counters represent batteries of artillery and mortars, naval craft, individual commanders, and bunkers. Each player’s military forces must manoeuvre across the game board, attacking the opposing force with direct and indirect fire, airstrikes, naval gunnery, and fighting hand-to-hand. One player is the Defender and the other is the Attacker. The Attacker must achieve his objectives before time runs out. The longer the game goes on, the more objectives he must achieve to win. Turns are one hour. Special rules include snow storms, the Finns attacking across the ice in winter, German naval landings using barges and assault boats, naval gunfire by flak barges and a destroyer squadron, airstrikes, variable visibility due to terrain, weather, and time of day, antitank guns that can fire HE in an indirect role, and much more.

In the 1942 scenario, the Finns attack across the ice in a blinding snowstorm against a reinforced Soviet battalion of half-frozen men, some of whom nevertheless resisted for 3 days. In the 1944 scenario the Germans fail in their attempt to bluff the Finns into handing over the island peacefully, land a motley force including worn-out infantry, coastal artillery personnel, 88mm flak guns with no ammunition, and 580 men of Marine-Artillerie-Abteilug 531. The 531st was no sedentary coastal garrison, but a special commando unit whose men took part in the very first battle of the war, the assault on the Westerplatte at Danzig on 1 September 1939. The Finns defeat them all, just in time to hand the island over to the Soviets as part of the Armistice agreement.
mechanics: Hexagon Grid, Impulse Movement, Movement Points, Zone of Control

name: Pass the Bomb: Family
description:
In this fast-paced game, players must solve a word or dexterity challenge before the bomb explodes! In addition to word challenges similar to the classic 'Pass the Bomb' game, this Family edition for 3 to 8 players adds simple skill/dexterity challenges like catching a ball in a cup or quickly 'building' a worm out of puzzle pieces. The word challenge categories are 'Word Acrobat', 'Rhyming Artist', and 'Typical' (thematically-related words). The 'bomb' is an electronic ticking timer that can 'explode' with no warning during the game.

—user summary
categories: Action / Dexterity, Electronic, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Jeu des amoureux
description:
Children game based on building couples and securing them with love potions. Rivals may break them up with toads. Players can steal a member of a couple from their rivals aswell. The overall value of the couples can be boosted with cards.

LGTBIQ+ friendly and racially diverse game.
mechanics: Hand Management, Set Collection, Take That

name: The Game of Steeplechase
description: The gameboard is long and oval-shaped, and the 100 playing spaces are narrow and angled. The basic rules of race games are still used, however, with turns missed and players moving backwards and forwards as directed. This particular game is played anticlockwise. The game has five fences with a fallen horse and rider at the second. The centre illustration and the corners depict the race goers, the grandstand, coaches, horses and men and women. In each of the corners is a scene from a horse race and in the space between the start and the finish the scene of gathering the horses ready for the race with the starter and his flag.
publishers: Flying Tiger Copenhagen, McLoughlin Brothers, Watilliaux

name: Obamanopoly
description:
From the publisher:

Obamanopoly is the Property Trading Game for the New Economy! As the only game parodying the dysfunctional politics of Washington and the ridiculousness of our current leaders, Obamanopoly is the right game at the right time.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Ropes and Ladders
description:
The object of this game is to move the playing pieces, which represent pirates, from the starting Cannon square to the Port square, moving as directed by the numbers on the die. The thrill of Pirates going up the ladder is exciting, but when they go down the ropes, everybody laughs.

This was Parker Brothers' answer to Milton Bradley's Chutes and Ladders.
mechanics: Area Movement, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Carrotia: Carrots Out
description:
Carrots Out is an expansion for Carrotia.

In Carrots Out the Master Rabbit must escape the mine and in order to do that he must protect his torch. If the torch lights out, then the Master Rabbit will face a terrible threat, as the enemy is waiting in the dark.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Maze, Puzzle, Real-time
mechanics: Action Queue, Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Tile Placement

name: Beast Masters Duel: Tree and Tide
description:
In Beast Masters: Duel, a two-player shuffle building, tactical head to head game, players take on the roles of Beast Trainers. These trainers come from all ages and regions of Tymuria to compete for fame and glory in these seasonal tournaments. Beast Training used to be for protection from the creatures of the Great Divide, as those creatures became less frequent though, it became a sport. Only entered though by those whose bonds with their Beasts was unwavering. The Beasts themselves relished the idea of competing as a team, in a sport, rather than risking their lives.

Set 2 – As the next Season begins, trainers are beginning to head to Mesa to compete. This Set contains both Camille and Tidus, young rival trainers from the Fertellis Region with explosive new techniques! Players may play the preset Camille/Tidus Teams of Draft their own from the 6 available Beasts in this set.

— description from the publisher
mechanics: Area Majority / Influence, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Hand Management, Modular Board, Open Drafting, Variable Player Powers

name: The World Council: Disaster
description: Disaster Expansion will include some random events. Councilors need to face them together in order to make the world a better place and save their country from destruction!
categories: Card Game, City Building, Economic, Expansion for Base-game, Political, Wargame
mechanics: Hand Management, Team-Based Game, Trading, Variable Player Powers

name: Erynie
description:
Erynie is a board game based on book under the same title by Marek Krajewski, a popular Polish crime fiction writer. Each player becomes an investigation officer, receives the main suspect accused of a crime and one innocent person. The goal is to find evidence of guilt or innocence.

Game is won by a player whose accusations are closest to the truth.

At the beginning of the game players receive randomly one suspect and one innocent person. During the game players are visiting several places in Lviv to collect evidence. After few turns of gathering proofs players can go to the police station and leave collected evidence there. Proofs have different influence on suspects and can be used as evidence of guilt or innocence. Players have to use their proofs to excuse their selected innocent person and to accuse their suspected person.

name: Auf + Zu
description: Players move round the track obtaining lids to nail onto their crates for dispatch. The track spaces have a variety of options/actions and the crates and lids have values. Art by Franz Vohwinkel.

name: Learning About Manners Picnic Basket Game
description:
From the Website:
"It's hard to have a perfect picnic party when ants keep trying to steal your food! Just say "Please" and "Thank You" to send those pesky ants packing and collect all the items that will make the picnic a success."

name: Fib Finder
description:
This is a game for young girls that acts like a toy lie detector. On your turn, the player to the left takes a card and asks you one of the questions on it (such as: Have you ever been kissed by someone real cute?) After you reply, you can move up one space on the game board--unless another player challenges your answer.

For a challenge, both you and the challenger place your fingers on the electronic Fib Finder. The challenger repeats the question into the microphone and you repeat the answer. The challenger then removes her finger and the Fib Finder will show green (true: move ahead 2, move challenger back 2), red (false: move back 2, challenger ahead 2), or yellow (unsure: move ahead one like normal).

The first player to reach the "Totally Truthful" space, or the only player not on the "All Time Fibber" space, wins.

name: Bug-Out!
description: This game consists of a square plastic cage, a large "bug", and 4 hooks. The cage has a hole on each side facing the players, and a hole on the top for the bug. To begin play, you drop the bug through the top hole and all players put their hooks through the side holes trying to snare the bug and pull it out through their opening. The bug may be hooked, poked, or batted with the hooks. A player scores whenever the bug comes out through the opening on his side. The winner is the first player to score 10 times and yell Bug-Out!

name: Summit
description:
Summit was originally published by Minden Games, 1992. It was republished in Counter Magazine Issue 10, August, 2000.

Summit is a positional card game based very loosely on mountain climbing. The object of the game is to lead your expedition safely to the top of the mountain (21,000 feet). Equipping your party, establishing base camps, waiting out the weather, and making the final assault are among the important elements of gameplay. Through planning and the proper use of your cards (and a bit of luck) you may reach the summit!

The game includes a map of the mountain and eight pages of rules. A token or marker, one six-sided die, and a standard 52-card deck are needed for play.

name: Visainen Koiratieto
description: A trivia game about dogs. There are 3 different difficulty levels and it's possible to do some risk taking in attempt to enhance your position on the board.

name: Rocky Mountain Rails
description:
Expansion for Rails Through the Rockies that supposedly made the game much more playable.

Expands:

Rails Through the Rockies


Re-implements:

Tracks to Telluride

name: Biribi
description: A French game played on a board on which the numbers 1 to 70 are marked. The players put their stakes on the numbers they wish to back. The banker draws a ticket, calls out the number and the player who has backed it receives sixty-four times his stake; the other stakes go to the banker.

name: Harry Potter: Diagon Alley Dash
description:
In this roll and move game you play as either Harry, Ron, Hermione or Luna.
First, you race around Diagon Alley (outer circle) where you need to collect 6 school supplies. Next, you board the Hogwarts Express (inner circle) for the final trip to school. The first person arriving at Hogwarts wins.

name: Elefun Snackin' Safari
description:
From the manufacturer:

It’s a bouncin’, snackin’ barrel of fun with the Snackin’ Safari game! Grab your elephant with his attached springy truck and go to home base, then start bouncing your elephant’s trunk on the snack cards to pick up a tasty snack! Once it’s caught, run back to home base and drop it off, then get back to the snackin’ as quick as you can! Make a pile of snacks, and if your pile is the biggest at the end, you win!

Snatch up snack cards with your elephant’s springy trunk! Whoever grabs the most snacks wins! 2 elephant heads come with handles and springy trunks. Bonus game: Find the golden tutti frutti cake snack card and win! Press on the trunk to lock the spring in place for storage. Stretch out the trunk to unlock the spring.

---

Action Game for the very young. Each player holds an Elefun head in a hand. The had has a spiral with which tiles on the table can be picked up. The tiles have different images on both sides,

There are three game ideas supplied:

- Both players have a starting tile. They pick up as many tiles as they can as quickly as they can and drop them on their starting tile. The player who finds a (face-down) golden muffin wins.
- Both players try to pick up as many tiles as possible, but without looking at the underside. The player with most pairs when all tiles have been picked up is the winner.
- Both players try to pick up the tiles in their playing color. The first player to collect all of them is the winner.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Real-time

name: Kaappikellon kummitukset
description:
The grandfather clock in the Pimpola Manor has stopped. Turns out that there are ghosts living inside the clock, and they don't like the striking of the clock. In order to get the clock working again, you have to find a new place for the ghosts to live in. Luckily, in the attic there's a wardrobe in which all the ghosts could easily fit.

This is a simple roll-and-move game. The first player to get all his ghosts inside the wardrobe wins. On the way to the attic there are four special spaces. Whenever a ghost lands on one of these spaces, it might sneak out for a nap, go doing pranks, or simply run back into the grandfather clock.

This game belongs to Peliko's line of children's games illustrated by Mauri Kunnas. Included in the box are a game board, a wardrobe, a die, and 16 ghosts in four player colors.

name: Teramyyd: Earthsphere
description:
Teramyyd: Earthsphere is a turn-based fantasy adventure board game set in the world of Teramyyd, a rich and fully-realized setting with a nuanced and detailed history and mythos.

In the game, you play a skyship captain, adventuring across the land to secure the resources you need to complete quests, defeat creatures, plunder the ship of your fellow captains, or to defeat the fearsome Kobolos dragon. Where lies your destiny? The choice is yours!
categories: Adventure, Aviation / Flight, Fantasy, Miniatures, Pirates, Science Fiction
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Grid Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: The Queer Agenda
description:
Written by LGBTQ+ people, for LGBTQ+ people (and their favorite allies).
Challenge your chosen family and match the funniest cards to win the dirtiest, sassiest, queerest game around.
As LGBTQ+ people, we get to choose our family.
We also get to choose fellow queers to write the funniest cards for the sassiest, dirtiest game in town.

—description from the publisher

This game is in the style of Cards Against Humanity with added Dare cards.

name: Mazemaster
description:
Mazemaster is a 2-4 player game where stone, zombies, dragons and even physics are merely obstacles to be surpassed as you build, fight and wend your way through a maze of your own construction in order to claim the legendary Relic. Starting from the very edge of the mountain, you – a mage on a mission – must use your powers not only to make your way to the centre, but also to impede and slow down your opponents through myriads of magical trickery - rotating their mazes into dead ends, burning their caverns, or even outright destroying what they create - all in order to ensure that the only wizard making it to the centre is you and you alone. But beware, not only do you have to make it to the centre, you have to make it out again.

With up to 3 other mages trying to stop you, that may not be such an easy feat!

The rules for Mazemaster are simple. At the beginning of every turn, players select up to three action cards they wish to use once the turn begins. These could be anything from as simple as move and build to cards that allow a player to rotate other player’s maze tiles, teleport them across unbridgeable gaps or even to destroy their path altogether. Each player, when selecting the actions they are going to take, can’t just think about what they plan to do; they also have to remember to try and slow down any player that may be ahead of them, or even preparing for a dastardly piece of magical trickery coming their way from an opponent, even as they try to make their way to the centre of the map, wherein lies the relic.

Reaching the relic, however, isn’t the end; your wizard has his powerful new weapon, but he needs to get out of the mountain in order to understand how to use it! And chances are, if you reached it first, your fellow players may not be too keen on letting you escape so easily!

name: Tell the Time
description:
"Learn the time lotto"

The object is to cover your board with the small picture cards.

Each player chooses a time board showing pictures of various times of day.

The players take turns to draw from a pile of time cards and announce the time on the card. Players check their boards for the time and the player with the correct board puts the tile on it.

The first player to fill her board shouts "Time Out!" and has won the game.

name: Berzerkerbirdz
description: Alien Invazorz have come to the Birdznest Nebula to contest in the Astrobirdz Extreme Sports Arena. The winner of each contest wins a settled world, and only you can decide the fate of your home world and stop the alien invaders from taking over your planet!

name: P.O.W. Rescue
description: This is a pretty esoteric game. The object of the game is to rescue POW's from Viet Nam's infamous Hanoi Hilton. The first player to rescue and escape with a POW from the camp cell and reach the end of the rescue/escape route wins the game. The designer believed that POW's were still being held in North Viet Nam and apparently created this game to keep people aware of that fact. He comments " POW Rescue is an action game of rescue dedicated to those still held as POW with the hope that Americans will never forget those we left behind". The rules for this very simplistic game are 3 very short pages in length.

name: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone: Through the Trapdoor Chapter Game
description:
A simple roll-and-move game in which players race each other to be the first to reach the Chamber Door. The game board has three regions, corresponding to three of the challenges faced by Harry in the movie: Flying Keys, Chess, and Potions. The game is called a "chapter game" in that it is packaged in a hard plastic case that looks like a book when it is folded shut.

This is a game in the Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone Chapter Game series, in which games are contained in a portable box designed to look like a book, and the theme of the game corresponds to chapters in the book Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone.

This is a roll-and-move race game. The goal of the game is to be the first player to successfully travel through the three chambers and reach the final door.

On your turn, you roll the die and move the corresponding number of spaces. If you rolled a 1, you collect a Skill Card and follow its instructions instead of moving. If you roll a 6, you can take a Skill Card or move 6 spaces. If you land on a "snare" space you must go back to the first space of the room. The first player to reach the final space on the game board wins.
categories: Children's Game, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based, Racing

name: Computerized Arcade
description:
This arcade is made up of 12 different games;
1. SONG WRITER: Game memorizes notes that you input and then plays them back.
2. ORGAN: Play the notes on the arcade like an organ.
3. REPEAT: Play the notes in the order that the Arcade plays them.
4. TORPEDO: Try to sink the enemy submarine.
5. TAG-IT: Try to press the buttons as fast as you can after they light up. If you do it quick enough you catch the mole.
6. ROULETTE: Computerized cassino roulette.
7. BASEBALL: A playing board that comes with the game allows you to play Baseball.
8. REPEAT PLUS: You press the button, your friend repeats your button and then adds one then you press the last two buttons and then add one.
9. TREASURE HUNT: Find Ali Baba's 3 treasures.
10. COMPETE: Who can react fastest?
11. FIRE AWAY: Alien invaders must be destroyed.
12. HIDE N' SEEK: Arcade makes 3 color secret code. You try to find it.

This game requires four C batteries.

name: Uniquely New Jersey
description: Be the first player to completely fill the state-shaped scoring map by correctly answering questions at five of the six key cities, and then answering a question correctly at Trenton.

name: Trifles
description: Trivia game where players answer questions and place colored discs on the spaces where they answered the questions correctly. When a player has three or more discs on each of the four sides of the board or six discs on any one side of the board qualifies to enter the circle. The Master Position is at the end where the player must answer correctly a question from the Etc. category to be the winner.
mechanics: Memory, Roll / Spin and Move, Tile Placement

name: VIPs
description:
This early game from publisher/retailer Heidelberger has 5 sets of tiles showing portraits of VIPs. There are men on one side, women on the other, you choose which side to play at the start. The faces are divided into three strips like a photo-fit, and players use chips to move them around to form the best pictures. Players then score points by selecting which sections look best.

The game appears to work best as a tactical 2 player game, and the hand drawn portraits look good, recognizable as famous people, but it doesn't seem to be a successful result.

name: Investor
description:
Quoted from the cover: "A Stock Exchange Board Game. The authentic game about REAL companies quoted on the International Stock Exchange, London".

It's a monopoly style game but trading in shares, using actual share prices over a 52 week period. The rule book consists of 4 small pages. Then there is a larger 8 page booklet of actual share prices. Finally there is a 46 page booklet describing the companies referred to in the game.

The purpose of the game seems to be to introduce players to share trading and encourage them to use the Daily Telegraph for their real-life trading.

Though nicely produced, counters for moving round the board are not included and there is no guidance on how many players are expected to play.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Commodity Speculation, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Stock Holding

name: Adultery
description: From the rules: The object of the game is spend a good time with 2 different players of the opposite sex. NOTE: Drinks & Mixes should be close at hand. Players spin and move their game piece around the board getting tokens worth two, three and five minutes. When all players have three time tokens, players are selected at random to retire to another part of the house. Game ends when each player had the chance to spend time in private with two different players.

name: Trivial Pursuit The Music Master Game: Sports Edition – Video Version
description: PAL VHS tape of sporting moments. Can be played as a game itself or used in conjunction with the Trivial Pursuit board game.
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Telstar Video Entertainement

name: Indy 500 75th Running Race Game
description: From the Instructions: "An Exciting, easy to play card game featuring the high horsepower thrills of eight decades of legendary Indy 500 cars. To win by being the first "Racer" to cross the finish line of the Indy 500 Scoring Board Track."

name: Beverly Hills 90210 Card Game
description: This trick taking game comes with a deck of 4 different colored suits. Each suit has 13 cards numbered 0 through 12, with 12 as the high card. Four of the cards in each suit (the 9, 0, 2, and 1) are Zip Code cards that score points. Each player is dealt 6 cards and a standard trick-taking round follows. The high card of the suit led wins all the other cards played. After the round, all players draw a new card from the deck to bring their hands back up to 6. Play continues until the draw deck depleted and the players have played all the cards in their hands. Players then score 1 point for each Zip Code card they have won. The first player to score 50 points wins the game (this may take several rounds).
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Trading Spaces Game
description: See how well you know your neighbors and how well they know you. Pick a room to play in and get ready to redesign it. Answer questions, then compare. The first team to "spend their budget," by matching opponents answers, wins!

name: The Art Game
description: According to Sid Sacksons "A Gamut of Games": Players circle the board, attempting to get works of art - attractive pictures are supplied - into complete sets, which increases their value. Sales between players are negotiated or set by a "markup" die.

name: The Great Gumball Game
description:
From the box:

"Pop the Gumball, Match the Color, Win the Game!

Take your own miniature machine, press down the dome, and watch the colored gumball rise to the top! Match the color of the gumball to the next matching-colored space on the board. You’re on your way!"

name: Deluxe Memory
description:
From the Invisible City Productions website:

Remembering those matches rewards you with some strategy for two to four players.

Object: To end the game with more tokens than everyone else. You do this by turning cards of the same rank face-up during your turn.

You Need:

* A poker deck (with the Jokers removed).
* About 30 tokens for each player.

On your turn, select two cards and look at them. If the two cards are the same rank (like two Fives) and are both Black, show the cards to the other players and choose a player to return that many tokens to the Bank. If the two cards are the same rank and are both Red, show the cards to the other players and choose a player (including yourself) to gain that many tokens from the Bank. If the two cards are the same rank and are different colors, show the cards to the other players and refer to the Mixed Chart [which is included in the rules.] Once the effect has resolved, set the cards aside in the discard pile and end your turn.

If the two cards do not match, put them back in their original spots, face-up. You can choose to put one or both of them back face-down, but you must give one token to the Bank for each card that you don't reveal. Once you've made your decision and shown (or not shown) your cards, your turn ends.

If you run out of tokens, you're out of the game.

The game emds when only one player has tokens left, or when all possible matches have been made. If you have the most tokens at the end of the game, you win.

name: The BibleMan Adventure
description: In this adventurous board game, BibleMan and his friends are on a mission to rescue children that have been tricked by enemies of God. Players select a hero card and matching token to battle the “Bad Guys” while traveling quickly through the town of Shatzville in an attempt to “save the children”. The first player to rescue 6 kids, deliver them safely to the town church and race back to the BibleMan Cave is the winner! The BibleMan board game is actually 2 games in 1. Instructions are included for both a Basic Game Ages 3 - 6, and an Advanced Game Ages 7 and up and allows for both age groups to play at the same time.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Religious
mechanics: Memory, Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Rejseholdet
description:
A murder has been committed and the local police call for back-up. In complicated cases it's never easy to find the killer.
In this game you get the opportunity to test you skills as a police investigator. Interrogation, gathering of evidence and finding the right suspect is all in a good days work for the special murder investigation force.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Tieto & Taito & Temppu
description: The board shows pictures of all 365 days of a year. Each player starts from his or her birthday and tries to be the first to make a full circle. While going forward players are asked trivia questions, their mathematic and lingual skills are tested and they also have to make some physical exercises.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Math, Trivia

name: WCW Thunder Card Game
description: Players try to match the symbol on their Wrestler card with the symbol on the Action card. The more matches you make, the more cards or points you score.
mechanics: Hand Management, Pattern Recognition, Set Collection
publishers: The United States Playing Card Company

name: Kävikö flaksi?
description:
"Did You Score?"

The restaurant is divided in five sections: Restaurant, Dance floor, Bar, Cloakroom and Taxi queue, each one of which has three spaces. At the start of each turn, a player must first spin the three-segment wheel of fortune (Men, Women, Unisex) and, depending on the player's real gender, take a turn or pass. When taking a turn a player moves her piece one space, then draws a card from the appropriate deck. Some of the cards have immediate effects, with others the players must roll the "smiley die" to determine whether the action taken/incident has a positive result or not.

The first player to get through the restaurant succesfully is considered to "have scored", and wins the game. In the last two decks it's also possible to "score" immediately through a card result.

The game is entirely luck based, and other players' game cannot be affected in any way.

name: Tarzan
description:
From the Box:

You and your opponents are in a dangerous race through the jungle. Quickly move your Tarzan pawn along the path by spinner count but watch your step or you might get caught in treacherous quicksand or fall into a native pit trap. Beware of the fierce beasts deep in the jungle. You'll be stalked by man-eating lions, panthers and crocodiles and hunted by rampaging rhinos that can stop you in your tracks and force you backward on the path. Be on the lookout for vines that allow you to swing out of danger and shortcuts to speed you on your way toward the finish space. Be the first player to complete the action packed race and you'll win the game!

name: Alfons kortspel
description:
Swedish card game featuring Alfons and friends from the books and short films by Gunilla Bergström. 58 cards are dealt equally among the players. One card is placed face-up on the table. The starting player turns up the top card from his deck. If it is the same character as the open card, or if the balloons on the cards are the same color, the player plays the card on a common pile and continues turning his cards. When the cards don´t match the player discards his card and the next player turns up his top card. If a player turns up a card that is both the same character and the same balloon color as the open card, he may put all his discards on the pile. Players may have to turn their discard pile into a new draw deck. The first player to run out of cards is the winner.

No decisions to make at all, but an easy game for small kids.
categories: Card Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Draw-Bridge
description:
An interesting 2-player Bridge game manufactured in polished wood by Chas Goodall & Sons Ltd, Camden Works London at some time in the early 20th Century. The main component of the game is a pair of stepped wooden slabs with 13 slots cut into them at 45 degrees so 2 dummy hands can be stood up at that angle, the slabs can then be placed on the table so one player can see the cards, but opponent can't. The actual rules for this 2-player version of Bridge are on the back of the wooden steps.

Although the actual date of manufacture has not been established, the game carries a patent dated 1905.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Betting and Bluffing, Team-Based Game, Trick-taking

name: Politricks Louisiana Political Game
description:
Discover Politricks, Louisiana's hottest new board game in which you could become governor with a roll of the dice! Continuous excitement and non-stop laughter await you and your friends as you "Campaign" your way through the ups and downs of the state's colorful political history. Gaining votes is easy, but so is losing them. So go ahead and take that bribe, just don't get caught! After all, Politricks is the name of the game!

Home Page: http://www.politricks.com/

name: Cranium Grab & Go Mega Marbles
description:
This game from the Cranium Grab & Go series takes marbles to a new level. Besides allowing regular play, this game also includes rings that, when the marbles land inside, the player must perform to score points.

From the publisher:

The game of marbles with fun Cranium twists
Compact packaging makes it ideal for travel
Fun for kids -- and adults!
Play with traditional rules or wacky new ones
A fun, affordable gift for family and friends

Need a burst of outrageous fun? Get your hands on Grab & Go Mega Marbles!

Play the traditional way or mix it up with wacky new twists, like shooting marbles into activity rings to determine whether you'll hum, spell, or act out a clue.

What's in the box?
Mega Marbles includes 22 colorful marbles (20 small and 2 large) and 10 goals.

name: Lerne Nürnberg kennen
description:
259 cards with questions about the great city of Nürnberg (Nuremberg). The board is a satellite photo of Nuremberg.
Whoever has collected 8 cards (by answering their questions), gets to answer the MASTER QUESTION.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Educational, Political, Trivia
publishers: Nürnberger Nachrichten, Stadt Buch Verlag Wolfgang Giesche München

name: Lucky's Clover Challenge
description:
"A Magical Adventure for up to Four Players"

"The object: Be the first player to move your 3 Marshmallow Charms around the gameboard and into your HOME line."

This is a roll-and-move game in the Pachisi tradition. It appeared on the back of a Lucky Charms cereal box and uses a pop-o-matic-style die-rolling device.

name: Schatzsuche
description: In order to find hidden treasures in the palace, you must go through many rooms, which are full of strange articles trying to find those treasures. With good memory and some luck the treasures come into sight.

name: Pizza Twist
description:
Pizza Twist is a child variant on Twister. A spinner determines which pizza topping must be moved, and then the players must physically place the topping piece on the large pizza-shaped playing mat.

Ages 5 and up
categories: Action / Dexterity, Children's Game, Party Game

name: Pelles riddarspel
description:
"Pelles riddarspel" (Pelle's knight game)

Based on the childrens book "Pelle hjälper en riddare" (Pelle helps a knight), the object is to be the first one to run through the castles different obstacles. The most imminent threat is the dragon. If you happen to stay on that circle you have to almost start all over again. The game is suitable for smaller children and the dice is the only tool. So there is no skill what so ever needed to be able to play the game. Some reading knowledge might be needed to support the first round to be able to solve what is written. But even the smallest children will get the point after the first round. The advantage of the game, that it is very easy to play, might also be its disadvantage. It gets boring quite fast. Even for the smaller children.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Travel Bingo
description:
Travel Bingo comes with ten dice featuring objects that might be seen while driving, such as animals, vehicles, and buildings. Players roll the dice into the included tray, and then try to spot the objects for points. Before rolling, one die is set aside to customize the game to the players' location. (For example, the orange die has farm-related objects, so it is set aside if the players are in a town or city.)

The game is designed for a single player or multiple players working cooperatively, but includes rules for playing competitively with multiple sets.

name: The Moment of Truth
description:
Where is the weirdest place, you've ever made out with someone?

Do you dare tell the truth? Well you better, for if your opponents feel your fibbing, to the lie detector you go!

The Moment of Truth is a zany party game filled to the brim with funny, shocking and downright racy questions that you and your best buddies must answer truthfully to progress down the path of riches. However at anytime one of your "friends" could call you out as a liar and send you packing to the patented "Lie Detector" to prove your story. Pass, and move ahead; Fail, and back you go in your shame.

First player to be truthful enough to reach the pinnacle is the winner.

3-6 "honest" players.

The game is based on the television series.
categories: Electronic, Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game

name: Full On World Soccer
description: The object of 'Full On World Soccer (i.e. football) is to score more goals than your opponent. To do this, you move your eleven players (coloured discs representing one of 32 countries) around the board to control the ball. Each turn the player in possession of the ball rolls three six-sided dice (including one directional die) and moves the ball accordingly. The aim is to move the ball into the goal or to another one of the players on the same team to retain possession. The game ends at the end of the allotted time. Two 30 minute halves are suggested in the rules, however any length game could be played.

name: Destination: Thee Bible game
description: Destination is the perfect way to create an atmosphere of friendship and learning for people of all ages, denominations and different levels of Bible knowledge. It is easy to learn and fun to play with series of special plays, including Destinations, Rewards, Passages and Miracles. You do not have to be as Bible scholar to enjoy challenges of Direct, True or False, Multiple Choice and Fill-in the blank questions.

name: Sunshine Cheez-It Scrabble Junior
description: Simplified version of Scrabble Junior published on the back of a box of Cheez-Its. Game is played using Cheez-Its with letters on them as the tiles.

name: Monopoly: Hollywood Edition
description: The stage is set. Lines rehearsed. Cameras rolling. Your role? Lead actor assuming the part of real estate tycoon bent on becoming Hollywood's most powerful movie mogul. The script calls for your character to possess an aggressive, take-no-prisoners attitude in the classic tradition of good, old-fashioned American capitalism. Buy, sell and trade Hollywood's hottest properties en route to taking complete control of Tinseltown.
categories: Economic, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Negotiation
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss – Die spannende Jagd nach dem Diamanten
description:
The goal of the game is to collect as many white diamonds as possible. The game board depicts the cursed castle with three floors, the top two of which are rotatable against the lower one(s). One of the investigators is put onto the top disk which is then rotated (as determined by a die roll). If the disk is rotated to a room symbol, the active player can try to obtain diamonds by rolling against an individual number belonging to each investigator.
In some cases, the players find a path to the next level. If in investigator can find the way out of the lowest level of the castle, he gets some diamonds and is out of the game.
There are red and white diamonds. Red diamonds can be used to manipulate die rolls, while white diamonds determine the winner at the end of the game.

Not to be confused with Die drei ???: Das verfluchte Schloss that came out in the same year, from the same publisher, about the same film, but from different designers.
categories: Adventure, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Kuninkaantie
description: Finland was part of Swedish kingdom for many centuries and in the 13th century the building of a road from the Finnish capital of the day Turku to the secondary city of Viipuri on the Russian border was started. The road was called Kuninkaantie (King's Road). In the game Kuninkaantie players visit 27 notable towns and villages along this particular road. If you'll happen stop in any of these locations, there will be tasks for you to accomplish, for example laughing at the king's rage. The main goal of the game is to learn local history and it's offered for schools as a tool for teaching.

name: LogIQ: Φ Phi
description:
From the publisher:
Challenge yourself and your friend with this fast-paced IQ duel game. Each product includes tasks divided into different task types, covering everything from number sequences to 3D problems and analogies. Put that grey matter to work and win the tasks by being the fastest one to solve the tricky problems!
Game 2 in series of 4!

name: Whatzizz??
description:
A mirror is something wonderful. The reflecting surface shows an exact image of whatever is held in front of the mirror. It´s a little more difficult if you can only see part of what is reflected in it. You need concentration and imagination to figure out what it is.

Each player puts a card facing downwards on the mirror element. Now all the players guess one after another what the picture might be by looking at the section of the mirror facing them. The player who guesses correctly may take the card and the one who collects the most cards wins the game.

Contents:
• 1 mirror element (135 x 135 x 105 mm)
• 60 motifs cards
• 5 empty cards to design yourselves
• 1 pen
• 1 coloured Beleduc Box

name: Diamond Bridge
description:
From the designer's website (www.diamondbridgegame.com):

Diamond Bridge is a strategy game for two to four players. The board has a diamond-shaped grid, four corner pits and gems of two colors.

To play, take turns placing a gem on any open dot on the board.

The object of the game is to bridge sides of your color with an unbroken string of gems.

The game always results in one player completing a bridge or the other giving up. There is no deadlock.

The corner dots count for either color.

A player who spans side-to-side calls out, "Diamond Bridge!"

The game concept is basic. Players try to bridge sides of their color. It's fun to play "right out of the box." For the serious player the complexity of Diamond Bridge soon becomes apparent. Mastering the game requires a sense of balance, spatial reasoning and sustained focus.

name: International Cricket
description: Dice based cricket game, The box folds out into a cricket ground, and both players have an elastic band powered catapult they use to "throw" the dice into the box. With the dice results either resulting with runs scored or a wicket.

name: Fuzzy Dice
description:
Roll, bluff and play the night away with this super-cool set of "MONDO" Dice and custom cards.

The zippered Fuzzy Dice contain --
3 MONDO sized black/white dice
70 playing cards, numbered 1 to 18
3 "Cooler" cards, with a value of -10
3 "Dealer" cards: High, Low, and High/Low
and rules sheets for all 3 games ...
and OF COURSE...the FUZZY DICE...the perfect cool carrying case.

Hang them from your rear-view mirror, stuff them in your backpack, bring them everywhere! Fun for all your friends and family.

These Giant Fuzzy Dice contain 3 games inside...

- "Fuzzy Dice" -- a variation on "Liar's Dice" or "Liar's Poker". The dice are rolled, and players declare how many cards they have that match a single die or a sum of two or more dice. Later players either raise or call the claim. Whoever loses the call loses a card from their hand. The last player with cards wins.

- "Chuck-A-Luck" -- world famous betting Carnival betting game of chance. Players place a card from their hand next to High, Low, or High/Low, then the 3 dice are rolled. If their total is 13-18, players who bet High save their card in their winnings plus a card from the dealer; if 3-8, those who bet Low do the same; if 9-12, those who bet High/Low save their card but with no extra card. After all the cards are played out, players reveal their saved cards, and the highest total wins.

- "Good Riddance" -- a fast-paced elimination game. Players place a card from their hand face up on the table, and the 3 dice are rolled. Cards that match any die or sum of dice discard their card; if doubles or triples are rolled every player passes a card from their hand to the left; and any player who matches the sum of the dice gets a free roll and discards all cards matching any dice or sum. When a player goes out of cards, the rest total their remaining cards. The lowest total after a certain number of rounds wins.
categories: Bluffing, Card Game, Dice, Party Game

name: Morjens
description:
Trivia game themed on famous places and persons connected to Swedish speaking Finns.

Questions are divided into five categories, and there are Easy and Difficult questions to choose from. You need to answer a question correctly to move forward. Answer an easy question correctly and you move one step forward, answer a difficult question and you move two steps.

First person completing a lap around the board wins.

name: Urbania
description: Just a roll-and-move to build up a new city and become the richest player. Branded by the Commerzbank as a promotional gift.

name: Take Me to the Cleaner$
description:
Take Me to the Cleaner$ is a hilarious board game promoting bonding and togetherness between couples.
1 to 4 couples can play this game with each couple playing "directly" and "only" against their own spouse/partner, not other players on the board. There must be one winner from each couple. The men in the game are known as "Tycoons" and the women are known as "Divas. "

Players roll the dice to advance around both sections of the game board. The outer ring is the "reality" portion of the game and there are three repeating squares that require a card draw with different tasks. The center ring is the "fantasy" portion and there you roll the dice to acquire ownership of the 20 "Matrimonial Assets". If you land on your own asset, you're safe. Landing on an unowned asset gives you ownership of that asset. If you land on an asset owned by your partner, you must hand over an asset of their choice.

To win the game, you must be the first player between you and your partner to accumulate the 20 Matrimonial Assets. Winning allows you to choose up to 3 tasks or consequences (from the Oops cards) for your partner to perform in real life the following week!

Components:

Game Board & Dice
Bride and Groom Tokens
Matrimonial Asset Cards
65 Busted Cards
65 Tycoon Oops Cards
65 Diva Oops Cards
65 Splitsville Cards
Pad of 20 Pledge Sheets
Rules and Definitions
categories: Card Game, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Dolce Vita
description:
Try to collect the most flirt chips in 20 rounds.
On your turn, you roll the die and move across the board; every space you land on has an event connected where you have to pay expenses, gamble in casinos, have a car crash, and other things - good and bad. On most spaces you have the opportunity to collect flirt chips. If you end your move on a 'marriage' space, you immediately lose the game. The same thing happens when you run out of money.

name: Prawda czy Wyzwanie
description:
PRAWDA CZY WYZWANIE (TRUTH OR DARE) is one of the most popular party games ever. Its prototype consisted of bottle gaming, and challenging or asking chosen players some kind of embarrassing questions.


In the card version of the game the players finally have a possibility to choose the task, and a random person who decides to speak the truth or take the challenge. They may choose from a pool of over 300 questions and over 100 challenges presented on the cards. The game also allows some space for inventing your own questions.
Extra rules and an option of a reward for the winner makes the game dynamic and exciting! Additional tasks and duels make the game even more fun. Another thing is the special cards which you can shuffle into the main deck. They give you the possiblity of changing the questions, or even asking players about the details of their previous answers, or force everyone in a current round to take a challenge!

name: Times Seven: Sayings of Jesus
description:
"Learn the important words of Jesus while you challenge your memory and test your luck. Race to collect seven Bible verses in seven rounds and win the game!"

Each round, players attempt to collect a set of four numbered, color coded cards that complete a Bible verse. This is done by drafting and discarding. Once a complete verse has been collected the player then lays down their set and tries to go out as soon as possible by discarding their remaining cards on other players' sets. Keyword cards and other action cards add an extra twist to the gameplay. At the end of each round, points are 'awarded' based on remaining cards-in-hand, and after seven rounds the lowest scorer wins!
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Religious
mechanics: Hand Management, Memory, Open Drafting, Set Collection

name: Beer Tic Tac Toe
description:
A drinking and more strategic version of Tic tac toe, to be played in pubs.

The rules are as follows:
a 3x3 grid is necessary for (at most) 9 glasses of beer.
The first player opens with ordering one glass of beer and placing the glass on one of the 9 spaces.
From then the play alternates between the two players.
A player can always choose one of the two possible options:
- order and place another glass of beer to an open space (available only until there are open spaces left)
- or drink a half glass of beer.

Whenever there is a line (column, row or diagonal) consisting of 3 full, 3 half-full or 3 empty glasses, the player achieving this wins (and the other player pays the bill).
categories: Abstract Strategy, Mature / Adult, Party Game

name: Show Jumping
description:
"Approved by the British Show Jumping Association"

From the manual :

"As one of the leading national sports of the country, Show Jumping has steadily gained in popularity. Without doubt, Television has done much to interest many people in this sport, and evidence of the increase in local shows brings witness to the rapid growth of interest in Show Jumping."

This game simulates show jumping and is designed to by instructional and fun. You lay out different courses to compete on using Britains Ltd plastic horse figures and fences.

There are six courses to choose from, the players layout the course with model fences. Each fence is numbered from 1 to 10. Players take it turn to jump the course by rolling the dice for each fence. They keep rolling until they roll the exact number on the fence and then take a hazard card to see if they received any faults for the jump. Total number of throws and faults are recorded on a scorepad for each fence. Time penalties are awarded based on the total number of dice rolls to get round the course and the winner is player with the least number of faults. There are rules variants for two other competition types.

name: Survival Camp
description:
"Welcome, fellow survivor.  You've talked about it with your friends. You've watched the movies. It's happening now. There is an outbreak of zombies. You have five minutes to grab whatever you can. I hope you're ready. We're heading for the hills to build our own survival camp."

Survival Camp is a dice and card game based on survival of the fittest. A zombie outbreak has occurred in your town and you must grab what you can and run. You’ll never be able to come back. It’s time to build your survival camp.

Players will build tasks based on their resources, stealing from neighboring camps and protect what they have with weapons against approaching zombies. First one to build camp stays alive.

Survival Camp is a travel-friendly game for 2-5 players.

Expansion packs will create more zombies for strategic play. Additional tasks for a more complex camp building.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection, Variable Player Powers

name: Veils of Verdandi
description:
'Veils of Verdandi' is a fantasy board game in which players work together to complete a heroic quest.The game has been created with the aim of translating the excitement of interactive storytelling of role-playing games to board games, while simplifying existing game concepts as well as adding new ones.

In the game, players must rescue the nephew of the king, prince Ture, from the dangers and mysteries of the Dark Forest. To do this, the players move across the game board as an adventuring party and visit strange and magical places while battling vicious enemies. But the players must move quickly, for when day changes to night, the Dark Forest becomes much more deadly indeed.

Used in this game are 4, 6 and 8 sided dice for combat and movement across the board, as well as for specific interactive story challenges the game has to offer. Players may buy new equipment and magical items during the game, and train their special abilities to a higher level.

The game is the first in a saga, the next installment of the game, Veils of Verdandi Book II, will carry the story beyond the Dark Forest and into a vast and deadly mountain range, and Slavic mythology. Players will be able to carry over any equipment and skills acquired in the first installment, and use them to defeat such dire foes as the Vampire, the Werewolf, and other dark and dreadful creatures born of mist and moonlight, that will challenge the might and magic of even the hardiest of adventurers.

name: The Human Race: A matter of life and death
description:
The Human Race is a game for people of all ages. As you play, you will see that each move is like life itself, with rules that allow for freedom of choice and ensuing consequences. Here you will witness the gravity of your own judgement and values, as well as that of others. What will be sacrificed to win the Human Race?

Unlike other games that endorse a win-at-any-cost moral, The Human Race demonstrates that employing such a moral is possible, but not likely to win the game. Points, intelligence, cunning or luck may win the game, but if you play with heart and conscience you will never lose.

Bitterness over loss has no role in The Human Race. For if you lose, it is totally your own doing. The freedom of choice is yours. Whether you play to teach your children or learn about yourself, The Human Race gives you hours of fun.

The rules are simple. The play, intricate. Downright soul-searching. The Human Race.

Playing the Game: First player rolls the white die and moves the number of squares indicated by the die moving in a clockwise direction. If a player lands on a square which points are indicated those points are added if it is a blue square (good)
and deducted from the score if it is a red square (evil). After the player has moved, they draw a blue card or red card determined by their final location, either adding (good) or deducting (evil) points from their score or following the instructions on the card.

Rolling the Life Dice: After following the instructions on the card the player rolls the three black "Life Dice". If all three dice show the same number then the player dies. If on a red square or has negative points the player is out of the game. If a player dies while having positive points and on a blue square, then even though the player is out, they still may win the game -- that is if all the other players do not reach the Final Resting Place with positive points or if the others die with fewer good points.

Final Resting Place: The game is won by the player to reach the Final Resting Place. If no player reaches the Final Resting Place, then the player who dies with the most good points is the winner.

name: Wonderfully Wacky Bar Games
description:
This game consists of a deck of cards, with each card describing a small mini-game that can be played with next to no pieces. These games range from deduction, bluffing to just plain silliness.

On their turn, players turn over a card and then play the short game described there. First player to win three of these mini-games wins.

name: Agentin salaiset paperit
description:
Agentin salaiset paperit (Agent's secret papers) is a Finnish board game very similar to New York Chase, or Scotland Yard, but just simpler. There is an Agent whose starting location is known, moves are secret, and his task is to escape from the city. There are also the Chasers whose task is to get the Agent in sight so that finally there is no corner for him to hide behind.

The rules are in Finnish but the map only has a few Finnish word so the game itself is almost language independent.

name: Bubbly the Dolphin Game
description:
A friendly sea creature that blows bubbles for you to catch. Grab a bubble catcher and let the fun begin! The catcher will count the bubbles. Listen for the "pop" as each bubble is counted. The one who catches the most bubbles will be the winner!

Includes:
Dolphin
Electronic Catcher
Indoor play mat
Bubble solution
Rules
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Electronic, Party Game

name: Cherry Bomb
description:
Cherry Bomb is a single player zilch (or also known as “Dice 10,000”) game of probability with
health and a bonus points system added.
You will need:
. 6 dice.
. Dice cup.
. A paper (Or an empty excel sheet) pad for keeping score.
. “Zilch” scoring chart.

The goal is to get to a certain point amount without running out of health.

name: Mischief Night
description:
Card game where you must get rid of all your cards to win, but beware... the monsters are out to get you on Mischief Night.

A light, fast paced card game for 3-12 players. Earn tokens by going out first and being named the Pumpkin King.
