The goal of Mischief Night is to get rid of all of your cards as fast as possible. The 92-card deck contains 78 monster cards ranked from 1 to 12, along with two Jokers (wild) and a Mischief Night X-deck of 12 cards.

Each monster card bears a number, which is not only its rank, but also tells you how many of that card exist in the deck. There are twelve 12’s, eleven 11’s, ten 10’s and so on, and a single card ranked #1 which is the Pumpkin King. The lower the number, the better the rank. While the #12s are low ranking cards and the hardest to get rid of, they each have a unique ability that may be used during the Mischief Night part of play at the beginning of each round.

In addition to the standard monster cards, there is another deck of twelve special (X) cards with different backs. This deck serves two purposes; it is used before the game starts to determine the starting player order and then 2 cards are earned each round by the player who earned Pumpkin King status. During the Mischief Round they are very useful in battling the individual special powers of the #12 cards. The more rounds you win, the better chance you have of protecting yourself from the mischief.

name: Divorce Court
description:
From instruction sheet:

OBJECT OF GAME:
Object of the Divorce Court game is to move as many WEBB-STICKERS as each player can in the WEBB-SITE.


This is a basic roll, move, draw cards game. As you go around the board you land on spaces related to court appearances and collect poker chips (chits).

name: Ireland (fan expansion for Ticket to Ride)
description:
This map is an unofficial Fan made expansion. Symbols & Graphics Copyright © 2004-2015 Days of Wonder, Inc. Produced with permission of Days of Wonder, for non-commercial use only.

This follows the principles of the basic Ticket to Ride game on a special board with special cards and rules. The object of the game is to gain the most points by travelling various routes and outwitting other players. You will need the train pieces and the train cards from either the US or Europe base games (or you can buy them from the Days of Wonder shop. You can use stations if you wish.

There is an extra set of cards for the "cities", each with a value to be earned by visiting that "city". These cards are dealt/picked up alongwith tickets in the same quantity and with the same 'keep/dispose' rules. Some of the cards give you extra facilities to complete your tickets. There are also up to 9 bonuses for the end-of-game scoring.

The main new rule is the option to discard 5 cards and pick up 5 new ones, as your turn. This is very useful if you are desperate for engines or a particular colour card. You can also call time when your wagon stock reaches 3, if you want, giving you the advantage of stopping other players completing tickets.
categories: Expansion for Base-game, Fan Expansion, Print & Play

name: Suuri löytöretkipeli ja Merirosvopeli
description: You take the role of one of the great explorers (Polo, Kolumbus, Da Gama or Magalhães.) This is a learning game where you follow the routes and events of your characters expedition, by rolling dice and moving. You can make it more interesting by implicating the Pirate rule, where some of the players take the roles of pirates.

name: A.D.A.P.T.: Red Cephalopod Expansion Pack
description: A red themed, offense focused expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 5 new bodies, 8 new parts, and 3 status trackers. Also introduces Autotomy, Grab, Inking, Neg Lethality, and Oversize: (Location). Adds +1 player to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Variable Player Powers

name: A.D.A.P.T.: Green Reptile & Amphibian Expansion Pack
description: A green-themed, defense-heavy expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 5 new bodies, 8 new parts, and 3 status trackers. Also introduces metamorphosis and withdraw. Adds +1 player to the base game.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination

name: A.D.A.P.T.: Yellow Guppy Expansion Pack
description: A yellow-themed, replayablity-increasing expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 15 new genetically-boosted guppies and 3 bonus guppies (red, blue, and green). Also introduces changeling, ferocious, genetic engineer, hearty, lethal, metamorphosis, oversize: (location), survivalist, and time turning.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game, Fighting
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: A.D.A.P.T.: Black Bio-Mech Expansion Pack
description: A black-themed biomechanical expansion to A.D.A.P.T. Includes 8 new parts, 3 new guppies, and 4 resistance trackers. Also introduces genetic boosts, blast, destined, energized, oversize: (location), shapeshift, shielded, targeting, and transmogrify.
categories: Card Game, Dice, Expansion for Base-game
mechanics: Deck, Bag, and Pool Building, Dice Rolling, Player Elimination, Variable Player Powers

name: Askungen
description:
In this children's game, themed after Walt Disney's Cinderella animated picture, players move along a path of coloured spaces by drawing cards with instructions to move ahead a number of spaces, to move ahead or back to a space of a certain colour, or to switch places with another player. When a player reaches the end of the track, they must select the correct shoe card from a spread of five to win, or be sent back to the pumpkin space.

Likely released in the late 70s or very early 80s.

name: Het Leven van een Loser
description:
“Het Leven van een Loser” is the title of the Dutch translations for the “Diary of a Wimpy Kid series”.

This game features the characters from that series in a variant on Pachisi, with a modular board supporting up to six players.
Instead of rolling dice, players alternatively play cards (numbered 1 through 13) to move forward, with some cards having special powers (e.g. swap two player tokens are move all your tokens forward).
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Take That

name: Rorshöck!
description:
What do you see when you stare at a Jackson Pollock? A drippy gooey mess or an angst ridden family dinner? Or how about when you gaze up at the clouds? Do you see a herd of African elephants or a bunch of cotton balls? Every day we are exposed to images that prompt or provoke our psyches. And what we see says a lot about our personalities--or lack thereof. That's why the simple act of seeing images in an ink blot can be so revealing--especially with the assistance of a highly paid, over-educated psychotherapist. But not everyone has that kind of time... or money. Which is exactly why Rorshock! cards are so indispensable.

Game includes 20 ink blot cards and a "Diagnosis Book" and offers multiple ways to play. Play can be as straightforward as one player saying what they see in an inkblot and another player diagnosing it with the closest matching diagnosis for that card in the book. Alternatively, the ink blots can be used to inspire writing prompts or games of Charades.

name: Port Perma
description:
Up to 4 Players can take part in the game. The Players first decide which colour they are to use and each one draw a shipping route Card, which names the ports he must sail to for loading and unloading. A "6" has to be thrown with the dice to start. With the next throw after the "6" the ship can sail from Hamburg. No second throw is allowed after a "6" during the game.

Throwing the dice is carried out by means of a short, sharp tap on the Knob of the dice box.

Each Player can only enter a port when the exact number necessary is thrown with the dice, otherwise he has to wait until he has thrown the exact number.

The winner is the one who is first to arrive back in the port of Hamburg and calls "Hamburg Ahoy".

—user summary

name: Speak Out: Misheard Song Lyrics
description:
This expansion pack features phrases that sound a lot like song lyrics…but just ""off"" enough to challenge players and generate lots of laughs. Players draw from the deck and read the phrase as best as they can, but it's not so easy to do when the mouthpiece is hindering them from forming words correctly. Players try to say phrases such as ""Eye wood block drive tundra trials"". Teammates must correctly guess the phrase in under a minute in order to earn the card. The team with the most cards at the end of the game wins. The expansion pack can be added to the original Speak Out game or 1 player can use the mouthpiece and everyone else can guess what they're saying.

Additional phrase cards for Speak Out. 72 cards (144 phrases) and 1 mouthpiece included.
categories: Card Game, Expansion for Base-game, Party Game

name: Wildes Olchi-Würfeln
description: The players role the 2 die one after the other and wipe off the olchis they throw.

name: Order Pizza-la
description:
Become a pizza chef and compete to collect pizza cards to complete your pizza. Each card has 1 of 6 kinds of ingredients and 1 of 8 kinds of alphabet keys.
In each round, the turn player flips a black card to reveal the alphabet key for that round, and all players get the card with that key at the same time.
At the end of the 8 rounds, you will have an 8-piece pizza.
You will score if you meet one of the two orders and complete the pizza with a particular type of piece. You win by getting the most points.

—user summary

name: Hormigas: Cavando entre Túneles
description:
The ants, as present as invisible in our daily lives, will wage a bid between obstacles and impediments, to form a colony larger than that of their rivals, connecting underground paths and above all teaching us, while we play, what this important work is about as tiny.


Cavando entre Túneles

Players play ants and are trying to dig a set of tunnels to reach the queen. The road can get complicated if obstacles appear, but in the end, the ants always reach their goal.

On each turn, players use cards to build tunnels to their queen and place obstacles in the other players paths. You must end your turn with exactly five cards in hand. Only one card can be played per turn.

The game continues until one player manages to lower the minimum number of tunnels, in order to place the queen at the end of the course and thus win the game (as long as all the cards are connected). As soon as you have played the required number of cards in a continuous line, you can add your queen to the end of this line in the same turn and win the game!


Hormiguero Infinito

From top to bottom or from bottom to top, connect the paths of the underground maze and create your own anthill. You are going to enjoy a game without limits and with infinite possibilities.


Trabajo de Hormiga

Collecting 100 ants for your anthill is not easy. To form this colony successfully you always have to start with La Reina. While working both on the surface and in the humid tunnels, you will have to be careful of the obstacles that will stop them.
your progress in the game.

On their turn, players must lay down a queen cards and then add tunnel card and ant cards totalling up to 100 ants. Or they can try to sabotage their opponents by playing obstacle cards.

ATTENTION: If the queen is not lowered, cards cannot be downloaded from tunnels or grass, since a colony does not exist without it. Once she is there, those cards are lowered until an obstacle is presented. Whoever has one in their anthill cannot continue to download cards until they solve it with the corresponding card.


The first player to solve all their obstacles and add more than 100 ants to their lowered cards will be the winner.
There are no more cards in the deck and the players have discarded all the cards in their hand, or that no one can bring down more cards, because the game is blocked. In this case, the dropped ants must be added, and whoever gets the most wins.
mechanics: Pattern Building, Solo / Solitaire Game, Square Grid

name: Torinopoli
description: A Monopoly-like game based on a ironic reinterpretation of Turin.

name: What Am I?
description:
This is a quirky card game, where you get a maximum of 20 questions to guess what or who your opponent is.

They could be an animal, vegetable, mineral or something completely random like a stapler or maybe a person like Harry Potter. It all depends on what they choose to be from the card they've picked.

It sounds easy doesn't it, but don't be fooled, as the person can only answer your questions with a Yes or No. Choose your questions wisely as twenty questions will soon fly by or you might be lucky and guess the answer in less!

—description from the publisher

name: The Bible Game For Kids
description:
Before the game begins, players choose one of three difficulty levels for their Bible trivia questions (Easy, Medium, or Hard). Players race to the finish by rolling a die on their turn and advancing their player piece the number of spaces rolled. The first player whose piece reaches the finish wins!

Players will be asked Bible Trivia questions of their chosen difficulty level when their piece lands on a red ladder or a rope. When a player's piece lands on a red ladder they are asked questions until they give an incorrect answer or reach the top of the ladder. For each question answered correctly the player moves their piece up one section of the ladder.

When a player's piece lands on a rope they are asked questions until they give a correct answer or reach the bottom of the rope. For each question answered incorrectly the player moves their piece down one section of the rope.

If a player's piece lands on any part of a blue ladder or blue chute they automatically move their piece to the top of the ladder or bottom of the chute.

Whenever a player's piece lands on a green arrow an action card is randomly drawn and the player must perform the action indicated on the drawn card. Typical action cards move a player's piece forward or backward several spaces. After moving forward from an action card a player ignores ropes, chutes, and slides but the above rules still apply for ladders. After moving backward from an action card a player ignores ladders but the above rules still apply for ropes, chutes, and slides.

Multiple player pieces can occupy the same space on the board. The first player to reach the finish line wins!
mechanics: Events, Race, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Bogyó és Babóca: Erdei kirándulás
description:
The fun trip begins! The forest road hides many experiences until we reach the ice cream parlor. Who will be the most skilled, who will be the first to taste Frici's delicacies?

The easy-to-understand, yet exciting board game enchants children into the fairytale world of Bogyó and Babóca. They can play together with Soma the Pig and the Centipede, go boating with Gömbi, and finally relax at Frici's ice cream parlor at the end of the road.

Each player starts from the starting square. When it's your turn, roll the dice. You must move as many as you rolled. If you have arrived at a tricky field, read what you have to do! Such fields can move you forward or backward on the path, reward you a reroll, or cause you to miss the next turn. The winner is the one who manages to reach the ice cream parlor first. However, the game is not over yet, as the others also deserve an ice cream after the big tour.

name: Teddy Bears Picnic
description: Teddy Bears Picnic is a roll-and-move children's game. Players must move their teddy bear playing piece around the board collecting items for a picnic. The first player to collect four different snacks and return to the centre of the board is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Ship It!
description:
The game of project management.

It’s a simple card game for three to five players, designed to help people talk through the various things that happen when you’re making software. You shuffle the deck and draw cards. Cards can be drivers, blockers, or actions. Your goal is to ship three phases of your project. You do this by getting rid of your blockers, collecting enough drivers, and yelling “SHIP IT!”

Drivers move a phase forward… blockers keep you from shipping… and Actions change the state of play.

name: Sexual Trivia
description:
Players move around the board answering somewhat clinical sexual trivia questions to accrue points (orgasms). First player to 100 orgasms wins. Categories for questions are General, Health & Sexual Deviations, History & Statistics, and People: Western & Other Cultures.

From the box:
"Sexual Trivia can also relieve the tedium of a long drive. Just take along the sex manuals and take turns asking questions. We do suggest, however, that the game not be played on public transportation!"

name: Mother
description:
(from publisher's website)

Was your mother's love measured by the circumference of her meatballs? Or was it stored in a Tupperware container to keep for a later date? Whether she was perfectly doting or passive aggressive, here's your chance to have the mother you never had or to relive your happy childhood. If you've ever had a mother, you need to play this game. Because whether you win or lose, it's guaranteed to be more fun than a barrel full of...well...mothers.

By answering a series of pop culture, pop psychology, history, trivia, and other ridiculously humorous mother-related questions like "Which sandwich most effectively alleviates guilt; turkey on whole wheat or corned beef on rye?" players move ahead one square. Or by role playing and acting out commands such as "Go 1 minute without showing any emotions" players move ahead 2 squares to move around the board and be the first one "in the will", while trying to avoid taking a "guilt trip", going to "therapy", doing a stint in "jail/rehab" or spending time in a "monastery/bunker".

name: Scooby-Doo Game: Where Are You!
description: The is a simple children's "track" game. The track starts at the bottom of the board near the Mystery Machine, continues inside a "castle", and has various instructions on certain spaces. The game also includes a spinner used to determine the number of spaces players can move. The board depicts tunnels and other "mysterious" places that a player may be taken to. These events are typical of the things that happen in the cartoon. A deck of cards also directs the action of the players. The winner of the game is the first player who follows Scooby and finds the "hidden treasure".
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Solvalla
description:
Solvalla in Stockholm is the most famous horse racing venue in Sweden, and gives it's name to this harness racing game - "a family game where you transfer the excitement of the harness racing track to your own living room."

Two to six players can participate in the actual race, while the number of those participating in the betting is unlimited. One player is chosen as the totalisator manager and collects the starting fees from each horse driver as well as the V5-coupons for betting on individual horses and their final places in the race.

The race itself is a simple roll-and-move affair, with horses allowed to move diagonally, block other horses by running in front of them, and naturally always trying to choose the inner lane to get and stay in the lead. Unsportsmanlike play - ie. not letting your horse win even though you can, maybe because of bets placed - carries a fine.

When a race is over, the manager turns over an odds card and deals out any winnings based on that combined with the V5-coupons, while the total of collected starting fees is dealt 2/3 to the winner and 1/3 to the second. The rules also stipulate that as many races are driven as there are horses in the game.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Roll / Spin and Move

name: El Delirio
description:
This abstract game presents a board with a square grid and 21 stackable pyramidal pieces per player, in three different types.
The players alternate taking turns moving the pieces in a given pattern trying to capture some particular pieces. The possible movements are different depending on the location of the pieces, and if the piece will capture another one or not.
The goal is to capture one of the rival objective pieces.

name: Careers for Girls
description: The classic game of Careers adapted to the young female audience. The career choices are Super Mom, Rock Star, School Teacher, Fashion Designer and Animal Doctor. A sample space on the gameboard reads, "Tell us the names of your 8 children."

name: Rode Ridder Avonturenspel
description: Based on the popular comic books and novels De Rode Ridder (written by Karel Biddeloo). Each player either plays De Rode Ridder or one of his opponents. The game book contains scenarios for play. In each scenario De Rode Ridder has to fulfill a quest, and his opponents do everything they can to stop him.
categories: Adventure, Comic Book / Strip, Medieval, Novel-based

name: Walk to Jesus
description:
Walk to Jesus is the first Christian Motivation Family Game in the world. It joins fun, religious education, it can be used for prayer or meditation base and besides all that it is a great game. It is a great way to spend some quality time together with your family.

To win in Walk to Jesus you need Divine Grace cards, which can be obtained by helping other players. Not only does this uphold one of basic Christian teachings, and has general moral value, it also adds to the depth of the game as Walk to Jesus is world’s first game requiring help to other players – your competitors – in order to win. This gives game a special strategic element making it more challenging and fun to play.

name: Three-Card Monte
description:
Three-Card Monte is played one of two ways. The first method is a children's game in which three cards or objects are laid out face-up. The cards or objects are then turned face down and scrambled. The challenge is then to pick out where one of the objects is now positioned. It's flipped over and the guess is either correct or not.

Variations of this "honest" version are now commonly shown on the big screens of sporting events.

The "confidence" version of Three-Card Monte actually uses 4 cards. The dealer uses a palming technique to make a card switch, so that the player can't find the correct card. This method is a rigged game, which often involves the use of a shill to create the illusion the game can be won.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Card Game, Children's Game

name: Irish Checkers
description: Similar to Wahoo, players attempt to move their marbles completely around the board in order to get back to the starting point. The Sullins Manufacturing Company discontinued the line due to copyright and trademark issues.

name: ScandalMonger Trivia Game
description:
America loves a good scandal. Nobody escapes the burning glare of the spotlight. Politicians, actors, athletes, rock stars, and even regular folks have all fallen prey to the media feeding frenzy. ScandalMonger Trivia Game offers players a chance to remember these stories, whether they were full-blown scandals or tempests-in-a-teapot.

ScandalMonger Trivia Game asks players to become reporters for ScandalMonger, America's premier daily tabloid. Working on assignments from the Editor's desk, reporters have to plot against competitors in the race to assemble the next day's front page.

The first reporter to gather a cover story in each of five featured categories:

Politics
Hollywood
Rock and Roll
Sports
and Miscellaneous, wins the game.
categories: Humor, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Trivia

name: Texas Trivia
description:
A Texas flavored version of a Trivia game.

Players move about the board answering questions to collect tokens AND money (must have one of each token and at least a million bucks to win) in a bid to claim they are "as big as Texas".

Trivia questions are asked from one of 5 color coded books that relate to different topics on Texas.

Though not explicitly stated, the game requires at least 5 players or 5 teams of players in order to actually play the game.

Very tongue in cheek handling of Trivia based gaming.

From box:
"Rustle up your compadres and kinfolk and you'll have more fun than a thirsty Texan at a Margarita convention. Try your skill at 5,000 questions in five categories: Texas Sports, Entertainment, No Place but Texas, Cities and Towns, and Lone Star Legends. It aint easy, Bubba. You'll hit some dry holes in this game, but you gotta keep drillin' away at the trivia questions till you hit your gusher. And if you love Texas, you'll strike it rich with Texas Trivia."

name: Top Shed
description:
" A Railway Game to recall the days of the Roundhouse Engine Sheds and the optional routes from London to major destinations. Entertaining, educational, novel concept, rotating roundtable in ' Roundhouse ' ".

Taken from description on box.

name: Airport
description:
Family game based on Frankfurt airport air traffic.

There are 2 (3) variants to play:
first: mix all (event=activity traffic) cards and flip them like memory - getting bonus points (energy chips) you must flip them in a matching (=increasing) sequence;
player with most energy chips wins; learn more about an airport.

Second (partly) cooperative:
act as a flight controller; try to bring all of your 3 planes to their destinaton (full cycle - start/rise/turn/debark/back to the gate) using your energy chips. Best player ==> be the fastest one, but all players lose if there are still planes after all energy chips are used. The biggest challenge is not to block other players' movements, because each turn you must 'burn' an energy chip.

third: it's a mix out of one and two: Gain energy chips (memory) first, divide and use theme to move/control your planes.

There is also a solitary approach for the second variant (use as few chips as possible).
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Memory, Point to Point Movement

name: Social Security
description:
From the rules:

"SOCIAL SECURITY is a new, novel, non-competitive game for family, classmates, church groups - or for any 'happening'.

SOCIAL SECURITY consists of a game board, six kinds of cards, a spinner, pawns, and a die.

Players, from six year olds to grandparents, will find themselves stretching their imaginations and practicing new communications skills."

Players move around the board drawing, reading, and commenting on mildly thought-provoking cards. Some cards ask for an opinion on interpersonal issues, some present Ozzie and Harriet-type domestic problems then ask for possible solutions. Certain squares direct you to spin a large spinner built into the game box that directs similar tasks ("Share a time when you had good luck", "Describe your favorite teacher")

The game morphs into a Christian version with the substitution of one deck of cards and the use of a spinner overlay. New spinner directions are like "Say something about forgiveness" and the new cards have Bible verses and stick figure drawings of Jesus doing things.

Great concept, but the execution is a little mundane and unimaginative.
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Storytelling

name: Pooh Musical Hide 'n' Seek Game
description:
Press Pooh's head to play the music and make his friends peek out from their honey pots. Who's hiding in which pot?

To play, flip over a card and try to find the matching character. To win, match all 6 of your cards by finding all 6 of Pooh's friends: Piglet, Tigger, Eeyore, Rabbit, Owl and Kanga!
categories: Children's Game, Educational, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Winnie the Pooh Card Game
description: The aim is to gather sets of three cards having same symbols. There are 24 cards altogether.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based

name: Mulan Magical Board Game
description:
(Text from back of Box)
"An ancient Chinese legend is magically transformed into an unparalleled adventure bursting with action, emotion and lots of laughs in Disney's heralded 36th animated Classic MULAN."

The object of the game is to be the first player to take your character playing pieces, one by one, out of your scoring banner into the center of the board, finding the quickest route, and stacking them on the character space. You will then collect, one by one, all of your Battle Flag Pieces and place these in your plastic stand, and return them to your scoring banner (again, finding the quickest route). Players can only enter the board center through their colored 'Mushu' square.

On each turn, players spin the arrow and move in any direction the number shown.
Instruction square - follow the instruction
Your colored square - jump to a corresponding colored square anywhere on the board
Land on a dragon space- move along the dragon body in any direction

Game plays with 2-4 young players, running approx 30 minutes.

Believe this game was a promotional item shipped from one retailer with copies of the first VHS release in the UK.
categories: Children's Game, Dice, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: 24 CTU Undercover
description:
From the Press Release:

In this political thriller it’s up to the players to spy, interrogate and reveal CTU’s plans as they foil yet another terrorist plot. The game features a unique system to track plan details on a cell phone game piece. Other players may call you by placing a die cut screen of their choice over your cell phone, revealing key information. Be the first to correctly identify another player’s plans and win CTU Undercover. Ages 12 and up. 2-4 players.

Buy Microbadge - 24 fan


Buy Microbadge - Kiefer Sutherland is a character Jack Bauer plays when he's not saving the world.

name: Big Break
description:
From the back of the box:
"Now you too can play the snooker star's favourite red hot TV quiz game anytime. Answer a question right and it's your turn to do some serious "potting". Answer it wrongly and you're snookered. Simply throw the dice and remember big throws could mean Big Breaks!"
Based on a hit early 90's BBC1 TV show in the UK hosted by Jim Davison and the snooker legend John Virgo.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Party Game, Sports, Trivia
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Meidän oma nukkumatti: Hyvän yön peli
description: In this game players roll special die and according to the result put either a star card or a piece of sandman on the board. Game has two versions, co-operative and competitive. In co-operative version players win, if sandman is ready before all star cards are placed. In competitive version the player who places the last sandman piece wins. In both versions players lose together if all star cards are on the board before sandman is ready.

name: Drag Race
description:
Drag Race is a paper-and-pencil guessing game for two players. Players alternate choosing the letter A, B, or C (darkening a half-circle to indicate their choice) and guessing what their opponent has chosen.

Player 1 chooses a letter and Player 2 guesses what they chose. If Player 2 guesses correctly nothing happens. If Player 2 guesses incorrectly Player 1 gets to darken scoring squares (representing speed), with the number depending on how late in the game it is (the later, the more points scored). The object is to score as many squares as possible.

name: Manic Martians
description:
The Manic Martians Game is a fun game for little ones. Bop a pop-up martian with a space rocket bopper to pick it up.

The Manic Martians Game is fun for two players. Your little one can watch as the martians go in and out of the craters, and then bop one on the head with the space rocket bopper to pick it up! This enjoyable game for 2 players is great fun for children and adults, and easy for little ones to understand.

The game has a round plastic board with small plastic martians set into holes in the board. With batteries, the martians will move up and down in their spaces. Each player has a small rubber mallet and must try to strike the martians with the mallet. A perfect strike will "stick" the martian to the mallet and the player may remove it from the board. The player with the most martians at the end of the game wins.

name: Bear vs Gorilla vs CEO vs Hippie: Extra Things
description:
Extra Things is a 9 card expansion with 2 more cards added as stretch goals. Without giving away all the secrets, all players will now have an attack of 15, Joey Greco (from the TV show Cheaters) as a gecko, the CEO dressed as John Oliver wearing a trench coat and bunny ears and even The Spanish Inquisition shows up.

The first expansion to Black Slither's first game.

name: Korpoludki
description:
Board game designed for 2-5 players aged from 12 years.

Rat race in the Corporation - it's not a catch. To climb the top of the KORPO S.A. in Mordor, get as many prestige points as possible. To this end, players collect First, Second, Third and Top Degree Attribute Cards. The one who scores the most points wins.

Players traverse a board (a corporate skyscraper) using action cards and visit various rooms and offices which enable them to collect attribute cards (representing various objects). Specific sets of these cards can be exchanged for a stronger attribute card of a highers level which usually give winning points and sometimes additional bonuses.

—description from the publisher

name: Jurassic World: Escape the Island
description:
Isla Nublar is the most feared island in the Jurassic World. This island - a few hundred miles west of Costa Rica - is home to the one and only Jurassic Park, and a few years later the new home of the highly secure Jurassic World. Still, nothing can stop the Indominus Rex from rocking the park again. When it turns out that the volcano on the island threatens to wipe out all the dinosaurs that have erupted again, it's up to a brave team of players to save the dinosaurs from their second extinction. You and all players embark on a perilous journey through Isla Nublar, trying to save as many dinosaurs as possible and reach the helicopter before the volcano floods the island with lava.

In this exciting action card game you have to strategically find the fastest way through the island and reach the helicopter with as many dinosaurs as possible. The player with the most rescued dinosaurs wins the game.

Search for the Safe Zones in each row and make it to the Helicopter with the most Dino Tokens!
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Semi-Cooperative Game

name: Veredicto
description:
In this game the players act as two teams of lawyers trying to influence the members of a jury.

There is a person accused of some crime, and one team act as accusers the other as defenders. Each side plays a card with some fact of the case, the cards will determine which people on the jury your team will influence, and then chooses to put a token (numbered from 1 to 5) face-down representing the power of the influence. After all tokens are placed, they will be counted for each member of the jury and the game ends.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Open Drafting, Storytelling, Team-Based Game

name: Maailmanympäri peli
description: Simple "roll and move" game, where players travel around world and learn geography. First part of game consists traveling through all continents and second part is a trivia of a geography learned when traveling.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Kelgukoerad
description:
"Sledging Dogs" in English. Based on Estonian TV-series with same name. Players are detectives and try to figure out crime-mystery. Winner is the player who solve the case first.

Its a board game made after a Estonian crime series "Kelgukoerad". You can choose to be one of the characters from the show to solve crimes. It is unique because cases keep on coming. You can buy more cases or download them from the series website. Very good and interesting game. How it work, is that you get like a crime legend (notes) and following different clues you need to reach the right answer. Once you solve it, it stays solved and you can buy or download more case files.

Box contains:
rules
game board
case file
32 evidence cards
8 "blind luck" cards
4 characters (Post, Kõsta, Kelk, Mart from the show)
2 dice
envelope with answer
mechanics: Cooperative Game, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Risky Business
description: Brightly colored gameboard is divided into 3 rings, each associated with one aspect of starting a business. The object of the game is to be the first player to build a company and complete an IPO (Initial Public Offering). All the big name companies are present on the board from Hershey’s to EBay. Complete a business plan, hire a management team, develop a product line and offer stock in your company to the public. Extremely attractive components.

name: Schnappi, das kleine Krokodil
description:
In this game "Schnappi" (a little green crocodile that became famous due to a children's song that made it into the charts) wants to seek rest and go to sleep in the middle of the board.
It's the goal of the players to move Schnappi over obstacles and finally into the middle of the board.

name: Don't Laugh
description:
With it's voice changing, fart sounding, wildly giggling electronic microphone - Don't laugh is the ultimate joke telling board game. The more players that laugh the more you score!

It's the game that will have you in stitches...but be careful...cos laughing makes you lose!!! The don't laugh board game offers interactive fun for all the family, so it's sure to be a popular game this Christmas...Each player in turn reads out a joke and then uses one or more sound effects to push the other poker-faced players over-the-edge and into fits of laughter and giggles!You get to move forward one space for every opponent who laughs...or who even cracks the slightest smile!Armed with over 1,000 jokes and a voice changing, fart sounding electronic microphone...the Don't Laugh board game is simple, straight faced, side splitting fun for all! It's the laugh-out-loud joke game, with farting, belching and cackling...but whatever you do.

name: Atchoo igloo
description: Players roll the dice and place correct blocks of ice to build the igloo. But beware, if the dice shows "Sneezy" bear comes out of his igloo and ejects blocks. The winner is the one who gets rid of his blocks.

name: Fish Food
description:
You are feeding the hungry fish a fist full of worms (hand of worm cards). The goal of the base game is to be the first to feed all your worms to the fish (empty your hand). The fish mechanism gets programmed to know where all the players. The fish will make jokes, chuckle at players, ask for food, and make other comments while the game is in progress. When the game finishes, the fish will automatically announce the winner.

To start, every player gets a hand of cards that evenly distribute the 12 worm cards. The Fish mechanism gets setup by placing it on the base and pushing it's fin. The fish will spin and ask "Are you ready to play" at one of 4 player positions. If there is a player at the position, hit the fish fin to confirm. If not, wait a few seconds and the fish will skip to the next possible player position. Then the fish spins and randomly stops to face a player. It makes an automated comment like "I'm hungry" and waits for the player it's facing to add a worm card to it's mouth. Players need to be quick or the fish will skip the player. Once you put a worm in the fishes mouth, the fish will make a crunch noise, spin and then randomly stop on a player position, spit the worm card out and chuckle. It may spit the card out to the player who put the worm in it's mouth in the first place. This process will repeat and eventually one player will have no cards left in their hand and win the game. The Fish will announce the winner.

There is also an advance game play variant: To start the game, separate the cards into stacks by color. Each player chooses the stack of cards that match the color of their player number on the game base. Turn Fish Food ON, and all players press the fish’s fin.

Feed the fish when he spins to you, but instead of trying to get rid of your card, try to collect three cards of another player’s color! When you have collected three cards in another color, press the fish’s fin once - you’re the winner!

From the publishers website: Fish Food is the FINtastic game with the smart fish that knows how to play! If he lands on you, feed him one of your cards. Watch out on the next spin – he may spit the card back to you! Get rid of all of your cards to win. The fish knows who wins and will call out the winner at the end of the game.

name: Harry Potter: Hogwarts Hallways
description: Walk on the whimsical Grand Staircase, take part in various classes and race through the corridors to the Great Hall! BE CAREFUL, magical challenges await you along the way... Collect THREE Subject Tokens first to enter the Great Hall. You can choose any player, you can be Harry, Ron, Hermione, Draco or Luna.

name: Vuonna 85
description:
"A boardgame where even losing is fun!"

This is a promotional boardgame based on, and published in support of, the 2008 musical comedy of the same name, the name itself being that of one of Eppu Normaali's biggest hits originally published in - you guessed it - 1985. The other two local (but of nationwide fame) artists whose songs the musical is based on are Juice Leskinen, and the band Popeda.

The idea of the game is for each player to try and complete three random tasks around the city, collecting stuff needed to throw a bachelor party for Palle, who's getting married with Karoliina. The game is set in the city of Tampere in the year 1985, and is naturally full of references to the city, it's vibrant rock music scene, and the '80s culture in Finland in general. For example, the two special vehicles with their own playing pieces present in the game are a Datsun 100A compact car and a Solifer Suzuki moped, and one of the tasks is to get 10 kilos of black sausage (a local delicacy) while another is to obtain a portable VHS player for the party.

There are six different characters, based on the characters of the musical, with unique starting points and their own little characteristics such as the ability to call a taxi anywhere with a Mobira Cityman mobile phone, or get on/off a bus at any point in a bus-line.

The first player who succesfully completes three tasks and returns to the central market wins the game.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Don't Lose Your Cool
description: Inspired by the internet's viral challenges that have gathered billions of views, Don't Lose Your Cool tests one's ability to remain calm under pressure. Players wear the Cool-O-Meter that measures their heart rate, and the opposing team rolls the dice that determine how they'll try to get the player to get flustered. A change in heart rate effects the meter and when the meter gets high enough the lights get to red, the alarm sounds, and the opponent wins for making that player lose their composure.

name: Roarem Castle: A Game
description: This game for 2-4 players. Each is equipped with a counter, 2 money bags and a stock of tokens. Players throw the die and move the number of spaces indicated. There are fines and rewards on the different spaces in the game. Landing on spaces 4, 20 or 29 causes the player to lose a turn. If you land on space 30 (Poor Lady) you must promise to buy her gloves. You move to space #30 and pay a token into the pool.In addition you can, on your turn, place the money bags on any of the servant spaces. When opponents land on those spaces they must add a token to the pool in the center of the board. If you reach space number 32 first you colect all of the tokens in the pool and win the game.

name: StakXchange
description:
PLAY YOUR WAY TO SUCCESS
and if a game could make you rich?

Here’s a smart game for all ages to learn how the world supplies and trades the commodities we need to thrive. From orange juice to lumber and money, discover what moves prices and how you can benefit - in the game and in real life.
Collect tons of money when events around the world influence prices in your direction!

Give your children (8 years old and over) a great chance to understand how the products they consume are financed and exchanged everyday. The younger the financial skill, the more they will have to build a prosperous future.

You are even offered a basic lesson in understanding commodiies trading and future contracts before you start. Roll the dice, buy or sell short contracts and collect or pay money according to the events described by the cards drawn. Whoever raises the most money win!
mechanics: Commodity Speculation, Roll / Spin and Move, Trading

name: Devil's Triangle
description: Players alternately place and move triangles around a board. Each player's 9 triangles have a number (1-9) on the back. Neither player knows which numbers are where. Each player designates one number as his Devil's Triangle (without knowing where the triangle is on the board). Triangles are captured by being surrounded on 3 sides by enemy triangles or the board edge. The first player to capture 3 opposing triangles or to have his Devil's Triangle captured by his opponent wins the game.
publishers: Croner, Peter Pan Playthings, Playtoy Industries, Pressman Toy Corp.

name: A Day Out with Thomas
description:
From the box:

A Day Out with Thomas Game--A Matching & Memory Fun Game
Come along with Thomas on a train ride full of surprises! Climb aboard and let the fun begin! Get your Ticket “punched” as you visit the Station Stops on your Ticket, then race back to the Roundhouse. The first Engine to arrive at the Roundhouse with an empty Ticket wins the game! Game includes: game board, 24 station stop stars, 4 Day Out with Thomas Tickets, 6 magic cards, 6 animal cards, 8 story cards, 12 ice cream cards, 4 engine playing pieces and spinner. Ages 3+. 2-4 players.
categories: Children's Game, Memory, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Trains

name: Schlitzohr
description: Card game of economics and advertising. Material: 27 advertisement cards, 54 Top/Flop cards, 28 bid cards, card holder, scoring pad, rules.

name: Turtles
description: The exciting new board game based on the famous Konami arcade game. It's each player's goal to rescue as many cute little turtlettes as possible and bring'em safely back to the home pond. But watch out for the evil beetles 'cause they're out to getcha!

name: Kuh & Kompagnon
description: A tile laying game about people who own a parcel of land and try to get clover and avoid gnawed leaflets or thistles. German game, out of print. Part of the "Stripes"-Series, which was invented by Ass in those days (other games of this series are Check the Ripper and Börsenkrach, for example). The stripes on the box gave the name to that series.

name: Chancer: The Game
description: A Monopoly clone, based on a popular British TV series in the 80s called Chancer, which featured a suave, nasty confidence trickster in the 1950s, cheating and blackmailing his way through bad debt, dodgy shares and the ladies' boudoirs on the way to a fortune. Play one of the characters, gain cash and shares and take Chancer cards to cheat the other players.

name: Tzuris
description: "Tzuris is an avoidance game with bidding, an elaborate trump suit and a gimmick. The gimmick being that when you play a card, you don't play it in front of yourself but in front of one of your fellow players. This is done in such a way that by the end of each trick, each player will have a card face down in front of them. These cards are then turned face up and the winner of the trick is determined. So the idea is to use your own good cards to force opponents to take tricks which will, you hope, contain cards which will count as penalties against them." Stuart Dagger, Counter, November 1999

name: Zombie Rampage
description:
Zombie Rampage, the Battle for Smithville (Part III), is a two player tactical game that was published in R.I.P. magazine #3. One player takes control of the Zombies and one player takes control of the unsuspecting humans.

THe game includes a stylised map of Smithville, 3 pages of rules, and one sheet of cutout counters.

To win, the Zombie player must kill all the Humans so that the Zombies can continue to try to destroy America in the 'Zombie Nation' game (q.v.). THe Human player must kill all the Zombies so that the events in 'Zombie Nation' do not occur.

name: Max Roll
description:
From the Box:

"Have you ever had a few minutes between games or between turns in a long game and needed something to do? This is just the game for you. Get your friends and play this simple, fast, real-time game of pattern recognition. You can adjust the level of difficulty to suit the time available and skill of those involved. A few of the hundreds of variants are supplied with the game.

Contents:
1 Playing mat with inscribed scoring and example patterns.
1 Set of the required dice [each player needs own set].
1 Instruction sheet. "

name: White Glove Girl: A Manpower Game
description:
Obviously a promotional/motivational item from the Manpower Employment Agency.
The object of the game is to be the first player to attain all 4 goals: Children's College Education ($2,000) - Vacation-Travel ($600) - Remodel Home ($750) - New Wardrobe ($200).
The goals are attained by moving 4 colored tokens around the board from START to HOME and then paying for the goal.
The first player to move all 4 of her tokens to the HOME spaces is declared the WINNER.

name: Tritime
description: This a Triathlon sports game using dice. There are three things you must do: swim then ride the bike then run a race . You do all all of these things by rolling the dice. There are also some action cards that influence each race.

name: Beverly Hills 90210 Survey Game
description: Be the first player to reach the finish space by correctly guessing how teens across the country voted on 90210 situations and teen themes. Game comes with a gameboard, 4 voting discs, card tray, card reader, 200 cards, 6 plastic pointers, 4 pawns

name: Pennopoly
description:
A monopoly (from Greek monos μόνος (alone or single) + polein πωλεῖν (to sell)) exists when a specific person or enterprise is the only supplier of a particular commodity.

Monopoly is a roll-and-move game where players move around the game board buying or trading properties, developing their properties with houses and hotels. When opponents land on players owned property, the owning player collects rent from the landing player. Owning sets of properties increases the rent paid to the player who owns them, by the player who lands on the square. The ultimate goal is to have the most money and drive opponents into bankruptcy.

Monopoly type game designed for Alumni, students and friends of the University of Pennsylvania.
mechanics: Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: The Ren & Stimpy Show Log Cereal Game
description:
From the box:
Reach into this package of log cereal and fish around. What did you find? If you're the first player to locate the pieces you need to complete your own comic strip puzzle based on one of eight actual TV episodes, you win. But if anybody finishes the History Eraser strip first, this game never took place.

The Game
Each player has a blank comic strip in front of them. The counters are placed in the box, thus creating a Log Cereal Box. The History Eraser strip is placed in the middle of the table.
In a turn, a player reaches in to the Cereal Box and pulls out a counter. If it is the same colour as your comic strip, you add it to your strip. If it is a History Eraser counter, add it to the History Eraser comic strip in the middle of the table. If it is none of these things, place it back into the cereal box and shake the box well.
If you pull out a log, various things might happen. All players might have to slide their comic strip to the person on their right or left. Or you might be able to take one counter of another player's comic strip and put it back into the box. And so on.
One really annoying rule - if you draw one of your comic strip counters, before you add it to your strip you must quote a line from the show indicated on that particular counter. If you cannot or will not do this, you don't get to keep the counter - it goes back into the box.
The first player to complete their strip, wins.
However, if the History Eraser comic strip is completed before any player's strip, then the game is lost by all players.
For die-hard Ren & Stimpy fans only.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Maktspelet
description:
In Maktspelet, players assume the roles of Swedish political party leaders and compete to form the nation's next government. There are 349 seats (mandates) up for grabs and the government can only be formed by a force with 175 or more seats.

On their turns, the players move their pieces on the board. Most of the spaces on the board are Profile spots that give seats to the controlling party. Players contest for these spaces by participating in a closed bid, using their Argument cards. The values on their selected cards is added to the value of their party's color on the spot, and the party with the higher total value wins the Profile. Players can also moving their pieces to the TV debates spot and try to bluff their way to win more seats. The Chance spots instruct players to draw a Chance card, making them win or lose seats, or even swap electorates. Players are free to wheel and deal in this game.

The game ends when all seats have been distributed. The winner is the leader whose party has the required majority. If no one has a majority, two players can join forces to achieve the required number and be joint winners.

Components list:
1 x Rulebook
1 x Gameboard
4 x Plastic standees (1 in each players color)
72 x Chans cards
20 x Profil cards
15 x Minister cards
4 x 27 Argument cards (divided in the 4 player colors)
397 mandates (349 + extras according to the rules)in
24 x Larger plastic 10 mandates
156 x Smaller plastic 1 mandates
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Hand Management, Point to Point Movement, Set Collection

name: Truckin' America
description:
Originated in a cab of an 18-wheeler.
Operate your truck throughout the United States delivering loads to major cities. Be the first to pay off your loan and become independent. Cards cover all kinds of special events.

name: Anatomix
description:
Calling all budding doctors and nurses. Anatomix is a fun way to build a body on your playing board. Choose from the skeleton, nerves, muscles and organs, the object is to be the first to complete your body. For younger players simply flick the spinner and take or trade body bits. For older players a multiple-choice question needs to be answered to gain, swap or take a body part. Play and learn more about your anatomy in this fabulous resource.

Learn and improve your knowledge of the body in this biology based game. With 2 different levels perfect for 5+ and 12+ players, this game is great to play with the whole family. This game is made from recycled materials. All questions are in English, French and Spanish.

Players 2 - 4 players or teams,
Ages 5 - 105,
Contains 48 Puzzle pieces, 4 player boards 84 question cards, 1 spinner, 1 rule booklet.,

name: The Batman and Robin Game
description: This 'track' game is based on the '60s television show. Players start in the middle of the board in the Batcave. The first player to follow the track around the board and return to the Batcave wins. Certain spaces have various printed actions which influence a player's moves and often impede progress toward winning. A spinner is used to determine movement.

name: Transat Québec/Saint-Malo
description:
The Transatlantic Race Game

The object of the game is to be the first to complete the race from Québec (Canada) to Saint-Malo (France). During the race, you try to benefit from the various currents depicted on the board as well as avoiding collisions with icebergs.

name: Trivial Pursuit The Music Master Game: Family Edition – Video Version
description:
Each player has a circular playing piece with six pie-shaped holes. The goal of the game is to collect a pie in each color. The colors correspond to different question categories.

The board consists of a circular track with spaces in seven different colors. Six of the colors correspond to question categories while the last color gives a new dice roll. Six spaces along the track are "pie spaces", and from these there are "spokes" of track leading to the middle of the board.

Players roll a die and move along the track in any direction they like. When a player stops on a color they get a question of the appropriate category. If the player answers a question correctly while on a pie space, they get a pie of that color (assuming they don't already have it). A correct answer on another square allows the player to roll again.

Once the player has one pie in each color, she can move along the spokes to the middle of the board to win the game.

Trivial pursuit game played with video clips.
publishers: Horn Abbot Ltd., Telstar Video Entertainement

name: Russian Roulette
description:
Russian Roulette is a banking game in which all bets must be placed against the Tzar who is the house or banker. The object of the game is to be the player with the most money when the game ends.

All players bet as to which card of a 24-card deck will be turned face up next. Players use their colored chips (each worth $1,000 in play money) to bet on the suit, the rank, and the exact face of the card predicted next. There is an unique way to get back into the game if you lose all your money.

The game ends when either a. the predetermined time limit expires, b. the bank runs out of money, or c. all players have been eliminated.

name: The Good Old Aunt!
description: A dice rolling game where the players compete to win the most tokens before the game ends. Tokens are placed on numbered spaces on the board according to a die roll (or the total of successive die rolls). Some rolls will require a player to forfeit tokens to the center of the board, other rolls allow tokens to be taken from this pool. The game is over when every number (except 13) is covered.

name: The Vietnam War
description:
The back of the box says it all:

"The Vietnam War is an easy to play game covering the conflict between the North Vietnamese and the US led South Vietnam. A 2 player game of war and politics, both players must wage war both on the battlefield and in the political arena. The US military could crush the North Vietnamese, if only the US player can rally enough support on the home front to allow it"

From the "An Empire of History Game" series that includes many battles from history. A basic level "Compact" game including a paper map, counters, rules, D10 die, and a cool little carrying box.

name: Hammerslag
description: Based on a Danish TV-program. The object of the game is to try to estimate how much a house/apartment cost around Denmark. In your estimate you have to consider the location location location...

name: Caboose Dice
description: Caboose Dice is a game of dice-rolling to score points, advancing your score along a track on the score pad. Each of the five dice has two locomotives and a caboose, plus scoring cars. Your throw must include a locomotive to be scored, and a caboose may double your score.

name: Bible Bingo
description: This is simply bingo with a Christian theme. The caller randomly draws a cardboard chit and the players match its background color, pictures, and/or a Bible verse reference with like squares on their cards. Blank squares are provided to cover matches.

name: The Deputy Game
description: Ages 7 - 14 "THE DEPUTY" This game was fashioned after the TV series that ran from 1959-1961. The box cover features HENRY FONDA who played the role of Chief Marshall Simon Fry, and ALLEN CASE, who played THE DEPUTY. Game components consist of the game board, 4 player tokens, instruction board and spinner, three sets of cards and dice, and the Marshall's badge. Marshall's badge is awarded to the winner of the game.
categories: American West, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Hearts: An Exciting Letter Game
description:
A six Dice game containing the letters that spell H-E-A-R-T-S on each side of each die. Each player rolls the dice once and scores based on how many letters of the word hearts are rolled. Each letter after the H is counted as 5 points. 4 H's rolled doubles your score and 4 S's cancel your score.

Strongly based on luck, Players compete to a predetermined point goal of 100 or 200 or whatever is agreed upon.

name: Jungle Book Game
description:
Game based on Disney's Jungle Book. The players play Mowgli and try to be become the first player to go through the jungle to the civilization, which is the finish.

First release (in Sweden) of this game was in 1968.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme
publishers: Alga, John Waddington Ltd., Parker Brothers

name: Great Day in the Park Game
description: This is a Candyland type track game with a Raggedy Ann & Andy theme. The board depicts a park with a trail winding through it. On your turn, you draw a card and advance to the next space whose color matches that on the card. If you draw a picture, you move to the space on the board that has the matching picture. If you land on a puddle space, you lose a turn. The first player to reach the balloon space at the end of the track wins.

name: Super 12
description:
Super 12 is based on 12 meter yacht racing. Up to six yacht pieces move around a board designed as a sailing race course.

Players are dealt cards and must predict the number of a particular "suit" the other players hold. When a prediction is made other players may raise the prediction or call - by playing a protest penalty card. Winners of each round advance around a sailing course board. Losing protesters go back a space.

name: Baltimore in a Box
description: A Monopoly clone from Late For The Sky; this version is based in Baltimore, Maryland. It has spaces such as McCormick Spice, U.S.F Constellation, Babe Ruth Museum, Baltimore Zoo, and Walters Art Gallery. The tokens include a pretzel, heart, baseball mitt, sailboat, crab, and fish. Cards include local events and staples of life in Baltimore.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Galleon Quest
description: Galleon Quest is the game of salvage operations for competing divers. The object of the game is to expand and build up your dive salvage business with bigger vessels and better equipment. The more salvage work you complete, the more money you earn. Be the first to purchase all the equipment necessary to salvage the great galleon wrecked at the ocean floor and you win!

name: ESP: The Game of Perceptive Skill
description: Since telepathy works best among people who know each other, bring together three of your friends to test your perceptive skills and powers of concentration against theirs. During the game you will acquire points by employing your extrasensory abilities to successfully determine the numbers being thought of by the other players. This sum will be the number of spaces the player moves on the playing board.

name: Spiralball
description:
From the box:

"Spiralball has a unique shooting action. The marbles are fired from the spring-action mechanism and enter the spiral channel which then launches the marbles swiftly in an arc toward the scoring holes. Of course, the plastic dome does contain the high flying careening sphere.

You gotta know just how fast or slow to shoot those balls so you can get in the high scoring holes and it's easy to keep score 'cause the balls always roll into those scoring slots with the numbers."

Game appears to be a contained "skeeball" set with 9 marbles in it.

name: Midnight Banshees
description:
From the website:
"In this game, you're one of four Banshees racing to be the first to collect five skulls from the surrounding tombs. Standing on the red-stained stones (I'm not certain why they're stained red, but I suspect it's leakage from the tombs), you perform the mystic ritual of 'Spinning the Bones' to overcome the magic spells of the Stone Sentinels (which keep the tombs closed). Next you peer inside the tomb, hoping to find a skull to steal (the skeletons don't mind because then they're able to watch the race, which they enjoy greatly), and hoping not to find a Vampire (because you would then have to give the Vampire a skull for having disturbed him). Racing away with a skull, you think you might WIN this time...and then you see the horrible Zombie lurching towards you, intent on eating...that's right....your SKULL!!!

(MIDNIGHT BANSHEES has a spinner under the gameboard,
so you never know which tomb might contain a Vampire!)"

name: Black Beauty
description: Milton Bradley product number 4771. Best guess is this was published about 1920. The game is a spin and move game.

name: Shift
description:
A quick card game for three or more players.

Object: Organize the cards in your hand into consecutive matched pairs.

You Need: A deck of cards with four distinct suits (red, yellow, green, blue / hearts, spades, clubs, diamonds / plains, forest, mountain, island)

Give each player two cards from each suit. The rank of the cards does not matter. Sort the cards in your hand so that no card is adjacent to a card of the same suit. On your turn you can shift (move one or two cards from one end of your hand to the other) or swipe (ask any player, 'Do you have any {name a suit}?' If your target has that suit at either end of his or her hand, he or she must give it to you).

If you have four consecutive pairs of suits in your hand at the end of your turn, you win.

name: The New Game of Human Life
description:
"Being the most agreeable & rational recreation ever invented for youth of both sexes."

A roll-and-move racing game with 84 space illustrating different stages of a man's life, broken down into 12 ages - boyhood, youth, young man, the prime of life, the sedate man, the old man, and decrepitude. The players race to reach the ending space, depicting The Immortal Man.

RULES OF THE GAME (engraved in the centre of the playing surface)

The Immortal Man, who has existed 84 years, seems worthy of his Talents and Merit to become for the Close of Life, which can end only by Eternity. When we shall arrive at the No.84, we shall have gain'd all we can by this Game, but if we exceed this number, we must go back as many points as we have proceeded beyond it.
The Age of Man is divided into seven periods of 12 years, viz. Infancy to Youth, Manhood, Prime of Life, Sedate Middle Age, Old Age, Decrepitude and Dotage. He passes through life in a variety of situations which are arrange in the order they generally succeed each other.
This game like all others of the same kind is played with a totum, each Player spinning twice in his turn, the only difference is, that the Players cannot stop at any one of the seven ages, but must proceed as many points beyond, as they have in coming to them. Yet as they may spin at the first 2 sixes and consequently would go onto 84, which would be most improper, those who have this chance at first, must content them selves with going to the Historian at 39.
The Studious Boy at 7 shall receive a Stake and shall proceed to 42, the place of the Orator.
The Negligent Boy at 11 shall pay a Stake and shall remain two rounds without spinning.
The Assiduous Youth at 15 shall receive 2 Stakes, and proceed to 55, where he will find the Patriot.
The Triflet at 19 shall pay 1 Stake, and proceed to the Songster at 38.
The Duellist at 22 shall pay 2 Stakes, and return to take the place of the Boy at Number 3.
The Complaisant Man at 26 shall remain there, and let others play until another comes to take his place, and then he shall go back to the place of his liberator.
The Prodigal at Number 30 shall pay four Stakes, and go back to the Careless Boy at Number 6.
The Married Man at 34 shall receive two Stakes for his Wife's Portion and go to be a Good Father at 56.
The Romance Writer at 40 shall pay 2 Stakes and go back to the Mischievous Boy at 5.
The Dramatist at 44 shall pay 4 Stars to the Masters of his Art and shall begin the game again.
The Benevolent Man at 52 shall go to 78 to amuse himself with the Joker.
The Temperate Man at 58 shall go to 82, to find the Quiet Man.
The Drunkard at 63 shall pay 2 Stakes and go back to the Child at 2.
The Patient Man at 68 shall receive 2 Stakes and go to amuse himself with the merry fellow at 80.
The Manhater at 71 shall pay 2 Stakes and go back to the Obstinate Youth at 16.
The Old Beau at 74 shall receive 1 Stake and let each of the others play one round.
The Satyrist at 77 shall pay 4 Stakes and go back to the Malignant Boy at 8.
Lastly the Tragic Author at 45 shall go to the place of the Immortal Man at 84 and win the Game by Succeeding him.

DIRECTIONS AND EXPLANATIONS (engraved in the spandrels)
1. The Utility and Moral Tendency of this Games.
If parents who take upon themselves the pleasing task of instructing their children (or others to whom that important trust may be delegated) will cause them to stop at each character and request their attention to a few moral and judicious observations, explanatory of each character as they proceed and contrast the happiness of a virtuous and well spent life with the fatal consequences arising from vicious and immoral pursuits, this game may be rendered the most useful and amusing of any that has hitherto been offered to the public.
2. Directions for Playing
This game may be played by any number of persons at a time; but care must be taken, that each player makes use of a different mark to move with, and be provided with at least twelve counters each, and agree how much to value them per dozen.
Let us then suppose that four gentlemen agree to play a game together, and stake four counters each. A takes red for his mark, B green, C black and D white. A begins and spins 9 and accordingly places his mark upon No. 9, which is the Docile Boy. B plays next and spins 7, but as the rules of the game specify instead of putting his mark on No.7, he must receive a counter from the pool, and carry his mark to the Orator, at No. 42. C being next in turn, spins only 2, and puts his mark on the place of the Child at No. 2. D being the last player spins 11, and goes to the Negligent Boy; but this being a forfeit, he must pay a counter to the pool and remain two rounds at No. 11 without playing in his turn. A now resumes the totum and spins 3, which brings him from No. 9 where he was to No. 12, but this being one of the seven ages, he cannot stop there, for agreeable to the rules of the game he must proceed as far beyond the age to No. 15, the place of the Assidious Youth; but instead of that he must receive 2 counters from the pool and go to No. 55, the place of the Patriot. B now takes the totum and spins 6, when being already at No. 42, the place of the Orator, he should naturally go to No. 48 but that being the age of the Sedate Man, he must proceed 6 points beyond 48 and put his mark on the place of the Vigilant Man at no 54. C's turn being but instead of stopping at this last number (according to the rules of the game) he pays a counter into the pool and goes to the place of the Songster at No. 38. D must as already mentioned also remain this round without playing. A again takes the totum and spins 2, and being before at No. 82 compleats No. 84 takes the place of the Immortal Man and wins the game.

NB. It is necessary to inform the Purchaser the Totum must be marked with the figures 1-6 and avoid introducing a dice box into private families, each player must spin twice, which will answer the same purpose.


The playing sheet is numbered in an anti-clockwise direction starting from the lower left corner. Each compartment shows a boy or a man at ages between 1 and 84. These are:-
1. The Infant; 2. The Child; 3. The Boy; 4. The Darling; 5. The Mischievous Boy; 6. The Careless Boy; 7. The Studious Boy; 8. The Malignant Boy; 9. The Docile Boy; 10. The Thoughtless Boy; 11. The Negligent Boy; 12. The Youth; 13. The Volunteer; 14. The Indolent Youth; 15. The Assiduous Youth; 16. The Obstinate Youth; 17. The Rebellious Youth; 18. The Gallant; 19. The Trifler; 20. The Lover; 21. The Idler; 22. The Duellist; 23. The Dissembler; 24. The Young Man; 25. The Decisive Man; 26. The Complaisant Man; 27. The Downright Man; 28. The Flatterer; 29. The Critic; 30. The Prodigal; 31. The Coxcomb; 32. The Generous Man; 33. The Economist; 34. The Married Man; 35. The Batchelor; 36. The Prime of Life; 37. The Author; 38. The Composer; 39. The Historian; 40. The Romance Writer; 41. The Poet; 42. The Orator; 43. The Comic Author; 44. The Dramatist; 45. The Tragic Author; 46. The Traveller; 47. The Geographer; 48. The Sedate Man; 49. The Imperious Man; 50. The Affable Man; 51. The Morose Man; 52. The Benevolent Man; 53. The Insensible Man; 54. The Vigilant Man; 55. The Patriot; 56. The Good Father; 57. The Ambitious Man; 58. The Temperate Man; 59. The Glutton; 60. The Old Man; 61. The Libertine; 62. The Philosopher; 63. The Drunkard; 64. The Miser; 65. The Gambler; 66. The Learned Man; 67. The Brute; 68. The Patient Man; 69. The Vindictive Man; 70. The Friend of Man; 71. The Man Hater; 72. Decrepitude; 73. The Sloven; 74. The Old Beau; 75. The Hasty Man; 76. The Hypochondriac; 77. The Satyrist; 78. The Joker; 79. The Silent Man; 80. The Merry Fellow; 81. The Troublesome Companion; 82. The Quiet Man; 83. The Thoughtful Man; 84. The Immortal Man.
mechanics: Events, Lose a Turn, Race, Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement
publishers: J. Wallis & E. Newberry, John Wallis

name: War to End All Wars: World War I Expansion with War of 1812 and Mexican War
description:
This supplement is actually four different games.

The first two games "War to End All Wars" with this expansion and "America Goes Central" use the existing rules from "War to End All Wars" while the other two games are simulations of the War of 1812 and the Mexican-American War. When using the game as a supplement for "War to End All Wars", the same rules are used, while granting additional North America playing area. The supplement has a color map of central North America similar to the one used in "The War to End All Wars: Box Set Edition".
categories: Dice, Economic, Educational, Expansion for Base-game, Wargame, World War I
mechanics: Area Movement, Commodity Speculation, Cooperative Game, Roll / Spin and Move, Variable Player Powers

name: Dora the Explorer: Picnic Fiesta
description:
Dora is planning a picnic with her friends. You have to flick their picnic favorites to them before Swiper the Fox pops up and stops you. Each of the picnic favorites is on plastic disc which you attempt to shoot out with the right amount of force and at the right angle to get it to land in an area where it can score.

Swiper is a pop up figure who will activate after 60 seconds, after which it's impossible to hit the target.

You can play in competition with other players and there is a second level where you have to shoot the discs in the right order and at set targets.

name: Rrrum um's Eck!
description:
"Rrrum um's Eck!" or "Rrround the Corner!"

Over the years Spielbox magazine has published some great games in its magazine. Usually they are originals by well-known authors that have appeared nowhere else, and at times they were so good that they were later appeared in full-on productions. Sometimes they were welcome reprints of highly regarded and hard to get games (3m's Jati). Exactly what prompted the republication of this old German children's game is better left the mystery it is, as there is very little remarkable about it. Maybe it was a great game by 1931's standards, but the German market by 1986 should have left a game like this in a corner best forgotten.

It is what can be typified as a Snake-and-Ladders game without the ladders, or 1-pawn Ludo with traps in which the prettiest girl may start. Players make their way with a single pawn from start to finish along a track of 6 rows, each 7 spaces long. The last square (on each row end before turning the corner) is a trap. When a player's pawn lands in one of those traps it will be sent back to square one, but not before a 6 is rolled to release the pawn from the trap. The only quicker way to start all over again is when another player lands in the same trap, because any player ending a move on another pawn's square sends that pawn back to the very beginning. Can it get worse? Yes, by landing in the last trap, because you get an immediate "mercy" die roll. A 6 means instant victory, any other number rolled will mean permanent removal from the game.

Maybe it was a reminder how far German game design had progressed in the 55 years since 1931. Saying that, it probably takes some considerable skill to make a game that is worse than Snakes-and-Ladders into a classic that warrants a reprint in one of Germany's most respected game magazines. What were they thinking.

Publishing history: this classic German family game can be traced back all the way to 1931 and appears to have been in print for a while. Much later it was reprinted by Spielbox magazine (4/1986 Aug-Sep) as one of the earlier entrants in the "Spiel zum Herausnehmen/Game to Remove" series. It was presented with the original artwork and with an exact replica of the original rules.
publishers: Carl Edelmann, W. Nostheide Verlag GmbH, Wilhelm Keil, Spieleverlag

name: The Wonderful World of Disney
description:
Each player takes the role of a Disney character (Mickey, Thumper, Donald, Bambi, Perdita, Winnie, Dumbo or Jiminy). Play commences with a view to collecting tokens representing the different characters and 'Disney Awards'.

Multiple Disney Awards are obtained each turn by selling tokens. Tokens can be purchased at the end of each player's turn by way of a general auction for Disney Awards....

The first player to obtain one token of every color (8) and 12 or more 'Disney Awards' is the winner.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Bowl-O-Rama
description:
A bowling game which uses a "Magic 8-Ball"-type device to simulate each frame of the game. Results given by the ball range from "Strike!" to "Gutterball" to "Karaoke Break."

From the publisher:

"Finally there's a way to experience all the thrills of bowling without having to rent a pair of stinky shoes. Bowl-O-Rama is an exciting game for all ages that can be played alone or with multiple players. All you need is a Bowl-O-Rama ball and a scorecard and you're ready to roll!"

name: Feinschmecker
description: Feinschmecker is a Trivia game about designers, fashion, luxury etc. If you are familiar with all these: Dom Perignon, Riva, Ducati, Rolex, Louis Vuitton, Cartier, Fabergé, Latife Rotschild, Portofino, GQ, Napoéon, Golf, Concorde, Wall-street, Hermés, St. Tropez, Villa D'Este, Tom Wolfe, Lamborghini, Swan, Marc Newson, The Metropolitan, Beluga, Aston Martin, Jaeger Le Coultre, Guggenheim, Phillippe Starck and Arne Jacobsen, this is a trivia game for you.

name: Hooked
description:
From the back of box:

Hooked (tm) is an exciting board game of chance and skill that keeps everyone at the edge of their seat. Players never know what the next move will bring.

Objective:
