To move your boat as quickly as possible to the fishing grounds (required at least four times), pick up your fish (one fish per trip), deliver it to the processor at some point during the game and then return to your home port. The first boat (team) to deliver all four fish to the processor and return to its home port wins the game. Advancing around the board becomes more of a challenge when the team members must guess mystery words related to the ocean, seashore or boats by the means of CHARADES and SKETCHES. There are short cuts and good news/bad news situations that also come up during the game which make HOOKED(tm) even more exciting and always changing. Playing time is about 60 to 90 minutes."

Requires at least four players (two teams) to play. Up to four teams (eight players) can play. Teams take turns rolling the die and moving the boat and following the directions on the space landed on. Spin the spinner when instructed and following the instructions. In SKETCH situations, one player must guess the mystery word based on clues drawn by the partner. If the mystery clue is correctly guessed, the team goes again. There is also a CHARADE option in which the mystery word must be guessed based on CHARADES type clues.

No designer or publisher listed but a Petersburg, Alaska address is provided.

name: Bop the Beetle
description:
This old game comes in a huge box (20" x 13" x 5"). It consists of five components only - a large plastic clam-like frog with identical halves almost 12" long and wide; two thick plastic oval beetles 4" x 6" and two 20" long solid plastic tubes (the 'boppers'). The two halves of the frog are joined by a hinge at the rear which causes the frog to lock in an open position when set.

The beetles are placed on the ground an equal and agreed distance away from the set frog and must be 'bopped' into the frog using the plastic tubes provided. This is accomplished by whacking the plastic tube on an edge of the beetle, causing it to fly up in the air. The first player to successfully bop their beetle into the frog causes the frog to snap shut and wins the game.

name: Beetle Bailey: The Old Army Game
description: Based on the comic stip Beetle Bailey.

name: Verkehrs-Quiz
description:
You have 50 cards with traffic signs and 50 cards with their explanation (in Dutch, French, Italian and German). And you have 8 cards with a police-man on it.
Different ways of playing.
Somebody reads the card, the others try to find the matching sign as quick as possible.
Or you can deal the cards with signs. Somebody reads the cards aloud. You put the matching sign on it. If you're incorrect, you get a police-card.

name: River Run
description:
One in a series of sixteen Flipsiders games designed to resemble pastel colored audio cassettes. The game contained a metal gameboard that would flip out with the snap of the wrist. A storage compartment at the top of the game would hold the magnetic pawns. A spring-loaded switch would spin the wheels of the cassette to generate random numbers and events during play. The game would hang from a blister pack on display at the store.

The left spinner is used to indicate upstream and downstream movement. The right spinner is used to indicate distance moved. The first player to reach the finish line is the winner.

name: Kick-Off Soccer
description:
The field is laid out on a 30 by 21 grid. Play alternates between the Offense and the Defense. The ball is advanced by passing dribbling and heading. When a defensive man is within specific distances from the ball and attempt can be made to tackle or intercept. The result is determined by throwing a die, but strategic placement of the men can affect the odds. Goal tries are similarly determined by die throws adjusted to the positioning of the goalkeeper and other defensive players.

From Designer's Notes:
KICK-OFF Soccer has been developed to follow as closely as possible the real game of soccer. The strategy and tactics are the same, as are most of the rules. Soccer is not a complicated game. There are very few set plays, these mainly arise on Corners, Free-Kicks and Throw-Ins. The game is played through with the skills, flair and innovation of individual players working together as a team. And so with "KICK-OFF", by using simple Basic Moves, the flair and innovation has been left up to the individual player.
After playing one or two games of "KICK-OFF", the method of play becomes easy and only brief reference is necessary to player and ball movement, and die throws. The die throws do not determine the outcome of the game, they merely simulate the chances played in real soccer.
"KICK-OFF" has been play tested by enthusiastic "youngsters" aged from eleven to adult. For the young enthusiasts, some adult assistance was found advisable at first, but once advised, they were at home with "KICK-OFF" as they were on the real field!
publishers: Camden Products Ltd. Tulsa, OK, Piknik Imports

name: Skittle Horseshoes
description: Players use the swinging skittle ball to try to knock their horseshoes onto a peg as in standard horseshoes.

name: Erbschleicher AG
description:
The players are relatives of aunt Luzie, who is soon going to die. Aim of the game is to inherit some of aunt Luzie's wealth.
To get to her money the players have a set of legacy-hunter-cards, from which 5 cards are drawn in the beginning. They are gifts for aunt Luzie. The inheritance cards are shuffled and placed in the middle of the board.
Every turn the players give aunt Luzie gifts like journeys or parties in form of the legacy-hunter-cards, which have a certain value from 1-6. Every player is allowed to give one card. In the 2nd phase another card can be placed to increase chances or to pick another category. After all players have placed cards aunt Luzie is moved around (dice) and according where she lands the player with the highest card(s) in that category inherits something.
The player with the most valuable inheritance cards in the end wins.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Creepy Crawlers
description: Take over the house with the help of creepy crawlers bugs. You can play with bugs inside this box, or with bugs you make in your creepy crawlers oven. Players take turns moving, capturing room after room as their bugs swarm through the house. The first player to capture three rooms wins the game.

name: Nutty Squirrels
description: Similar concept to Hungry Hungry Hippos. Four players manipulate their squirrel's arms to catch the nuts that fall from the central tree.

name: Tabulos: Leer de tafels met Dokus
description: Children's game about table manners and food. Probably published in the early '90s.

name: Milk Race Game
description:
At the time that this cycling game was released the Milk Race was the only professional multiple-day cycling race in the United Kingdom. It was published by British company Jason Games.

Each player controls one cyclist on the board. The movement is determined by spinning a wheel in the middle of the board and by dice. There are also tactical cards that can be played. The board also has sprint and time trial sections.

name: El joc del món
description:
El joc del món ("The game of the world" in catalan) is a light and quite ironic card game on economic and political influence groups and on their efforts to become more powerful while maintaining some credibility.

Each player (in a standard 4 player game) represents two great global influence groups and has three voting cards. The cards have effects on the others' influence groups but also on his own influence groups, in the form of money revenues or expenditures and in the form of credibility gains or losses.

A standard game has six voting rounds and before the ballot the players could use their diplomatic skills for negotiating good deals with the other players (but of course, they could be betrayed!). After the six voting rounds the winner is the player with more money and which is, at least, among the first three in credibility.

name: Grunt 3rd Edition: Fantasy Miniature Battles
description:
First printed in 1996, in the years since Grunt has sold thousands and thousands of copies over four print versions (Original 1st edition, 2nd Edition, 2nd Edition: Deluxe and 2nd Edition: Deluxe 2 player Box Set). Now newly updated to Grunt 3rd Edition, this revised edition of Grunt has brought the game system back to its roots, a fast paced, easy to learn all purpose fantasy miniatures system thats extremely affordable.

Grunt is a unique miniatures system that focusses on army development, where you may recruit new units through the course of game play, plus have existing units gain experience points and levels. With expansion sets you can expand your army building options to include skills, abilities, expand your kingdom, customize your castles, add wizardry, monsters, magical items, develop heroes and immortals and more.


In this fashion, you strive to build up your army and kingdom over multiple battles (game sessions). You must weigh the costs to your army to achieve victory in your battle today against the gains victory can gain for your army for the long haul.
Grunt 3rd Edition is a complete miniatures game system, including game rules, 45 Battle Cards, a castle template, city template, assorted cut-out Battlefield Markers, plus cut-out army units enough to field two complete armies. And, of course, you can always print out more as needed!.

Includes:
Cover + 38 pages
- Game Rules
- 45 Battle Cards
- Castle Template
- City template
- 2 Cut-Out Armies
- Assorted Battlefield Markers that include Supply, Traps, Cavalry, Fortifications, Fortresses, Scaling Ropes, Ballisti, Siege Towers, Castle Defenses, and Catapults.

name: Operation Fitness
description:
This game was produced by Waddingtons Games for SKI (a British yogurt manufacturer) and was available by mail order from SKI.

The object of the game is to be the first team coach to get all four members of their team 'fit' by reaching 100 points on the SKI fitness scale. There are no dice; instead pieces are moved round the board according to the instructions of red movement cards. They gain or lose fitness depending on the blue activity cards drawn. Fitness is recorded on dials (SKI Fitness Scales).

name: Fantasifararen
description:
Fantasifararen ("The Fantasy Traveler") is a Swedish game recommended for children 6-12 years old. It is based on a book, "Fantasifararen - Jakten på Kapten Klos ring" that is included in the game box.

The players move along a game board trying to be the firs one to reach the goal. On the way they encounter different challenges. To be the winner you have to use your imagination and be willing to fulfill some dares.
categories: Adventure, Children's Game, Fantasy, Humor, Novel-based, Party Game
mechanics: Acting, Rock-Paper-Scissors, Role Playing, Singing, Storytelling, Voting

name: Super Jock Soccer
description: Like all Super Jock games, the player pounds the head of the jock to propel the ball. The jock player tries to score and the defender controls the goalkeeper. The players take turns trying to score and whoever scores most wins.

name: ¡¡El juego del ligue!!
description:
This is a dating game. The object is to find your couple, and then have them complete a route filled with all types of places and situations, and finally once that is done, being able to enter the apartment.





















El objetivo de este juego es encontrar a tu pareja, efectuando un recorrido repleto de todo tipo de lugares y situaciones, y una vez logrado esto, poder entrar en el apartamento.

name: Tænkestorm
description:
(Translated from the box, in Danish)

Tænkestorm is a funny and engaging game that everybody can join!

The players are placing colored sticks in given patterns, either by adding or moving sticks every time it is their turn.

The players draw a thought card which depicts the figure the should make. It is the big color wooden die that determines the color of the sticks the players add or move. When a player succeeds in making the pattern on the card, he/she wins the thought card. The player who first wins 3 thought cards also wins the game.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pattern Building, Tile Placement

name: Gladiators
description:
Based on the hit Australian TV show of the 1990s, Gladiator.

This is a board game for 2 to 4 players, using the die and a counter for each player.

Move around the board and be the first to finish having faced the test of the Gladiators.

Watch out for Condor, Vulcan, Rebel, Tower and Cougar along the way.

name: Mailbox: A Treasure Hunt Party Game
description:
The object of Mailbox is to be the letter carrier who delivers the most letters to animals' mailboxes. The game utilizes a dealer or leader to facilitate game play.

The game consists of 8 mailboxes, each with 4 animals' names and pictures on them, and several sheets of letters, which are to be delivered. The leader writes each players initials on a letter, distributes them to the appropriate players. Players search for the appropriate animal's mailbox, deposit their letter, and return to the leader for another letter to deliver, continuing until all letters are delivered. The winner is the player who delivers the most letters to the correct mailboxes.

name: Spear Song
description:
Spear Song is a set of tabletop wargame rules primarily based on the Dark Age/Medieval period. By concentrating on the 'mechanics' of pre-gunpowder warfare, rather than focusing on particular armies or battles, the system should be flexible enough to cater for the historical preferences of most players who are interested in this era. Rules for chariots and 'Eastern style' warriors further increase the potential by allowing for Celtic or Crusader type settings.

Whilst the rules are mainly designed to create skirmishes and small-scale actions, a section is also included to enable larger scale battles to be fought using the same basic system.

Each major section of the text is followed by a fictional narrative that explains how the system works in game terms, and an introductory scenario based around the narratives is provided to familiarize players with the game.

As with other Dropwing systems, it is intended to extend the historical material that we produce in line with market demand. Having said this, Spear Song provides a 'stand alone' system in it's own right, which provides players with the basic material to fight battles using a wide variety of warriors from the 'Sword and Shield' era.

name: The Wind in the Willows Game
description:
Each player plays as either Ratty, Mole, Toad, or Badger. The object of the game is to collect and deliver presents to your friends and then be the first to make it back home.

2 to 4 players Ages 5 - 11.
categories: Animals, Fantasy, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Novel-based
mechanics: Pick-up and Deliver, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Karafe
description:
From the back of the box:

When you play Karafe, you become the wine maker. You buy your vineyard; harvest your grapes, bottle your wine and sell it. Just open a few bottles of wine and let the party begin. There are over 500 interesting questions or wine taste tests divided into two category levels, so everyone from the sipper to the connoisseur can compete on a level playing field. By the time you play the game just a few times you will impress all of your friends with your knowledge of wine.

Home Page: http://www.karafe.com/

name: Wicked Narrows: Rome's Disaster at Kalkreis, Sept 9, 2 A.D.
description:
Wicked Narrows covers the Roman disaster in the Teutoburg Forest on September 9th, 2 A.D. Led by one of Rome’s favorite son’s, German born Arminius, turned on those that loved and trained him, leading four German tribes (18000 men) into deadly battle with Varus’ Roman Army. The German ambush at the Kalkriese Narrows ( a narrow strip of land only 220m wide) caught the Romans by complete surprise with an am-bush. One the 2nd day, all 20000 Romans had been killed. This game focuses on the second day as the Romans approached the narrows and the German attack !

The map scale is about 550 yards per hex. Each combat unit is a cohort of 500 men for the Roman and between 500-1000 men for the German. A game turn represents one hour of time.

The design is unique and captures the flavor of battle during this period. The game depends upon the German player and when he launches his devastating attack. In fact, until the German attacks, the Romans simply casually march towards their destination. When the attacks begin, blood will spill across the map as the Romans try desperately try to maintain damage control. But this is hard, as the German tribes create an attack like a shark frenzy, which only continues to become more barbaric!

The battle sequence contains three rounds of types of combat, leaders and morale are vital and is impacted by what happens in the combat rounds.

One 11x17 Map, rules, 280 counters. Still only $16.00. Designed by Kerala Cironi. Developed by Perry Moore.

name: Cossack Revenge: Denikin's Abyss, 1920
description:
Cossack Revenge depicts the tragic end-point of the White Army's battle against the Bolsheviks. In March 1920, as the White Army retreated to their last escape route, the British, which had supported them with material since 1918, finally committed a battalion of troops to secure the port. At sea, several battleships and the first aircraft carrier provided cover. On shore, the fighting was desperate using all available resources including tanks.

The game depicts the situation from March 20th to 27th, when the last evacuees left and the Reds stormed into the city. In the game, the Whites must carefully evacuate their troops. Failure will end the White Army cause prematurely.

Game Scale: The map scale is about 1 mile per hex. Each combat unit represents roughly a battalion in size.

name: Family Dice Games
description:
FAMILY DICE GAMES is a plethora of dice games packaged together into one box.

-Craps
-Poker Dice
-Put & Take
-Bowling
-Jack Pot
-Liar's Dice
-Ship, Captain, Mate & Crew
-Twenty One
-Aces
-Sequences
-Snake Eyes
-Horse
-King Nero
-Down & Back
-Strike Three

The set features a Yahtzee style dice cup, a set of five multicolored poker dice, five multicolored casino dice, five green d6, and ten green six-sided dice with a bowling pin on one face, and two six-sided dice for the game Put & Take, which bear a combination of letters and numbers on their sides.

Score sheets for the bowling game were included, as well as small poker chips for the games King Nero, Liar's Dice, and Twenty-One.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Bluffing, Dice, Party Game
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Hand Management, Set Collection

name: Miss America Pageant Game
description: This 1988 Miss America Game is a trivia game about the life and occurences of things during the pageant.

name: Disney's Dinosaurspelet
description:
Dinosaurspelet (The Dinosaur Game) is set in the theme of Disney's "Dinosaur", where the players control Aladar and his friends to find his native breeding grounds. Chased by raptors the players might have to sacrifice some of Aladar's friends to reach home.

Contents:

- Game Board
- 83 cardboard pieces
- 4 playing pieces with plastic feet
- Die
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Prehistoric
publishers: Damm / Egmont, Kärnan, Kirjalito, Litas Spil

name: Mormon Baseball
description:
This is a religious-themed trivia game for members of the Latter Day Saints (Mormon) church. The trivia questions are religious in nature and are asked and answered in a mechanism simulating a simple baseball game. The key to the game is the question and answer booklet, which includes two pages of rules and 53 pages of questions. Each page has six numbered questions and answers. There is a cardboard field inset in the box and plastic pegs to use as runners.

For each "at bat", the batting player rolls a D6. For the first batter, the "pitcher" on the opposing team reads that numbered question from page 1. If the player answers correctly, he receives the result designated for that question. If he answers incorrectly, he is out. Pegs are placed on the field and advanced accordingly. One roll on each page provides a result without a question.

With each succeeding batter, the question moves to the next page of the booklet, allowing a long game before any possibility of a repeated question arises. As per normal baseball rules, three outs ends an inning and the team with most runs scored after nine innings wins. The game seems to expect high scores: there are holes in the scoreboxes for 24 runs by each team.

Many of the questions are very basic: "Who was the real father of Jesus?" (God). Others require more detailed knowledge of the Mormon church: "Name the brother of Joseph Smith whose name begins with the letter H who was one of the Eight Witnesses" (Hyrum), or "Which of the following is not an office in the Melchizedek Priesthood: Elder, Seventy, Teacher, or High Priest?" (Teacher).

name: Kolme pientä porsasta (Tre små grisar)
description:
The theme of the game is the story of Three Little Pigs and the Big Bad Wolf; the game consists of four player tokens, the board and a die. The players draw lots over who is the Wolf.
The players roll the die and move their tokens according to the roll. The player who reaches the goal first is the winner. However, the Wolf must capture all three Pigs in order to win. In case he is ahead of all three Pigs, the Wolf, and he alone, may move backwards.
If the Wolf arrives at a circle where a Pig is resting, he has captured the Pig and that player must remain there. If another Pig arrives at this circle, the captured Pig is released. He may also gain his own freedom by rolling a six.
If a Pig arrives at a circle where the Wolf is resting, the latter must remain there for two turns.
In addition to these basic rules, there are several special event circles that have their own rules for the Pigs and the Wolf.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Track Movement, Variable Player Powers

name: Kampen om Örebro (Kunskapsspelet)
description:
Kampen om Örebro is about the Swedish city Orebro. It is a game similar to monopoly with some extra rules such as questions about local company in örebro.

Kampen om Örebro belongs to a series of games called kunskapsspelet.
mechanics: Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Other Wordly
description:
2 players (or 2 teams of 2) turn up a card with a word on, and the first to announce a synonym for the word takes the card, and then a new card is turned over. This continues for 3 minutes, using a sand timer.

Then the "brain freeze" round begins, where a single card is turned up. The first player to name a synonym for the word gives the brain freeze card to the opponent. That player then has to try and name another, different synonym for the same word, and if so, passes the brain freeze card back. This continues until the current holder of the brain freeze card is unable to name a synonym. The last player to name a synonym then takes the card.

Then the whole process is repeated with players having to name antonyms instead.

Players then have 1 point per card, with a penalty of -10 points for the holder of the brain freeze card.

Instructions are also included for classroom play.

name: T-Rex Rules
description:
From the back of the box:

From Anklyosaurus to Velociraptor, these giants that roamed the earth are colorfully depicted on these cards. With over one hundred dinosaur facts (2 each per card), kids will really become dinosaur experts. Players match up pairs of cards, whoever is left holding the Tyrannosaurus Rex card becomes king of the dinosaurs. T-Rex rules!

name: Jouons avec Tintin à Moulinsart
description: A book of 15 games based on the adventures of Tintin, the french reporter comic character created by Hergé. The various games range from purely luck driven to more abstract games with no luck whatsoever. Each game fills one or two pages of the book and some require that the players supply additional material (dice, pawns, pen and papers).
categories: Book, Comic Book / Strip, Dice, Puzzle, Word Game
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Paper-and-Pencil, Roll / Spin and Move

name: The Good News! Bad News! game
description:
The Good News! Bad News! game is a cross between Monopoly and Life with a twist. You can move your pieces by using a roll of the dice (Luck) or you can use the Rubik's cube-like pyramid called a "Pyraminx" (Minimal SKill) to decide how far to move. By twisting the pyramid in a certain way you can guarantee yourself so may places to move. Avoiding low paying vocation spaces, for which you qualify initially, maximizes your chance to later get more than your fair share of the lucrative positions after attaining higher educational qualifications. Of course, even an expert can not expect to get all of the best jobs, but what you can do is leave some low paying ones vacant and "Bad News" all opponents into financial oblivion!

The designated "Adult cards" can be excluded when playing with children or adults who are sensitive to the subjects on the Bad News cards. No cards are really X-rated, but some Adult Cards quote embarrassing subjects from newspapers or TV which must pertain to someone! Use discretion and delete cards which could be found objectionable. Or just go ahead and offend your friends!
mechanics: Action Points, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Duel in the Sky
description:
From the Box:

"They shall mount up with wings as eagles" (Isaiah 40:31)...and Duel in the Sky

This is a game of daring, strategy and chance. Two eagles circle, stalk and pursue each other until one swoops to victory.

To hover, to dive, to climb, to soar is decided by chance and the cast of a die. Direction and distance is decided by the strategy and daring of the player.

This is a 3-dimensional game that teaches in the simplest way: depth perception over a 2-dimensional playing surface.

Contents:

A large playing surface (cloth board), a die, and two cube playing pieces.

name: Hamilton On Board
description: Hamilton On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Ontario, Canada. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit Family Services of Hamilton.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Springfield On Board
description: Springfield On Board is a Monopoly clone based on the city in Missouri. Board squares are replaced with landmarks and businesses from the area. Proceeds from the game go to benefit the Leadership Springfield.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: The 80's - 90's Combo Game
description:
From publisher's page:

The Combo Game features 1,200 all-new questions about 80’s and 90’s nostalgia so it’s perfect for re-charging your copy of The 80’s Game® and The 90’s Game®. Or use The Combo Game’s travel-sized game board and game pieces to play on the road! Either way, get more great trivia about Cheers, Aerosmith, The Naked Gun and Guns N’ Roses. For 2 to 5 players or teams of teenagers and adults.

name: The Errand Boy
description:
Extrapolated from description by eBay seller Walnutts for ebay:

The 2 fold, chromo-lithographed Game Board measures approx. 10 1/4” x 20” and features 2 images in the center - one showing the “Good” Errand Boy and the “Bad” Errand Boy and the other the interior of a Banking Office. Scenes at each corner of the Board and text the spaces on the board relate to various events (both positive and negative) in the career of a Errand Boy. The object of the game is to work your way up from "Applicant" to "Banker” using the spinner located on the game board to decide on movement.The game box features chromo-lithographed paste down illustration of an American street scene with the dedicated Errand Boy protecting his package while a roust-about competitor is seen dropping his packages, smoking a cheroot, getting in a fight and generally messing up his duty.

name: Choose the Right Match Game
description: This is a matching card game aimed at the LDS (Mormon) community and asks players to match images and religious facts based on characters and concepts from the Book of Mormon.

name: Prairie Hazards
description: This game is a re-creation of prairie life in South Dakota. Each player chooses an animal from one of five groups (Waterfowl, Upland Game, Small Mammal, Big Game, and Predator) and tries to make it around the board, facing hazards along the way. After they have completed a lap, they switch to an animal from another group and go again, until they have completed the game with all five animal groups.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Hannah Montana DVD Game
description:
From Amazon.com's site:

"The Disney Channel's teen pop sensation Hannah Montana stars in this multi-activity DVD game. Players compete to be the first to make it to the stage and "rock out the show" just like their favorite singer. Along the way, they must earn tokens by winning challenges, which include singing the lyrics to Hannah's songs, posing for the paparazzi, guessing Hannah's fashion sense, and answering questions about the show. The winner will be rewarded with her own karaoke-style spotlight performance. DVD bonus materials include a virtual version of Hannah Montana's Magic 8 Ball. Includes DVD, 3-D game board, die, four movers and 20 tokens."

name: Horsie-Horsie
description:
Content: eight track cards, 4 counters (horses), colored and numbered discs in a bag, a check card

The horses are moved forward by the drawing of the discs out of the bag by the "controller".
The first horse in the finish wins.

A rare game from 1947!

name: Goin' Fishin' Game
description:
Simple roll-and-move game for younger children.

Players spin the spinner and move the indicated number of spaces. If the space landed on has a black arrow, the player must obey the instructions the arrow points to. If a player lands on a square with a numbered fish, that number of fish are caught by the player.

When a player reaches the finish square by exact count,
the game ends. The player with the most fish at that time is the winner.
publishers: John Sands Pty Ltd, Milton Bradley

name: Livräddningsspelet
description:
Life guard game!

Learn all about how to save lives on the water summertime and on the is wintertime. You make your way on the board game and answer the questions about lifesaving. The first to cross finish-line is the winner.

contents:
1 board game
1 dice
4 player pieces
52 cards
1 wheel
rules
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Point to Point Movement, Roll / Spin and Move

name: From the Gecko
description:
If you love puzzles and games you will love From The Gecko™.

From The Gecko™ is a unique speed math game that focuses the player on understanding numbers and making quick decisions.
Fun for kids of all ages, even grown-ups! Kids will have a blast while learning and laughing. Will you be the first to build your gecko? Great for all ages.

For 2 to 6 players.
Made in the USA.

name: Madicken
description:
Astrid Lindgren is one of Swedens' most famous writers of childrens books. This game is from one of her books that has become a film.

Madicken likes pretzels and in this game it's three different kinds of pretzels. On the back of the pretzel there is a number and you move forward this number of steps to try to be the first to the finish line were a giant pretzel is waiting for you that Abbe made.

Contents:
1 board game
4 playing pieces
45 pretzel cards
1 giant pretzel

name: Infected
description: Draw a card and use your body to communicate your new affliction to the other players, if someone guesses the illness in a timely manner, the amount of points indicated on the card are awarded to both the infected person and the player who diagnoses it. Whoever correctly diagnoses an illness is the next player to get infected. Points are subtracted if a player passes up a card, however that player may pick a new card during the same turn. The game is over when all the cards have been played and the winner is the player with the most points.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Party Game, Real-time, Word Game

name: Space Race 2000
description:
Space Race 2000 was developed after 2 1/2 years research and testing by its Seattle, Washington inventor. The game provides basic planet information such as names of all the planets, how many planets are there? Which planet is closest to the earth? Many other questions are answered as you never lose interest in the excitement of the game. Excellent learning tool for all ages as our progress in space continues. (Not a trivia game)"

Roll-and-move around the ring-shaped board attempting to land on every planet of the solar system. Collect all 8 planet chips plus one moon chip and then return to Earth to win.

name: The Telephone Game
description:
Be the first to reach FINISH after progressing along the path marking the history and evolution of the Bell System.

Includes a colorful board, four plastic telephone tokens, two special "Touch Tone" dice, and storage insert.

Telephone Pioneers of America

(c)1982 Cadaco

name: Zingo! Heroes
description: Bingo variant for Ages 4 and up. A plastic dispenser deals out two plastic tiles per turn, the first player to see a match between the picture on the tile and on their cards gets to claim the tile. Get three tiles in a row to win. Zingo with marvel heroes in every tile.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Friends Around the World
description: The board game focuses away from competition and rather fosters cooperation with each other. The object is not to get there first, but to get all his friends together to the finish. Chance cards are not only penalizing the individual player but everyone.

name: Der schiefe Turm von Pizza
description:
From the publisher's website:

Build the leaning tower of pizza!

Collect the pizzas and put them, one on top of the other, to build the leaning tower. Be the first to deliver the order. The higher the tower, the more points you get. But be careful not to make the tower crash ...

The game consists of 80 wooden "pizzas", the order-cards and the scorecard. Turn by turn the players collect pizzas until an order can be completed by putting the pizzas on top of one of the towers. The higher the better, but once the tower crashes down, you loose your score, so be careful!

"The leaning tower of pizza" is a fun and thrilling game of skills for kids and grown-ups.

name: Wizards Game
description:
"Card game between rival Wizards."

Each player randomly selects a wizard character to play. Each wizard has a unique special ability. The card deck contains magical ingredients, spells, abilities, knowledge, and magical items that the wizards may possess or create.

The players keep track of three types of points during the game. Lore Points, gained through research, are used for Bidding to acquire cards. Heka Points are used to play Spell Cards. Fate Points are used to determine the winner at the end of the game. Having certain cards in play will generate Fate and Heka Points each turn.

"The first player to accumulate 25+ Fate points is the winner."

name: Two Lobster Dice Games
description:
This game comes as five dice packaged in a tube with a short page of game rules. The ones on the dice are replaced with lobsters.

In the first game (just called "A Lobster Dice Game") players must successfully molt their lobsters by rolling the dice. Unsuccessful players are out of the game, and the last lobster to molt is declared largest and wins.

In the second game ("Lobster Fishing") the players score one point for each lobster of legal size caught (i.e., a lobster rolled along with a 4, 5 or 6.) After 10 rounds of fishing, the winner is the one who caught the most lobsters legally.

name: Krokofant
description:
Are you able to puzzle together a zebra or an elephant? Or maybe a Krokofant (Crocodile/Elephant)! What new animals can you figure out? A game full of fun and learning with wooden blocks, animal cards and die.

First form the four animal-puzzles by randomly placing the 24 wooden cubes on the table 6 cubes for each animal.
Each player gets 4 cards one of each color.
In his turn player rolls the dice and may turn as many cubes in different posittions as the dice indicates.
If one of the puzzles shows the animal player has on his card he may turn tha card face-down.

Player with the 4 face-down cards in front of him is the winner.
categories: Animals, Card Game, Children's Game, Puzzle

name: The Shopping Game
description:
Simple economics for children aged from 8 (although most 5 year olds can play the game well).

Move around the store buying the cheapest item of clothing (from 8 different types) but don't spend more than £25 (it is an old game!).

name: Buck Fever
description: Roll a die and move your hunter on the game board. Try to collect animals while dealing with various situation cards.

name: Sindbad: Das große Abenteuer-Spiel
description:
A simple roll-and-move game, similar to Snakes and Ladders. Themed as an Arabian nights adventure of german TV series hero, Sindbad.

(For those of you who remember: watch the intro of the series here: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aK6Hf0IYst4)

name: ElvisOpoly
description:
ElvisOpoly

"The Rock 'n' Roll Game of Fortune & Fame"

This is a monopoly style game about Elvis Presley. Players move around a board featuring Elvis songs and collect gold or platinum records. Board spaces include Graceland and the U.S. Army.

Includes board, cards, plastic record discs, tokens, play money, dice, rules, and storage insert.

(c)1995

name: Mika
description:
The game is based on the TV-series Mika, a Swedish/Lappish TV-series. The goal is for each player to be the first to transport yourself and one reindeer from Kiruna to Paris. With Mika-cards you can use different vehicles to move - cars, trucks, train, boat and barges. If you land on a red point you draw a red event card (mostly negative events), and on blue points blue event cards (mostly positive events).

Towns on the map (Swedish names):
Sweden: Kiruna, Boden, Umeå, Borlänge, Gävle, Stockholm, Göteborg, Helsingborg, Malmö

Finland: Kemi, Vasa, Tammerfors, Helsingfors

Denmark: Köpenhamn, Helsingör, Fredrikshavn

Germany: Hamburg, Bremen, Hannover

Netherlands: Amsterdam

Belgium: Brüssel

France: Calais, Paris

Components:
1 board (map of northern Europe)
4 pieces
32 Mika-cards (traveling-routes)
32 Event cards (16 blue and 16 red)
Money
mechanics: Open Drafting, Point to Point Movement

name: Second Russian Revolution
description:
"Can YOU gain freedom for the oppressed minorities? Or as the Russians can you preserve the last multinational colonial empire in the world? Play this game and find out!"

The focus of this game is the struggle of five minorities (Armenians, Balts, Belorussians, Moslems and Ukrainians) to establish republics independent of the central Soviet government (which, in practice, was actually that of the Russian majority). They do this by declaring secession (consistently misspelled "succession" in the rules) and defending its breakaway move. Combat is conducted by matching cards and either "battle" or "guerrilla" tactics, which leads to gain or loss of support points. Play is varied by events (e.g. Sino-Soviet War), foreign support (from America, China, Iran or Western Europe), and betrayals. The Soviet players wins by playing all five reform cards (e.g. "release political prisoners", "purge hard-liners")and having no independent republics. The Minorities win by having at least three independent republics in play.

name: Trivial Pursuit: McDonald's Happy Meal edition
description:
A promotional, stripped down, mini version of Trivial Pursuit: Genus Edition. Uses a spinner instead of a die. The question categories on the 16 cards are:

Around the World
Entertainment
World of Wonder
Earth Story
Fun & Games
Wild Side

name: Kleiner Rabe hat Geburtstag
description:
Translation: Little Raven's Birthday

A game in the "Little Raven" series based on the children's book series by author Nele Moost and illustrator Annet Rudolph.

From the Publisher (translated from German):

" 'Where are my gifts?' cries the Little Raven, as his friends for a birthday visit. But they've got a game invented and all the gifts hidden. And since the little raven can never get enough, there are some gifts given twice. Who advises correctly, what gifts are in what are packages? A good memory helps."

This is a memory game.

name: Gronewold Demolition
description:
The object of the game is to raze and remove an eight story building of ones' opponent, and be reimbursed by City Hall for the completed demolition work.

Each player is given a square on the board and 32 colored blocks. Each constructs an eight story building using all of the blocks within the designated area on the board.

Die rolls determine which draw deck one takes cards from, and whether that player also gets an additional turn.

The orange, yellow, and green card stacks each function differently and help to determine actions taken by that player.

After one of the players has removed all of the blocks from his or her building, the game ends. The total of cash on hand and cards from the orange stack (contract cards) determine the winning player.

name: Shaun das Schaf Gemüsefußball
description:
In this game, only one thing matters to the sheep: Goals, goals, goals! The pigs have put together an opposing team on the pasture and Shaun and his friends will need all their dribble-skills to get across the goalline! In this fast paced game only a good eye and a bit of flair will carry you to victory.

Players take turns picking teams and then roll the footballs down a ramp. If the ball makes it to the end section (the goal) you score points, but pig defenders block the way.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme, Sports

name: Monopoly: Washington Redskins
description: The famous Monopoly game. Players vie to buy, sell and trade legendary greats Joe Theisman, Darrell Green and Joe Gibbs as well as Super Bowls XXVI, XXII and XVII in pursuit of owning the ultimate Redskins team.
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Player Elimination, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading

name: Das Göttinger Turmspiel
description: The game consists of 72 wooden disks in 6 colors and 6 sizes. At first, players take turns piling up "towers" (pyramid shaped). In the second phase, the players try to build towers that only contain disks in their own color. Whoever manages that first is the winner.

name: All Around the Farm
description:
From the box: "Be the first to feed your farm animal in this noisy game of animal sounds and counting!"

Theme: Each player moves around the farm collecting food for a specific animal and talking to other animals.

Goal: Collect six pieces of food in your wheelbarrow and return the wheelbarrow to your animal's stall.

Game play: On a player's turn he rolls two 6-sided dice. The player then has up to four choices on how to move his wheelbarrow around the circular board: by the amount shown on either die, by the sum of the dice, or by the difference between the dice. Every time the player lands on a wheelbarrow space he may add another piece of food to his wheelbarrow. The first player to fill his wheelbarrow and return to his animal's stall wins the game.

Additionally, every time the player passes another player he must make his own animal's sound. Whenever he passes an animal shown on the board he must make its sound. If a player fails to make the correct animal sound he must return a piece of food to the stockpile.

The box recommends ages 6 and up, but the gameplay seems more suited for ages 3-7.

Components: The game board and other pieces are all of cardboard construction.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: El jinete solitario
description:
From the box cover:
Entertaining game where the players have to make a long and dangerous journey through the desert. Each player could rely on the help of our friend Lucky Luke. With Lucky Luke, he will be able to overcome the different dangers which are all around him.
The players will move their characters around the board by rolling the dice until they reach the end of the journey.
Play and enjoy yourself with The Lonely Rider!

Components:
• A full colour board
• Eleven board pieces representing the characters and obstacles with their plastic stands.
• A plastic dice

name: Umferðarspilið mitt
description: A one track (with 60 spaces from start to finish) game from The Road Traffic Directorate, meant to help children learn the traffic rules. The players roll a die and move forward as the die dictates. On a few spaces there are some instructions the players must follow. The first player to the finish space wins, but must recant one traffic rule and follow it from that time onwards.

name: Yo Gabba Gabba! Party In My Tummy Lunchbox Game
description:
Packaged in a metal lunchbox, Yo Gabba Gabba Party In My Tummy takes one of the more famous skits/songs from the children's television series, and turns it into a card game, with a unique card-draw mechanic based on hitting cards with plastic spoons.

In "Party In My Tummy," two to four players compete to provide a healthy lunch for the characters from Yo Gabba Gabba - Plex, Moono, Tootie, Broby, Foofa. Using telescopic plastic spoons with suction cups affixed to the end, players pick up food cards (by hitting them with the spoons) and place them under a card-cutout of the appropriate character. Cookies can only be given as the final card (the dessert) in a character's lunch set. The player to complete a character's 5-item healthy lunch gets that character and a point. Wild cards can be given to any character and are worth additional points at the end of the game.
categories: Card Game, Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Pizza 31
description:
Based on the card game 31, or Blitz, players try to come as close to 31 as possible with only 3 cards, all of the same type of pizza. Includes 52 pizza slice-shaped cards (6 different pizzas) and 18 tokens.

When the pizza delivery "knocks", the lowest scoring players discard a token. If a player runs out of tokens, then they are out of the game.

Improve your child's counting skills with this card game.

name: Partner gesucht
description: Before the game, each player chooses certain characteristics of his or her ideal partner. Then everyone moves around the board, following the instructions on the fields. Eventually, the players collect cards with characteristics. The first player to collect all the characteristics on his or her "wishlist" is the winner.
mechanics: Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection

name: Obstkörbchen
description: Lillifee themed game. The object is to fill fruit baskets with fruit tiles in a market. The pawn moves past those baskets; and at the end of each turn, a tile is turned over. If it is a kind of fruit needed for the basket next to the pawn, it is put in. When a basket is full, the player to put the last tile in gets a reward card. The player with most cards at the end of the game is the winner.

name: From Head to Toe
description:
From publisher's website:

"Get your family moving with the Eric Carle From Head to Toe Game! This game develops a child's self-esteem and confidence. Players flip over cards to see who can do various moves with their bodies like Can You Wiggle Your Hips? Everyone who answers I Can Do It! does the action. This game encourages imagination as children act out images on the cards, and coordination as children learn to move all parts of their bodies."

name: 天空盤 (Tenkuban)
description:
The Japanese name Tenkuban (天空盤) roughly corresponds to "Sky Board"; this is a version of the game "Ghosts!"

Each player controls 4 angels and 4 devils on 6x6 board, their identities hidden from the opponent.

A player can win by:

moving an angel into a goal square from the corners of the opponent's side;
capturing all 4 of the opponent's angels; or
tricking the opponent into capturing all 4 of the player's devils.


Players deploy their pieces and then take turns moving one to an adjacent square. They may capture enemy pieces but do not know whether it is an angel or devil until after the capture.

Dartslive Co., Ltd produced 3 versions of the board game in different materials (cardboard, clear acrylic, & stainless steel), as well as a mobile phone version.

name: Muníci
description:
You take on a role of a "Muník" (there is no direct translation of the word, assume something like a Mole) and strive to dig out passages underground, finding treasures and resources, with which you can later buy pieces of a very large and Super-Heavy Digging Machine, with which you can outpower all other opposition.

The board is prepared out of many face-down tiles, which may or may not contain something worth taking. Then the players move in their turns, according to the Attributes of their Moles and the equipment they possess in search for more resources. They can store them in their Storage space and also sell them for gold and vice versa.

Ultimately they want to buy and build the parts of the Digging Machine and the first one that succeeds, is the winner.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Pick-up and Deliver, Point to Point Movement, Trading

name: Malins munspel
description:
A roll and move game with the need for tooth brushing as its main theme. It was create to promote better dental care among children.

The name munspel is a play with words. It can be interpreted as a game about the mouth, but is is also a name of an musical instrument.

name: Ratz Fatz auf den Bauernhof
description: This installment in the "Ratz-Fatz"-series revolves around the farm and eveything around that. Like the other Ratz Fatz games Ratz Fatz auf den Bauerhof is an educational game and it actually includes several games aimed at children of different ages. Game play revolves about recognizing the animals, and machines on the cards and making connections between them as fast as possible, another version of the game is a fairly straightforward memory game; yet another version that can be played and which is suitable for slightly older children (5-6) makes the game into a storytelling game.
categories: Action / Dexterity, Animals, Children's Game, Educational, Memory

name: Am laufenden Band
description: Based on the popular German TV series "Am laufenden Band", the boardgame version is fun for all in the family. Every player maneuvers his playing piece across a conveyor belt, aiming for the highest scoring playing fields. The players push their luck and have to jump off the conveyor belt at right time. Content: 1 playing board, 24 playing pieces, 1 dice, 1 rulebook.

name: Bear Blocks
description:
"Little ones will love rolling the blocks and matching up teddy's colorful accessories with this introductory matching game..."

This educational dexterity game helps develop visual discrimination, language skills, and fine motor skills.

Players select three bear tokens at random. Each player takes turns rolling the "bear blocks" which are actually huge 1" x 1" dice. The object of the game is to match the clothing worn by your bears with the bears on the dice.

Several play alternatives are presented in the rules. This offers some variety for the children.

name: Math Mouse Games
description: A game with six different boards and 9 different games in which children learn math concepts while playing. Games include Gobbling Fractions, Roll-a-Problem, Gardening, Blast off, Grocery store, Fraction/Decimal Cards, Multiplication Board, Add Off.

name: Bob the Builder Rallye
description:
Ready,... set,... go! Bob and Wendy are waiting for Baggi, Rollo, Buddel and Heppo at the construction site. Who of them will be the first to reach them? Who will have the most luck with the die in this funny game with 3D-effect?
Very simple roll and move game.

name: Quartett-Würfel
description:
The game contains 12 sets of four tiles showing items belonging to a particular profession. The cards are color-coded, so there is a blue, a red, a yellow and a green tile for each profession.
One color is picked out and the 12 tiles are placed openly on the table. Each player picks one of these.
Then players take turns flipping open a tile from the draw stack. If the tile belongs together with that player's first tile, he/she can keep it. Otherwise it is openly discarded. The next player can take it if he/she needs it, then draw a new tile as usual. When a player thinks he/she has 4 matching tiles, the tiles are placed on top of a large plastic cube. A mirror shows the backside of the tiles - if these form a picture of the profession, the player keeps the set.
When all sets have been distributed, the player with most sets is the winner.

The game is themed for the a German children's TV show called "Die Sendung mit dem Elefanten"

(User summary by HilkMAN)
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: Mini-Rallye Europe
description:
In this roll and move trivia game, players race across Western Europe answering questions about the various countries or areas in which they visit. The questions cover subjects of, among others, history, literature, fine arts, geography and economy. Each player has a small deck of cards that they can exchange for advantages (extra dice of movement typically) under certain circumstances (answering a question correctly or landing on a particular kind of space). The first to move their marker to the end space is the winner.

The game has three sets of cards, each containing a set of questions at different levels: novice, intermediate or expert.

Text is exclusively in French.

name: Whoops-a-Daisy
description: Game inspired by the commercial success of Pass the Pigs. In this case, the 'dice' are two cute little cows. You throw the cows on to a board, around the outside of which is an illustrated picket fence. The fence is divided by fence-posts and you use this as a scoring track. Made to advertise Anchor Butter, a leading brand in Britain.

name: Karnak
description:
User summary:

Theme - A fortune telling game based on cards and pendulum. Played solo or between two players with roles of questioner (later on just Q) and interpreter (N). The interpreter leads the game and the questioner is the one receiving information about his/her home, work, personality, love, future and past.

Game-play - The game-play is divided into two phases 1) the card turning and 2) the pendulum swinging.

1) The card turning phase starts by picking up the proper coloured scarabs to the game board; the hair, eyes and favourite colour of the Q. The Q shuffles the purple 54 card deck and hands it over to N. N divides the deck into 3 separate decks of 18, 9 and 27 cards. The cards are dealt on the game board in the order 18, 27 and 9. The 18 cards are dealt on locations shown at the front page of the rule leaflet. The cards have 6 words in them and one of those is picked depending which is forming a pyramid with the game board (the black half of the pyramid on the left side of the card and the white half of the pyramid on the game board). While the cards are dealt, the N questions the Q if the word on the cards have any special meaning. The forming words are related to either home (1st vertical row), work (2nd), personality (3rd), love (4th), future (5th) or past (6th), depending which vertical row the cards are placed to. The 27 cards are then dealt on the game board (some restrictions apply, see the rule leaflet). Then the deck of 9 cards is used as a key to whole interpretation. At last the rest cards of the deck of 27 are used to check if something is being dominant on some areas of the Q's life. The final interpretations varies each playing time.

2) The pendulum swinging phase starts by placing the four decks of 28 cards onto the game board. The decks are placed on lower part of the game board, around the pyramid (letter A shown on the first page of the rule leaflet). The decks represents the areas of home, work, personality and love. The players decide one of the four categories and Q decides a question he/she wants to get answered related to that category. The transparent pyramid is placed on the game board and the pendulum is used for random number selection. There is numbers of 1-28 around the pyramid on the game board and the random pendulum swing decides the number of the chosen card. The N reads the text on the proper card to the Q. Same is repeated to other categories and questions.

Goal of the game - Interpreting the message gotten with cards and pendulum and gaining more self-consciousness.

The game includes:

1 game board
1 transparent pyramid
1 pendulum
4 decks of cards (28 cards each)
1 purple deck of cards (54 cards)
2 bags including different coloured scarab buttons
1 rule leaflet (4 pages)

From Finnish intro on the rule leaflet:

"Karnak on kiehtovan jännittävä ennustuspeli, jota voi pelata yksin tai yhdessä. Se perustuu eräisiin muinaisegyptiläisiin mysteereihin ja kulttuuriperinteisiin. Koska peli on tunnettujen astrologian ja horoskooppien asiantuntijoiden suunnittelema, pelaajat voivat sen avulla myös kehittää omaa kuudetta aistiaan ja salattuja kykyjään. Luonnollisesti sitä voidaan pelata myös pelkkänä pelinä, mutta moni varmasti mielellään käyttää sitä oman itseymmärryksensä kehittämiseen ja hankkii sen avulla tietoja sisimmästä minuudestaan. Näitä tietoja voi sitten soveltaa toisten, kenties vähemmän onnekkaiden ihmisten auttamiseen."

name: Ekosystem
description:
Educational board game 'Ekosystem" is designed for high school students of grade VIII which are familiar with ecology. Purpose of this game is to help students revise information about ecology.

Game box includes: 12 tiles with questions and tasks, chart with correct answers, 4 pawns and a dice.

Game is played by 4 players. They randomly choose pawns' colours and thus are assigned names: green – producer, blue – primary consumer(herbivore), red – secondary consumer(carnivore), black – decomposer(saprotroph). Green pawn moves first, next is blue, then red, and black last. Players move their pawns on the board by the number of fields indicated by the dice.

The are 12 marked fields on the board. Whenever a player's pawn steps on any of those fields he takes a questions and tasks tile with the number of field he stepped onto. He has to read a question or task aloud an immediately answer it. Illustrations near the board's edge might help. Answer is then checked with the chart.

The winner is the player who acquires the most points. For every correct answer player is awarded 3 points. Bonus for track completion: 1st place – 3 points, 2nd place – 2 points, 3rd place – 1 point. For incorrect answers players have to skip a turn. If there are any unanswered questions behind the last pawn, players that have reached finish line can try to answer them.

name: Top Gun
description: Simple roll-and move game with same weird twists. The pawns represent air fighters. At first they have to pick up weapons (there are circles on the board where they have to go around till they step on the appropriate square), then go and eliminate the targets. If you miss the target squares, you have to start again. If you step on some specific squares, your plane is destroyed - yes, it is a roll-and-move game with player elimination.

name: Anglin Action
description:
When you get the urge to fish but can't launch the boat.... Here's the solution.

Anglin' Action is a game that involves matching fish with their correct location and lures. This allows a player to 'catch' the fish. All of the fish are assigned different values.
The winner is the player with the most 'fish points' at the end of the game.

Playing the Game:

Deal five action cards to each player.
Pile the remaining Action Cards, Lure Cards and Location Cards at the side of the table.

There are three simple phases that make up a player's turn:

Draw Phase: Draw one card from the game deck
Action Phase: You may play an Action Card if you want. Simply follow th einstructions on the Action Card. Limit one per turn.
Fish Phase: On this phase a player may do ONE of three things:

Move to a location- Take a location card and place in front of you.
Put on a lure- Take a lure card from your tackle box and place in front of you.
Catch a fish- Take a fish from your hand that matches the correct lure and correct location you are in.

Afteryour fishing phase is over the next player goes.

Winning:

The game ends when any player has caught their limit of ten fish. At this point the winner is determined by the player with the most points. Therefore the player who caught ten fish may not necessarily be the winner of the game.

name: Washington-opoly
description:
From LateForTheSky.com:

We chose some favorite landmarks and traditions, mixed in some cherry blossoms, great parks, a few festivals, the arts, some BIG FUN... and voilà behold; Washington-OPOLY!

Grab Some Friends and Gather 'Round!

Here's a quick idea of how to play!
Buy property, collect City Blocks and trade in for a Key to the City. It sounds easy enough - but add in a traffic jam, property taxes, parking tickets and the IRS and it becomes a little more difficult... and a lot more FUN!
mechanics: Auction/Bidding, Roll / Spin and Move, Set Collection, Trading
publishers: Late for the Sky Production Company

name: Zoo 3000
description:
Card game where the players create their own zoo. These zoos don´t consist of "ordinary zoo-animals", instead there are for example aliens, monsters, ghosts and wherewulfes.

The game mechanics is very simple. You start with some cards in your hand, and there are cards of four different kinds.Different colours on the back sides of the cards. Different families, but within each family the cards have different values. Each familiy (group of cards) are placed faced down in four different piles. On your turn you discard one card from your hand and take one card from the pile of that family. Then you try to get cards with as much value as possible, and the player with the best total value (points) wins the game.

name: Barbie Fashion City
description: Barbie Fashion City is a simple Barbie-themed roll-and-move game. The players roll dice and move their Barbie-like pawns over a game board which has 3D shops on it. The first player to visit eleven stores and return home is the winner.
publishers: Egmont Polska, Lansay, Winning Moves Germany

name: Dice Soccer Game
description: A small soccer simulation based on 2 6-sided dice and one special dice. By rolling the 6-sided dice, players try to gain and keep possession of the ball and move it to the opponent's side of the board. If the ball enters the penalty area, the special dice is thrown to see if a goal is scored. After a time limit or an agreed number of goals, the game is over.

name: They're Off
description: 44 cards, in sets of 6 racehorses. There are also a number of special cards (Objection to Winner, that sort of thing). When a player is dealt his hand of three cards at the start, he must place a secret bet on which horse will win the race. These bets are written down and the paper folded. A horse wins the race when one player has collected a full set of that horse's cards.

name: Baila Afterparty
description:
Baila Afterparty is a party game for 2 to 8 players. The game board is divided into 3 circles or "levels", which are preparty, the club and way back home.

Players take turns rolling the dice and move their playing pieces in accordance with the roll. The player then takes a card from one of four decks depending on what space they've landed. The card instructs the player to resolve certain tasks: i.e. making a noise like Tarzan, kiss a player in his/her right etc. If the player refuses and gives up, he/she won't gain points or will lose some points.

The game will end when all the players have reached home. The player who has collected most points is the winner of the game.

name: Capitanes de Mar y Tierra
description:
From the publisher:

You are a young captain in charge of your own fleet of ships, seeking fame and fortune. Conquer the islands and increase your wealth so you can be a powerful admiral.

Have you found a section of ocean where there are several islands that are not under the power of any kingdom or country and it is your duty to land on them and claim its riches for you. Be careful as other pirates have been established on nearby islands and are in search of new domains, you will fight them, showing who is the most powerful captain, using your ships to take out your opponents.

Have fun, managing your ships, conquering islands landing in their ports, increase your wealth, and if necessary destroy your opponents by blowing up your traps. Who will be the most successful captain?

The board represents a section of ocean with several islands, each with its port and wealth. Each island has a number that represents wealth and every time you take possession of an island, its richness is added to the total wealth of the player.

Each turn each player can make up to six actions that can be: Build, move or disembark. Additionally, the player may attack one or more opponents or blow up one of his traps.

There are two ways to end the game:

1 - Time limit: At the beginning of the game a limit of time is proposed. Upon completion of the time the winner is determined by the number of ships that the player have on the board and the wealth earned.

2 - Total Victory: The game ends when one player remains on the board or when a player takes possession of all shipyards.


Del editor:

Conviertete en un poderoso capitán acumulando riquezas y dominios.

Eres un joven capitán a cargo de tu propia flota de barcos, buscando fama y fortuna. Debes conquistar la mayor cantidad de islas, aumentando tu riqueza para que seas un poderoso almirante.

Has encontrado un sector del océano donde se encuentran varias islas que no están bajo el poder de ningún reinado o país y es tu deber desembarcar en ellas y reclamar sus riquezas para ti. Ten cuidado, ya que otros corsarios se han establecido en islas cercanas y se encuentran en la búsqueda de nuevos dominios; deberás enfrentarte a ellos, demostrando quien es el mas poderoso capitán, utilizando tus barcos para eliminar a tus oponentes.

Diviértete, manejando tus naves; conquista islas desembarcando en sus puertos, aumenta tus riquezas, enfrenta a tus oponentes y si es necesario destruyelos haciendo explotar tus trampas. ¿Quién será el capitán mas exitoso?

El tablero representa un sector del océano con varias islas, cada una con su puerto y riquezas. Cada isla tiene un número que representa su riqueza y cada vez que se toma posesión de una isla, su riqueza se suma al total de las riquezas del jugador.

En cada turno cada jugador puede realizar hasta seis acciones que pueden ser: Construir, mover o desembarcar. Adicionalmente el jugador puede atacar a uno ó mas oponentes o hacer explotar una de sus trampas.

Hay dos formas de terminar el juego:

1- Límite de tiempo: Al comienzo del juego se propone un límite de tiempo determinado. Al terminarse el tiempo establecido de juego se decide el ganador según los barcos que se tengan en el tablero y la riqueza ganada.

2- Victoria Total: El juego termina, cuando queda un solo jugador en el tablero o cuando un jugador se apodera de todos los astilleros.

name: Cashpot
description:
This is a traditional family board game in the style of monopoly, but with a fruit machine theme.

The object of the game is to accumulate enough money to spin a jackpot spinner. If the spinner comes up "win" then you win, if it doesn't, the game goes on.

On their turn, players roll dice trying to match fruit machine symbols. They can only move if they match at least two symbols. They can gamble on rerolling some dice to improve their move, but with the risk of forfeiting their go completely.

After moving, players will collect a certain amount of money based on how many symbols they rolled. They can then bank this money or gamble it by rolling a special six-sided hexagonal metal dice.

The game is mainly of interest for the incorporation of different luck-based elements: four six-sided dice with fruit symbols, three six-sided dice with numbers, one six-sided metal hexagonal dice to gamble with (which has sides labelled "lose," "double win," and "treble win"), and one six-sided spinner.
mechanics: Betting and Bluffing, Dice Rolling, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Wintersport
description:
Goal: Be the first to race to position '100' (alpine cabin with a warm welcome)

Typical 'Snakes and Ladders' game from the 30's in Germany

Roll the die by turns and step forward - until you will be transported
nice & cute, individually designed pawns

Cover/design according spirit of the time (in Germany)

name: Know Your Bible
description: Card game with trivia questions about the Bible. It also has rules for a Biblical Patience game using the cards.

name: The Sproutz: Race to the Stage
description:
The Sproutz: Race to the Stage is an education board game that teaches children about nutrition, exercise and growth hormone deficiencies.

The game play is simple: draw a card, answer a question and if you are correct, move that many spaces. Players collect tokens as they land on specific spaces that can be used as a tiebreaker.

The goal of the game is to be the first person to make it to the stage while making sure you have more tokens than anyone else who might also make it to the stage on their last turn.

name: What's the Difference?
description: A party game for the more observant guests. Everyone gets to see up to 12 pictures. Then, more pictures, with subtle differences are left where guests can see them, and they must write down what is missing from the second picture version. Whoever gets most right answers durin the evening, wins.

name: Jack 'n' Jill: Jacks Game
description:
Objective: be the first to cross the finish line.
Jack 'n Jill is a board game which is played with jacks. Jacks? Those pointy little metal things that came with a bouncy ball.

The game is set in Nursery Rhyme land. The players bounce the ball and try to pick up as many jacks as they can, which determines how many spaces they get to move forward.

name: Plutocracy
description:
Plutocracy is a game with elements of business and politics. You are a serial investor starting and building companies. You can also collect political favors in various ways, and use those to gain an advantage to your own companies, or to slow down your competitors.

Plutocracy is a card game. The opportunities available to you in a given round is represented by your hand. Your resources are collected separately, as money and political tokens ($ and poli-chips).

There are free actions you can use each round if you cannot (or will not) play any of your cards. Events add some uncertainty. One event is the "End Game," which you can use to adjust the length of a game, by placing it in the deck either near the top for a short game, or near the bottom for a long one.
categories: Card Game, Economic, Industry / Manufacturing, Political

name: Jim'll Fix It
description:
Game based on a popular television show where Jimmy Saville (an eccentric disc jockey) fulfils viewer's ambitions. If you were lucky and picked for the show, you not only fulfilled your ambition, you were also awarded a Jim Fixed It For Me badge. This became a much sought after item.

The players are children, wanting to have an ambition accepted. A 'Jim' playing piece starts life on the board and is moved by a Jim spinner. The player moves by a normal die. The objective is to land exactly on the same square as Jim. If you do, you draw four cards. The cards say things like "I would like", "I wish" etc., and also the subject of a dream wish, something like water-skiing or flying. If you can make a legitimate statement out of the four cards, you win. But this is unlikely on the first attempt and you will need to meet Jim again. If you do, you add two cards to your original four and again try to form a legitimate statement. If you can't, you discard two cards and you will have to meet Jim again.

The first player to fulfil a request with their cards, wins.
categories: Movies / TV / Radio theme, Word Game

name: Quick-Quiz: Sport
description:
108 game cards with 500 questions and 500 answers.
The question is asked and the quickest player with correct answer gets a point. Who collect 25 points first wins the game.

Contents:

108 playing cards,
notepad and pencil

name: Etsi ja löydä
description: Etsi ja löydä ("Seek and Find") is a game for children. There are 36 picture cards and 50 question cards in the game. The picture cards are placed on the table face up. Then a random question card is drawn (by a player who can read, otherwise the players do not necessarily have to know how to read yet) and a player tries to find quickly as possible one or more cards matching the question card. Usually the question relates to some detail in the picture cards (for example: find as many animals as possible with a tail!). The player marks the found cards with a piece and scores points as shown on a timer (a special timer included in the game). The player with the most points in the end wins.

name: Kongegammon
description:
This modern two-player-game is inspired by The Royal Game of Ur. The board is a replica of the board of The Royal Game of Ur. However, in this game each player has 9 unmarked black or white pieces, respectively, and the game is played using two standard (i.e. modern) four sided dice.

In turns, players throw the two dice, and then enter one or two pieces, or move one or two pieces. The pieces enters the board at the specific start for each player, and then moves along a specified path from start to end, where the pieces are moved off the board. The movements of the pieces across the board (with special rules for the rosettes) as well as the rules for sending an opponent’s piece back to start reminds of (but are substantially different from) those listed for The Royal Game of Ur.

The winner is the player who first gets all his/her nine pieces moved all the way from start to end and off the board.

name: Quick Kick Fast-Action Soccer Game
description:
Statistical sports game, featuring every World Cup team from 1930 to 1990. It uses the designer's innovative design to decide each match-up in double-quick time. This enables a player to play a whole tournament in one evening.

Dice rolls and charts combine to give each result.

name: The Wicked Willie Game
description: This board game for adult on a hen do or in another party or good natured fun setting. Each player takes a coloured playing piece and works their way around the board's main track (red) and sub-tracks (childhood, adolescence, middle age and old age) until you reach the twilight zone. First to finish with a hand of 20 scores wins. Wicked cards have scenarios and give a score (which you collect) and Willie cards have scenarios and move you back/forth so many squares or to a set place on the board. Humour is integral to the game both on the board and the cards. Instructions are on the bottom of the box.
mechanics: Dice Rolling, Open Drafting, Roll / Spin and Move

name: Stop & Go
description:
The aim of the game is to remove the traffic sign cards from the game board. The player who has gathered most cards is the winner.

Before starting to play, shuffle the 24 cards well and place them on the fields with the blue side upwards and with the poles of the sign posts pointing all in the same direction. No card should be placed on the field with the traffic lights. This field is used to place the pieces. Now agree on a player who starts, and then alternate clockwise. The player whose turn it is throws the dice and forwards his piece on the game board by the number of pips. After starting the game, the field with the traffic lights must not be entered again. You may move in all directions but not diagonally. During a move you may change the direction as often as you want. However, you have to keep two things in mind: you must not move on to a field twice during a move, and at the end of the move you must not arrive at the starting field. Bad luck, if you throw a six, because you will have to miss this turn. If a move ends on a field with a card, you have to guess which of the two signs shown on the blue side is displayed on the yellow side of the card. Subsequently look whether the traffic sign you think is shown on the yellow side. If the guess was correct, the player may take the card. The player places this card with the blue side upwards in front of himself. If the guess was wrong, the player has to return the card to the same place on the game board. If one card only is left on the game board, the player whose turn it is may throw the dice twice and move. If this card has been removed as well, every player counts his cards. The winner is who has most cards.

name: Der Löwe ist Los
description:
Children's game that is very much in the camp of a favourite German game called Malefiz ('Barricade in English').

Each player gets two identical playing pieces. The board features paths from the bottom up to Pride Rock at the top. But the paths get closer together as they go up the board which results in playing pieces getting a little tight to move. Thus, if you land exactly on another playing piece, that piece must return to the bottom row and start again.

Movement is by a die (that includes a spot symbol on two faces). Should you roll a spot you can place a jungle maker on to the board. Or, you can move one on the board to a new location. These jungle markers are blockers which cannot be jumped.

The winner is the first player to get one of his pieces on to the Pride Rock square by an exact throw of the die.
categories: Children's Game, Movies / TV / Radio theme

name: La Boîte à Quiz
description:
The Box provides seventy-eight quizzes. Each card contains a fact and number of questions on a common theme.
Answer correctly and score a point. The player with the most points wins.

Several other rules are proposed including soloplay rules.

name: Hot Wheels: Body Worx!
description:
from Amazon
Now is your chance to build the custom Hot Wheels car you've dreamed of! Packed in a clever and portable lunch box, Body WorX has you put together parts of Hot Wheels cars printed on cards. The player who puts together the most cars wins the game. Box measures about 5-inches tall x 5 1/2-inches wide x 2 1/4-inches deep. Ages 4 and up, 2-4 players.

Players have a hand of cards. They are attempting to complete a Hot Wheels set: one "tires" card, one "chasis", one interior, one exterior. The cards have to be collected and played in order.

There is a drafting mechanic not unlike Uno. Players may draw from the top of the deck blindly or select the top discard.

There is some "take-that" where players can slow down their opponent's progress by giving them a "flat tire" card or some other setback card.

name: Crazy Cubes Soccer
description:
From Rules:


Roll a Cube - face side up determines who the Goalkeeper is.
Each player takes 5 shots, rotate the eyes to keep score.
Player with the higher score wins.
Set up player targets to practice free kicks.
Set up Referee target and try to knock down to practice accuracy.
